<Author>LizA81
<Content>Warm Sun, Freezing Showers My boyfriend and I have visited the Dominican Republic before. We pretty much know what to expect when booking a stay at a 4 star all inclusive resort down there. Clearly, the star system that we use in the US doesn't translate but we're not picky so we went ahead and booked at the Caribe Club Princess even though we read the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor.The resort lobby is nice and the staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful. Our room was nothing special but we had a balcony overlooking the pool and it was clean. The biggest issue I had with our room and the entire trip was that we did not have hot water in our room from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. We started out thinking it was funny, calling to the front desk to complain and then thinking the water would get hot within a few hours. By day three, after calling the front desk, tracking down maintenance on our own and talking to our travel agent, it was no longer funny. Let me tell you that nothing ruins a wonderful day at the beach like coming back to your room to get ready for a nice evening and taking a frigid shower. It is just absolutely ridiculous that in six days, they made no headway in fixing the problem and made no apologies about it. The worst part is that on our last day, they were extremely eager to flip our room. The fact that they were going to put another pair of unsuspecting vacationers in that room with no hot water, no warning, no explanation seemed like awful hospitality. The entire hot water situation made me seriously question the hotel's management. The Dominican Republic is not the place to go if you want to eat gourmet meals. The food at the Caribe Club Princess is not stellar but it is exactly the same as it has been at other, more expensive and better reviewed hotels in the DR. They have french fries, hamburgers, pizza, etc at the buffetts. so if you are really nervous about local foods, you can always turn to the basics. The food is nothing special but is the same as you would get at any other resort. The Mexican restaurant (El Sombraro) and the Italian Restaurant (Mama Mia) were quite good. You have to make reservations at these places but it's well worth it . The first night, the only reservation we could book was at the Dominican Restaurant which was I was not a fan of. With items like snail meat and goat on the menu, you may want to avoid this one unless you are an adventerous eater. My boyfriend and I spread the food around on our plates and then hit the buffett.As far as other hotel ammenities. The shows at night were much like the shows at any other hotel. The security was fine. We definitely felt safe during our stay. The beach and pool areas were great. When there's sun, waves, and free yummy cocktails, I'm always happy! Afterall, the beach and the sun is the real reason for the trip, right?I would absolutely visit the DR again BUT would likely try another resort. The service could have been friendlier but it wasn't a deal breaker for this resort. The kicker was the hot water and the resort's inability to do ANYTHING about it. Our trip was still wonderful but there was nothing about the Caribe Club Princess that makes me want to go back. It's not the priciest hotel and I understand that mediocrity goes along with that but I'd rather have mediocrity and a hot shower somewhere else.  
<Date>Jan 5, 2009

<Author>VARADEROGIRL
<Content>The Good The Bad And The Cockroach My husband and myself together with another family stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from November 14, 2008 to November 21, 2008. Adult ages 24-27 and kids 2 and 7.We booked this vacation thinking that this hotel in fact was a 4 star as represented by Sunwing Vacations. We were very disappointed to discover that this hotel in fact should not be rated as a four star hotel for the following reasons. To commence once we arrived at the hotel we were told that our rooms were not ready, fine no problem here as we completely understand that it takes time in order for the rooms to be cleaned etc. We were told to return to the front lobby desk at 3pm. At 3pm we returned to the lobby desk to be told that yes are rooms were ready and that we would be on the first floor. We advised that neither couples would like to stay on the first floor (we had specifically requested a 2nd or 3rd floor room) and the other couple that travelled with us had two small children and didn鈥檛 want to stay on the first floor for the fear of having one of their children open the sliding doors and walking out. While we were awaiting to see if we could be accommodated on a 2nd or 3rd floor we witnessed a complaint from a couple staying at the Tropical Princess that their room had been broken into via the sliding door. They were located on a first floor room. We then went back to talk to the front lobby reception and were advised that all they could offer us was a room on the first floor and on Saturday, the next day, they would move us to another floor. At this point a lady came out and advised the gentleman we were dealing with in Spanish that he could not offer us those rooms as those rooms have 鈥減roblems鈥? Both the gentleman and the lady then disappeared and once the came back they told us that they had found another room for us on the second floor.At this point we were all very happy to know that we could finally go to our room. Once we arrived at our rooms we discovered that we had been placed on the Tropical Princess side of the resort when we in fact were booked for the Caribe Club Princess side. It is not that this was a big issue but considering the fact that we paid more money to stay at Caribe Club Princess we were very disappointed. We expressed our concerns with the manager of client relations and she advised that at the moment these were the only rooms available. We agreed to stay in these rooms until the following day when we were told something would become available on the Caribe Club Princess side. The other couple travelling with us went into their room and we went to do the same. Well once I scanned my card to be let into the room I discovered two naked ladies in the room which I had been assigned. They didn鈥檛 speak a word of English and luckily the manager was still on the premises and I advised her that the front reception had issued me a key for a room that was already assigned to someone else. On top of this being unacceptable behavior it is also a great security risk that the hotel doesn鈥檛 even know which rooms they are allotting to which people. At this point I was very frustrated and this was not the dream vacation I had envisioned. I then went to the front reception with my friend and advised them of the trouble. They found other rooms for us but were unable to explain why the mistake of giving me someone else鈥檚 room key happened in the first place. The rooms we were assigned on the Tropical Princess side were utterly disgusting, they were outdated, the balcony door lock was broken and the front door lock had been tampered with. At this point I did not feel safe in the hotel at all but told myself that it was only for one night until they could place us on the Caribe club Princess side.The next day we were thankfully as promised moved to two rooms on the Caribe Club Princess side and I started to feel that this vacation was going to be a good one after all. Well that is not what happened at all.On Tuesday November 18, 2008 we made a reservation to go to the Mamma Mia (Italian) restaurant for dinner with the other couple we were travelling with. We arrived at the restaurant and everything was going well and we all ordered appetizers. Everyone except my husband order calamari and my husband ordered bruschetta. When the appetizers were delivered I saw that my husband was staring at his plate. To my disbelief on his plate was a cockroach. I could not believe what I was seeing. We were staying at a 4 star hotel and my husband was delivered his bruschetta with a cockroach on it. Not only was there a cockroach but it was dead with its legs up in the air and appeared to have been cooked with the cheese on the plate. At this point all of us lost our appetite and got up and left the restaurant. We called our server to the door and advised him of what had happened. When this happened we could have made a huge scene about it but didn鈥檛 want to disgust the other patrons in the restaurant. At this point we went to the buffet to have some fruit as we were all starving. After being at the buffet for a little while we were greeted by the foods and services manager (Milton) and the chef of the Mamma Mia restaurant and we were apologized to. We were offered a complimentary dinner at El Pescador or La Cava because of our worries. We advised that we would think about it and let him know the next day. The next day while we were having breakfast Milton approached us and asked if we had made a decision we advised him that we would go to El Pescador that same night. That night we went to El Pescador but dining at this hotel was not the same for us after we had seen the cockroach. We didn鈥檛 eat the same and were disgusted for the rest of our stay, needless to say that we were not able to eat normally for the rest of the week.On Thursday November 20th we were approached by the concierge lady advising that the hotel had been told of the incident and that the hotel wanted to offer us a dinner in compensation for what had happened, we advised her that we had already been to a dinner the previous night and that in no way did we feel compensated for what happened nor were we able to enjoy our meals since then. She asked us to please consider this and advised that if we accepted this offer we would have to sign a release form which basically stated that the dinner was in compensation for the cockroach being on the plate of food and that we were not to make any claim with the hotel, management or tour operator because of the situation that had occurred. We advised her that we would not be signing the release form as we felt that everyone including the tour operator should be aware of the type of food that is being served to people at this hotel. She was not very happy about this.Needless to say when Friday morning came we were more than happy to be leaving this hotel and at the same time very upset that we spend our money going to hotel that was rated four stars but yet are serving cockroaches with their food.We are very disappointed with all that happened at a time when we were supposed to be resting and on vacation and because of this we will never again visit a Princess resort.Hope this review helps someone realize this is not a sanitary place to be !  
<Date>Dec 19, 2008

<Author>wobblesSF
<Content>The worst service  After staying at the Paradissus hotel next door for 3 days we moved to the Caribe Club Princess...That was a BIG mistake.All inclusive there does not mean all inclusive, 2 restaurants areexcluded, in room safe excluded, water spots excluded...and the list goes on. customer service is completely null ...they simply don't care. The bed in the room was awful with a sinking hole in the middle and the room smelled like urine...YES the beach is beautifuland all and all the staff is nice but they don't have a clue what the word customer service means. I understand that it is one of the oldest hotels in the area but the 4 1/2 stars is a TOTAL overstatement...Don't go there with any expectations.It is just not worth it!

<Author>Cheetah777
<Content>hmm..where to start?? brother got MUGGED ON RESORT?..[--] front desk??... Well let's just start off by saying that the resort was beautiful and we had a prime spot close to the buffet, pool and beach. But it was too bad that their food was garbage, and although we had access to all 5 a la cartes the portions were very very small and everything tasted like garbage.I must say that the best thing about the resort was the activities staff!!...always smiling and having a great time around the pool and on the beach!!!And i must say that that was the best lobby parties i have ever been to before. Thank you activities staff,, you guys are awesome!Although we had an amazing time with the activities staff and bar staff, we had a horrible experience when we were ON THE RESORT....my brother ended up getting mugged outside of the disco and the man held a HUGE MACHETTE KNIFE to my brothers throught....my brother thought that that was the end of his life then and there. But thank god he could run as fast as he did. So the man got all of my brothers money, his bank card, which he somehow managed to withdraw over $1000, as well as his silver chain and braclet. We were just disgusted of how something like that could happen on a 4 star resort...doesn't make sense to me at all. It's horrible when something like that had to happen on the resort right in the middle of our vacation. To not even feel safe on the resort that we booked our 1 week vacation on is the worst feeling to have especially having 3 days left to spend on that resort.Bottom line, the front desk lobby staff and guest services staff were absolutly horrible. They didnt help us out at all. They screwed us around more then anything. HORRIBLE when you have to go to the front desk for help and no one is capable or willing to help!! DISGUSTING...so due to the mugging incodent and the usless front lobby staff I STRONGLY DO NOT reccommend this resort to anyone. STAY AWAY, it's NOT SAFE!!!!

<Author>quist
<Content>Can't wait to go again EXCELLENT       Entrance to lobby  
<Date>Oct 13, 2008
<Rating>5	4	4	4	4	4	5	-1	
<Aspects>
0

<Author>rocksta
<Content>2nd Time Round Here- Still just as FANTASTIC!! This is the second time my partner and I returned to the Caribe Princess, and we certainly didn't regret our decision to go back.When we went last year it was amazing, and this year was the same, if not even better!!!On arrival you are greeted with tropical juice and such a warm and friendly attitude from the staff! They seem to bend over backwards to help you in any way, they cannot do enough for you.Again our room was spotless...even better this year as we had a pool view and a view of the sea which was brilliant. The fridge was stocked up EVERY day with PLENTY of water and soft drinks. Our maid did a fantastic job at cleaning our room and ensuring every day, we had clean towels and bedding.The pools again are just faultless. We found that you did not need to fight for a sunbed or even lay your towel out early in the morning. There was plenty available for everyone without being at all cramped.In my opinion the food was fabulous! They had an amazing selection for any food lover. Different kinds of meats, vegetables, desserts and fruits.Throughout the week me and my partner dined at 3 of the all inclusive restaurants in the resort: The chinese, Mexican and Italian, and again they were excellent. At one point during our dining we had the choice of 3 drinks placed in front of us!! water, wine and soft drink! The staff were so kind and friendly and the food served was just like your excellent 3 course Italian restaurant u get in town that you would pay lots of money for!!! The resort itself was faultless again. The gardens are so well kept, beautiful gardens with trees, plants flowers and wildlife running around all over the place- gives you something to look at and admire while you are walking around. Everytime u passed a member of staff they always greeted and smiled at you, no matter what they were doing! They really made u feel like one of the family.We took advantage of the tennis courts and had a great time. They have so much to offer you. The lobby is a fantastic place just to sit and chill out any time of the day or night, with the bar open serving plenty of yummy cocktails!The entertainment was very amusing- they even put on a show of the infamous thriller dance by Micheal Jackson which was really good and showed so much effort!Finally- the best part- the beach. ABSOLUTELY STUNNING...again! Again u did not have 2 fight for any sunbeds as there were plenty available any time of the day. The beach was clean and the waters sparkling blue. The beach hut is really good too if u just fancy a quick hotdog and chips at lunchtime, or a nice sprite to cool u down! Again this is all at your fingertips, you pretty much don't have 2 walk anywhere.On a particular choppy sea day, we borrowed some body boards (which is included) and had a great time surfing the wavesSo as u can see, theres plenty to do in Caribe Club, and I would DEFINATELY recommend it to anyone, and WILL definately be going back in the near future.Caribe club has everything u could need and want.Do not listen to the fussy reviews...its absolutely perfect.  
<Date>Oct 3, 2008

<Author>bgurl
<Content>Enjoyed this hotel very much!!! First of all after reading the reviews I was a bit nervous about going to this hotel but I truly believe everyone's experience is not the same but I did get a load of good solid informatiion from the reviews that I did read.Upon arrival our room was ready and our bags were taken directly to our room and the trolley that passes by the hotel periodically will get you to anywhere you would want to go around the resort. Our room was very cold and very clean thanks to the wonderful maids like Mirta. Our fridge was always stocked with bottled water and diet soda which is what we requested. The hotel pools and beach were magnificent and the people and staff like Jose from the pool bar were very pleasant and made our stay enjoyable.The breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets were all excellent and always had a good variety of selections and good service from our waitor Alberto who always greeted us with a smile.We took advantage of the resorts tennis courts, shows, archery, pool table and bicycles for extra things to do and they even supplied the trolley to take us to their casino for free which is only 5 minutes away. We went on 2 tours the monster truck safari a full day which was awesome and for the low price of $70.00 per person we did everything including riding on horses and it included a delicious lunch. The other tour was the atv crazy wheels which was a blast and that was 1/2 day.To shop for souvenirs you best bet is to go to plaza bavarro which is also about 5 minutes away to bargain with the locals and we got good prices for our items including $2.00 key chains and shot glasses. You do pay a one time fee of $10.00 to enter their country and these people work very very hard all day long and they deserve tips and they appreciate anything you give to them.All in all our trip was excellent and you should bring your own suntan lotion and bug spray etc because at the resort they are very expensive. We would definitely go back to this resort in the future and again our stay was truly wonderful.  
<Date>Sep 8, 2008

<Author>kev07uk
<Content>Lovin the Dom Rep 08 having only just returned from our first trip to the caribe club princess i feel it only fair to add to the generally positive feedback of this beautiful resort. a seamless transfer and welcoming check in were followed by two weeks of excellent service, smiling faces and fun activities for all. fair to say that the food may be somewhat questionable as almost all in our party of 17 travelling from ireland spent all too long nestled on the loo's!! this may also have been helped along by the fairly harsh tasting alcoholic drinks available, an upgrade to premium would be advised altough a little pricey at $22 per day.however all in all a charming resort complex with sprawling gardens with very frequent transport from end to end. excellent pool facilities and daytime games, and a stunning beach that will eat up ur days and a broad range of restaurants and bars to take care of the nites!!holidaymakers range from north and central america thru to most european countries being represented, and most seemed pleasant and ready to enjoy the party.i certainly would return to the CCP, altho next time i'd bring a stronger stomach.kevin mc g N.Ireland

<Author>Chas86
<Content>Booking for next year... Firstly ignore the bad review that has been written! I have just come back from 2 weeks at the Caribe Princess and it was fantastic!!!!! The hotel is great, very clean and tidy(maids we're cleaning in the lobby at 10pm), rooms are very spacious, cleaned everyday, mini bar in the room which is re-stocked everyday with soft drinks and water. Theres 3 pools to choose from the main pool by the buffet resturant has entertainment allday, the animation guys work very hard and try to get everyone involved, their also very friendly and will just come over for a chat. Evening entertainment was good, shows every night in the Theatre, then on to the lobby for some tropical music which was fun! There are many different restuants to choose from, the main buffet resturant has different themes every evening, but is repeated each week, wasnt a problem though. The waiters were very happy to help couldnt fault them at all. The Le Matica bar served food during the night so if you got hungry from all the dancing then head on down.The main lobby is about a 10 min walk from the rooms, theres plenty of wildlife around including 2 ducks that never left each other. There is a bus service that runs frequently, just stick your hand out and jump on, it will take you around the complex. Overall this has been the best place ive stayed in and ive traveled alot! Take advantage of the things to offer and you'll never be bored.

<Author>lamwig
<Content>Loved CCP Punta Cana If you are looking for the best staff on earth CCP Punta Cana is the place to be. The staff especially the animators were friendly and extremely accomodating. The overall quality and cleaniness of the rooms were average, the mini bar was stocked with soda  water. I'm a bit picky when it comes to food so to me the food wasn't all that great but there was an abundance of food so you will not go hungry. My husband loved the food as did my 16yr old and her friend. We all at one point suffered stomach cramps/diarhea(can't avoid this if you are from the U.S.) read Dept of State Background notes for Dominican Republic or anywhere you travel outside the US to get reccomendations on shots or preventive meds to take before going abroad. Everyone we met from the U.S. had some type of stomach ailment but it doesn't last long. Most of the tourist were friendly with the exception of the Germans/Italians they were snobbish and they were extremely territoral but we didn't care because the area of the beach that they seemed to take over was soooo boring as with the area that they commanded in the buffet area. The theater was entertaing and the disco was lively.Overall, my experience was great., I felt safe (plenty of security) my (16yr) daughter and friend were free to roam the resort without my husband and I worrying . I highly reccommend spending the extra $$$ to upgrade to VIP, free massage, rum and cigars, motorized sports and internet access.Would I go again? yes indeed, I'm booking a group of 20 for next year

A call to the reception for a Dr. for a friend of me was ending up in 40 min. calling numbers they gave without answers and a Dr. who showed up in 1hr 45min....!!! 1. The Room: The Hotel Rooms (Room 1335) are divided by a wooden door to the neighbour room which has at the bottom 2-3 cm free place so You can even look into the neighbour room and You can hear the smallest noise which is made by neighbours, complaining 4 times over 2 sleepless nights to the reception couldn鈥檛 make the 4 young guys in my neighbour room quiet, 3rd day a personal visit to Guest Relation Services which is very arrogant, unfriendly and not ready and able to help, could say just that if I want I can change MY room, why should I live the discomfort of change all my stuff to another room when it鈥檚 not me who is disturbing anyone during all the night until the morning 06.00???In the 3rd night of my stay in morning 05.00 I called the reception and said to them if they are not able to get quiet 4 partying guys I鈥檒l do it myself in any way!!!Than just they sent a security guy to make them quiet... <Author>Michigan123
<Content>Overall trip was OK We were traveling in the month of July. The hotel was not bad. The beach was beautiful. The sand was nice and soft. Great for playing with sand toys. Children had a blast! The pool was also very nice. There were a couple of different pools to go swimming in. However, the food and drinks were not that great! The drinks all seemed to be made with too much heavy syrup. We have been to Riviera Maya prior to this for an all inclusive and the Riviera Maya definitely had better alcoholic drinks. The children ordered virgin strawberry daquiri's and they did not like the taste of them. A couple of times, they made strawberry daquiri's with a pina caloda mix and strawberry syrup. Also, the food was not that great in the buffet. We all received upset stomach's and diaharria while on vacation. The food in the restaurants was OK. Overall, we had a good time. However, don't be surprised if you have stomach problems.  
<Date>Jul 14, 2008

<Author>CourtSTL
<Content>Great time, great trip- almost perfect... Just returned from Caribe Club Princess on Sunday, June 29. We had a group of 8, twenty-somethings, and overall, it was a great trip. Short version, we would return to this resotr. Relaxing time and enough going on that there is always something to do. Here is the long version:Arrived to beuatiful lobby. Rooms weren't ready, but we were there before check-in, so that was to be expected. We headed to the buffet for lunch and then headed to the bar, then to the pool. Pools (first and third specifcally) could use some cleaning. They are not your normal swimming pool blue. That being said, a large part of that is probably the sunblock and drinks from the swim up bar. Water was a good temp, no complaints. Beach is gorgeous! I am more of a pool person- hate sticky sand, but this is soft, smooth sand. Nice sea breeze all the time made the temps there, even in June/July very reasonable. We had heard there were lots of bugs, so we came prepared with bug spray, listerine to spray doorways, and afterbite for once you were bitten. Didn't need any of it. I think I was the only one in the group to get any bites, and I had two all week there! I would have gotten more then that at home. The constant breeze helps keep them at bay. We upgraded to the VIP package- booked through Apple Vacations, and apparently this isn't an option for everyone. If you can upgrade, do it!! It's well worth the extra $ up front. The first night there it rained, so instead of eating at the buffet, we ordered our free 24 hour room service (part of VIP) and headed to one of the rooms. We had our robes, a big umbrella, rum, beer, and cigars in the room when we arrived. One of the four rooms was missing theirs, but it was brought up a coupe of days later. Also, two of the four rooms were missing alarm clocks- strange, but they were eventually brought back to the rooms. We made dinner reservations for the rest of the trip. Tried the Chinese- probably the worst food on the property, I wouldn't waste a night on this one. Next night was Italian- not too great either. Mexican and Brazilian were both great. We repeated at the Brazilian restuarant as that was the one location that seemed to agree with everyone's systems the best. About that- someone (another guest) told us on arrival not to eat the eggs at breakfast. They had been there for over a week, and avoided the eggs, and hadn't had stomach problems. Most of us avoided them leaving for a very boring breakfast day after day. (think dry toast, boiled potatoes, and cut up hot dogs). Those that ate the eggs were in no worse shape then the rest, so if you like an omlet, go ahead and try it. We did the steak restaurant for our VIP dinner, and it was great. Good presentation, good service- long meal. We were there for over 2 hours, and did this the last night. Might have been better to do that during the middle of the trip, but good none the less. Within the first 3 days of being there, we had all gotten sick. Stomach cramping, nausea, etc. We tried forever to figure out what we had all eaten in common, and the only thing we can figure was the beer! We all avoided it the rest of the week and didn't have any more significant problems. Do take you imodium from home, and lots of tums- you will need them!!! I travel frequently, and often have some minor stomach troubles, but nothing like this, and never have I seen a whole group affected. They do have a shop on site that provides this, but they are expensive- $9 toothpaste. We did two excursions provided through our tour group. We did the Marinarium excursion- well worth it. Boat ride, snorkeling with sting rays and nurse sharks, and a booze cruise back to the bus. Good time had by all. We also did the ATV excursion. 2 in our group had been to Punta Cana in the fall, and said it was amazing. The one offered at the hotel was not the same tour. we saw a golf course, an old abandoned hotel, a rock quarry, etc. Not worth the $, and really not worth the open air bus ride with the exhaust pipe pointing in the passengar area the entire hour ride there. If you do an ATV excursion, make sure to get clarification before hand about what you will see. There is supposed to be a great one that takes you to a cave with a natural pool in it- not ours!Last few days were spent taking advantage of our motorized watersport (1 hour boat ride) and complimentary massage on the beach. Both were great. Don't do the boat ride if you are suseptible to sea sickness, or are not a frequent boater. It's a rough ride. We took drink containers with us with coolie cups around them to keep drinks cold. They were a big hit. We had a lot of people asking us where we got them, and even offering to buy them from us. (We found them at Walmart)- not quite a bubba keg, but perfect for what we wanted them for. Take something to put drinks in. The service at the pool bar was very slow. In fact, often, we got out and went to the beach bar b/c it was quicker. The bartender at the pool bar is constantly force feeding mamajuana shots to the guests, and he is the only one there, so forget about getting a regular drink. On the topic of bartenders- Kelvin is awesome. He works at the 24 hour bar in the afternoons and evenings. Very attentive and friendly. The bathroom near this bar is disgusting- probably the worst on property for good reason. It's closest to the swim up bar, the snack shack, and the 24 hour bar, so it gets pretty constant use. The day we arrived, there was no toilet seat in the women's. That was replaced the next day though. Rooms- our room was great. Since we were VIP, we were in rooms with balconies, partial pool and ocean view, vaulted ceilings, and a sunken living room. Great, and large enough for all 8 to sit and play games at night. We never had a problem with bugs in the room despite a few spills the first night- we were on the third floor. 2 of the other rooms did have very small ants. Not enough for them to complain about, and only really bothersome when food was left out. American applicances plug in with no adapters, take small bills for tips- it will greatly improve your service throughout the trip, and enjoy yourself. The facility as a whole is beautiful. Trip was relaxing, and we are ready to plan another adventure. If you have specific questions, feel free to write.

<Author>kiethc
<Content>Beautiful Place, but terrible food and got very ill! Stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from July 3 through July 6, 2008. The beach and pool was beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful. But the few positives cannot outweigh all the negatives.We used Apple Vacations and their staff was friendly and helpful. The Punta Cana airport was nice and easy to navigate. The Apple staff took us to the resort via airconditioned bus and it was about a 30 minute ride.Check in was easy and we had no problems with the front desk. However, I read all the tripadvisor posts before leaving and found many of the same situations occurring during my stay. The room keys assigned by the front desk didn't work upon check in and it took about two hours for a new set of room keys to arrive.The resort is fairly small, but the front desk/reception area is located a long distance away from the resort/rooms/pool area.My biggest dissatisfaction with the Caribe Club Princess was the food. It was awful. I have travelled everywhere (throughout the caribbean and mexico) and have been able to find something to eat to survive. Not here. Buffet was terrible. Snack bar was even worse. Only thing edible was a the desert bar (ice cream). I pretty much starved for 3 days. The food was prepared very poorly and the Caribe Club did little for variety. The same food on the buffet showed up at the specialty restaurants at night.The bread was always three days stale, the soda was watered down and the meat was always questionable. The service in the buffet was terrible, they pretty much ignore you (I was always polite and offered a tip..still didn't help.) On the second day I got very sick to my stomach and spent the rest of my trip sitting on the toilet. My wife had many of the same ailments, but not as bad as mine. I am still sick (3 days later) as I write this review. I did not drink anything but bottled water and only at the buffet once. The best part about the Caribe Club is the pool area and beach. The beach is amazing and one of the best I've seen. The pool is great. The activity staff goes out of their way to keep everyone entertained. The pool bar is staffed by Jose, who has a great personallity and aims to please. His drinks are strong and fast. Jose pushes a native drink called mamjuana, which is served as a shot. Mamjuana is a rum based drink with honey, cinamon and some local tree roots or bark. Jose was a bright spot for our trip everyday in the pool.This resort is primarily habitated by non-American guests. People from Canada, Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Germany, UK and Italy were all represented during our stay. Some of the guests from Puerto Rico were rather rude at times and became annoying at the pool, but they are from a different culture than Americans. Some of the travelers from Europe were not so courteous as well.We left the resort one day to tour a local cigar-maker since we were told that many of the cigars sold in the local stores in Punta Cana were forgeries. The prices at the local cigar-maker were much cheaper and well worth the money for the cab ride.Check out was easy at the Caribe Club. Apple provided a large air-conditioned bus again and transportation to the airport was very good. Leaving the Dominican Republic is much more of a hassle than getting there. They only had one crew working the security check point that was servicing the entire airport (probably 10-15 flights within a 2 hour period). This took forever and was not air conditioned. Therefore, all visitors were boarding their airplanes uncomfortable with sweaty attire.Overall, I would consider returning to the Dominican Republic in a few years, but would not stay or recommend the Caribe Club Princess. On the flight home another couple told us about their stay at the Paradisius and they had identical complaints.I will probably go back to the Mexican Riviera Maya for a quick inexpensive getaway next time.I am not generally a negative person, but I felt compelled to write this review. If you are going to Punta Cana, I would suggest paying some extra $$$ and going to a resort that is 5 star or better....then maybe this won't happen to you.  
<Date>Jul 7, 2008

<Author>J-Wags
<Content>Nice for the money After reading some of the reviews on here I was apprehensive about this trip, but overall it was a good place especially for the money. First the good.... The rooms were all close to the pools, beach and restaurants which was a big plus for me. My room was always clean, the firdge was always stocked with plenty of soda and water and most importnatly the air conditioner kept the room VERY cold. Jose at the pool bar made the day at the pool fun and entertaining, the local beer is pretty good. The mexican specialty restaurant was EXCELLENT I could eat there every day (I suggest the chicken fajitas). One nice thing was they did not limit the number of nights you could eat at the specialty restaurants you just had to make reservations.Now the not so good.... If you can get a soda in the restaurants when they finally came out they were so watered down you might as well drink water. I was beginning to think that maybe Domincans did not drink anything with their meals because there were times we had our main course of food before they would even take a drink order. The food on the buffet was not good, lots of fish and other items most americans arent accustomed to eating. There were lots of locals from Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic that came in Friday night and took over the pool bar on Saturday, I say took over because they were so loud and obnoxious that no one wanted to be there anymore. Overall this was a good trip and I would definitely go back to Punta Cana, adn would consider going back to Caribe Club Princess if the price were right again.  
<Date>Jul 7, 2008

<Author>Alethea48
<Content>Excellent hotel We arrived at Punta Cana on 9th June and after collecting our luggage made our way to the Caribe Club Princess. On arrival we were served juice and checked in pretty quickly. We got a safe key and hopped on the transport and were taken to our rooms. The bellboys followed on with our heavy suitcases.Our room was on the top floor of the building and overlooked the back which was fine. The room was clean and tidy and the air conditioning was great. All staff were friendly and I'd like to say hi to Clifford down near the beach area selling trips, he was always polite and said hi. We had a massage near the pool which was great. We loved the bar down next to the beach after the shows and the lobby entertainment. It was so nice to chill out on the beach. The entertainment/shows were good especially the lion king and the dancers were fab. We had such a great time and we thought the food was fine. We also booked into the Brazillian Restaurant and the Chinese which were both very good. All in all a great holiday and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone. I especially enjoyed all the rum and coco loco's.

<Author>Alexrabi
<Content>Very Nice Hotel, Food needs Improvement!!! We returned home Tuesday June 24 after 7 night stay with party of 7, 4 adults, 3 children. Overall the physical plant, buildings,pools and grounds are in very good condition. The beach is beautiful, the rooms clean. Basically we had a delightful time. The only major complaint was the quality of the food. Having stayed in all inclusives in Mexico and in Puerto Plata, DR and elsewhere this was the WORST food we have ever encountered. The best meal was breakfast, as for lunch and dinner forget it. The staff is very poorly trained both at front desk and dining room, however bars and housekeeping staffs were well trained. This hotel could be excellent with an improvement in the dining room.

<Author>baron334_123
<Content>Caribe Club Princess Stayed at the caribe club 1st week of June. Was very concerened due to many less than complimentary reveiws. What very seldom is mentioned is how beautiful the resort grounds are. After passing the lobby and row of little shops, a winding paved path takes you through tropical mangroves teeming with birds and wildlife. The rooms have open vieling hallways where the rains drop onto indoor gardens. There must be something about the food that not everyone can tolerate. I was able to eat more than I needed with no problems, yet my wife took ill later on in the week. The rooms were nice, althought the pillows were a little lumpy. The staff were very friendly, any time I called for a problem I usually gor a quick response, including the time I broke a bottle of soda in room. all in allhad a great time, and thought it was an excellant value

<Author>nfd445
<Content>Had a good time! OK...the first thing I want to say is read the reviews with an open mind! We read all the reviews before our trip and we were somewhat concerned. But after our trip, I can offer you the details which I think is pertinent.1) Airport....The airport is nice for a destination airport. Plenty of porters to assist with the luggage. Entry to the country was quick and easy. Exiting the country was a little longer but the process is fairly streamlined and easy.2) Bus to resort....The transportation provided to the resort was on a comfortable air conditioned bus. The bus, provided by Apple Vacations, provided an Apple representative that gave a brief description of the country and the Punta Cana region. Very informative and fun as well.3) Check-In...This was also quick and easy. The staff was extremely helpful and spoke english very well. The bellhops quickly loaded our bags and transported us to our room.(we, myself,wife and oldest daughter (9), travelled with another couple and their 2 boys (10,12). 4)Room... OK..here is where we had a problem. The first set of room were on the second floor. There was a musty odor as soon as you hit the second level. We entered our rooms which were 4 doors apart(they were supposed to be connecting) and found evidence of mold and mildew in the HVAC units. One room had a puddle of water on the floor. We immediately found a resort employee and told them this would not do. He called the front desk and said he would return in 2 minutes. 10 minutes later the wives took the kids to get a snack and my friend and I trekked back to request a room change. At the lobby, we found our Apple rep and he (Tony) was AWESOME in assisting us. He scheduled room change and we went to look at our 2nd room, along with some gentlemen from Dayton that were in a similar predicament. We went and looked at the 2nd room on the 2nd level and same conditions. By now I was frustrated and quite unhappy. While awaiting a ride back to the lobby, ione of the guys from Dayton came down and told us that the 3rd floor rooms were MUCH nicer. So we went back, met with Tony and arranged ANOTHER room change. The desk staff seemed gracious, but we allowed the Apple rep to handle the discussions, as I was not in an appropriate mood to deal with them. The desk arranged for two rooms on the 3rd floor that were interconnecting and we went to inspect the rooms. WHAT A DIFFERENCE. The 3rd floor has cathedral ceilings and feels very spacious. Air quality was also much improved. The rooms are fairly nice, but the resort is dated. The room was clean and relatively insect free as we had a couple of small ants in the bathroom. We did spray OFF around our door frames to inhibit insect access. Beds were ok...not great but not terrible.5)Food...The food was relatively good with many different selections. With three children, we were concerened, but the kids enjoyed themselves and even tried different food choices that even surprised me. Now I have to say, our group did have a touch of the runs intermittently during the trip, but immodium was a saver. We did know of others at the resort that had stomach trouble. It would not be fair to blame it on the resort, as the food seemed good, but it should be noted that we did experience a little tummy trouble.6)Service.... Maid servic was very good. We did pack some little gift bags for the maids and we received great service. There are no wash clothes so bring your own. The white towels are dingy, not crisp and are fairly worn, but the did the trick for drying off after a shower. Bar service is good. The bartenders are more than willing to make any number of drinks for you and will recommend any drinks for you. Jose, at the pool bar is great. He is always fun and full of energy and you can hear him at the pool bar every day. He loves to give out the country's signature shot of mamajuanna.....an interesting concoction. Waiters were great and polite, but they have a tendency to grab your plate before you are finished. We did email and fax requests to the front desk prior to our arrival and never received a response and we also found out that my wifes father had called and left a message that we never received. Other than that, the service was quite good.7)Entertainement... The entertainement was good. I wouldn't call it world class, but we enjoyed ourselves. The entertainment crew works hard...ALL DAY. The try to have fun with the guests all day and offer a different program each night at their auditorium. We enjoyed the various shows we saw. I know the kids definately liked the magic show and the resorts presentation of the Lion King. Just remember, the entertainment is for fun and you need to make the most of it. You will enjoy it as long as you are not expecting /vegas quality entertaining.8)Excursions....We took 2 while we were there and had an EXCELLENT time on both. Tony the apple rep recommended the 2 that we took. The first was the Bavaro Runners safari tour. This tour takes all day. They pick you up and take you throuugh a guided tour of the region, showing you horseback riding, shows you a school, cigar making, sugar cane fields, an actual dominican household along with its growing of cocoa and coffee beans, provides luch and a swim at a private beack location. Alex was the tour guide and our entire group had an absolute blast. The other tour we took was a boat/snorkle trip at the Marinarium. FUN...we snorkeled with nurse sharks and stingrays, enjoyed a catamaran cruise of the various beach resorts and enjoyed a shallow swim in the ocean. This was a 4 hour tour and was fun for all.All in all we enjoyed our vacation. We would definately recommend Punta Cana for a vacation destination. For the money we spent, we all felt like we got a good deal on a good vacation. We intend to return. We might spend a little more money on a different resort, but we would go back to Caribe Club knowing what we know now. ANy one with questions can feel free to contact me and i will gladly answer any questions that I can.  
<Date>Jun 8, 2008

5	54(door):1	159(access):1	1099(spray):1	2339(frame):1	2360(insect):1	

<Author>Ris_Bry
<Content>Great service, great time! CHECK-INMy fiance, another couple and I checked into the Caribe Club Princess on May 31. This was our first all-inclusive VIP vacation (the fourth for our worldly friends!) We were greeted in the lobby with a refreshing glass of punch. There is somewhat of a language barrier, but the check-in process was smooth. We learned that most of the front-line waitstaff, bartenders and front-desk staff are multi-lingual. APPLE REPRESENTATIVEWe booked our vacation through Apple and received a flier at the airport stating the name and time that we were to meet with the Apple rep on the first day. This is important as he will give you a great deal of information on the country, resort and day excursions. You will also receive information on the hotel restaurants. Advance reservations are needed. You can visit the hotel concierge located in your buidling to make reservations. We stayed in rooms 2207-2208 and Jasson was our very friendly concierge. Our VIP package with Apple included massage (three huts located on the beach and around the pool), watersports, internet access, rum, cigars and top shelf liquor throughout the week. The massage was excellent!DINING/FOODWe dined at Mama Mia (Italian), Sombrero (Mexican), Shanghay (Chinese/Japanese) and La Cava. EXCELLENT FOOD at all four. There is also a Brazillian and Dominican offering, but we did not have time to try all. The restaurants only seat around 50 people which makes for a very intimate dining experience. Breakfast and lunch is served in the main buffet area. The offerings change daily and there is something for everyone. The service was excellent. Be sure to look for Eduardo who provided us with a daily Spanish lesson. The food was tasty even at the main buffet, however you do have to keep in mind that you are in a foreign country and the food is prepared differently that what you are used to. We all experienced bouts of intestinal problems. Be sure to pack plenty of Pepto, Alka-Seltzer and Immodium. You will be thankful. If you forget, the gift shops offer these items. DRINKSThe water at the restaurants is safe to drink, but we requested bottled water at the pool and beach bar (Bar la Matica). Remember to stay hydrated...one bottle of water per every 1-2 drinks. We witnessed some rather intoxicated folks throughout the week. Make sure you visit the sunken pool bar. Jose is the bartender and you cannot mistake his Ayyyyyy Amigo everytime you walk past or swim up to his bar. He was alot of fun. He will introduce you to a Dominican classic, mamajuana. This is a potent mix of bark, rum and who knows what else. You have to try it once. If you like it, the gift shops and airport sell it. Also, the specialty drink in the Dominican is the Coco Loco. It is a milky, coconut drink. Tasty. You can also enjoy daquiris, margaritas and pina coladas. Anything you want. The bottled beer offered is Presidente, Miller Genuine Draft and Heineken. Stay away from the Soberanna that is stocked in the room fridge. It's awful.ROOMSOur room was oceanview/poolside so we were very close to everything. Other reviews have stated this was disruptive, but we did not feel so. You are still far enough removed that it should not be bothersome. The pool closes at 7 pm so it is quiet in the evening. One tip: Pack your own washcloths. The hotel provides bath and hand towels, but not washcloths. The maids will also come around at night and distribute fresh towels. We did appreciate this. You will be given two blue beach towels and an additional two cards that are redeemable for two additional towels at the activities hut between the beach/pool. Don't lose these cards. You are required to turn them in with your room keys at check-out. There is a $25 charge per lost card. The rooms were clean and the maids were very friendly although they speak little to no English. Also, request the lock to the room safe at check-in. We never felt unsafe, but it is nice to have the option to lock up passports, cash and jewelry. SHOPPINGWe did not venture off of the resort except for an excursion. If you don't mind bartering and haggling then there are beachfront tents set up down from the resort. There are also vendors that the hotel brings in 1-2 times per week. They set-up outside of the main buffet. My friend and I purchased bracelets, but I'm not interested in the haggling aspect and probably wouldn't stop again. Larimar and amber are the stones native to the Dominican. The larimar is a gorgeous teal stone. There is a very high-end jewelry counter located in the lobby area. They have some very nice pieces. I found everything I needed at the hotel gift shops and didn't have to make a deal. American currency is accepted everywhere on the resort and expect to get American change back, not the peso. The prices are listed as peso so just know that approximately 33 pesos equals one American dollar.EXCURSIONSThere are many day excursions offered. We tried the Marinarium which is a party boat/snorkeling adventure. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this 1/2 day excursion. The crew was extremely friendly and fun! We snorkled, enjoyed a variety of drinks (including Coco Loco) and were able to wade in a natural swimming pool in the middle of the ocean. The price was around $80 USD per person and it was worth every penny. My fiance danced the macarena and won a trivia contest. We all had a great time. Bring extra cash for the excursions as they are not included in your package but are well woth the money. My fiance befriended a family from Cincinnati and they also recommended several excursions. There is something for everyone. Parasailing is also offering. OVERALLWe had a great time! The resort is rated 4 stars although I don't feel that it was 4 star by American standards. We went to celebrate our 30th birthdays and my engagement and that's exactly what we did. We relaxed and had an overall good experience. I would recommend the Caribe Club Princess to friends and family.  
<Date>Jun 8, 2008

<Content>best beach # 1 What can I say, went on a girls getaway to the Caribe Club, May 2-5, 2008, weather was awesome, and probably the best beach ever, no shells, no seaweed, no fish, and best of all clean, if you are from the east coast you know what I mean, blue, clear, warm water is the best, had a blast with Nadine and her gang at the scuba shack, went on a catamaran, and the banana boat, props to Ramon and his crew on the entertainment, animation staff, they couldnt have been nicer, Kelvin in the beach bar, everyone we met was so nice, the food was a bit of a struggle for us, not much taste, kind of bland, we had the VIP package so we at at the seafood restaurant, lobster just okay, Italian, like Ragu, at home, but again we werent at home, massage included, great and on the beach if you choose, love the coco loco drink, great value at this hotel, not budget, not extravagent, just right.

<Author>gaz08_8
<Content>overall holiday was good We stayed in the resort from 28th april - 12th May 2008Overall the holiday was very good.The staff are very sincerly freindly, and very accommodating, especially in the bars and restaurants.I travelled from England with my wife and her parents and we all agreed that the resort had something for everybody.There are three pools of which one has a pool bar and is very lively, the other two are quiet so are idael for children or older people who require some peace and quiet to relax.The hotel caters for mulicultural tourists and we befriended quite a few people of which were mostly American and Canadian.There were a very small minority of ignorant guests but you get that in every hotel that you stay in no matter where you are.The beach is picture postcard quality, i would go as far to say that is the best beach i have ever seen.However there was an issue with the food,All the English (and others) i spoke to, all complained of stomach problems , which affected all four of us at some point in the two weeks we were there.I have to say that we found the alternative restraunts dissapointing ie chinese, mexican although the Italian was proberbly the best of a bad bunch.If you want a relaxing holiday with sunand sea then this is definately the place for you, but if you want to go on trips then i wouldnt recommend this resort.I dont think i would recomend this hotel to any of my freinds because in my opinion a jamaican 4 star hotel is a lot better than the caribe princess which is a 4 star+.

<Author>ironminerlab
<Content>Never Again This was our second visit to this resort and it will be our last. We booked the VIP package as we had on our first visit. On our first visit, everything was great which was why we decided to return. What a difference two years makes. Firstly, the check-in service was poor at best. None of the VIP extras were included in the envelope. When we were shown to our suite, it was situated on the ground floor next to the bar pool; we had requested upper floors away from the pool. The ground floor rooms, especially the bathrooms, are crawling with insects. They will send someone to spray but if I want to sleep with insects, I'll book a tent in the jungle. We checked in on a Saturday and it wasn't until Tuesday evening after numerous trips and calls to the lobby that we finally got things straightened out. It seemed to us that the whole aura of the place had taken a steep nose dive. Things were left undone, some of these were safety items like missing boards on hot tub decks, and the general cleanliness of the place had dropped. On our first visit, we had a problem with the AC in our room. I called the front desk and a repairman was there within a short period of time. On this trip, we made many calls to the desk and were promised right away, sir but nobody showed. It was really, really frustrating.One of the biggest differences that we found were the quantity of vendors walking the beach and almost every one of them in your face all day long. On our first visit, vendors set up on the property for one night only and we found it kind of interesting and indeed, made some purchases. This year, they were there almost every night - it was like trying to run a gauntlet to get to the restaurants. We didn't want to be unfriendly, but there is only so much of this that a person can stand. I could go on and on but you get the picture and you can decide for yourself. As for us and our friends, who by the way, have been here on more than one occasion, we will never book another vacation at the Caribe Club Princess.  
<Date>May 23, 2008

<Author>ScituateGirl
<Content>Nice Resort We stayed at the Caribe Club Princes during April school vacation with our two boys (11 and 15). Overall the resort was very nice. The grounds were beautiful and our VIP suite was comfortable and clean. The VIP suites are conveniently located near the pool with the pool bar and the beach. We tipped the maid service 3/day which gave us reliable cleaning service. Room service could be improved, we asked for an extra blanket and never received it.The food at the buffet was good with a decent variety, however the adults in our party did experience stomach problems where the Amodian AD we brought came in handy. Make sure you bring your own medicine since in Punta Cana you will pay a lot more for any medicine and trying to find a pharmacy is a challenge. We only tried one of the restaurants since reservations were required and we didn't like to commit to a time, we wanted the flexability of eating when you felt like it. We did try La Cava and got the Broiled lobster which was saltier than we prefer. The water sports were a bit of disappointment for the kids because again you had to make a reservation even if it appeared as though the equiptment was not being used. It's difficult to have a time scheduled for kids only to find the kids are in the middle of a volley ball game once the time arrives. The teenagers wanted to try Parasailing but it wasn't free because they required you to pay for a lesson in advance, also true with wind surfing. The banana boat ride wasn't available unless you had 4 or more people. So overall the free watersports was a challenge to say the least and it was obvious that they were reserving water sports for the paying customers. There is some solicitation on the resort, selling excursions and jewlery and hand-made items which can be annoying at times. Overall the kids still enjoyed themselves. Tip when traveling with older teenagers, the alcohol is a little lax so keep an eye on them.  
<Date>May 19, 2008

<Author>coldcanuckinohio
<Content>A nice resort My husband and I stayed at this resort April 17-24. First of all I would say that like many/most resorts in the Caribbean or Mexico the rooms in this resort would be more like a 3.5 star but the rest of the amenities would be a 4 star including food. The room was very clean though and we only had a problem with one pesky mosquito on a few occasions. We had upgraded to the VIP, which although not totally what I thought it would be, was still great because it was soooo close to the main pool (and on the main floor) so going and putting a towel on a pool chair was the easiest thing in the world and I was grateful for that. And yes -- bring your own facecloths, I don't know if employees steal them or what, but it is really tough to get one. This is not the first time I have encountered this in my travels.As stated, the beautiful lobby - which is really spacious and has a very nice bar is way too far from the rooms. I think this really puts a damper on night time socializing with other guests. I really believe that in light of this design, they desperately need a good size beach or pool bar so people feel they have an alternate entertainment option to the nightly shows. For this reason, don't be looking to party to hard at the resort.The grounds are beautiful with the ducks, birds which make calls like monkeys at night and peacocks. It's nice to walk around there but bring comfortable shoes as it is quite a trek from the lobby to the rooms.I found the food to be very good and I have travelled extensively in the Caribbean, Mexico and also in Europe. The variety is fantastic at the buffet restaurant and we ate there every day for breakfast and lunch, and the first night for dinner. All other nights we ate at the a la carte restaurants, with the Italian and Mexican being our favorite. I didn't want to try the Chinese and Brazilian because I had read/heard that both were not as good. Surprisingly, the Ribeye steak at the Mexican restaurant was very good - not tough, although the steaknife might as well have been a butter knife. We also ate at the one gourmet restaurant (french)- can't remember the name. It was very nice, and I found the service at the a la cartes to be very good - and much better English at these restaurants. Pool bar - swim up bar is really fun and Jose is very fun even though his English is limited. He really needs some more interesting shot glasses for his never-ending MAMA JUANA shots. If anyone is going, I think he would love a new shot glass or two. He is very entertaining and we became fast friends. He even called us at home when we returned. You have to realize that they get more French guests, so they don't get to practice their English as much. They are eager to learn so make the effort and they will too. Be nice and tip if you feel it is deserved. These people work 11-16 days in a row without a day off. How nice could you be after all that time on your feet? The beach is of course second to none. Shopping is ok but I was disappointed by the lack of quality of the silver (spoiled by Mexico obviously). Barter religiously. We bought 2 paintings (unframed) at the market down the beach - about $190 for both - one was an oil and both were quite large. Also bought coffee beans by the pound for $4 each (4 of them) at the same place. Don't be stupid and forget to pack the immodium you bought (like I did) or it will cost you $9 for 4 tablets. Fortunately, I was fine after taking one. Bring lots of sunscreen, we did and never got burnt, which was nice. Bring bandaids for those new shoes you may be wearing for the first time (or aren't used to walking in) - ladies you know what I'm talking about.There's a guy at the beach bar who makes a delicious drink he calls especial with bananas and chocolate - it tastes like a banana split. He got tipped everytime I asked for that.Went to the casino the first night - there's a free shuttle there and back - it was nice. Did have a spa treatment - forced my hubby into it too. The body scrub was awesome and massage -- Julia is probably the strongest if you like a deep massage like I do. Wouldn't recommend the manicures/pedicures - they are quite ammateur for the money.All in all a really nice getaway. I would go back with my kids next time and hopefully it will be in April also because it isn't too crowded then (except Easter week - beware around that time).  
<Date>May 11, 2008

<Author>Mokey1Woodbridge
<Content>Beautiful Place This was a girlfriend getaway. We were there from April 30 - May 4th. It was beautiful. I have read several reviews some good but most were bad and I have to admit I was SCARED!!! But don't take the other reviews for granted, you have to experience it yourself.When you first arrive at the airport, you'll be greeted by women dressed up and willing to take your pictures with them. You will be able to purchase these when you leave for $8. They come out very good. I wanted one, but my girlfriend beat me to it it and they only make one copy.. :( After that, you go through and pay your $10 tourist card and get your luggage. You will have men trying to take your luggage and carry it for you. I wouldn't of done it, but my girlfriend had already gave our stuff. They help you to your information desk and YES they expect a tip, so if your not a big tipper, then I suggest you carry your own luggage. They will try and bug you, but be strong and keep walking.Once we got to our apple vacation desk, he showed us to our ride and they took us to the hotel. It's about a 20 minute ride from the airport to the hotel (unless you have other stops on your bus as well, then a little longer).Once we got to the hotel, we checked in and it was BEAUTIFUL... The lobby was so nice, the staff was friendly. Everyone said HOLA. It didn't take us long to get our room and since we were VIP (which I sugget), we had to meet with the guest services to get all of our information, such as (internet, motorized sports, and massage) coupons.It was beautiful weather all week. It only rained Friday night really hard and Sunday morning (for like 5 minutes) dispite what the weather channel said. The beach was GORGEOUS... I have never seen a beach more beautiful. Water was great. Yes, you have women walking around topless but this isn't just at the beach, they also do this at the pool. It didn't bother us though.The food - well that is a different thing. At the buffet, they have a lot of different things, I didn't care for the buffet, but for breakfast I got an omlet and potatoes, nothing else. For dinner, I only ate cheese  pepperoni pizza. The Seafood restuarant - NASTY!. The Mexican place, DELICIOUS, as well as the Italian (momma mia).The rooms - they were very nice  clean. They are dated like in previous reviews, but very clean. Our mini fridge was stocked every day and we didn't have to request nothing. The only thing I suggest is, if you plan on tipping, do it when you leave. We didn't tip until 2 nights before we left and on the last night, they didn't give us our turn down service. We were in room 2222, our balcony faced the family pool and ocean, GORGEOUS!!The pool bar was good, JOSE  OZZIE are the men at that bar. The manager Carlos was very nice as well. The Beach bartender was KELVIN, he was MY FAVORITE. If you gotta try a drink, try the banana mama or ask Kelvin for bed breaker, very good. Also ask Kelvin for Killing Me Softly.They will keep trying to have you taste their mamajuana, some liked it, I HATED IT. Too strong and NASTY.Over all, a very nice place. If I had to say a bad thing, it'll be about SOME of the guests. We met some very nice people from England and all over the states, but then we had met some ignorant guests from London, but you ignore the ignorant people and enjoy yourself. I would love to take back my husband  daughter. I hope you enjoy yourself if you go and I would consider upgrading to VIP if you haven't already. Well worth the extra money.I hope you find my review helpful.  
<Date>May 8, 2008

<Author>Mia51Boston
<Content>Would not stay at the Caribe again Customer service at the resort does not exist, when we asked for towles, or extra soap they would tell us in 5 minutes and they never show up.The bedding, blankets,e.t.c. was old and worn, there were 3 tiny very soft pillows in a king size bed.My husband's brand new polo shirt with the tag still on was taken from the room, we reported the incident but they came up with nothing, if you do stay at this resort, please lock up your valuables in the safe box.We've been to Punta Cana 3 times prior to this, we never had any problems.. the staff at the resort needs to be educated in customer service and learn to speak some decent English.The food was nothing special, leftovers from dinner were made into a different dish for next day's lunch.The specialty restaurants were anything but specialty, we went to the Italian restaurant, (Mama Mia) and ordered white wine, the waiter comes by and before I could stop him he re-filled my glass with red wine, the waiter had no clue what he did wrong..At the Chinese specialty restaurant I hadn't finished all of my soup, and when the waiter came to take the bowl he was looking inside and stirring the left over soup with the spoon, I was mortified, I thought he might pour it back into the pot, that incident was very creepy and weird.The maids were more polite than the customer service at the front desk, they deserve a tip every day.My husband and I have been to most of the islands in the Caribbean, our stay at the Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana was the worst.

<Author>HubbleLondon
<Content>A lovely resort After we booked, we looked at some of the reviews and the mixed comments gave us some concerns. We needn't have worried.We travelled with Thomsons and had an excellent flight. It was on time and their extra legroom is great. Transfers were a bit slow, and the other hotels we dropped off at were huge. Ours was a bit smaller, but not much.The reception area is big and open and airy and efficient. Then we had the train ride down to the apartments. This is nearly half a mile through the mangroves, but didn't take long.The room we had was conveniently placed, quite near the restaurants, pools and beach. We had some teething troubles with the air conditioning and with a water leak in the bathroom, but these were resolved reasonably quickly once reported to guest relations.The main buffet restaurant served an extensive range of dishes which should be enough to satisfy most palates. The biggest difficulty was getting a cup of coffee at breakfast - they always seemed to be running out of cups! They also didn't quite seem to grasp the concept that you need hot! water to make tea.The a la carte restaurants were a varied bunch - from excellent Italian and Mexican to poor Chinese, with Brazilian and Dominican somewhere in the middle. One problem we found was that apart from the lobby bar (nearly half a mile away) there was really nowhere around the restaurants to sit and have a quiet drink before and after your meal.The beach was lovely - and was kept exceedingly clean. The animation team was really aimed at a much younger audience than us, but they put in a lot of effort. The multi-lingual evening entertainment was mixed in quality - but nevertheless popular. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our two weeks here and would recommend it to anyone.  
<Date>May 3, 2008

<Author>Newfoundland65
<Content>Loved the Caribe!!!! I gotta say this resort was great. The rooms are simple but for the families like ours that basically slept and changed there they were fine. If your looking for pillowtop matteress's and down pillows your out of luck. Our room was cleaned everyday and the sheets changed when we wanted. The enterance was impressive and the walk to the rooms was wonderful and pretty, there is a wetlands and lots of birds. Grounds well kept, grooming was constant while we were there. This is a resort where everything is close by. We had a room on the third floor in building one and when we walked out there was the buffet, the main pool and the beach( the most important) We got chairs on the beach everyday. The people were wonderful who worked on the resort and special thanks to Jose at the pool bar who entertained and took care of us and to Stephenson on the animation team who took the time to get us to participate in activities and made it alot of fun. Look for them both if you go. The staff all gave a smile and a Hola as you passed by , take the time to do it back if you can, they work long hours which makes the effort even more meaningful.The buffet was great and we stuck there most of the trip. The food was tasty and alot of it prepared fresh in front of you. You got sat promptly and were served drinks quickly, not that it mattered we were on vacation and not in a rush.We had no problem with mosquito's although they were there. Just take your repellent. The beach was absolutely beautiful, and we spent as much time there as possible. It made the whole trip worth it. On the whole we liked the size of this resort, the proximity of the facilities, the friendliness of the staff, had no problems with our needs being met at all. There was a good energy to this place and we would go back no problem. So if you are booked or are booking you will be fine here.

<Author>jatrevino4979
<Content>Loved the Room, Hated the Service We vacationed at Caribe Cub Princess from April 12th - 19th. Well I'll start off by saying that when we arrived the host asked us to leave our luggage in the front. We really didn't trust leaving them there, but we did. We checked in and since we booked the V.I.P. package they sent us to the concierge. They gave us everything we needed for our stay. We went back to our luggage and the trolly was there to take us to our room, but we were still a little confused on what or where we were going. We arrived at our room (2111) without our room key, the front had forgot to give us our key. The room cleaning lady had to open our room door while we waited for our keys. We were amazed at the view. We had a great view of the beach. Room service brought the key quickly. Well that night I was waiting to see a fight of Cotto vs. Gomez and 2 weeks prior to our vacation I personally called to make sure that they had HBO and they told me they did. To make the story short I missed a very important fight. That night they also showed us how important customer service was to them. They told us that they would send a technician over to our room and he never arrived. The room cleaning was good. The A/C was cold, worked very well. The other dissappointing thing was that from the time we got there they told us that they had Corona beer, but that they still hadn't distribute them to the bars. We asked all week long and never saw a Corona beer. The Higuero Buffet food is not very appetizing, but I guess it will do since there is nothing else for breakfast and lunch. Let me correct myself, for lunch there is snacks at El Pescador, which isn't very good either. Not all the food was bad though, all the restaurants were great but the best was El Pescador. Make sure you make your reservations for the restaurants for each evening so you can try them all. With the V.I.P. package it includes 1hour per person on the internet, 20 minutes massage per person, and one motorized watersport per person, plus a bottle of rum and 3 cigars. My wife and I definately thought that the massages were worth it. Just remember that when they say international drinks they mean Heineken and Genuine Miller. For the last thing don't go to the disco thinking you can drink whatever because that was one of the only places that we found Corona beer but they wanted 7 dollars a beer. VERY RIDICULOUS Other than that the beaches were very clean . The gardening was very well kept. The shows were ok. Hope this iformation was helpful.  
<Date>Apr 22, 2008

<Author>Goosefam
<Content>4 stars, maybe out of 10 !!! First of all, all the talk of mosquito's and bed-bugs. We did not personally have them but saw and heard of guests that did. I guess it's the luck of the draw for your room.My wife came down with a mysterious rash on our second day there. It completely covered both legs and kept spreading. She had to seek medical attention on site for $400, get the vacation insurance!! It won't help you though when you go to buy sun block in CCP gift shop, $35 dollars!!!There is no place on site to get cash, none of the excursions accept credit cards so your pretty much out of luck unless you take a taxi into the city to get cash. Even then all you can get is Peso's which actually is preferred over the good ol US dollar, it fluctuates everyday.The food is way below average. The buffets are pretty much the same thing every day but with a twist. Your going to see hotdogs sliced, diced,fried,boiled etc. EVEN FOR BREAKFAST!!!!!The a la cart restuarants are a little better but still nothing special.The service is OK but the language barrier is quite a problem, if you know Spanish you'll be fine!The bar drinks are different, the bartenders always but their own Dominican twist on your drink, you'll never have the same drink twice. So if you find a bar and your happy with the drinks, stay there!! Forget paying for the VIP, I called room service twice for American beer and never got it!! You only have the choice between Miller Genuine Draft or Heineken(which is'nt American anyway).The rooms are plain, even VIP, the bedding is paper thin, sheets come off the bed every night. Pillows are as described by other guests, like rolled up towels in a pillow case! Everything else in the room is what you would get in a hotel, nothing special!!The grounds are well kept and beautiful. The beach is the best part of Punta Cana. I found Americans to be scarce here though mostly Germans, French and Russian.We did not go to the shows, did not have the massage. The internet was always down when we took the 15 minute walk to use it.We would not go to this resort again, we may go back to Punta Cana but search for another resort!!  
<Date>Apr 22, 2008

<Author>REDSOXRULE99
<Content>Fabulous resort ! Like everyone else, I was nervous about the review of mosquitos and getting sick and musty hotel rooms and so on..... but I was pleasantly suprised to find that the Caribe Princess was even BETTER then any pictures I saw or reviews I read.Ok.... there are some small things that a few people allow to ruin their vacation like a cold shower here and there or too many Europeans. That is why the price is so reasonable.... if you want the Plaza in NYC then you have to pay PLAZA prices. We walked the entire hotel strip on the beach and there was not one resort that could hold a candle to the CP beach. And.... only the CP has rooms on the beach. Or on the pool. If you happen to get a bottom floor (and yes it will smell musty since you are in the Caribbean) then simply ask to be moved. The turnover is daily so another room will open up. The staff work 14 hours a day and for 12 days on - 2 days off.Their weekly pay equals two hours of minimum wage in the US and yet they never look tired or cranky. The only crank people I saw were guests wanting more and more and more ..........Bottom line -- this resort blew away any other place we have stayed. We relaxed, ate, swam, watched the activities, met a few people (they are as nice to you as you are to them) andall for a price that would not get you a weekend in NYC ! As far as mosquitos -- I think I saw two. Two. The Caribe Club Princess is what you make it. You can pay double somewhere else but you will get the same thing.So - trust the good reviews and ignore the bad ones. I will be going back next year !  
<Date>Apr 21, 2008
