<Author>lusu26
<Content>Service??!! On arrival at the Caribe Club we were shown to our room which smelt, only had one bed (not ideal for a mother and daughter) and the patio door had obviously been broken into previously as the lock did not work and was bent. The porter rang reception and was told they would bring in a single bed. Nothing happened so we ourselves walked to reception - a ten minute walk in the wind and rain - and were told we could not change rooms as they were already overbooked and had sent another couple to an alternative hotel for the night. We were told that if we returned at 2pm the following day, we may be given a different room if there was availability. Our Thomson rep was of no help either! We went back to the room to find two maids dragging a filthy bed into the room and balancing the coffee table precariously into the wardrobe - leaving no room for hanging clothes. Not that we would have hung anything in the room anyway as the room smelt so awful. We dragged our tired selves into the buffet restaurant, only to be seated and have to wait several minutes to be served. We asked the waiter for water and wine and when it did not arrive 10 minutes later, we asked again. And again. Oh and again. Only then to be given the impression that we were a nuisance and we were really asking too much for any amount of service. This happened repeatedly, in fact the only meal time we received service without asking for it was the last day at breakfast. Unsurprisingly, this had followed a customer satisfaction survey being passed around and I'm sure numerous complaints! Bar the service, the buffet was exellent. The food was always fresh and varied and there really was little point in venturing into any of the a la carte restaurants as the food was nowhere near as good as in the buffet, however you were attended to far more quickly!! I can't recall seeing any flies - very impressive considering it was fairly open air - and we always thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We managed to change rooms the next day and whilst there were two beds and no smell, there were several issues that were never really resolved. The towels were always a grey colour - a little off putting when you are jumping out of the shower! We were also only ever given one small bath towel each, with no consideration of hair or hand towels. The fan in the room continually clicked so was really unusable. The air conditioning control box had no controls on the outside so we had to remove the front panel to exposed wires, changing the temperature and switch on/off this way. Not ideal! When the repair man came to 'fix' it, he simply shook his head, pulled off the front cover and showed us how to fiddle with the controls this way. When repeating the story to the Thomson rep, she simply said 'don't go near the wires with wet hair'. Useful? Thought not. On check out day, we phoned down to Guest Services (if that's what you can call them) and asked for a porter to collect our cases. Not an unreasonable request as their were no lifts and the rooms were a 10 minute walk from reception. Five phone calls and an hour later we were still waiting for the porter. Luckily, we saw someone walking around so he could take us and our luggage. Absolutely appalling. After that extensive moan, we both enjoyed our holiday very much but I really feel that the service lets the Caribe Club down significantly. Many people moaned about the language barrier, I don't feel this if fair as they are a Spanish speaking island and we should not expect them to speak English. I think if the service in the restaurant had been of a higher standard, this would be a much better review. And ultimately, I think Thomson need to provide a better service in their reps. Whilst she was friendly, any problems we presented her with she did not deal with at all. Highly recommend Thomson long haul flights, planes are fantastic and far roomier than Virgin Atlantic and BA.  
<Date>Apr 15, 2008

<Author>paramedicsparky
<Content>nice hotel...not a place for people with disabilities!! Hello...My friend and I stayed at this resort for one week (women ages 26 and 42). When we arrived we were given a room with one bed but had reserved a room with two double beds...it took quite abit of talking to get a double room. My friend is recovering from a car accident and is not able to walk the stairs or great distances. This hotel has NO elevator even though it is three stories. NO availibiltiy of a wheel chair for use...but they do have ramps beside the major buildings..There is alot of walking needed to get from point A to B but you can catch a mini bus if you wait long enough. There is not alot of food for the vegetarian as most dishes are meat/fish based. Most times I could not find someone in the dinning room who spoke enough english to tell me if the dish I was interested in had meat or fish..beware of the lack of labeling for the person with allergies. The pillows were absolutely terrible!!!!!!!! I think they used the old towels to make pillows as they were so lumpy. This is a difficult resort to go to if you only speak english. If your a single woman ...well thats another story!!.....the staff that work by the pool flirt and proposition you so much you are ready to scream by day 3. But overall my stay was nice...could have done without the all firting to have some peace.  
<Date>Apr 14, 2008

<Author>dropusaline
<Content>3rd time, experience talking, nothing bad to say       Inner courtyard  
<Date>Apr 13, 2008

<Author>km92088
<Content>From Boston, MA My boyfriend and I just returned from our stay in Punta Cana at the Caribe Club Princess. We stayed there from 4/4-4/11. We had a good time on our vacation, but would not return to this resort. Before going I read several reviews on a few occasions regarding the hotel, some praising it and others not so much. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I always went with the positives, and would judge the place myself based on our stay. The positives is of course, the beach is beautiful. The weather was great. Mid to high 80s and sunny all week! The grounds at the resort are very well kept and beautiful. The walk is long from the lobby to the rooms and you can take a little trolley bus if you want, but we chose to walk on every occasion for the exercise and that the grounds were nice. There were mosquitoes at night however. We didn't have an issue with finding a seat at the pool or beach. We would get out there at around 11am too, and had no problem. Most of the time we were able to find a seat under the shade in the cabanas. The employees were also very friendly. They always said Hola! in passing. We had no problems at check-in. The gentleman that helped us was very nice. We went down to the bazaar/flea market on the beach, which is about a 15 minute walk. If you go, definitely low ball them and barder. Every place has the same thing so you can definitely find the price you want.Do beware though, they do allow being topless at the beach and even the pool, and we saw it a lot. It seemed like the majority of the tourists were from France, so it was difficult to make friends because they didn't speak English.We went to the shows at night down by the lobby. They were pretty lame and started around 9:45-10pm. Which was late. But it was something to do. The food wasn't bad. It was edible, they had a big variety. The fruit is good and the waffles at breakfast. The Dominican restaurant was also good. Every night at the buffet they had a different theme. So there was changes in the food but there was always the old standbys of pizza, pasta, and french fries.The only issue we really had revolved around our room. We didn't get what we asked for. The pillows were lumpy!!! We had to request new ones, they were a little less lumpy. The beds were hard. You only get 2 English speaking channels on TV-- TBS and Court TV. There are a total of about 12 stations. I also had a cold shower both Fridays we were there, which was very aggravating.You probably get what you pay for though, if we decided to expand our budget we probably could have gotten another place. I would consider staying at the Bravaro Princess next time, their sister resort. We heard nothing but good things about it from the travelers with our charter group who stayed there.You have to make your own opinion on the place though.  
<Date>Apr 13, 2008

<Author>khendrix6
<Content>Great Vacation! My husband and I, along with another couple (the four of us are between 26-32 years old), stayed at the Caribe Club Princess Feb. 3-Feb. 10, 2008. Before we booked our trip, I read reviews of the resort and was very nervous to book our trip because it had received poor reviews- well, I am glad I kept an open mind and booked the trip anyway. We had a great trip! My husband and I have been to Punta Cana before, but the other couple had not. They had a great time as well. The resort and grounds were gorgeous and it was nice that it was pretty well spread out. It was nice to walk around and have a lot to see. The food was also good. My husband and I have stayed at several resorts in Cancun and Riveria Maya, Mexico to compare too, and this food was very good also- some of the best food we've had. We liked the Mexican, Italian  Chinese speciality restaraunts. The buffet was your typical buffet- nothing major. We ate at the main buffet for breakfast. Then we liked to eat lunch at the snack buffet (it was the seafood restaraunt at night) and we made friends with the watier, Edguardo! He was so much fun and remembered what we were drinking the whole week. We would tip him well and he always took care of us! He was alot of fun and we were sad to leave him on the last day. The beach in Punta Cana is GORGEOUS! It was nice to escape the cold winter in IL and be in the warm sunshine! The pools were also nice. There were 3 different pools- the one with the swim-up bar was the fun one- they had daily activities and played music. The only bad part, was there was hardly ever an open chair at the pool. The other 2 were very quiet (although the four of us were a loud group!). We spent the majority of our time out by the beach- that's what Punta Cana is known for- a gorgeous beach!! We had to enjoy it for the 7 days we were there! The only trouble we had with the whole trip, was check-in. Our room wasn't ready, but the other couple's room was. It took almost 3 hours for our room to be ready. We were tired and hot (ready to change clothes!) so that was the only frustarating part. But we had a few drinks and waited in the Lobby for it to be ready. Then the rest of the trip was very enjoyable. We went to the disco one night and the locals that come in made it a little scary. We didn't stay long because we didn't know how safe we felt. But they played pretty good music....American music at first, but then it changed to local music. (I wouldn't let any teens go there by themselves- especially girls- we saw a few things and it made us uncomfortable!) My friend and I also went parasailing! That was a lot of fun. Otherwise we didn't leave the resort and take any excursions. We've done that before and just wanted this trip to be a fun, relaxing one. We all in all had a great time and recommend this resort, and might possibily return someday. It was rated a 4 and that's probably what I would keep it at... But we had a great trip and for the price we paid, it was definitely well worth it!  
<Date>Mar 31, 2008

<Author>sunseeker53053
<Content>Still daydreaming about paradise March 5 through March 12, 2008Rated a 4 - should easily be a 5. Friends thought this place was awesome but I had doubts about booking after reading some of these reviews. Please read the reviews but keep an open mind. Check in went smoothly. We did VIP which was well worth it for the room alone. VIPs all in 1 building. Upgraded from a pool/sorta ocean view to full ocean view for an extra $190. A bargain for the view! Room had a slight musty odor but at night we left the patio door open (we were on 3rd floor) and had the greatest breeze and wave crashing sounds. No bed bugs or mosquitoes as mentioned in some other reviews. Buffet food not always warm but certainly edible and mucho variety. The ala cartes were exellent. Tried Chinese, Italian, seafood (included in VIP-otherwise a $25 charge), and Brazilian. Don't miss the Brazilian-its quite a different dinner concept. Food available somewhere 24/7.VIP included top shelf liquor (still ended up with Presidente beer as husband liked it better than the Heinekin - never did see Budweiser), 3 cigars, bottle of rum, 1 hr motorized sports, seafood or steak ala carte, 2 massages (never did), free safety deposit box use and a great room, had a step down area with a couch, table and chairs. Ask for room 2311 if you go.Nightly show at 9:45 kinda hokey but fun to laugh at/with. Party then moves to lobby until midnight with entertainment staff mingling/dancing with guests and then on to either the disco (too loud for my old ears) or to the beach bar that is open all night (also serving food). Beach was the nicest I have ever seen. Very active waves. Not a shell to be found - not even shell pieces - only pure white soft sand. Had no trouble getting beach chairs under palapas or getting beach towels as mentioned in some reviews. If boobs offend you - Punta Cana is not for you. All ages from sweet young things to old grandmas stroll up and down the beach with just swimsuit bottoms. Flea market is to the left when you stand in front of the ocean. They pretty much have the same things. Also, vendors set up at the resort on Friday and Tuesday. You might want to check prices at the gift shop near the lobby before buying from the vendors to get an idea of pricing. I bought necklace/bracelet/earrings for $6 more from the vendors than the gift shop had it priced. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Bring plenty of 1's for tipping. These same staff members are on duty from early morning breakfast hours to the end of dinner hour daily. We were there for 7 days and saw same staff every day. Supposedly they work 9 days and get 1 off, before sun up to after sundown on their feet. It is my feeling if you can afford a vacation like this, you can afford a little more to show your appreciation for fine service given. We did the boat trip for our 1-hr motorized outing included in the VIP. Eight vacationers on boat - no one but us tipped. I gave the guy $5 and he hugged me as if I was one of his long lost relatives-he sincerely appreciated it. Did zip line trip. That was a lot of fun. Long and short of it - Caribe Club Princess is absolutely beautiful and we will probably be going back next year.  
<Date>Mar 27, 2008

<Author>mermaid7272
<Content>Great Place---- No lie! To those who are going to this hotel, please DO NOT listen to the negativity about the Caribe Princess! The hotel is above average and a beautiful place to stay. Only a few problems.The food is excellent and the waiters are funny and attentive to your needs. The main buffet had food to suit anyone except perhaps a spoiled Paris Hilton type. The specialty restaurants were very good, especially the Brazilian  Italian ones.Our room was clean  furnished with soaps, shampoos  amenities  towels. There was a free mini-bar with soft drinks  beer  bottled water.DO not drink the tap water in your room or brush your teeth with it, use bottled water.There was no screen on the balcony door though, and the electrical system was hard to figure out!The biggest problem were loud, drunks who fought outside in the halls late at night. They were rude Americans with no class, and the front desk did take care of the problem very quickly. It's no wonder we Americans have such a bad reputation in the world.Entertainment was very loud and annoying, the music never stops nor does the loud mouths of the activity staff.The beaches were white sand, turquoise waters,  great waves. Only problem there was there were too many people on the beach. The pools were very nice, three of them. If you want a quiet room, and are not a Spring-Breaker, ask for a room in one of the Villas, they are in the quiet part of the resort and are geared for older, less wild types!

<Author>Vancouver18
<Content>Ignore the bad reviews, this place is great! Four of us, all 20 year old males, stayed at the Caribe Club Princess for a week from March 10-17th. I read the reviews on this site before we left, and was worried that they would be true, however was more then surprised to find out that the CCP was a great place, and none of the bad reviews held any merit. We ate at the buffet at least once a day, and quickly made friends with one of the waiters. We tried the Italian, Dominican, Brazilian, and Chinese ala-carte's, however really only enjoyed the Italian and Brazilian. There is snack bar near the beach that is open from noon to 6am that has hot dogs, hamburgs, nachos, salads, etc. We usually had a snack there in the afternoon and then a snack around 2am after the night was over.We mostly sat on the beach during the day, and then moved to the swim up bar in the afternoons. The bartender there was awesome, we quickly became friends with him, and he gave us excellent service. They key point here is to be nice to the staff, and they will do the same to you. We encountered a lot of young people our age on Spring Break ordering multiple drinks and yelling rapido, rapido. This is not the way to do it; just wait your turn, be polite, and you will be fine.At night, the lobby gets going around 10pm til' midnight once the nightly show is done. There is music and dancing, and then people head to the Arieto disco or to the beach bar. We tried the Disco a few times, but it is excessively loud to the point you can hear it from a long way. There are also tons of local prostitutes inside, propositioning the males. We were in there for less then 10 minutes before it started. We only went to the disco with friends, and otherwise avoided it and chose the beach bar instead. The beach bar serves drinks all night, and the bartenders were nice to us, we gave them a tip a few times and they would serve us immediately before any one else, which was nice.We did one excursion. We went on the Caribbean festival excursion which is a snorkel tour and booze cruise, and includes swimming with nurse sharks and sting rays. It was an alright trip, but a little pricey at $80 usd but I would do it again.Finally, the rooms were more then adequate. We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor which gave us vaulted ceilings. The rooms were updated and kept clean every day, and the fridge was stocked with water, coke and sprite. Bathrooms were clean and new, and no complaints there.I read the reviews before I left, and was worried that my friends and I would not like this place. If you are young and want to have fun, or would like to be able to drink until the early morning hours, then this is the place for you. It is a 4 star resort, and a lot of people I met said that they could not tell the difference between the CCP and a 5 star, so like I said, take the bad reviews with a grain of salt.  
<Date>Mar 20, 2008

<Author>youngtravel444
<Content>Caribe Club Princess is only a 3 star resort We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess the last week of Feb, 2008. There were 2 couples aged 30-34 travelling together at this resort.Overall - the resort itself was good. The beach is fabulous which can be expected at any resort in Punta Cana. The buffet and a la carte resaurants were all good (except for the Chinese resaurant). The resort ammenities (i.e pool, grounds etc) were well kept and clean.The major negative aspect about this resort would be our room. The room was clean, but definately a 3 star and not a 4 or 5 star room. The hotel is made up of several 3 level buildings. We were on the bottom floor and our room (and our friend's room) looked out onto an alleyway that was used regularly by staff members. Also, there were mosquitos in our room, and our light was broken when we arrived (however was fixed later in the week when we complained about it). There is a mini bar that is stocked every day.Also - there were not enough safety deposit keys for everyone who was staying at the hotel the week we were there. Our friends had to wait 2 days before they were able to get a safety deposit key.One of the best things about the resort was the La Creperie snack shop. You can get crepes (ham/cheese, or fruit), ice cream etc from 1:00-6:00pm every day. Delicious!!Also, if you are looking for a shopping market on the beach - go to the one that is to the left of the resort it is only about a 5 min walk. There is another one to the right of the resort, but it is about a 45 min walk, and not as good as the other one.Overall, I would go back to this hotel, as long as I got a different room (I think the rooms on the upper floors are better).  
<Date>Mar 16, 2008

<Author>mrsusca
<Content>nice place overall All staff were very friendly, food was pretty good loved the buffet, didn't like the chinese at all. mexican was very good. we had a basic room nothing special. but it was kept clean if you tip or give your maid something like a candy bar you get some specials like flowers and extra pop and water. we did have a few probs with the bed bugs but its the tropics so what do you expect? the beach was just beautiful with no shells and very little sea weed. if you go to the shops go the the left on the beach not the right or you are in for a LONG walk. the shows were ok. very nice well kept grounds. most the staff really tried to keep you happy. loved the guy at the pool bar he was great. went on the splash tour with the mini speed boats and snorkling it was so much fun i would do it again!! not really a place for kids unless you want your children looking at all the topless women on the beach guess wherever they come from its normal . nothing i want my kids to see. overall it was a good time, dont know if i would go again but it was a nice place.

<Author>DR1234
<Content>Only OK Went to the Caribe Club Princess in the DR Feb 27-Mar 5.We have been to the DR twice before, 1st stay was the Palladium 2nd was Ocean Blue. I wish we would have been at either of those two this trip.The good about the Caribe, The staff is very freindly and helpful and I believe they try there best it always helps to tip a buck or two. The food was good at all the resturants and the buffet.The bad, The rooms need renovation. They are overused and not tended for, they have no dressers for your clothes the door that covers the mini bar fridge didnt close in either room (we went with another couple) and the mattresses where wore out. The walls in the rooms are paper thin you hear everything, hard to sleep. You can see light thru the cracks in the doors to your room. The Apple vacation rep, during the oreintation made it seem like you could get a hold of him any time, however, even when he said he would be at his desk at certain hours you couldnt find or contact him. Example We made reservations for Cocotal Golf course thru him and payed him. When we went it was overcrowded so after 4hrs and only finishing 9 holes we quit we turned in the cart and was told to contact our Apple Rep for a 9 hole refund then went to the club house for drinks,lunch and our ride back. After 3 days we finally got a hold of the Rep he said it shouldnt be a problem contact him tommorrow after 2hrs of hunting for him he said Cocotal was giving him problems and he would see us when we leave and get it staightened out. Needless to say he wasnt around, were home and still no word.The pool bar didnt have it's own bathhrooms so you had to walk to the nearest ones that were the beach bathrooms and then there's only 1 seater for the women and 1 for the men.In our opinion the Caribe Club should only be a 2 to maybe 3 apple compared to the Palladium or the OceanBlue.

<Author>l2travel27
<Content>very disappointed and so frustrated I never thought that I would feel strong enough about a resort to post on this site, but after our experience I felt I had to. My husband and I just returned from 1 week at Caribe Club Princess. We refer to tripadvisor often before booking vacations and we happened to book this resort right before the last few bad reviews were posted. We were expecting a decent resort based on the earlier reviews. We also booked the VIP package. Our flight and transportation to the hotel were fine, however the resort was not at all what we expected. When we arrived we were greeted by staff who seemed inconvenienced to take care of anything. We were brought to our room, only to find the resort maid tidying up. After she left it was clear that she hadn't cleaned the room at all. Our bathroom light was out and neither the maid nor the person carrying our bags seemed to think that this was a big deal. There were quite a few mosquitoes in our room and the hotel room was overall very dirty. We complained to our concierge whose response was, You have a bed, you have a TV, you have a coffee maker, what more do you want? Needless to say we were furious at this point - if we hadn't paid what we did for this vacation, then yes we wouldn't be asking for lights that worked in the bathroom and a mosquito free room, let alone a clean room. That first night we spent over 1 hour killing mosquitoes in our room. When we finally climbed into bed we were so disgusted to find sheets with several unsightly spots which closely resembled bodily fluids on them (no I am not exaggerating here!) That first night we barely slept, due to the mosquitoes that seemed to pop up no matter how many we tried to kill and the fact that the two of us were huddled in the clean corner of the bed not wanting to touch the rest of the sheets. We met with our Apple representative the next morning told him our concerns and he said that he would send someone to FUMIGATE our room and send the maid with clean sheets. He said that if we were not happy after that then we could POSSIBLY change rooms if there was one available. Those were our only two requests and he seemed frustrated by the complaints. We spent the second day at the beach and returned to our room at approximately 4:30-5 only to find it in the exact same condition as it was when we left in the morning - the same sheets and still many mosquitoes. My husband called the front and complained and the maid did come with clean sheets and a can of bug spray that she handed to him for HIM to spray the room. At this point we were both so angry and frustrated that we ended up spraying the room ourselves and leaving the doors open while we stood outside for 15 min to let the room aerate. I had to laugh at the situation at this point because I was about to break out into tears and I didn't want to ruin what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation. Aside from the situation with our room, we found the food to be disappointing in most of the restaurants (other than La Cava and the Brazilian restaurant... the Italian was also not bad) and were greatly disappointed by the staff service. We can only think of 2-3 people who were friendly and did not seem inconvenienced to be doing their job. We are not picky people, nor are we demanding and it seemed as if we were trying to please them more than they were us. If you haven鈥檛 booked your vacation yet I would definitely NOT recommend this resort. If you have booked then I would ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floors when you get there. We met people that had rooms on these floors and they did not seem to have the same mosquito problem that we did although some complained of the shower not having hot water. Also, if you have booked and can upgrade to the VIP then I would highly recommend it. It is definitely worth it as other people have mentioned. The food at the restaurant (La CAVA) that comes with the VIP was really good and you don鈥檛 have to pay for things like the safe and bottled beer. The breakfast buffet was good, however the lunch selection was not so great. Also, they have a crepe place near the beach that serves crepes and ice cream. That was good but the service was not. We didn鈥檛 get sick during our trip but we were both careful about what we ate. Also, we highly recommend bringing 鈥淥FF鈥?with you for the mosquitoes. The night shows are later (9:45) and we had to buy OFF there because of all the mosquitoes outside and in our room. The one great thing that we both enjoyed was the BEAUTIFUL beach!! The water was crystal clear and the sand was white. It was wavy as someone else mentioned in another review but we still went in every day and had a blast! It almost made up for the resort鈥?. almost! The weather was also perfect. We ended up making the best of it so if you have booked already don鈥檛 be too discouraged. If you keep a sense of humour about it then you鈥檒l have a good time.  
<Date>Mar 1, 2008

<Author>Starter1159
<Content>Great Vacation My wife and I got back last night after a wonderful trip. This was our first time to Punta Cana. All of our other trips have always been to Mexico. The best thing about the trip are the beaches. Soft and wonderful. We are beach people and spent 90% of our time there. We went on long walks each morning and afternoon. The food was normal for an all-inclusive, not great, but we could always find something to eat. Breakfast was definitely the best. We ate at La Cava, Italian and Brazilian. The Italian had the best food, but the experience at the Brazillian was great. We felt that the VIP was well worth it. The room was much nicer and in a better location. The maids kept our refrigerator well stocked at all times and gave us fresh towels every morning and night. Not having to wait in lines to sign up for reservations. It was also nice to have a Budweiser or Heineken now and then without having to pay extra. We tipped regularly and usually got better service because of it. We brought insulated mugs so that our drinks lasted longer on the beach. They did not have a problem filling them up with the tip. We thought that the people at the resort were good, except for guest services. They did not know anything. The front desk personnel were the best. The bartenders were always fun and entertaining. All and all a great trip and a place that we would recommend and visit again.  
<Date>Feb 24, 2008

<Author>jellybean0913
<Content>Great Vacation at Caribe Club My boyfriend and I stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from January 27th to February 3rd, 2008. We had a great time and would return.The buildings where the rooms are located is a good 5 minute (or a little longer) walk from the main lobby, but the stroll down the walkway is truly beautiful with an array of different birds (peacocks, cranes, ducks, etc) and trees and bushes to stop and look at. There is also a little bus that comes by regularly for those who don't want to walk or are unable to.We took the VIP package and had a lovely room on the main floor just steps from the sandy white beach. The a la carte we had at La Cava was delicious (we both had steak), and the atmosphere was romantic. We also enjoyed the Italian a la carte (the 4 cheese gnocchi was unbelievable!!), and again the atmosphere was perfect. The service at both was great. We did not enjoy the Seafood a la carte as much as the lobster is prepared differently. The main buffet always had a large selection with something for everyone. I wish I had of tried the fresh banana juice at breakfast before our last day there. No wonder they were always filling it up...it was a hit!!The variety of drinks was great and we enjoyed them all (banana mama's, coco locco's, daquiris, etc.) We've actually got recipes off the internet for many of them.We had visited Cuba last year and I was impressed with how friendly the staff and people had been there, and I was not expecting that on this vacation. I had no need to worry, we found all the staff and people we came in contact with to be very friendly and helpful.We joined in a variety of games around the pool and on the beach, enjoyed a massage at the spa and went on a couple excursions (swam with nurse sharks and stingrays).The shows in the evening were much what you'd expect - you'll enjoy some more then others. The one I didn't think I'd like (Gothic) turned out to be my favorite (Michael Jackson's Thriller, Rocky Horror Picture Show, Queen and Phantom of the Opera).After the show you have the option of going to the disco (we never did), to the lobby for some dancing, or down to the beach bar where you can also get snacks (hamburgs, fries, nacho,etc.)Take some of the reviews with a grain of salt.  
<Date>Feb 20, 2008

<Author>sawebb
<Content>Wonderful Experience We just returned from our stay at Caribe Club last night! We took another couple who have been at 4 other resorts in DR last 4 years. Loved the room right by the pool and just steps from the beach! Loved Mamma Mia, the Italian restaurant, and the Asian restaurant! Both great! Loved the concierge who can book your dinners every morning at your building. Excellent employees who always smile. Won some money at the casino too. I did get many mosquito bites though, they were fogging the grounds at night. Didn't get any last year. The in-room safes are broken and need repair. The patio doors on ground floor need some lock repair. However, the rooms are very clean, a little dated, but it does not change the beauty of the beach, the ocean and the experience. The food was better than last year. We took tours and rented jet skis and had a ball! We will be back next Feb. Would definitely stay here again.

<Author>kusue
<Content>loved caribe Loved the Caribe stayed there from 2/5/8 to 2/15/8. Glad I ignored the negative reviews. We did VIP suggest that for anyone going to the resort it is worth the few extra dollars. Our room was spacious and having the additional sitting area was a plus our room overlooked the pool and could see the ocean from our balcony.No problem with the food people have to understand that they are in another country so the style of cooking will be different and they will offer different forms of food, try them they are pretty good. A La Carte restaurants were great the only one we did not try was the Brazalian. Went twice to the dominican and the steak there was so tender and great. Ever restaurant was small and intimate which makes it a nicer atmosphere and you can enjoy your meal.We did the Le Cava restaurant for Valentines day and it was very romantic, the lobster was excellent so try it. I could go on and on but try the resort and have your own great experience we did and enjoyed our stay. We bought into the royal vacations package so will be coming back.

<Author>IowaLotus
<Content>Had a great time at Caribe Club Princess. Just returned from a 7 day stay and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and the resort was very clean. My wife and two (young adult) sons went for a winter escape, we had two separate rooms. The beach was our main focus and it was very nice, clean, with lots of activities, etc. We ate at the mexican specialty resturante once but decided to just use the buffet after that since there was so much variety and flexibility. We never bothered to attend the evening shows or the disco since we were too tired from playing all day. I didn't travel 7 hours to see a show or attend a night club, if that's what I wanted I'd go to Vegas. I just wanted an escape from the winter cold. I wanted sun, sand, beach, water, food, and drink. All was delivered to our satisfaction!

<Author>jolajarek
<Content>not worth the money, stay away I stayed with my family at Caribe Club Princess first week of December of 2007. I traveled with my husband (we are both 28), our 3 year old son and a couple in their 40s. We were tight on the budget and were not planning a vacation last year, however when I saw the Carible Club Princess deal I jumped on it with no hesitation. We arrived at the hotel from the airport few minutes after noon and were told that the room will be rady at 3:00. We decided to grab something to drink, I ordered pinacoladas and mohitos at the lobby bar, they were the worst drinks I have ever tasted. Both drinks were not made with fresh fuits and mint, but some artificial green syrup. Finally at three we went to get our room key, we were supposed to pick it up at the entranceto one of the hotel buildings. It took us 20 minutes in line, were all we were breathing was sewer, it was discusting.Our room was ok, nothing special, just a standard hotel room, bathroom was ok too. There was iron, hair dryer and remote control in the room. If you want to use the safe, you need to ask for a key at the front desk during check-in, and they are going to charge you around $25 during your check out. food: we went to two specialty restaurants, chinese and italian. Italian was good, the desert was delicious!, the chinese however, was really bad, but the desert was excellent if you like fried ice cream, if yougo there for the food you will be really disappointed, if you like fried ice cream then I recommend it highly. After these two we decided to try the main buffet for dinner and it was not bad at all. The food was exactly the same as at the specialty restaurants becasue they have a different theeme night every day, one day its mexican food, then italian, chinese and so on. There was something for everybody, the desers were good also.Drinks and Bars: bad, bad, bad no matter how much you tip. they might give you more alcohol but the way they mix the drinks is horrible. Pinacolatas were bad, mohitos, mamahuanas, miami vice, cosmo, dirty monkey, it did not matter what you ordered, I asked them for a slumer after everything else failed, they did not even know what it was ?! so if you are a drinker bring your own alcohol or stay awayEntertainment: bad, unprofessional, silly shows. The evening entertainment at the theater was not good. Very amateur, bed costumes, bad jokes , bad music. I love to attend these evening events and this was the first hotel that I did not like and first hotel that did not have a Michale Jackson showService: service was ok, rooms were cleaned nicely, the towels were always there, the waiteres were quick to clean up the table and every one was very friendly and nice, easpecially to the kids, I liked thatresort area and beach : beach was nice, huge waves, maybe it was just the season, we were always able to find a beach chair.Towels, however, was a problem, if you did not get them first thing in the morning, then you had to wait until 12 for the secod batch. There are few pools in the resort area, all vere nice, water was warm and clean ( except for the swim up bar).Overall I do nto recommend this hotel. We have traveled to PuntaCana twice before and stayed at the riu resorts, which were excellent. We have never stayed at a 5 star hotel. Riu Cancun in Mexico was the best hotel we ever styed in, so we are not not picky when it comess to accomodations or food, we try to travel on a budget, but if somebody was offering me to stay at this resort again for free, I would not go.  
<Date>Feb 8, 2008

<Author>marinaChicago
<Content>Don't eat anything!!!! Don't eat anything at this place... because if you do, you'll end up running out to the balcony to vomit while your roommate has uncontrollable diarrhea in the bathroom!!! Then, after you have no more food and water in your system to throw up, you'll start with the bile... which is very unpleasant. And, once the hotel has made you so sick that you cannot keep anything down, they will charge you about $250 for a doctor to put an IV in you. Even though 10 other people seem to have come down with the same thing and have not left the premises of the hotel, they refuse to acknowledge that you've gotten food poisoning and should not be forced to pay for them to put some water back in your system. Aside from this, there are two positive aspects of the hotel. If you are interested in seeing improper cooking standards, this might be a good place to go for a field trip. And if you do happen to get the most terrible food poisoning of your life, complaining to a manager will probably get you a box of cigars and a few bars of soap.

<Author>Westwoods99
<Content>Loved it !! :) My husband and i stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon, we had spent most our money on having a brilliant wedding day and had little left over for our holiday!Ive been to The Dom Rep 5x before and my husband had never even left britain!!This hotel was a 3* at the time so i expected 3* not 4* or 5* like some people do!All i will say is the room was clean, sheets changed regularly and the air conditioning was out of this world - so cold i had to turn it off at times!! The maid was a Gem, i left her a little note on my first day asking for diet coke only in my fridge, and a small tip 2 -3 dollars and my fridge was 'packed' solid' with the stuff every day!!Plus she left us flowers etc in our room!!There were 3 pools! one with a bar which was a little busy and too loud for myself!!One between the two hotels which was quiet and then there was the pool next to the Tropical Princess, this was amazingly quiet with little fountains and a bridge!! Very easy to get a sunbed, however there was lots of Americans who used the free pool towels to reserve sunbeds at the pool while they went to the beach!! - So we played them at there own game!!The beach was lovely, the sea was gorgeous the best so far, (do not go to the North as the beach is not that nice!!)The food in the hotel was 'typical 'all inclusive pizza, pasta, chips then rice salad etc with a few dodgey looking meat dishes!! - use your common sense when eating, people seem to leave this at home on holiday!! (Its not the uk and Hygiene standards are lower - GET OVER IT!)Which brings me on to a review i read earlier about the birds, Yes birds fly into the Buffet restaurant, its open air .... What do they expect!!Occasionally a family of Peacocks would walk past your table, personally i found this quite charming as they were cute!!There were other restaurants that you had to pay a supplement for and when you check out you pay for these, about $10 a head - except they didn't charge us at all!! If you are looking for excitement at night then this is not the place for you! The animation team try and put on a good show but by the time they've spoken in 4 - 5 languages youv'e missed the punchline or your just totally lost!! - we gave up!!The one bad thing i would say about this hotel is the 'lucky lucky men' who come into the complex with there stalls. They come in about twice a week, and they can get quite pushy and occasionally rude!This would have ruined our holiday if we had not made it into entertainment for ourselves - getting from the pool to our room was like running a gauntlet!! - it was Funny!!If you go on any trip go on the 007 speedboats, you drive your own mini speed boat over the sea and go snorkelling!! - this was amazing however i did have to tell my husband to slow down as he thought he was a speed demon!!!!When taking into concideration reviews from this site remember people are after different things and have different expectations!!We ignored the bad reviews and am glad we did!!You get what you pay for we only paid around 拢600 each and loved it!!To say my husband had never left Britain - now weve booked to go to cuba!!P.s One last thing, we visited the shop near the lobby most days for an ice cream - Dont bother its free in the creperie!! Which is right next to the pool we were at!! We didnt discover this till two days before we left!!

<Author>XYZ_03Ontario
<Content>Bug Bites! Stayed at this resort from Jan 17 - 24. The room was ok, seemed to be clean, but was dated. The restaurants and the food were very good. We ate at the Italian, Chinese, Mexican, Brazilian, and the creperie and enjoyed them all very much. As well, the buffet was fine, especially for breakfast........ made to order omelets were great.However, almost everyone on the resort was covered in but bites. We landed at 9:30 Thursday night and woke up with bites friday morning. Made us think they were bed bugs. We stripped the bed down and didnt find anything but we are still not sure. We saw the maintenance people fumigating a number of rooms which caused us great conceren.i have stayed at many resorts in the caribbean and have never had this before. The resort told us it was sand fleas and mosquitos, but as stated, i have never ever experienced this before.Has anyone else experience this at the Carib Club Princess? As a result of this i cannot recommend this resort to anyone until they get this under control. One member of our party had over 40 bites.

<Author>LilBee24
<Content>Mixed Review This is a VERY late review, I went in April 2007. Just wanted to add my two cents to the mix. As someone who has been to Punta Cana twice and also to Cuba, and someone who is not fussy, this was a nice place but probably the worst resort I have stayed at. Why? The staff!! Nice at first, but LOOK OUT! Two ladies we knew were robbed by their maids.Another woman was nice to a guy all week, tipped him etc..., and then when she asked if he could get her some bags of coffee beans he took advantage of her and majorly ripped the poor lady off. Tripled the price, like - what a sleezeball. My friends and I befriended a guynamed Carlos at The Creperie who was sweet, and then within a few days became super nasty when my friends and I turned down his advances...I actually think he spit in my crepe, made us feel really uncomfortable and laughed and spoke Spanish to his buddies and pointedat us, threw the food on the table etc.., He was actually scary when he said: I showed up at the disco and you weren't there! bla bla bla... We had to avoid the Creeperie as we now called it for the rest of the trip. Also, this staff is annoying as all get-out - they literally pull you by the arms and drag you to play the games on the beach or by the pool. One guy stole my friend's purse right off her shoulder and held it hostage until she would play some crummy bingo game, even as we insisted we were late to get ready for dinner reservations, until she finally snapped and just said listen, give me the freaking purse!! The staff was really quite annoying sometimes. Even saw one physically drag a lady's loungechair down the side of the pool (with her in it!) to where they were starting a game,and she was in the middle of relaxing! She did not look pleased.HAVING SAID ALL THIS....That was the major downfall (more to come). For now, some pluses: The beach is beautiful. GORGEOUS. Full of straw palapas to sit under, lovely white sand, awesome. The restaurants and buffet are DELICIOUS. Pools are beautiful, landscape is beautiful, andif someone complains about walking to the lobby they must be hacking their way there through the forest and ignoring the beautifully manicured stone walkways that are lit up at night, and often serviced by golfcarts to drive you. Sometimes they have fun dance parties in the lobby, and there's an all-night beach bar to drink and eat at, so you can have fun if you're willing to make your own fun but it ain't wild-party-crazy-Cancuun. There is a fabulous casino that a free shuttle will take you to - roulette, blackjack, slots, clean and friendly, and drinks only a peso or free if you're playing. Ok, time for a few more downsides: the hall outside our room STUNK. There was an open air courtyard at the end where they let garbage pileup, and I swear to you - I'm not fussy - but I would almost throw up every time I walked back to my room. Gross. We put up with it though, the rooms were really nice inside and stink-free once you made it in. Invest in the safe (see robbery comment above). Balconies lacking, furnished only with plastic chairs. But after a few cervasas these are as comfy as the next....Entertainment is pretty lacking...the disco sucks (full of creepy locals, and the guys we met said that every night they went to the disco they were propostioned by prostitutes). So....pass on the disco, I would suggest. Oh! Last complaint: The mixed drinks were pretty crappy. I'm more of a beer drinker, but anything that needed to be mixed was just swimming with too much sugar. Premium liqour was not free - couldn't get a Bailey's and milk, for instance, like I had enjoyed at previous resorts. Couldn't get a nice caesar. Tip: they had free champagne! That almost made up for the lack of a good mixed drink, but if you are fussy aboutyour drinks this place might be a deal-breaker.Overall - if you get it cheap go for the beach, the landscape, and thegrub!! Be wary of staff that seem friendly and are only trying to use you (for sex or money). If you like crazy dancing nightlife, it's not the place for you b/c the disco is sketchy (I hear Grand Paladium has amazing nightlife and is just down the beach). ummm... Great casino! Walking distance to Bavaro town. If you get even the faintest whiff ofgarbage from the hall outside your room - move ASAP b/c it will getmuch worse!Good luck!

<Author>ryguy2008
<Content>Great Resort! The Perfect Vacation! As a family of 5, after our stay at Caribe Club Princess from Dec 22-29, we have only good things to say about the place.First of all, don't let any of the bad reviews discourage you!A run down of everything... Check in: Smooth. The shuttle bus from our travel agent with TMR was ready when we were. In the airport, there's a little booth where they direct you to your bus. As well, porters offer to bring your luggage. You also have a rep from your travel agent whose available an hour a day at your resort to answer your questions, and who gives a welcome meeting to go over everything to new guests. Our room was ready when we arrived. We took the VIP package, so we got the coupons we needed right away (massage, motorized water sports, and Internet.)Food: Excellent. The food is prepared differently than in mainstream North America, but it definitely is good. Breakfast is, as other reviews say, pretty much the same thing daily. However, there is so much available, that you don't get bored of it. The fresh omelettes are delicious! You choose what you want inside (tomatoes, red/green peppers, ham, cheese) and the guy makes it for you on the spot. As well, you can have eggs easy over... There's also muffihs, bacon, potatoes, scrambled eggs, waffles, pancakes, rolls, and so much more. The fresh juices are also really good.Lunch is also really good. There's 2 snack bars at either ends of the Tropical/Caribe Club beach section, which are only about 3 minutes walking distance from each other. The food there is delicious, there's always pasta, hamburgers, hot dogs, nachos (with cheese or salsa), and more. As well, there's a bar at each lunch buffet spot. (The buffets are at the seafood restaurant, and the dominican food restaurant.) As well, there's always the lunch buffet at the place where the breakfast buffet is, which is just a wider selection. However, you need to have shoes and a shirt to go in there...You will not go hungry at Supper either. There's the buffet at El Higuera (the place where the breakfast is), and a choice of 5 restaurants that anybody can use, and 2 that cost $25/person. (Or if you have the VIP package, you can choose 1 of them once per week at no extra cost.)The supper buffet is always great. They have a different theme each night (like Italian, Brazillian, Dominican, etc), and the food there is always good. There's easily 100 things to choose from there. They seem to always have some things made on the spot too, like fried vegetables, or fresh pasta with the sauce of your choice. If you see something made on the spot, get it. It's usually a hint the food is good. There's also icecream at the supper buffet.... Once you bring your food to the table, a waiter will get you your drink.As well, the restaurants are also good. In some regard, some of the food you see at certain buffet themes you get at the restaurant. We ate at the mexican, italian, chinese, and steakhouse (VIP extra).Mexican (Sombrera)- Food was great. They come and sing you a song while you are eating. Nice variety.Italian (Mamma Mia)- Really good. Pasta with seafood sauce was great.Chinese (Shanghai)- Alright. Certain parts were great, certain parts were alright. They serve you sushi and beef on a stick when you sit down, which is really really good. However, the main meals are only alright. Nothing amazing. The fried icecream (vanilla icecream, with fried dough around it, with chocolate sauce on the side) is amazing!Steakhouse (La Cava)- This was included with our VIP package, and definitely was amazing! The food was delicious! The steak was cooked perfectly! The apetizers and main courses were humongous and delish! The shrimp surprises (apetizer) and the steak were amazing. Definitely recommend this place.The other VIP restaurant, or $25/person one, is the seafood restaurant which we didn't try. (El Pescador)Now onto other stuff...Staff- The staff were always very helpful, and wanted to help you. The waiters at the buffet were usually on the ball and got you your drink pretty quickly. As well, they kept the place clean for you when you arrive. The waiters at the restaurants were always on the ball, having a new drink ready for you basically as soon as you finish yours. The bartenders also were great. There were a few instances where the staff only spoke Spanish, so it was a bit difficult to communicate. But usually they would know some English or French (french was a bit more common).Housekeeping was usually on the ball. If you leave them gifts and a tip, they make up your room fast and sometimes leave towel designs (like a heart or a swan..). One day they forgot about our room though, and didn't make it up until we got them in there at 5 PM. Animation staff - Amazing. Always on the ball. Throughout the day, there'd be water aerobics, step up aerobics on land, merengue dance lessons, darts tournaments, pentaca tournaments, bowling down pineapples with coconuts tournaments, etc. If you win a tournament, they present you a diploma at their nightly show (more on this soon). They'd always try to get you to participate, and they definitely are fun to be with.Beach - Spotless. Therea are people there picking up garbage all throughout the day. The sand is so soft and clean, and the water is a beautiful blue. The water is always warm too. You can get a boogie board free for 1 hour a day. As well, there are some excursions that you can sign up for at the aquatics hut (at a cost), that we didn't bother with. Some were snorkeling with dolphins or whatever... The beach is also cleaned throughoughly at night. There was never ever an issue trying to find chairs or getting a hut. And this was during their high season...As well, with our VIP coupons for motorized water sports, we tried the banana boat ride. Its basically an inflatible long tube that everybody sits on with a handle per person. And one of the water staff on a motorboat pulls the tube fast throughout the water. Only try this if you like moving FAST, and getting wet. Definitely a lot of fun, and recommended....The pools were also always clean. We only used the main pool (the one with the swim-up pool bar) where all the action is, but there definitely was never any issues here. Only thing is the water is a bit cold because it's not heated. Bars: Tons of fresh drinks, fruit punch, soft drinks, slushy drinks available that don't have alcohol. Also tons of alcoholic drinks available for adults. If your VIP, you get access to all the liquors free of charge, whereas non-vip's only get national alcoholic drinks.Besides the beach, everywhere else is clean. There's a kid's club that we saw doing activities throughout the day, but never really looked into it. There's also teen club with foosball tables and pool tables. There's tennis, and mini golf available at no extra charge for those who are interested.For those who aren't sure, the VIP package is definitely worthwhile. First of all, all the VIP people stay in one hotel. In this hotel only, every room has a *private* balcony. Elsewhere, balconies are not completely private or sometimes even shared. There's a concierge in your hotel from 9-4 PM daily to answer questions or for you to reserve your restaurant. Much easier than having to wait in line with everyone else to reserve. And overall, you don't want to have to pay more for anything during your stay. The massages are so worthwhile, as well as the motorized watersports if you like that. Also, at the bars, you don't want to have to be charged for a drink if it costs extra. As well, your hotel is perfectly located. You're right at the beach and the main pool with all the action. There's no real walking distance.Nightly shows: Most of them are good. We were fortunate to be able to see the Lion King, and that was fantastic! They always have nice sets, lighting, costumes, etc. However, they mouth the words to any songs or dialogue in the show. Luckily for us, the Lion King was all in English! They also have many dance shows with different themes (Carnaval, Christmas, etc..). Their comedy show skits were cute, at most. They also give the tournament winners their diploma before the show. After the show, the animation staff (who perform in the show) invite the audience to come and dance with them for a bit before they send you off to Areito Disco which we never went to. Don't make our mistake. The theatre near El Higuera (the buffet place) is NOT the main theatre. That's for a little show guests put on that we never really figured out how it works...Everything is really close to each other. The only real distance is about 5 minutes to the lobby and the theatre with the nightly shows. And there's a shuttle that comes often anyways...The lobby is beautiful too. They clean it so often.Something else they have is a photographer who goes around during the day with a different animal or model to take your picture. There's a little monkey, iguana, parrots, beautiful white birds, or sometimes a male or female model. He takes your picture with whatever he has, and then the print is available in the lobby at night or the following day. The pictures always come out great because they use a great camera, and they add to it a nice border with Caribe club... dec07 or whatever)... but pictures are $15/each. If you buy more than 10, its something like $12/each. Although there's no committment to buy it...Also, after 4 days they throw out any pictures unpurchased.Tipping- No obligation, but if you do, people definitely make an effort to offer you better service. $1 goes a long way here. No need to tip more than $2-3 at at a time. These people work hard and don't get paid much as it is.Checkout- Also went smoothly. We purchased a late checkout (at 6 PM) because our bus left only at midnight. You can only get this though the day before or day of checkout. Otherwise checkout is at 12 PM. You' re still able to get access to all the resorts features until you leave. They can also lock your luggage in a safe room so you don't have to worry. With TMR, our shuttle bus was on time. After a few stops at other resorts, we reached the airport. 30 minutes to go through check-in and security. It's a bit different than other airports, as in, you get to see planes taking off because the airport is just one giant hut of sorts. Anyway, I think that's it! If you have any questions, feel free to contact me. Don't worry, relax, and have a great trip!  
<Date>Dec 31, 2007

<Author>CoteStLuc
<Content>Paradise! This was a dream vacation! We have three kids (two are teens) and we all had the most wonderful experience. The resort is beautiful, the food was delicious and there are numerous activities for all ages. We highly recommend the VIP package, which entitles you to free massages, motorized sports, dining at specialty restaurants and access to internet. The beach is gorgeous, the people are friendly and the staff animators have more energy than you can imagine! There are daily tropical dance lessons on the beach, land and water games, organized sports of all kinds and fun nightly shows. Money extremely well-spent! We all came back tanned and very happy!

<Author>psucavvy
<Content>Satisfied with the CCP experience Our visit to the Caribe Club Princess was a 5 day, 4 night experience booked through my company (travel company) via Apple Vacations. I selected the VIP package based on the minimal amount of price difference between that and the standard room. I requested a king sized bed, and an upper level room, and got both with no problems. We were situated in 2311 with a wonderful ocean view. In our opinion, the VIP package was worth the extra money-- a great massage, internet (which we did not end up using), an hour of motorized watersports (took the boat excursion up and down the coast, circling the shipwreck and heading south past the hotels for a dip in the shallows), and of course the premium dinner. We ate at El Pescador and it was definitely worth it. I had a massive platter of fried lobster that was fantastic. I found that most of the positive reviews on this website held true. We had no issues with the maid service, our concierge Alex was great and very helpful, our Apple Rep. Tony was also great. We did two nights at the buffet for dinner, and one at the Italian restaurant. The food was serviceable enough for our tastes. What else can I say? The activities staff was nice and did not press you into anything you didn't want to do, and the two Jose's at the pool bar were very entertaining! All said we had a wonderful getaway, well worth it!

<Author>PennsylvaniaRealtor
<Content>What a Blast!! 11 of us stayed at Club Princess Nov 26 to Dec 3rd, we all had a great time!! This hotel is rated a 4 star, I don't know why, it was beautiful, our room was really nice, the grounds were just gorgeous, the staff work so hard to please everyone, alot of activities during the day and the beach was breath-taking. I know this hotel is an all-inclusive, but we did tip the staff and the maid, they so appreciate it, when you see how these people live outside of the resort it is so sad, it really makes you realize how lucky we are!! I also brought a suitcase with toys and gave them out to the dominican children when we went out on the excursions, it was a christmas for them, be careful if you do this, when you give to one child, you are swormed by so many others. As far as the excursions, the Safari trip 1/2 day was alot of fun, you visit a dominican family home and see how they live and you also get to see thier culture, I really liked this trip and would probably do a full day next time, we also did the speed-boat/snorkeling excursion, this wasn't for me but everyone who went loved it, the dune buggy excursion was alot of fun, if you do this one, wear something dark, you will be full of mud, what a blast though. There is flea-markets on the beach, but a little bit of a walk, I went to the one on the left, it was probably a 15 minute walk, you can find great gifts to take back home, but bargin with these people, they start out really high in price. My friends also went to the one on the right, they said it was a really long walk and it sounds like they have the same stuff. The beach was so pretty, we never had any trouble finding a seat. The weather was beautiful, about 85 and sunny, it rained at night so it really didn't affect us, the last day we were there it started out really cloudy, this was the day I got the most sunburn though, be carefull, the sun is strong. The food was very good, a large selection, the Chinese and Italian restaurants were the best, the buffet was also very good. We only went to one show, they do the shows in four different languages, so everytime they speak it is long, it was funny though. Be carefull, don't drink the water, one of our friends got very very sick. I have been to Mexico, Rivera Maya twice and loved it, but the beaches in the dominican are nicer. We booked our trip thru Apple Vacations for a great price and all had a great time, we would definetely come back to this hotel, when I read some of the reviews, I was scared, don't be, you will be amazed how nice it is. Have a geat trip!!!  
<Date>Dec 23, 2007

<Author>jerseyHamilton
<Content>family fun been to this resort twice first time as a family vacation loved it so much brought more family back.Found the rooms to be ok not a five star but you only sleep in them. The pool was ok spent a bit of time in it but we went for the beach which is what made our vacation. Loved the beach and the sand. enjoyed everyday playing in the warm water, lying on the beach or going for a stroll. If you stroll far enough to the left or the right you will find some shopping venders. You have to haggle with them but you can get some great deals. Did'nt buy too much just a few items. Pretty jewerly but remember to haggle down alot. The food was great. As with any resort you will find some food not appealing but at the buffet we always found something that we enjoyed. Was not too fond of the al a carte restaurants preferred the buffet. Loved the staff and the nightly entertainment. They really tried to make you comfortable and join in on the activities. Some we joined in on some we did'nt. Went to the disco one night had a great time. Overall we did not want or need for anything. As I said we enjoyed ourselves so much that we have gone twice. I have booked again for 2008 but we are trying a different resort hopefully I won't be disappointed.  
<Date>Dec 15, 2007

<Author>Vacation-Loca
<Content>Beautiful beach and grounds, average food and service       One of the beautiful pools  
<Date>Dec 13, 2007
<Rating>3	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	
<Aspects>

<Author>NicoleandKyle
<Content>Tried it, but won't go back My friend and I stayed at Caribe Club Princess from Dec 7-10th. We were looking for a fun and rather inexpensive long weekend getaway and we definitely had fun. ARRIVAL - Upon arrival, we were immediately helped, but were told that our room was not ready (12:30PM). We were told to leave our luggage, go have lunch, and come back in an hour. We returned and were given our keys. When we went to the room, housekeeping was cleaning it still.GROUNDS - We decided to tour the resort - our initial impression was that the grounds were well-kept, with more of the natural landscaping than others in the Punta Cana area, and a lot of very exotic-looking birds calmly walking around. Multiple pools mean no waiting and no overcrowdedness, but I was surprised by the lack of pool cleanliness. There is a lot of dirt on the walls and floor of the pool that is noticeable. Public bathrooms are also pretty gross - we just kept going back to the room instead.FOOD - We visited the buffet - definitely lots of choices, but as we experienced at lunch and during the following dinners, the food quality is not high. Seafood dishes are fishy smelling and tasting, red meat is fatty, and general appearance or types of dishes are not that appetizing. My friend and I are both very adventurous eaters, so we tried almost everything and at most meals, we ended up sticking to mashed potatoes, pizza, french fries, pasta, and salads as these items tasted the best. Sad to say, we did waste some food but it really was inedible. Breakfast was pretty good - made to order items are delicious. Everything else is cold (all three days). Croissants and waffles are delicious! We also visited the Mexican and Chinese restaurants. The Mexican had fantastic soup and entrees, but the appetizers/salads/dessert were poor. The chinese was awful - everything was cooked and flavored with an abundance of soy sauce. We had 4 different entrees - they all tasted the same. DO NOT GO THERE! The creperie was nice, but not as good as the reviews of others suggested. THE BIGGEST PLUS - Both my fellow travelers and I got stomach sickness the last 2 visits to the DR. We were not sick at all from this resort - they do an excellent job of making sure that you are protected from bacteria, etc.BAR - unbelievably nice bartenders, very quick to get a drink - you can get champagne all day long which is nice, although not until after 12:30PM, so that leaves out mimosas at breakfast. Beer is Presidente which is great. Chocoloco is a phenomenal concoction! Either way, bartenders will make you any drink you want, shots are available if you want to do them, etc. No top shelf unless VIP, but I don't think anyone we met really missed it.BEACH - so gorgeous! Beautiful sand, warm aqua water, plenty of chairs. We weren't bombarded by vendors as some other guests were. If you said no, they did not argue with you and just walked away. We encountered maybe three per day. The beach is the reason to go to this hotel (and this country)!ACTIVITIES - Staff was pretty annoying about getting you to participate, but I think they were harder on us because they are all young men and we are female 20's. Lots of volleyball, water aerobics, salsa/merengue lessons, etc. We didn't go to the shows or the disco, but our friends that we met at the resort loved both. Casino is at a neighboring resort - very simple - BJ, 3 card poker, slots, roulette, craps was pretty much it.HOUSEKEEPING - really friendly, but awful. Worst I've experienced in my 3 DR trips. Not sure they change the sheets, definitely do not pick up after you, barely restock the minibar. Tips don't matter as we left some large ones. They folded up the towels we put on the floor and pretended they were new. We didn't get service at all one day. The other day, they came at 4:00PM. The next day, they came at 8:30AM. Totally inconsistent. No pretty fresh flowers, towel designs, or fantastic service as we have come to expect from housekeeping in the DR.THE ROOM - probably the worst part of the trip. The worst linens ever, air conditioning that would not shut off (we froze), and definitely a musty smell to the room. Towels were short and of very low quality. We saw a MONSTER black spider in the room one day. Tons of mosquitoes - each of us have at least 15 bug bites, but the other tourists from the other hotels had this as well - so I think it is the time of year. I traveled in April the last 2 times and did not get one bite. The location of the room was fantastic! We were in the 2100 building and we were steps from the buffet, beach, and 2 pools. Highly recommended location. Room is stocked with water and sodas. Doors to rooms are very thin - you can hear everything in the hallway. Every room that we saw has a small deck or balcony which is really nice.MISCELLANEOUS - Service at the buffet was awful - you may or may not get a drink (including water) with your meal. Hardly any of the resort staff speak English, so brush up some Spanish or French. Almost all European and Canadian guests at the resort, which we (as Americans) loved! If you are a girl in your 20's, be forewarned that every male staff member will flirt with you constantly. Which some girls probably loved, but I thought was very annoying. They ran out of beach towels every day. We always went early to get ours, but our friends sometimes had to wait hours for theirs.OVERALL REVIEW - for what we paid for three nights (inclusive of everything) - $515 USD per person - round-trip non-stop flight, airport transfers, and all-inclusive hotel, I'll say we did ok for our money. We came for a quick trip to enjoy the beach, pool, and warm weather and that's what we got. I was ready to go home when we did - I can't imagine staying a week or more here...I would be so bored!! If you are looking for friendly people (both guests and staff) and beautiful scenery, this is the place for you. If you are looking for a culinary and resort experience - this is not it. Great place to escape with friends for some alcohol and fun in the sun. I won't be back, but that's primarily because I won't go back anywhere unless it is spectacular. There are too many places to try!!!!  
<Date>Dec 10, 2007

<Author>hinmanhouse
<Content>pleasantly surprised! We booked this trip following the advice of a travel agent. She was definitely right - this is a very nice resort for the money! From the moment we arrived everything far exceeded our expectations. Our room was very nice and had a mini suite, complete with a fruit tray and bottle of rum (we think this was because we told them both our friends and us were celebrating birthdays and anniversaries, but we're not sure). The maid was excellant, and provided extra towels, bottled water, beer and soda upon request (we did tip her!) Since it was just a short trip, we spent most of our time on the beach or in the pool. The beach was very nice, and plenty of chairs for everyone. The pool was also, and Jose Alamarez, the pool bar bartender was fabulous!! He really made sure everyone was having a great time, and made them feel welcome. Most of the staff were courteous, but it appeared their level of friendliness depended on how comfortable they are with the language barriers. We met many nice people; it appears there were more Europeans, and Candadians than Americans. The food was fairly good. Breakfast was pretty much the same thing each day, though there were plenty of selections. We thought the buffet food was better than the restaurants, though it's nice to sit down and be waited on during dinner after a long day on the water. We took one excurions dune buggying, which was an absolute blast! Be advised -do not do this if you don't like dirt and mud! I typically don't, but after the first puddle, it just didn't matter and I enjoyed it! All in all, this is a great resort for the money!  
<Date>Dec 7, 2007

<Author>bottjenn
<Content>Fun time! My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Club from November 10 - November 17th to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. We were a litte worried going there based on some of the reviews that we had read but I am happy to say that we had nothing but a wonderful experience! The staff from the minute we arrived to the minute we left were AWESOME! Their english was great and their personalites and humor were great! We did get the VIP package and we were very pleased with it! I would reccommend that package to anyone! It provided us with a great room, great drinks, a wonderful massage and a delicious dinner at La Cava! we went to almost all the restaurants and La Cava was hands down our favorite! Chinese was our next favorite. We didn't care for the Mexican though but that is what the buffet was for ;) The only bummer we experienced was the weather. I know that we went during rainy season but still! It rained all day on Tuesday which we really didn't mind since we had already scheduled a shopping excursion for that day. It then decided to rain all day on Thursday so by the afternoon we said that we are here on vacation and we are going to go play in the ocean while it was raining! So we did! Other folks had the same idea and we had a ball! It wasn't thundering or lightning so we were fine! We had a blast catching the waves and just having good old fun in the rain and water! It then decided to rain all day on Friday so we went and got massages at the Spa. We can't say enough good things about the spa! Go! It is beautiful! We tipped our maid $2 every other day and we never had a problem. She was great!Food - buffet was good. Always something there to satisfy ya! Room service was good and timely too!Pools - all 3 were great! It was nice to have an option of getting away from all the action at the main pool....Service - WonderfulWe would definitely consider going back...Have fun! No worries!  
<Date>Dec 6, 2007

<Author>mirasmum
<Content>Great Holiday After reading all the negative reviews and having stayed at a 5 star hotel in Mexico previously, I wanted to add a quick review of our stay.My family and friends just returned from a 7 day stay at this hotel. My nephew was married at the resort during our stay. Our party had a fantastic time. We would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have lots of fun around the pool and can't afford a high end hotel.We did not take the VIP upgrade on this trip as it has not been worth the extra money at other resorts we have stayed at. But you definitely should take it at this resort if you can afford it. Some of our family members did have it and I counted at least 15 improvements that we did not have.Generally the VIP rooms have newer furniture, whiter towels, better stocked refrigerators and other various things. VIP also includes rum, cigars, two 20 min. massages, free water sports, and the list continues. All VIP rooms are in one building.Our building, across the pool, was all non-VIP rooms. The furniture was a little shabbier, the towels grayer, only water and pop in the frig. And to be frank, our room was musty smelling. But the rooms of other family members in our group, were fine. It didn't matter as we were there to be by the pool and the beach and didn't spend much time in our room.The main floor hallway at the end of our building had a very bad sewage smell but was easily avoided by using one of the other hallways. The buffet food was good, although definitely not 5 star quality. More like 3 1/2 star . But you could always count on fruits, breads, cooked veggies, eggs, pasta.The restaurant food was above average to excellent.Service at all food venues was absolutely wonderful. A tip goes a long way. Try to sit in the same area of the buffet each time you visit and you will soon be recognized and with a healthy tip on your first visit, will be given extra special treatment each time you eat. Keep in mind that these servers work all day and evening for 12 days with 4 days off. And they always have a smile.The beach was out of this world. And the main pool had a great acitivity staff with lots of action. The smaller pools were quieter for those that prefer that.A good resort for a good price.  
<Date>Nov 25, 2007

<Author>HeikeWales
<Content>great holiday We had a two week holiday in the caribe club princess and were more than pleased with every aspect, meaning rooms, food pools, activities, gardens and beach. Contrary to the last review there were lots of activities on offer all day long, ranging from archery to Yoga. Even though we did very little because we liked sitting on the beach so much, it was obvious that they were all run professionally and people were enjoying themselves.Everything was very clean, well-kept and rather wonderful. There is no need to worry about anything and the few people who disliked this hotel must have had a very negative attitude. As for the traders in the grounds, they are a nuisance but here is the way to handle them: Show courtesey and respect by shaking hands and talking to them, they are just human beings! Then be assertive but pleasant. If you don't want to look say something like: We don't want to buy any jewellery/carvings/pictures etc. because we already got it/don't like it/have run out of money. Be honest and pleasant, make eye contact and ask about their family and have a chat. After about four minutes (and what is four minutes?) they will be happy to say adios. You have met a local, you have acted politely, and learned something about a fellow human. That is the way to be. Thye dominicans think that people who just quickly walk past and avoid them, are rude, sad, and stressed. The resort is relaxing so why not be relaxed in your attitude? Many tourists seemed frightened but there is no need. Enjoy your holiday and make the most of it. The one thing that was surprising was that the sea was quite rough and we couldn't do the kayaking and snorkeling we had planned to do, bit of a shame but what can you do?  
<Date>Nov 14, 2007
