<Author>shellyl1107
<Content>Had a great time Just returned last night from our stay at the Caribe Princess and I was nervous after reading some of the reviews. No need, the staff was great the hotel was clean, the service was very good. We always had clean towels, and they even brought us more each night. We had the vip package, which I would do again. The VIP package includes premium drinks and my husband likes Bud, so it was included for us. The rooms were clean an spacious. The pool was always clean. The hotel does have some wear and tear but that is expected. The beach area is clean and there were always plenty of chairs. The food was always good. We ate at all of the restaurants except the seafood one. La Cava was the best. You have to pay for it if you don't have the VIP but I would say it was well worth it. My least favorite was the Chineese, but even that was good. A couple of things I didn't like. On Saturdays and Wednedsays they let people from the outside set up tables to sell you things, They are very aggressive and tough to get a round. If you are not interested just keep walking once you stop it is very difficult to leave. They also try to get very high prices bargin bargin bargin. Threaten to leave and you will get your price. If you travel with travelers checks they exchange bank will only cash them for pesos. Make sure you use all of your pesos because they will not exchange them back for you. Also, the rate is different at the exchange bank than it is when you buy something. 31 pesos to the dollar at the bank but you pay 33 pesos to the dollar at the store. We tipped everyone so everyone was happy to see us and gave us great service. The maids go out of their way for you if you tip them.. If you can bring crayons and coloring books or school supplies to give the maids or other staff they really appreciate it. I am all ready booking my trip to go back we had a great time. Oh yea I should say not a lot of night life but there is a disco that opens at 11 but you have to pay for drinks after midnight and they are expensive. Next time we will stay for 2 weeks. Remember a vacation is what you make of it.  
<Date>Nov 11, 2007

<Author>travelingsandi
<Content>Great Value at a Great Resort I just returned from the Caribe Club Princess, our 9th stay in Punta Cana. We have stayed high end (Riu Palace Punta Cana, Secrets) middle (Iberostar Punta Cana and Hacienda Dominicus, Sunscape the Beach and the Grand, Riu Bambu, Melia Caribe)...I had a group of 23 with me. This was the only 4 Apple in the Dominican we have visited. Having sold it many time and having had happy clients I was not worried., even with a few bad reviews.All I can say is I had 23 happy clients with me even with Tropical Storm Noel at our resort the first few days. This resort had quite possible the nicest and most accomdating employees I have ever dealt this!! The staff is wonderful and people make the place! A nice resort with unhappy and unhelpful staff does not cut it with me!Rooms were fine, clean and nice, and very spacious.Service-Beyond all expectationsFood-good everywhere we went, buffet and ala carte.Beach-SUPERB!!Entertainment-great at the beach and pool, the 2 evening shows I went to were okay, but that is not my thing to begin with...Several of my repeat clients could not figure out why the resort was not rated higher-and quite frankly neither could I. My new clients who had never done all inclusive loved it also. One friend who NEVER returns to the same resort, said she thinks with this one she might break her rule, she would like to return!There just was simply nothing to complain about...as a TA I am always looking for things that need improvement, and really they are doing it right at this resort. Some fans in the lobby, cause it gets warm would be nice, and better lighting when you go to the theater...would be all the fault I could find!This resort offers fantastic value for the money

<Author>NewJerseyIrishMom
<Content>Great Hotel For The Price We booked an Apple vacation at the Caribe Club Princess during the week of October 22-29, 2007. We had great weather for six of the seven days, then the storm came in. It did rain a few nights, but that is to be expected for the area and time of year. It was our first time in Punta Cana and after reading some of the reviews, I was hoping I didn't make a mistake booking that hotel. Well, I didn't!! It was a great vacation. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room clean everyday. We ate at the buffet for two dinners and always found something good to eat. The restaurants were also very good, but you have to make reservations early. We had dinner at the restaurants on five nights and found the Chinese our favorite. I don't understand how some of the previous writers could complain about the food unless they are extremely picky. There was always something good to pick from whether you like fancy or the plainer fare. Some people will complain no matter what. The beach was the best beach ever, even nicer than Cancun, although the water in Cancun is a little prettier. The water was warm and clean. There are no shells, stones, etc. on the beach which made long walks enjoyable. We had no trouble finding chairs or huts to sit under during our stay. By all means, if you are looking for a great vacation without going into debt for it, go to this hotel and use a few dollars that you saved on tips for the staff. They deserve it. We would definately go back to the Caribe Club Princess and recommend it to others.Joanne and Ed from New Jersey

<Author>meloddy25
<Content>Loved everything about it! My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Club Princess for 2 weeks in Oct 2007 and we had a great time!! The hotel was beautiful, colourful and the vegetation looked amazing. They had all kinds of birds around the hotel site (white ducks, little ducks, peacocks, roosters, herons, little black birds, etc) which you could feed. The walk from the front desk to the hotel was about 8 minutes but they had shuttle services for those who didn't want to walk. The lobby was beautiful and they offer internet services ($10/hour). The food was delicious and had something for everyone! Their buffet was great (and had a wide variety-they had a section where the food was always different but also had a couple of other sections where they served pizza and pasta everyday at every meal) and they also had 5 a la carte restaurants. We tried 4 out of 5 restaurants (mexican, brazilian, italian and chinese) and were happy with each one fo them. They also have a beach bar which starts serving food at 11:30 a.m. for those who can't wait until the buffet opens at 12:30 pm. The beach was beautiful and well maintained. There was plenty of chairs for everyone but of course, we were there during the slow season. If you walk 20 minutes to the left of the hotel or 40 minutes to the right of the hotel, you get to little shops on the beach were you can buy souvenirs. The only thing that we found annoying with those is that the vendors will come and grab you right off the beach to come see their shops and they will not take no for an anwser... When they would do that, I would ask if they would give me what I wanted for free as I didn't have any money, then they would let us go!The staff at the the hotel was very friendly and helpful. They always had a smile on their face and were always happy to assist you in any way they could. If you tip them (bartenders, buffet servers, restaurants servers) $1 US, they will remember you. We didn't even have time to order a beer that it would be sitting in front of us. My parents came with us for the first week. They usually travel in 5 stars hotels so I was scared they would not enjoy a 4 star as much. To theirs and our surprise, they loved it. The only thing they didn't like is that they bought the VIP package, which was a waste of money for them. The package gives you 1 hour of banana boat, 1 hour of internet (which needs to be used in one time or else you loose the remainder of the hour), 20 minutes massage, free premium liquor and a free dinner in a paying restaurant (value of $25/person - steakhouse or seafood). All of that for an additional $200/person. To them, it wasn't worth it and they do not recommend it to anyone. I would go back to that hotel in a heartbeat! We were afraid that 2 weeks might be too long in one resort, but it wasn't long enough! I would have stayed another 2 weeks! Have fun if you decide to go there!  
<Date>Oct 30, 2007

<Author>paradise51
<Content>avery  Different strokes for each traveler. Our experience at this resort is one of great pleasure. The food was wonderful and the scenery was breath taking. You can never please all travelers. People bring their issues with them, and they become magnified with any small problem. Enjoy your vacation. We don't speak spanish and had no problem getting what we needed during our 7 nights stay. The staff was very helpful, especially the front desk clerk Ivanova. This was my first trip out side the United States and my girlfriend 2nd time to punta cana . We will be returning to this resort in the near future.

<Author>SophiaMichigan
<Content>fantastic vacation This was our second time at the caribe club and it was a great time again. We stayed 10/7/07-10/14/07. We lucked out, weather was great. We really enjoy this resort and like the lay out of the rooms. Rooms are close to all pools and the beach. All the specialty resturants and buffet are near the rooms and not up by the lobby. This hotel does not put a limit on the specialty resturants so we were able to get a reservation every night, including the day we arrived. We have stayed at much more expensive ai and have been limited to only 3 times for a 7 night stay. We enjoyed the food at every resturant. The pools, beach and grounds are very beautiful. Great service every where from the front desk, buffet staff, and bartenders. We did do one excursion. The half day Outback Safari. Perfect amount of time off resort and a very informative and enjoyable excursion. We also went to the market down the beach and the plaza down the road.This is our 8th all inclusive and I would rate it as 5 star and definetly would return for a 3rd time.

<Author>vacgirl92
<Content>Not bad at all! Don't let all the negative reviews scare you. I was sick with concern before we went on our trip, wondering what we were getting into. Read on...We arrived in Punta Cana on September 26. We received our luggage and got our transportation to the Caribe Club Princess relatively quickly. Check-in was no problem and before we knew it, we were in our room. We had no issues with the room. It had everything that they said it would. No surprises. The pool was great. It seemed clean and there was always someone attending to it. The staff was great. They gave alot of attention to the visitors and made sure you had what you needed. The beach was beautiful. We ate at the Chinese restaurant twice and enjoyed it both times. The Italian restaurant was good also. We didn't care for the Mexican restaurant, but that's just us. We are all picky eaters and couldn't get used to the fact that the food would be prepared differently there. We ate most meals at the buffet, but there again, we would pick and choose. We had our old standbys and so in that respect it got a little boring. Most people we talked with loved the food.I was very concerned about reviews that I read regarding the flies on the food in the buffet area. I did not see one fly on any food when we were there. Maybe it was a different time of year, but that was not an issue for us. The only negative thing I would say is that there are some areas of the buildings that could use some TLC, but when you consider how many thousands of people use this place in a year, I can expect some wear and tear.Do visit the vendors down the beach. There's alot of shopping to be done there. Make sure you don't pay what they are asking. You must barter with them or you will get ripped off. Shy about bartering? Don't go.All in all, for the price, this place is very nice. The grounds are pretty and well taken care of. The staff was very attentive.

<Author>DomRepublic
<Content>Beach was nice Upon arriving we were told that the room with the King size bed was unavailiable, after some arguing we were given the room we wanted and had booked.Food was ok, nothing special. Some kind of small black birds like to frequent the main buffet. This seemed to us to be kinda cool. Its not till you see them hopping on the tables and picking at scraps that it becomes bothersome and downright unsanitary. Breakfast tables had cloth placemats placed on them. When a table was emptied, these placements were used to sweep the table of crumbs and them flipped upsidedown to be reused again. Small streams run under pathways from the lobby to your room. The first stream had a smell of something like sewer or something rotting in the mangroove. This was especially noticiable late at nite. The smell once was so strong we had to hold our breathe.Hospitality overall at the resort was not very good unless you tipped them.Rooms were very clean.

<Author>Music1224
<Content>Definitely Not The Best Resort Out There! My 3 girl friends, and I stayed at Caribe Club Princess at the end of September and to say the least, we were quite disappointed. We are a well traveled group and have been to the DR on a handful of occassions and have stayed at many beautiful resorts. We're a very easy going group in our mid-20s and love to have fun on vacation but I would say this resort ranks the lowest in all the resorts we have ever stayed at. Check-In: We had to wait almost 2 hours to check-in to our rooms. It wasn't even like we arrived in the morning but early in the evening and were expecting our rooms to be ready. We made the most and had a couple of drinks. We finally got our rooms but waited another 45 minutes for our luggages to be delivered to our room. Not to mention, the room was very hot and felt like there was no air circulation in there. Definitely wasn't a good start to our vacation.Restaurants/Food: When you don't have to cook your own meals, I guess that's always a good thing. Lots of variety but you pretty much had to make reservations first thing in the day for the a la carte restaurants or you'd be out of luck. We ended up eating in the buffet for the most part.Beach/Pool/Grounds: Nicer part of the Punta Cana beaches but defintely not enough palapas. The pools are nice but they can use some touch up and needed better cleaning from the debris that accumulates in them.Entertainment: It was your typical Animacion/Entertainment team with various activities throughout the day and nightly shows. Overall, friendly staff as the Dominican people always are and many of the reasons we love this country. And we love all the cute Dominican boys but we did encounter a couple of them that were to aggressive and way too flirtatious that it actually became annoying - and never had anyone asked us for money so bluntly. Other than that, all the other staff were always friendly and smiling.Overall, the resort attracts more Europeans and found ourselves, Canadians, being minorities amongst the tourists. Not a bad resort but I would never go back. We got a good deal for our vacation package but I would have paid more to stay at another resort if I had known better. I guess you get what you paid for!  
<Date>Oct 9, 2007

<Author>iluv2travel50
<Content>Great Girls' Getaway! We were 7 girls (OK, so we're 50 YO women, but we still think of ourselves as 'the girls'!), looking for somewhere inexpensive and complete for a long weekend. We settled on the Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana. The weather wasn't great, but the trip was, regardless. Our accommodations were spacious enough for 2 (6 shared rooms), and the staff could not have been nicer. We upgraded to the VIP package which included dinner in the theme restaurants-- we had seafood, Chinese and Italian over the three nights we were there, which I strongly recommend. I don't think three breakfasts, lunches and dinners in the buffet would have cut it. (There's also a creperie and poolside pizza for lunch.)If you're going to these restaurants, book your reservations the day you arrive. They are tiny and tend to have limited availability.Pools and bars are plentiful, but there wasn't much opportunity for dancing, as one of 'the girls' wanted but the rest of us were tired after dinner so it didn't bother us.There's souvenier shopping on the property, and if it's t-shirts you're looking for, they're fairly priced at $8 for children's and $10 for adults. You might do a little bit better by negotiating with the guys on the beach, but if you don't like bargaining, go to the stores. I bought some larimar (which I swore I wouldn't do, but it's beautiful and I couldn't resist!). I went to the Harrison's jewelry story at the mall. (It rained one afternoon so 6 of us took a taxi.) If you go, they have a beautiful selection of excellent quality larimar. But be prepared to negotiate. I got great prices, esp compared to the best I could get in the hotel lobby. (Even they will bargain with you though not as much.) Wherever you shop, don't pay retail. And don't compare the pieces the vendors sell with what you find in a fine jewelry store. It's not the same.I wish I'd had more time on this trip. When we lost 1.5 days to travel, and another to rain, it really cut into the fun. October is still part of the rainy season-- June to Oct. It's also extremely muggy and very humid. If you have breathing problems, go another time.We went thru Apple and for a place that was largely unknown to us, it was the way to go. Their reps and drivers were professionals. USA 3000 was our airline and I'd use them again in a heartbeat. As a charter, we were able to take off early by 30 minutes each way. (So don't get to the airport at the last minute-- your flight may be gone!) I would strongly recomment a non-stop flight, if it's available. We stopped at BWI on the way back and even tho it wasn't our final destination, we had to get off there to clear customs, collect our luggage, clear security and re-enter, then wait to reboard the same plane. (And then 45 min later, we did the deboard and wait for luggage part at home, again.) (I'd make sure it was direct next time, even if it were more expensive.)For the price, this was a good value. I like the island and the people were very warm. As Americans, we were in a tiny minority. This is a very cosmopolitan vacation spot with Western and Eastern Europeans, as well as Russians. I thought that part was fun. The language is Spanish, though a number of hotel staff spoke perfect English and some spoke it with a heavy accent. Brush up on some Spanish phrases before you go. They appreciate you trying. And PS, watch out for the boys on the banana boat. They say they won't dunk you, but they do :)  
<Date>Oct 9, 2007

<Author>travelbeast01
<Content>Just O.K. The transportation to the airport went just fine. Our check in went smoothe. The greeted us with mamjauna upon our arrival. We had a nice room near the pool. The room was clean. If you leave tips, the house keeping does a good job.If you're looking for a party, this is not the place to go. The entertainment was not too hot either. If you've been to one all inclusivie rosort, you've been to them all. The same layout. The food gets tiresome after a few days. There is basically not much to do accept for lay out on the beach (which was dirty) oy by the pool and get tanned. The disco played all Dominican music which was no fun considering I couldn't understand anything they were sais ying. There is an internanitonal part also but the good american drinks, you have to pay for.We went on an excursion The Outback Safari, it was alright. Not a whole lot to rave about to me. We stopped at this one place that supposedly made homemade mammajauna which iis popular there. Got that stuff home and it was some fake stuff that taste like MD 20/20 with wood chips in it. Don't buy it. Of course while you're there they let you tast it but its not what's in that bottle. You don't know what you're buying until you get home. Oh I forgot unless you run the air at all times, the room becomes really wet and dampre. We couldn't figure out why our room always smelled moist until the 6th day were there.The Buffet was o.k. but the Shangay was horrible and the Dominican restaurant uuummm it was bearable. Our last day there we had the Mexican whihc was by far the best restaurant there. Stick to the buffet to be safe. It was really not much to do there. Maybe because we were single. Depending on what you're to do; if its rest and relaxation, you'll definetely get that. Checking out went smoothe also. All of the staff were really friendly.

<Author>mizkitnp
<Content>Great Place -- Great Value We stayed at this resort 8/31 - 9/7. We enjoyed our experience very much. I was a little concerned due to some poor reviews -- but that certainly was not our experience. We booked through USA3000 vacations and for $75 more pp, had the VIP Suite upgrade -- well worth it, I feel. Our room was on the 3rd floor (no elevators), but directly overlooked the beach -- very lovely. It was large -- with a nice sitting area and balcony. The room was clean and well appointed. Several reviews stated that they had to get to shaded chairs by 6 am -- I find that hard to believe! We never had problems getting a shaded chair (the ones around the pool with the bar filled quickly, but there are two other very large, and quieter, pools where we never had a problem). In addition, most shaded chairs on the beach were empty. The resort was only about half full, so this could have been the difference -- but even full, there appeared to be ample shaded chairs. There were 5 speciality restaurants and a buffet. In addition, there were two premium restaurants -- La Cava and El Pescador, which required a $25 pp fee. We had one option apiece for these with the VIP package, and it was good (La Cava), but I would not pay $25 extra pp. You needed reservations for the other 5 restaurants, but a concierage was available in the buildings all day, and we had no problem booking. The food was good and varied. We really enjoyed the Dominican restaurant -- typical Dominican food. We enjoyed a complimentary 20 minute back massage on the beach (part of the VIP package) and since I was a certified diver, had a complimentary dive with the VIP. The grounds are spacious and well kept, the staff very friendly and accomodating. There is a shuttle bus to and from the main building from the room buildings, but we always walked. We did not go to the shows -- they didn't start until 9:45 pm and we preferred sitting on our balcony and listening to the surf. This was a great time to go (albeit the threat of hurricanes) -- the weather was great and far less crowds. We did three off site tours: the Marinarium (swimming with nurse sharks and rays), Outback Safari (an all day journey to the rural area of the DR), and an on the beach horseback ride. All were good and worthwhile. All and all, I feel this is a good choice and great value.  
<Date>Sep 9, 2007

<Author>azzuri
<Content>Great time! Highly recommended Great time overall! Stayed there Aug 31 - Sep 7, 2007 and had hard time to go back.Pluses:- fabulous beach (this is a beachfront resort)- good variety of water sports available (including parasailing and scuba diving)- very friendly and nice hotel staff and animation team- good variety of entertainment programs (pool daytime, theater and lobby evenings)- international atmosphere (visitors from many countries, speaking many languages)- beach bars open long at night- good food in general (main restaurant has dinners from different parts of the world every day), other restaurants - Brazilian was the best- wireless internet available in the lobbyMinuses:- the main restaurant, the theatre and the lobby are poorly ventilated, sometimes it gets uncomfortably hot- music in the discotheque way too loudTips:- book restaurants ahead of time (2-3 days in advance), otherwise they get full quickly- go to Higway for shopping, much cheaper than duty free at the airport, a town an hour away. Also an opportunity to see a typical Dominican town, we went there ourselves with a public bus, no safety issues, you may hire one of the kids there for 10-15$ to show you the city- if you bring your laptop, make sure to say it to the guy selling internet access, there is a different pricing plan for laptop users (10$ a day) vs. regular internet users (10$ an hour). Regular access will not allow to connect your laptop to the internet

<Author>trip005
<Content>best value for the $$ We just finished staying at the Caribe, from Aug. 27th to Sept. 3rd.What a buy for the $$. We certainly got our money's worth.We booked thru apple vacations and my local travel agent.We flew usa 3000, both flights were great, ontime, transfers were good, hotel check in, we arrived early about 11:20 and our room was ready, easiest check in we have had.I don't know were the other reviews come from on things like towels, beach chairs and huts, we had not problems . Fresh towels every day, although the washclothes were scarce, we did not have to get up at the crack of dawn to reserve beach or pool chairs, each day after breakfast, around 9 or so there were plenty, even mid day..there was not shortage to be found. We did find the lunch buffetts to be a bit boring..but there was plenty of food and choices, just not to our liking, but we didn't go hungry at all. The best place for lunch, The Crepeorie.The service was very good. we didn't have any trouble getting reservations for dinner, itilian was our favorite. The people were very courteous and helpful, they don't speak much english, but they will try every attempt to figure out what you need. check out was a breeze too. Our 2 kids had a great time too..plenty to keep them busy, from boogie boarding to mini golf to football on the beach...all in all a very good trip. oh i forgot, the beach, absolutly wonderful!, pure white sand...great water....

<Author>sanaaxoxo
<Content>Not Bad We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from 08-17-2007 through 08-24-2007...not a bad experience definately had its perks and downsides....but as many people have said in this forum... 'a vacation is what you make of it'...keep in mind you're not in the usa or canada...so OBVIOUSLY things will be different....(language, food, culture etc)...here's what I can think of as far as reviews go:Food/Buffet/A La CarteBUFFET The buffet is exactly like any other all you can eat restaurant....bland, plain etc...however extensive in its options every night....it can get to be a bit repetative but thats why you should explore the a la cartes for variety.....they have themed nights and sometimes you may find the same dishes on the a la carte menus in the buffet....(i.e. mexican night, chinese night, seafood night etc)..but with the buffet you obviously cant predict what they will serve....overall it was good.. the set up was nice, it is a really big restaurant....shared by both resorts (the tropical princess/caribe club)...this resort is big but thats because it is a lot with two resorts combined in one...the wait staff was nice always very receptive, they made sure that for the most part nobody was at the buffet with their swimsuits on (thats great! i think)... there is a bit of an issue with flies around the food displays.. but its an open concept..so its hard to avoid bugs..you sort of have to suck it up...and not think about it...i know its hard!...but its either that or starve the week that you're there...A LA CARTEHere's where I get my money back :D...forget the buffet.. the A LA CARTE restaurants were amazing...we did Chinese, Brazillian, Mexican and Italian....with the Caribe Club we had 5 a la carte reservations included....we didn't bother with the restaurants that were not included (la cava, and seafood)...here's what I thoughtChinese: it was amazing! we did it twice....the food was well prepared, very flavourful, and presented in an elaborate display..the restaurant was always quiet..which is a nice change from the buffet...portions were a great size! and the staff for the most part was really nice..and treated us well...Brazillian: i won't lie..this was not anywhere near being a favourite for me...none of the wait staff spoke english..which is fine for staff you don't have to communicate with (i.e. entertainers etc)...but when it comes to ordering and having questions be answered..forget about it....this restaurant was different than the other places....it was a 5 part meal...and you were basically served everything on the menu...waiters would come with platters and service everyone all at once...like one guy would come out with chicken and go around each table serving whoever was interested..then the next item on the menu came out and so on....this was a long process especially because nobody spoke english...people were confused as to how to order the food....we didnt realize that you have to wait for everyone who reserved to be there..before dinner begins...NOT COOL! i definately did not like this concept....Italian and Mexican: it was great! food was nicely prepared, some variety... nice cuts of chicken...im a big fan of white meat..so to have this sort of quality at an all inclusive resort was nice... DESERTSI liked the buffet for deserts, you can take as much as you want...and it is the exact same thing that is served at the a la cartes, except you can have more of it...oh and apparently the a la cartes are creperies during the day time, but we couldn't be bothered to find out...so we didnt go...SNACK BAR:Average...I thought it was the least clean, because people served themselves..usually right after they got out of the pool or returned from the beach..I stayed away...but sometimes you're starved and there's not many other options...Service/Maids/Receptionists etcOur maid wasn't the best....they dont change your bedsheets..so be sure you request a fresh set of sheets...otherwise you will have sand, bedbugs and god knows what else creep up on you in the middle of the night...its not good if you have little children.. Receptionists were great at the front lobby! The man at the front desk really hooked up a nice room for us infront of the pool with an ocean view... no complaints!...Bar staff were always great, and they spoke english which was a nice treat...the service wasn't too bad....our signature vacations representative was not the greatest..we felt a bit mislead...i suggest really reading up on the reviews for excursions etc..before spending an arm and a leg.. the excursions were overpriced and nowhere near what was described...my friends went snorkling and took pictures with sharks and stingrays..that I was told was worth the money.. other than that...I would really think twice about some of the excursions..such as Saona Island...it takes two hours by bus to get to the boat ..then another hour and a half by catamaran... but on the way back to the bus lot they take you one speed boats which is a bit of a relief..but its really tiring!..and the last thing i want on vacation is to be tired..Pool/Beach/Entertainment/ShoppingPOOLNice...a little smaller than I expected...not too deep its deepest area is 5 feet...so you can basically walk across..which is fine.. as my friends put it..you're not there to do laps in the pool..you're there to relax which is just what the pool is for...The main pool gets a bit dirty, and I wish there were more staff available to maintain it...because you end up stepping on cups, sand and god knows what else....the swimup bar was cute...sort of small and crowded...strange enough the majority of the crowd at the swim up bar were little children..who liked to sit up on the bar stools....figures because it was in the shallow end...the other pool was nice, definately quieter might even be bigger..im not sure..we liked the music and games so we didn't bother with the second pool....but it was definately cleaner!BEACHGORGEOUS!..no complaints..soft sands....little sea weed.. friendly people..lots of chairs..we didn't ever have any trouble getting a chair for ourselves at the pool or beach..there werent many vendors...nobody bothered you..so it was really just paradise.. :DENTERTAINMENTThey played great music by the pool, lots of mainstream music, reggae, spanish etc....large variety for everyone to enjoy...the pool games were silly..and get repetative..was fun to watch though.. The night time plays were just okay....sort of a disappointment... the kiddie shows we didnt care for..since we were all adults there.. but it looked cute from far..and the kids seemed to have a good time..but again..not what i was there for...the adult shows were average...a lot of them involved members of the audience who were pulled on stage...they had similar shows everynight.. so they didn't really stand out....the lion king was a good show... keeping in mind that it's obviously not broadway..but it was probably the only show we stayed to watch until the end..SHOPPINGThey have plazas outside of the resort, that we did not bother with..we walked across the beach to the flee market.. I had more fun bargaining...as its something you never get to do here in North America...always offer 1/3 of the price..and hey flirt with them...if you're cute...i guarantee you will get a good deal.. we didn't have to beg too much..the people at the shops want to sell what they have...so they'll settle at a good offer that works well for the tourist...STAY AWAYY FROM THE GIFTSHOP!...we bought calling cards that were 300.00 pesos but the card said 250.00 pesos! so they rip you off ....and there is nothing you can do or say... its a rip off!....dont buy anything unless you need to..and are desparate... $15.00 for a bottle of sunscreen?..it's almost theft! i feel...just be well prepared and pack of of the necessities in your bags....ahead of time otherwise they will rape you with their high prices...NIGHTLIFEWe spent our time in the lobby..it was always entertaining they usually had live bands play..the lobby was massive..it was nice to sit on the couch and enjoy a nice cold drink which watching the festivities go on...lots of people dancing..it was beautiful!.. probably one of the things i miss most....The disco was okay.. Areito was what it was called and it was on the resort...I heard Mangu was better..so if you're there to party! go to Mangu it's apparently THE spot...We didn't enjoy Areito...crowd was boring.. nobody on the dancefloor...and too much spanish music.. I prefer mainstream, reggae...and that's what you will find at Mangu....Room/Amenities etcShower: no pressure..but hot water was availableFridge: Stocked up on a daily basis with non alcoholic beveragesTowels: Not always replaced unless you throw them on the floor, thats how the maid knows to replace them...if you keep them hung up they will assume you don't need new ones!Pillow Cases/ Bedsheets:ASK for new ones..otherwise you will never get them changed!Internet:Is offered to you for $10.00 for a whole hour that you can use over the span of 5 days...it's not bad especially when you're homesick and just want to pop onto messenger to update everyone at home about your trip...Phone/Calling Cards:You will get ripped off..but if you must..then buy a calling card its 10.00 us and you get a half hour...hotel charges 2.00 connection fee..but once again it is sooo worth it when you get homesickOVERALL:Great experience! I enjoyed it....I made the best of it..some downfalls but they are soo minor..the beach is GORGEOUS and the people are friendly...this resort was nice..and I would recommend it for famillies...and people maybe a bit older than myself...like age 30+  
<Date>Aug 27, 2007

<Author>mandyraz
<Content>excellent value We had a wonderful vacation; this is not a five star hotel but for the price it was definately worth it. I have stayed at much nicer resorts for more money and for travelers on a budget the Caribe Club is well worth the money. Do not listen to all of the complaints, we had a great time. Check-in- Perfect and fast. We had three rooms next to each other. The hotel staff immediately brought us beer while we filled out paperwork and such. We changed into our bathing suits and enjoyed the gorgeouos beach until our rooms were ready. Rooms- clean and comfortable; yes the pillows are lumpy but whatever we were so tired every night it did not matter! Fridge stocked daily- if you want beer in your fridge just ask the maids they are very helpful (you need to speak Spanish to them though). Beach and Pools- beach was awesome and the staff very fun; many games all day long very entertaining. Pool bar gets crowded, a few dollars helps :) The partially shaded pool on the Tropical Princess side nice and quiet if you need a break, although the bar that is there has the only actual frozen pina coladas (the beach bars and pool bars can't seem to keep up with their frozen drinks, they were always watery). The shaded spots on the beach are usually all gone by about 8:30 or 9:00- so if you want one go out earlier.Food- We got tired of it, but that is normal for any all-inclusive. It was average, definately make reservations at a restaurant each night. The buffett was nice for lunch since they have fresh salads. My favorite lunch was the creperie- it opens at 1:30 but is well worth it. Mushroom and cheese crepe- they used fresh shitakke yummm. We paid for the seafood restaurant not worth it. Lobster way overcooked and drown in butter. Domincan restaurant was very good; italian okay (don't get lasagna so salty) although the antipasta bar at the beginning awesome. Overall it was fine; fresh fruit always available and absolutely wonderful. We don't go on vacation to eat so we really didn't care. Staff and other guests- staff very helpful and friendly. Guests from all over the world, we met so many nice people that we partied with all week and will keep in contact with in the future. I would not recommend this resort for singles; it is a great place to meet people and relax.Check-out- well this was the only bad part of the whole trip; but hurricane dean delayed our flight and there was some miscommunication with our apple rep but we got out just in time! The direct flight on USA3000 was awesome. Would definately go back to DR- although I would try a different resort just because I like change.  
<Date>Aug 24, 2007

<Author>RodneyTheDiver
<Content>Had a great time We visited this resort Aug 11-18. This was our 4th trip to DR, but our first stay at this resort. We were very happy with everything. We did keep in mind that we got a great deal and weren't staying at a 5 star hotel. Our check in procedure went smoothly. We had a room facing the pool and with an ocenview. The room was very well airconditioned and very clean. We had no problems all week with anything related to our room. The door to the balcony did not lock, but there was no handle on the outside door, so we didn't have any concerns about anyone getting in. We also did not use the safety box and had no problem with anyone bothering our stuff.The beach was beautiful and the pools were great. The beach actually reminded us of Myrtle Beach or Daytone Beach with the waves. It's was lots of fun to play in. Unfortunately it was a little too rough to snorkel in which is one of our favorite things to do. We could have taken an excursion, but we had so much fun on the beach we didn't miss the snorkeling. We had no trouble getting beach chairs either. We usually got lounge chairs down close to the water on the beach in the morning and then moved around later in the day. It wasn't a problem to get a covered area later in the day. We found the wait staff to be very friendly and helpful and even playful at times. We enjoyed the buffet for breakfast every morning and then ate at one of the beachfront grills for lunch. We maybe had to wait a little bit for drinks, but you could see the staff was busy so we didn't mind the wait. It is also obvious that they do work long, hard days and most of the time don't receive a whole lot of thanks for what they do. We always tried to leave a dollar or two for our wait staff and they were always very pleasant and did everything they could do to make us happy. We also tried to learn a little Spanish so we could talk a little with them. From other reviews we thought most of the staff did not know English, but most everyone we ran into knew enough to understand what we wanted.We ate at the Dominican, Italian, Brazilian, and Mexican specialty restaurants. We enjoyed all of them especially the Brazilian. The wait staff at each of these restaurants were also very good.The resort itself is beautiful. The walk through the mangroves is very pretty, lots of lush palms and trees and water areas. They also had music piped in which was very pleasant. The buildings were very pretty and there was a little water garden area out in front of the specialty restaurants that was very nice. The staff tried hard to keep the resort looking good. The thing that we noticed was there were lots of cigarette butts on the beach and lots of trash, but that was because people don't know how to clean up after themselves and can't use the ashtrays that are very readily available as are the trash cans.It didn't seem that the hotel kept you very informed of activities going on in the evening. One night there was a beach party that we stumbled upon, then one night there was fire works at midnight. It was very pleasant thing, but a little shocking to be awaken out of a dead sleep with exploding fireworks. We enjoyed this resort a lot and would be happy to come back to this resort anytime!  
<Date>Aug 19, 2007

<Author>Janokal
<Content>Sorry, I dont speak Italian. We spent in this hotel barely 2 days of weekend, taking voluntarily temporary assingement form our Occidental Flamenco Hotel due to overbooking. And theses 2 days reassured us how lucky we were choosing Occidental originally.The only good thing was a room. Clean spacious and bright, we ended up in Junior suite what was very comfortable having 2 children with us. No problems with any bugs/mosquitoes reported here by others. AC working great, 2 decent bathrooms etc.Main problem was food. Can only say about main buffet and beach restaurant. After spending prior several days in Occidental Flamenco, we found food in Caribe Princess mediocre. To make it worse, they have serious problem with bugs and flies in buffet area. Literally dozens of flies walking over tables, sometimes we felt like eating @ barn.On top of it, the waiters there are... well, problematic.. Dont count on any decent service in buffet, be prepared to serve yourselves with drinks, otherwise you could end up dehydrated. Waiting half an hour for drinks , coffee or anything is a norm, not an exception.The beach area was OK. Had to reserve the palatas very early in the morning. Its also very crampy, the lounges are so close each other its sometimes hard to find a way between them.And, till we came in, had no idea it is so heavily italian oriented hotel. Kinda funny being greeted Ciao, not Ola by most. Did not bothered us at all.After spending 2 days in Caribe Princess, we could only truly appreciate the service we received in Occidental Flamenco, where we enjoyed far superior quality and overall satisfaction.  
<Date>Aug 16, 2007

<Author>tootspa
<Content>have a great vacation and relax!!!!! I was extremely skeptical regarding this hotel especially after seeing the mixed reviews. I tried to cancel through US 3000 and Apple vacations and was unable to get a response from either group. Thank goodness that I didn't my family and I had a wonderful and relaxing time. The weather was beautiful. The hotel room was clean, comfortable, large and overlooked a clean pool with a ocean view to the left side of balcony. The resturant staff was courteous and pleasant. It does help if you know some basic Spanish words however. I highly recommend the Japanese, Brazialian, and Mexican resturants on the resort. The Domincan, Italian and Buffet were nice and the food was edible but not anything different then home. There is something for everyone to eat and enjoy however. The staff appreciates tips but they do not expect to be tipped. I took 50 one dollars bills and left the maid $2.00 a day we had a clean room, towels and a refrig stocked with beverages everyday. You do need to be up early to get a sheltered beach chair or to get a seat around the pool but by early my husband went down at 8am or so and we never had a problem getting a chair or we went later in the afternoon and found seats on the beach they just may not have been under shelter. We did not buy any gifts at the hotel we bought everything from the beach venders which were located to left when you went onto the beach. REMEMBER barter and bargain to get the best deals if you can't agree on a price don't budge on YOUR price because 9 times out of 10 they will look for you as you walk to another shop and you will get YOUR price. We left the resort for a shopping tour which included lunch for 25.00 pp and it was nice and worth the money. We went to San Domingo on another tour for 48.00 pp and it was a nightmare. The people are very poor and you are constantly being tugged on, followed, or asked for money. My adult son had suede shoes on and a small child (approx 10 or so) started cleaning his shoes with a brush while he was walking after repeating No several times and trying to walk it was easier to give him a couple of dollars at which time a large amount of other street children and young adults appeared for money. Be prepared for this. The tour features alot of culture, churches and sights but also the poorness of its citizens is appreciated on this city tour. The shopping here can also be bargained but not worth the aggravation of fighting through multiple shop attendants who are trying to get your money. So in closing go to this resort, have ones, enjoy the grounds, gardens and the beach, eat, take your mosquito repellent, and enjoy your vacation because customer service is their goal and we received it with flying colors. We'll be back next year!!!!!  
<Date>Aug 15, 2007

<Author>leicapuli
<Content>Not bad for a first time Our first trip to DR and to an all-inclusive resort. It wasnt bad at all. The food staff was very attentive. The tram was not bad of a wait. <Author>beachlover707
<Content>i'll let you decide for yourself if you want to stay here or not. Ok so instead of telling you don't stay here or stay at this hotel i will let you be the judge after reading what happened to my fiance and i during our stay here. We stayed in the hotel from august 6th to the 10th, 2007. the first day we arrived early and was told that check in was at 3pm but we would still have full access to the resort. so we went to eat and i was going to go to the beach but realized my swimsuit was in my big suitcase (don't know how i forgot to put it in my carry on but whatever). so we wondered around the grounds for an hour until i could not take the heat. we went back to the lobby and the front desk man saw us and said we could check into our lobby. this was 2pm so we were very greatful because we so wanted to take a shower and change. well everything was fine until i realized that the sheets were dirty. unfortunately this was not until the evening when i realized this. so we had to sleep on top of the sheets instead. there were old blood stains on the sheet and in various locations of the sheets. i called houskeeping around 9am on tuesday morning and reported this. i specified that the sheets were dirty when we checked in and was assured it would be fixed soon. i left the room to eat and then go to the beach. we returned at 3pm and our sheets still had not been changed. i called housekeeping again and the guy told me he had sent someone. i said no the sheets are still dirty. he said he would look into it. so i waited until 3:30pm no one came. we decided to leave again to keep from getting too upset. i walked out and saw the maid. i tried to tell her to change the sheets but her english was bare. fortunately i had looked up some common phrases to say in spanish in case i needed the maid to change something. so i left her a note by the bed as well asking to change the sheets with a tip. when we returned to the room at 5pm the sheets were changed but one pillow case was dirty with a blood stain on it. the maid changed the sheets everyday though without us asking after the first day. so that was good. we tipped her $3 a day although she did not replenish the toiletries that the hotel leave. in fact one of the items was empty. i was shocked. i thought she would replace it but never did. oh and it is true the pillows are lumpy. at least one pillow was lumpy for us. as if having dirty sheets when we arrived was not enough we had a mosquito problem our hole time there. we stayed in room 2140. this is on the first floor in caribillo (right in front of the pool with the bar). it took us two days to realize the mosquitos were coming from under the door. so we slide a towel under the door to stop them from coming in but when the maid came the mosquitos got back in. my fiance and i actually made a game out of killing the mosquito's. we played to see who could kill the most mosquito's. the last night was the worst. the mosquito's did not care that we had OFF on. They ate us alive. i woke up with mosquito bites all over my eyebrow, face and ear. my fiance got bit twice on his lip.he barely slept on thursday night because of the mosqito's. he also thinks there were bed bugs because he kept itching the whole time we were on vacation (i wouldn't be surprised). then to top it all off when we were leaving friday morning i went to remove the towel from under the door and i saw something move away when i did this. so i opened the door to see what it was and saw a lizard. i was like i cannot believe this if the towel had not been there a lizard would have gotten into our room as well. ok enough is enough time to go. my recommendation never stay on the first floor of a hotel and especially not this hotel. avoid this room. the room was big and nice but the mosquito problem made the trip bad. i know it is a tropical island but you shouldn't have to fight off mosquitos inside your room. i expect that when i go out to the events at night. but on a bettter note the beach is beautiful. we had a blast playing in the water for hours on end. it's true the huts fill up fast but i didn't care. i like being in the water and not sitting on the beach. my fiance and i always found chairs and we pulled it close to the water to watch our stuff. no one ever touched our stuff. we did one excursion outback safari. it was great. i would definitely recommend all to experience this. you meet families from the dominican republic and see how they live. they provide you lunch and at the end you go to another great beach. i personally thought the beach they brought us to was much prettier than the beach we resided on but my fiance disagreed with me. i think something about this beach being less polished for tourists made it more appealing and the view was exceptional. the food is alright. i would suggest signing up for the various restaurants because buffet gets repetitive. to me breakfast was the worst. it was always the same. i ate omlets everyday. i would suggest they have more meat selections for the omlets as well. not everyone wants ham. buffet at dinner is good because they have different themes everynight. we ate at the mexican, italian, and chinese restaurants. i wanted to eat at the brazillian restaurant. i even got to the station at 9am on the dot to be the first person to sign up for brazillian and i thought i did until i check my slip the next day and realized the man signed me up for chinese. how he got chinese from brazilian is beyond me. so i went to try to correct this the next day when i saw it but the person just called the man who scheduled our dinner to see if we were telling the truth or not. the guy that made the reservations said we were confused we said chinese. i said no we don't i hate chinese i know i didn't say that. needless to say i wasted my breath because they refused to squeeze us in. i was so upset. my fiance convienced me to give the chinese restaurant a shot. so we did. it was the worst restaurant i thought. they make everything with soy sauce and call it soup or sauce. i had chicken and brocolli with curry sauce. the curry was soy sauce with some spices. this made it gross. my fiance had lobster in oyster sauce. the sauce again was soy sauce with some flavoring but the lobster itself was good. i also had a chicken and egg soup that was basically soy sauce with chicken.mexican was good. i liked what i ate but my fiance did not like what he had. i had chicken fajita's. he had shrimp quesadiah's (sp?). we both loved our soups. he had the spicy one and i had the non spicy one (there are only two types of soup). italian was by far the best restaurant. i loved everything i had. i had the fish and my fiance had pasta. his appetizer was great the fried seafood platter. so must go to the italian restaurant. oh warning do not go to the resort store for anything. they over price so bad in there. i forgot my off and had to buy some for there. it cost $16 for a $5 bottle in the u.s. then my fiance got sun bburn so i needed to buy cream for him. the cheapest one was $14. do buy your liquor before you get to the airport. they overprice the liquor there too. i wanted to get my mom a bottle of anejo liquor her favoite but it was priced up by $15. i asked Kelvin, the bartender at the resort the cost and he told me. that is how i know the airport marked up the price by $15. oh you must visit Kelvin, the bartender, if you do go to the resort. he is great. he always went out of his way to assist us in anyway possible. he works hard and long shifts as do other workers. we saw people that were there from morning to morning sometimes. the woman that greeted us at breakfast greeted us at dinner in the late evening. so tip. the staff really worked to make our stay nice. they were always so friendly and nice. my boy jose was great. he gave us drinks we didnt ask for but they were always great. his speciality drinks. oh try kelvin's specialty drink as well. it is excellent. oh we did not do the safety box thing. we kept our stuff in the bag and we were fine. our maid nor anyone else ever touched our stuff. oh one last comment. we saw one activity the Lion King play. it was cute. it is not broadway but the staff worked really hard to put on a good show. i thought it was so cute. i liked it. that was the only one i actually stayed up to watch. so after reading this you can decide to make an informed decision about whether you would like to stay or not.

<Author>doodles572003
<Content>The worst Nightmare of my Life!! Well, first of all we got there from the airport and we had to wait several hours for our room. It did not seem like the hotel was well organized, and no one really knew English well! We thought we would be treated better since we were VIP members, and paid more for it which was NO WAY worth it! The hotel room seem outdated, the shower had terrible water pressure, the TV did not work, and it was not very impressive . The beach was delightful, however it was impossible to find a lounge chair at the beach and at the pool, people would wake up at 6 am to save a chair, is that what vacation is about?????? The pool was very dirty paper floating in it, stuff on the bottom of it, and it was not well mantained. The pool area was so loud, it was impossible to relax. I also found the grounds to be pretty however you can wait for a tram car for almost 45 minutes, and when you walk to the lobby its so far you sweat to death. The ground were very pretty like everywhere else.The service was poor, it seems like the workers were annoyed they had to wait on you, and did not go out of their way to make you feel confortable. You had to wait forever to get a drink, water, whatever! Hardly any of the workers understood English, it was very difficult to communicate what you needed.The worst part of this so-called vacation was the food. So many people that week got ill, 3 of our family memebers were deathy ill. So ill they wanted to put or 2 children into the hospital. They ate bad food by thepool cause the food is out all day, and in that heat of course its not healthy. We spent almost 600,00 visitng the resort doctor, and she confirmed that the food caused their illness. It was either a parsitie or bacteria in the food, that made them so ill for the entire week and even when we came home they were still sick for another week. They were thrwoing up/diharra/high fever/ so weak that they could barely walk . This was our worst nightmare of our lives. We saved for 1 year to go, and I felt it was not worth it even if we were not sick. The hotel management did NOTHING, about our family getting deathy ill due to their food. What a disapointment and nightmare. I felt it to be annoying before my family got so ill to try and make reservations for certain resturants at the resort, they were always filled! WHAT IS THAT ALL ABOUT?? The water sports were very expensive, and I found anything extra you wished to do was extremely expensive. It was cheaper to get a massage in the USA/nails done/and you hair done. It was out of control the price for these thing at the resort. It was a huge disapointment and so were any excuriions were very expensive.Don't go there and risk your families well-being!!!! We travel yearly to different islands and have never experienced such a horrible place/week! Save your money and look elsewhere!

<Author>manda32303
<Content>Great Time For a Small Price! Okay...So I was one of the people who read these reviews months ahead of time to see what I was in for! Me and my boyfriend went and had a blast. I would recommend this resort for simple people looking to enjoy a relaxing week. If you atre looking for 5 or 6 star, then find a 5 or 6 star to stay. Get it???

<Author>3ees
<Content>very pleasant After reading many of the reviews here, I was very nervous about going, but shouldn't have been. First, I should say, that we've only been to one other resort, and don't usually go on the type of vacation, where you just stay around the hotel. Nevertheless, our goal was to just have a few relaxing days with our 4 year old at the pool and beach, and we had just that! I guess going in with low expectations helped us. Even though our room wasn't supposed to be ready until 3, it was ready when we arrived at 2, just when our daughter was melting down from fatigue. Our room, (the supersaver standard size) was much bigger than I expected, with a sunken seating area extending past the beds. Everything was clean, but the pillows were quite lumpy, as if stuffed with cotton balls. We had one instance, where the maid forgot to refresh our towels and water, but as soon as we called, it was sent to us. I enjoyed the fact, that it was an international clientele, not just Americans, although some of the Europeans didn't even try to speak Spanish with the staff, which irked me. I speak very limited Spanish, but everyone can say gracias, right? I agree with everyone else, that the pools and beach were lovely, although seeing the pool strewn with used straws and cups, is not a pleasant sight. We found the staff to be always attentive and super friendly. The buffet was always satisfactory and provided something for every taste. We also dined at the Dominican and Brazilian restaurants, which were very pleasant experiences, both due to the service and the food. Another suggestion to the hotel would be to provide drink menus at the bar, so that one could explore something beyond the standard pina colada. In summary, I think because we did not arrive expecting a full luxury perfect resort, we had a great time and would recommend it to another family with the same expectations.

<Content>Not great My daughter and her family went with us to Punta Cana, it was there first time and our seventh. We ate at the Italian, Asian, and Mexican, they were OK, but nothing to write home about. The day we checked in our room was not ready, they told us to eat lunch and it would be ready when we were done. We got soaked to the bone.The beach is very small, not near enough lounges, the grounds were not kept clean, the food was OK. The employees were great.We will not go back. It's just a shame that out of all the times we've been to the Dominican that the first time my daughter and her family went it was the worst of all. My son-in-law got very sick with a parasite, had to go to the Dr. there, she was very nice, but he's still ill and has to go to the Dr. here Again

<Author>puntacana9274
<Content>Don't go here!!! We booked this through Apple Vacations, and they highly recommended this resort. We let them know we were on our honeymoon. We got to the resort on Thursday at 3pm, it took us over an hour to check in. We upgraded to VIP package as per the suggestion of the front desk. VIP doesnt mean anything. We were informed that you had to make reservations for dinner the day before, or else your only choice was to eat the buffet. Noone told us this,and since we arrived at 3pm we had to eat our frist night in the buffet which has no fans and was HOT and disgusting. We were also not informed that there would be a dress code for men in all the restaurants, which we were told was strictly enforced. After making my husband adhere to their rules, there were plenty of people eating in shorts. If you did not wake up at 7 am to put your towel on a chair you didnt get one. One morning I woke up at 7am to put towels and reserve chairs, wehn we got there after eating breakfast someone had moved our stuff and put there stuff down. When we went to the desk abotu it the guy said it happens all the time. Very frustarting when all you want to do is relax. The staff was not helpful to us at all, and we are very generous tippers. We tipped everyone and did not find that we were treated any nicer. Of course we r in a different country and dont expect them to speak our language but some were not helpful at all. We also had ants in our room, which they came and sprayed 4 hours later, with us in the room. We had to call to request all of the things included in the VIP package more then once. The food was terrible. We both got sick, which as I said is expected to a degree, but when you eat in a buffet thats outside, hot with bugs crawling all over the food, obviously your going to get sick. We were told the VIP package include 24 hr room service, when we called at 11pm one night they had only hamburgers.We made reservations at the spa, walked all the way over there to be told they had no record of our reservation and we had to come back 4 hrs later.They gave us two keys that didnt work. After dinner we walked back to our room to find our keys didnt work. We called the front desk, (which is a 10min walk at least) and they took 1 hour to come with a new key. It was 110 degrees, and we had to stand and wait, then they came with the wrong key. After we finally got into our room 1 hour and 15 min later, we called to complain and they told us there was no manager at the time and nothing they could do about it. The pools and beach were beautiful. The brazilian restaurant was the only good dinner we had all vacation, and as stated in previous reviews thank god for breakfast. We travel all the time, and go to many places. We wanted a nice relaxing honeymoon, and instead had a weekend filled with stress. This was one of the worst vacations I have ever had, thank goodness they have nice beaches and nice weather or I would have come home early from my own honeymoon. I would recommend spending a little more money and going elsewhere.

<Author>ScreenNamesSuck
<Content>Average, but Nice This hotel is nice, but average. My husband and I travel a minimum of once a year on a family trip and sometimes 2 and 3 times a year depending on the destination. We visited Punta Cana with our daughter from 6/16-6/23. The best part of this hotel is the beach. The beach is one of the best swimming beaches I have ever been to. Our first day there we saw a sea turtle playing with the ropes in the swimming area (on the beach). The water and sand are perfect. Also, the grounds are well kept and beautiful. The hotel was nice, and our room was always clean. Our maid was Yanelly, she was great! I miss you Yanelly. Make sure you tip your maid, and the wait staff. We tipped our maid $5/day and $10 our last day. She was so appreciative, she gave us a big hug and kiss when we were leaving. They work so hard cleaning those rooms, they deserve a nice tip. Although this is an all-inclusive resort the people that live in the Dominican Republic are very poor. We always had wonderful service when we tipped our maid and wait staff. We upgraded and did the VIP package. We thought it was a good deal since they upgraded our room to an oceanview suite. That alone was worth the extra money. You also get topshelf liquer and rum in your room, turn down service at night, in which they will restock your fridge and make sure you have enough drinks. They also give you a beach towel, that you can exchange for a fresh one at the activity center. We also got a massage on the beach. I would advise that you do it first thing in the morning before the pool activities start (they get loud). We did ours in the morning while it was still quiet outside. You also get 1 hour internet service to use for the week. This is nice if you want to check back with family at home, and don't need to actually make a phone call. The shows were average, some were just really bad, but at least they provide some type of entertainment. They should have more shows that feature latin dancing; especially Bachata and Meringue, since we are in the Dominican Republic. It would have been nice to see some really good dance shows...no lip singing. The beach party was awesome! We went to 2 different beach party's and I wish they would have had one each night. It was so fun to dance on the beach, at night, to latin music. Food is good but average. You have to sign up for the theme restaurants, the food seemed to be a little better at the them restaurants, than the buffet. We ate at the Italian, Seafood, Brazilian, Mexican, and Chinese. They were all good. You have to pay additional for the Seafood restaurant, unless you are VIP. I had the Lobster, and it was delicious. The portions were big, I do not like to waste food. I would rather have smaller portions and order more if I'm hungry. If you are going to eat at a theme restaurant you have to sign up in the morning at the concierge (on the first floor of your hotel room building). They will reserve up to 2 nights in a row. You cannot make reservations for the entire week. Also, try the Craperie for lunch, or a sweet treat. They have ice cream and gelato's...great flavors too!If you want to shop for some gifts, there are vendors located on the left or right of the resort. I thought the shops to the left of the ocean were a little closer (about 20 minute walk). The shops on the right, near the pier, are about a 40 minute walk.You also have access to the bikes (for free), but they are very old and it is a little scary riding off of the resort. Everybody is trying to sell you their stuff and most of the people speak Spanish. It would be nice if they had a guided tour and better bikes. If you want to do something fun, without going to far off the resort, they have a great snorkeling trip for $20. You leave right off the beach and it is only for 1 hour. They took us to an area about 15 minutes away called the Aquarium. We saw a lot of beautiful fish. I would advise if you really are a snorkeling enthusiast, Soana Island would probably be the best, but this is an all day activity. I think you go to 2 snorkeling spots. I will have to arrange a trip to Soana next time I visit. If you are going to do any excursion at all, I would advise that you do the Outback Safari. This is so informative. It gives you a chance to see how the Dominican family lives. You also visit a coffee/cocoa plantation and a rum/cigar factory. A children's school, the local clinic, and meat market, and other fascinating places. You get to see the countryside, it is so beautiful, but very poor. You will appreciate the things you have in life. This is an experience you will never forget. Candido was our driver and Omar was our guide, they were excellent. If I go back, I will do this excursion again. Make sure you bring your camera, you will take amazing pictures. This hotel is a European chain, so beware for all of those that are afraid to see topless women and men/women in thongs and speedos. This does not bother me at all. The hotel was nice except for the over-the-top party goers. I like to drink, but there were some out of control people there that were hanging out at the swim up pool all day, drinking all day, and getting sick in the pool. I quit swimming in the pool for this very reason. Also, the bartenders are not quick enough to serve all of the people who would like to have a drink in the pool. I would not go back for this very reason. The hotel is cheap enough to attract the younger 18-21 people who can afford it. They act like they have never drank before and get out of control, puking drunk. We saw 2 different incidents with young kids getting sick in the pool. Next time, I will pay the extra money to go to an adult only hotel, that does not have such a party atmosphere. I do not want to feel like I am at Spring Break when I am on vacation, I just want to relax and have a few drinks, and not deal with out-of-control annoying drunks.  
<Date>Jul 20, 2007

<Author>jh2007_7
<Content>Go and enjoy After booking our holiday I read a lot of mixed reviews about this hotel and some of the really bad ones did un-nerve me before we went so I thought I would give you an honest opinion of our trip so you know if this hotel will suit your needs. We had a fantastic holiday at this hotel but I think it helps if you know what to expect!We flew from the UK for a 7 night stay at the Caribe Club Princess in early July. All in all I found the staff and the hotel very pleasant, the main reception is very grand and the gardens are beautiful. It is not one of the most luxurious hotels I have stayed in but it was comfortable and we had a really great time.The food was good, however we specifically booked this hotel for its 7 a la carte restaurants and we thought the main buffet one served much better food than the themed restaurants. Generally the food was luke warm at the a la carte restaurants so after eating in three of them we reverted to the buffet for the rest of our stay, although you may get a little bored with this if you go for two weeks.The pool and beach are absolutely gorgeous, clear water and white sand so you will not be disappointed here. My only warning to people would be that if you want a sunshade, prepare to get up REALLY early. I was forced to get up at 7am some mornings to try and get two beds under a sunshade and even at that time in the morning I struggled to find space on the beach (getting up at that time is not something I would usually even consider on holiday but as the sun is so strong there and I have really fair skin I had no choice). People must have been up before dawn reserving beds with towels!The only other tip I would give people is when it comes to bartering for souvenirs, we stuck by the rule of offering quarter to a third of the price they start at and this seemed to work most times! Personally I believe a holiday is what you make it and about a lot more than the hotel itself. If you want a hotel that is very luxurious with plush decor in the bedrooms then this hotel is not for you, if however you are happy to stay somewhere comfortable with a good atmosphere and beautiful surroundings then this is hotel will suit you fine. Overall I would rate this hotel 7 out of 10.Go and enjoy!  
<Date>Jul 20, 2007

<Author>ponsla
<Content>Wonderful Vacation We just returned Saturday, July 14 after spending 7 nights, 8 days at the Caribe Club Princess. We had a wonderful time and met allot of nice people throughout the week.We had a great room on the second floor facing the ocean, couldn't be more perfect! Housekeeping usually came around the same time every day while we were at the beach except just 1 day it was done later in the day and had to wait till done.We ate at the Chinese, Mexican, Italian, Brazilian and Steak restaurants. I would have to say the favorite was the Italian. Service was very efficient and food was very good, in fact, ate there twice during the week. Our least favorite was the Brazilian. Seemed like it was all the same food that was in the main restaurant only it was served to you.There were 3 pools, our favorite was the main one right outside our building with the swim up bar. We would spend a few hours on the beach and then hang out at the pool till ready to take it easy before dinner.The beach was beautiful with hard to claim lounge chairs. If you didn't get to the beach early, you didn't get a lounge till later in the day. There were beach activities as well as pool activities during the week also. Weather was perfect all week also. Couple days it rained early morning and cleared up the rest of the day.Didn't do any excursions since it was the first time there and had heard earlier about some of them and just decided to pass on those. We had nothing to compare to since it being the first time there so really have no negative feedback.

<Author>debbieb-w
<Content>Don't do it!!! If you are planning to visit this Resort, DON'T DO IT, GET YOUR MONEY BACK NOW or change resorts.My husband and I are not high maintenance. We arrived this resort, Saturday, 7 July. We paid way too much money for this (all inclusive) trip, at over $1500 each, we expected better service. Upon arrival, we go to our room (VIP suite), the bedpost was broken at the head of the bed. We called 5 times before someone came to see about it, then he began fixing the door to our patio which nothing was wrong with. He didn鈥檛 understand what the front desk told him because they obviously didn鈥檛鈥?understand us, but they said they understood our complaint. We called the front desk again to ask them why the person is fixing the door when we didn鈥檛 call about a door. Eventually, after us doing sign language and showing him the problem, he then turned his attention to the bed. After which he called for help because he could not fix it. Beds were very uncomfortable for your back, like as slab of wood with awful pillows. Bed dressing was awful. The table in the room was full of ants, we asked to exterminate the room, no one did anything about that. The phone didn鈥檛 work in the bedroom, we had to run in the bathroom to answer or make calls, no one responded to this complaint. The towels are dingy and no one should ever use them or put on the dingy bathrobes hanging in the closet, which were suppose to be luxurious . Out of all the people working there, 1 or 2 could understand our needs and we had the hardest time getting the simplest questions answered or problems solved. We continuously called about the TV which had very few channels and it took them until Wednesday to come and load the channels. There was a broken tile in our room, it had been cemented back to the floor but this was just tacky. The maids never really cleaned, they just tidied up. The toilet and tub was not fully cleaned the entire time we were there. We asked for another suite and they refused us that. I wish there was a way to recoup some of our money back. I will not ever refer anyone to that resort. It was nothing we could do about it, so we sucked it up and made the best of it. The food was OK, activities are great and the pools and beaches are fun. We wanted all around service and we did not get it. We understand this is a poor country, but it was very expensive for what we got. Be sure to bring what you need because if you buy anything out of the shops, everything is overpriced. Be careful when you go shopping off the resort because the vendors think all visitors are rich and they remove the prices from the merchandise and then tell you to get everything you want and they will give you a good price. BEWARE, YOU DON'T KNOW THAT YOU ARE GETTING A DEAL, BECAUSE YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT THE PRICE IS.

<Author>grrhart23
<Content>Perfect vacation! I just got back about 2 weeks ago and our vacation was absolutely amazing! anything that you might be concerned about doesnt even matter once you arrive and are greeted by the most amazing people you will ever meet and see the gorgeous grounds for the hotel! We took care of the workers and in turn were treated amazing our entire stay. Best two tips i can give for this place is.... bring ziplock bags to keep your money in so it can stay with you at all times even in the water and not get drenched. We put ours in my boyfriends pocket of his swimming trunks and it worked out great and was easier to tip at the pool bar! Also rooms 2311and 2312 are both 3rd floor complete ocean view rooms and it is well worth it to request them! Any questions feel free to ask!

<Author>pcdr_7
<Content>Caribe Club Princess - Honest Opinion I usually dont listen to the comments people make about resorts because they are negative but I will give you my honest opinion from my experience at the Caribe Club Princess @ Punta Cana. First I list the positives of the resort....the staff were friendly and very helpful, also the scenery was beautiful...white sandy beaches and clear blue water...a few things that made the trip a bit frustrating was the european people...not to be rude, but the ones i ran into (literally, because they wouldnt move) were rude and not friendly and it was difficult to find english speakers, but I understood that considering I was in another country. The euro tourists language barrier just made it a bit frustrating. Also the food was not the best, and if you are not informed about the way reservations are made or just arrived, you are kind of stuck. Another thing that was negative was the local people trying to sell you things in the middle of the resort. They literally hound you to buy things. Also when we first arrived at the resort (about 11am) we were not allowed to check in until 3pm, so we were kind of left to entertain ourselves. Overall, this resort was not bad, but i think i would look at various resorts and compare before making a decision. I would give 3 out of 5 stars  
<Date>Jul 7, 2007
