<Author>poppymontague
<Content>it was brilliant!!!!!!! First and foremost let me just say DO NOT LISTEN TO THE BAD REVIEWS THIS PLACE WAS BRILLIANT!the people who wrote those reviews we're obviously stuck up and snotty..... ok!booked with Thompson flight was great, they've upgraded everything on the plane, seats, entertainment food etc.. good startArrived around 3 o'clock and the sun was beaming down, headed straight for the beach, which was pure paradise.The weather was pretty much perfect all 2 weeks around the 35 C mark which is very hot you will agree.The hotel wasn't too busy the 1st week but got busyer the 2nd. All the staff we're amazing, if you go, speak to Johnathon and Edwin both fantastic blokes who made our holiday something else.Food was good, a good selection most nights, tried nearly all the restaurants and both agreed that the Dominican food was the best.spend most of your time in the sea and still go home with an amazing tan.... it's well worth it!won't ramble on just to say GO THERE!!!!Liam  Helen - south London, England

<Author>staceys523
<Content>Caribe Club Princess is great all around! We went through apple vacations for this trip. I'll try to break it up by sections.Hotel Grounds: BEAUTIFUL! The grounds are so expansive and are so beautiful. There are tons of birds to see all throughout the walk from the lobby to the pool/beach area. Also, I noticed a lot of people writing in reviews how it was quite a walk. The walk from the pool to the lobby has to be over just 5 minutes and it really seems like nothing. I actually appreciated the grounds being larger as it is not really a good idea to leave the resort. Rooms: I was surprised how big the room was. We were on the 3rd floor and our room was always clean. A note to many there is a bottle opener on the inside of the dresser door that leads to the fridge. We did not know this until day 4 or 5 so we were sruggling to open bottles as even their pop is in glass bottles. The beds were comfortable, we did have a problem with hot water but they took care of it by end of day 2. The maids do not speak english but I know some Spanish so simply leaving $2 and a note asking for beer and extra towels did the job. We didn't do the VIP route and it was not necessary at all. Food: The food is different, a burger there is not like a burger here but there is something for all. We actually did the buffet to avoid reservations at sit downs and the buffet always had a special theme as well as options for everyone. The pizza in DR happens to be my favorite pizza I've ever had. During the day there is a buffer in the afternoon and on Saturday they had a cookout grill buffet by the poolside that was neat. Activities: The pool was great. We stayed at the main one wtih all the activities going on. Yes the music gets repetitive and after a few days the animation team gets on your nerves asking for activities but they had water aerobics, pool volleyball, beach volleyball, water olympics, beach olympics, and all kinds of other activities going on every day. We found it hard to get a drink at the pool bar but the other bars were less crowded. A lot of middle aged people not wanting to be out in the sun all day would sit at the pool bar in shade all day just dishing out dollars so they not only blocked the bar but the bartenders would pay most attention to them. The beach was so beautiful and the pelicano divers hut is for CCP and you can get snorkel gear, boogie boards, kayaks, etc. Also if you want to snorkel go here! It is only $20 and they take you out to a reef with great tropical fish plus it doesn't take your whole day only 1.5 hours. All the other trips are $65+ and some take up half your day which we didnt want to do. We wanted to do the four wheeling trip but the week went by so fast. Service: The people at CCP really work so hard and long hours. Most work 6am-Midnight. Some workers were even climbing palm trees to get coconuts for people by the pool, they are always trying to take care of you. It did take awhile to get drinks sometimes at dinner but you'll have that. One downside... Apple Vacationers received invitations under the room doors about a beach party that yo had to RSVP for and everything and we were really looking forward to it as it's hard to change up your nightly activities and it just kinda fell apart. We were a little disappointed about that however this resort is great and I'd definitely go back!  
<Date>Jun 17, 2007

<Author>GWN1960
<Content>Did not love the Princess Just returned from a week at this resort and we took our 3 year old. First the positives; BeachThe beach was great, lots of chairs and tiki style huts for shade, they need to clean the sand around the tables and chairs as no ash trays are provided and there are a lot of butts around, it was also the only place where you would get a breeze, none of the open air restaurants have fans so it is really hot. PoolThe pool(s) were great, but they too could use a good cleaning it did not seem as the skimmers were on during the day, so a lot of hair and other floating debris. The wading style entry was great for our 3 year old and they brought out animals and other characters every day for pictures, no charge to have the picture taken, but $10 (US) or 10 for $8 (US) and they have them posted in the lobby every evening. Our daughter loved the monkey and the snake.Now for the not so good;Suite/RoomWe upgraded to VIP so we had an extra large room on the top floor (3rd), no elevators, but it had a little sitting area where we could set up our daughters DVD player and toys. The refridgerator was stocked everyday with water, diet coke, and other sodas and beer. The AC barely worked but we had a ceiling fan that made it just tolerable. We only had one day out of 8 where we had both hot water and water pressure, it was like showering under a bathroom faucet the rest of the time with little or no hot water. Bathrooms had plenty of towels and hair dryer and other amenities even though the shower/tub control was broken so the shower worked sporadically (when there was enough pressure to keep it on).Resort LayoutThe main lobby area, as well as the disco and stores are a fair walk from the room, pool and beach areas and there is no scheduled tram service so you have to try and stop one when you see it, not an easy process.Meal ReservationsTo get into the non-cafeteria style restaurants one has to make a reservation and if you are non-VIP you pay extra to go to the (La cava or la pescador) but even then you can only go once per week to these two or you pay $25 (US) per person at the La pescadore. You need to make reservations 2 days in advance at least and you will not be able to ask other people you meet to join you as they have a strict seating policy. Each building had a rep during the day to assist in the process, but you need to read the reviews or better talk to people who have eaten at the restaurant's to decide on your first day where you want to try and eat the rest of the week.The bad;The day we arrived we asked a couple who just stayed a week how the food was, the only positive things they had to say was they looked forward to breakfast everyday (cafeteria style) and the seafood restaurant (la pescador) was not that bad, but by all means avoid the chinese restaurant, which was closed at least 2 or 3 nights that we were on site.We had a large group and at least 25% of the people got some type of food reaction or poisoning resulting in days inside or a visit to the medical clinic (which is very good but expensive). Overall I would rate the food as poor to terrible, with the exception being the Mexican restuarant (OK) and the Pescador (OK), the lunches, dinners in the main cafeteria style building were terrrible. The wait staff were good and very accomodating but could not make up for the just warm and questionable food. Room service which is included in the VIP package had limited choices and we could find nothing that any of us including our 3 year old liked, she would eat the french fries, but not touch the hamburgers or chicken(?) nuggets.The other problem with the open air restaurant was the lack of any fans, so they were hot. Also there was no place where you could get something cooked to order so at least it was hot.BarsWith the VIP package you get premium bottled beer vs draft and higher end wines and liquors, not a bad deal. However, none of the bars have any type of music so there is not much night life with the exception of the disco, which opens at 11. The disco however only allows or participates in the all inclusive package for one hour to 12, after that you pay, so much for all inclusive and one reason why they may not have music in the other venues.There really is no place to escape to that we could find outside the resort, there is a small shopping area 5 minute (cab ride - $6 [US] total) with restaurants where we had the best meal of the trip, this is also the area to buy anything you need or forgot back home as a litre of milk in the resort store is $6 (US) and 3 large bags of Doritos and Cheese pufs were $15 (US), aspirin, advil or anything else other than t-shirts were over priced by 3 times the amount one would pay at home.WeatherThe weather was great but it would have been better if the rooms had AC that worked properly and the restaurants had fans.I have not seen any place in the DR where food is not a problem, it may take a few more years for food to catch up to Mexico or Jamaica or other previously cautious food locals.  
<Date>Jun 10, 2007

<Author>tony838
<Content>Very poorly managed We just returned on 6/9/07 from a one week stay, 5 nights of which we were barely able to get 3-4 hours sleep. Our first day was absolutely lovely, great staff, ala carte restaurants, sandy beach, nice pools. The second day the nicety ended and the ugliness began when a huge group of high school seniors from Puerto Rico arrived. They were promised a party week which they got and we lost all possibility of a resonable night's sleep. The property has a disco and when the kids left the disco between 3-4am, it was rampage of the spring break Cancun variety. The kids were yelling and whistling in the halls, banging on doors, misdialing phones (we got 2 phone calls at around 4am). If it were not for the loud laughing I would have been fearful that we were in a riot situation. The total lack of management was apparent when there were at least 75 kids in and around the pool at 4am, of course yelling and splashing in a pool that is closed after 7pm. I assume 4am use of the pool is OK if you are promised a party week. Then the situation got worse. I got a room change only to find out that night I was now surrounded by the party week kids. A Polite request to the kids across the room from us to close their door while 8 of them were partying was replied to by that's your problem, not mine, at that point we felt threatened and backed away. After numerous complaints the Apple rep. said the Guest Services Manager would be in touch with me. Not only did she not contact me, I could not track her down. The long  the short of the whole situation was that mangement chose to suspend and not enforce basic hotel rules. The rank  file staff were at the top of their game. We witnessed waiters escorting kids out of the buffet restaurant who felt sandy wet bathing suits  bare feet were acceptable dress at the dinner hour. We travel often and this is was our 3rd trip to the DR. We have never written a negative review or traveler warning, but this needs to be said. Oh, witnessing Pam  Joe's renewal of their wedding vows was a positive highlight of the week.  
<Date>Jun 10, 2007

<Author>magstu
<Content>A Relaxing Holiday When we finally arrived at the hotel the reception staff dealt with us quickly in a very friendly manner. We had requested a room on an upper floor but got one on the ground floor, immediately we rang reception and they changed the room straight away. So if you are not happy say something, they are only too pleased to help. The room was very comfortable and air conditioned, a god send in the hot weather. The grounds were very clean around all pools and other area's. The beach and the sea were exceptional, nice to cool down in. Plenty of loungers, only complaint most loungers around the smaller pool were broken. The main restaurant was buffet style with plenty of choices, and there are also other themed restaurants. We tried the Chinese and LaCava. Chinese so so, but the meal in La Cava was awful. We waited nearly 3/4 hour for the first course and again before the second. Finally leaving without the sweet course.We had to pay a $25 supplement to eat at La Cava and then found out we also had to pay tax on this when departing. We suggest eating at the main buffet restaurant (more choice and if you don't like it, get something else)Except for the bad experience in one restaurant we had a brilliant holiday and would recommend this hotel to other's.Also if you get chance go on the Monster Truck Safari, long day but well worth it. Weather was good all the holiday, unfortunately no air conditioned area's to sit and have a relaxing drink.  
<Date>May 22, 2007

<Author>hellodiane
<Content>Loved the island and the resort!! We just returned from Punta Cana and stayed for a week at Caribe Club Princess. This resort is absolutely beautiful with its bright colors and exotic landscaping. Our room was nice and had a view of the ocean. Maids do not speak english so communicating was a challenge but seemed to work out fine. They are very eager to make you happy. The beach was the best I had ever seen, even better than the Mayan Riviera, which is hard to beat! Powdery white sand and a large beach that you can walk barefoot on because the sand is cool to the touch and there aren't any shells on it. There is alot of topless women and old men in speedos but if you don't shock easily you will be fine :o). The food was good but it was alot different than you get here. I recommend getting reservations and eating at those restaurants at night so you can be in the air conditioning and the bugs don't chew on you............I did use Off but it didn't work, I have several bites on my arms and legs. The pools were nice but sometimes the main pool got crowded. They could have skimmed it more but other than that it was nice. If the naked people on the beach bother you the pool is the place to be. We purchased the VIP package. To us it was worth the additional money. We received a bottle of rum and 3 cigars in our room, dinner for 2 at one of the pay restaurants (the best and biggest lobster I ever had!), a private beach party and a private cocktail party, free motorized watersports and a massage for each of us(loved the massage!). If these are things you think you would like to have it is worth the money. Also free room service whenever you want it. Our Apple Rep was Tony. He was great and very helpful. We went on two tours......the Marinaquarim and the Outback Safari. The Marinaquarim was okay but not really worth the money. The Outback Safari was fantastic!! It was worth every penny and probably more. It was a long day 845am thru 445pm but it was so much fun and our guide was great. We learned alot about the DR in this tour and would highly recommend it to anyone going there. The one thing that we didn't like there was the aggressive salepeople. They are grabby and I don't like that. If you are firm with your no they will leave you alone usually! All in all I would return here (and will return). The price was great, it is so pretty and the people are happy to have you. There are some language barriers but that is part of the charm!! I hope they do not Americanize it too much because that would take away so much from the island.  
<Date>May 21, 2007

<Author>Ilandking
<Content>Great Resort.....just some minor changes needed. We recently returned from our trip to D.R. It was my first trip to a Non-english speaking country so I had prepared myself for an adventure. Overall my fiancee and I had an absolutely wonderful time. The service was great, the drinks were good (Im not much of a drinker so it was mostly wine and a rum tonic or as they say ron tonic for me) and the disco was really fun as well. The property in my opinion is bigger than most. I think they were going for a more tropical feel and I think they did a good job. They had many different animals around the property like peacocks, ducks, woodpeckers, swallows and many different types of fish. It is a huge property but they do provide a little shuttle service that runs a route on the resort that will take you to the reception area from your room or you could choose to walk through the mangroves for a scenic route that took us about 5-10 mins. because my fiancee kept stopping.To maximize your stay I would suggest a couple of things,1) Get the V.I.P package. We felt as if we got a little extra from our trip than what most people were telling us who didnt get the package. Plus if you're not used to their drinks having a cold heneiken or a glass of bailey's as my fiancee did really makes a difference. And you would have to pay extra without the V.I.P package.2) If you dont do this already, prebook your seats. Its ok going down but coming back it gets tricky. I had one couple who acually ended up with one sitting in the fron of the plane and the other way at the back. Trust me its one less thing to worry about.3) Tip the staff. I know a lot of people have a problem tipping especially when we already paid what we paid for the trip. But common sense will tell you that with the many workers that they have its hard to monitor good customer service. And dont panic, it does not have to be much. I took about $50 US in singles and the most I tipped one person was $3 and we felt like royalty. Was that fair? Maybe not, but we just added that to the cost of our vacation and everyone was happy plus remember too that this is a poor country and the money you spent on the trip doesnt go to them directly so a litle bit to us, goes a long way to them.4) You dont have to get a safe. They charge $4US a day or $25 flat for the week. We didnt do that. We just locked everything up in our suitcase when we left the room and everything was fine and plus we left a $1tip for the same housekeeper everyday and she was really nice to us.5) Bring small bills. The biggest bill we brought were $20's. You will have a very difficult time getting anything larger changed.6) Be prepared for very little English. Im surprised that some people get upset at this. You're going to a non-english speaking country, just try to sit back and enjoy yourself. Also there are a lot of Europeans, especially French. So you're surrounded by Spanish and French all the time but the French isn't so bad, its kinda like being back home in Toronto.Those are the major things. If you can do them I pretty much guarantee that you will have a great time as we did.  
<Date>May 12, 2007

<Author>rjfjr62
<Content>Don't Do It! A friend of mine and I decided to take a getaway to the carribean. After hearing that Punta Cana was nice and finding a good deal at the Caribe Club Princess, we decided to check it out. We booked through the USA3000 website which turned out to be through Apple tours. Our flights were nice and we actually arrived ahead of schedule. We then were directed to the tourbus which took us to the Resort. This was our first taste of dominican time with many to follow. The ride was supposed to be 10minutes but turned out to be over 1hour. When we arrived at the resort, it seemed like a nice place. The lobby was open air and very pretty. We were told that our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm so we grabbed a drink and sat on a couch. The clerk found us within 30 minutes and told us that the room was ready. We took the tram over to the room and when we entered the room we noticed that the sliding door to the balcony wouldn't open or shut. The room was also old and run down. I wondered how the maid didn't notice this or why she didn't notify somebody to fix it prior to our arrival. We called the front desk and told them of our situation. They said that they would send somebody to fix it. We tried to wait but got bored. Thank god we left because we would have been sitting there for 6hours. I had to make another call to get somebody there. This was only the begining. We attempted to eat at the buffet and it was nasty. We found the pizza, rolls and fruit to be good so pretty much lived on that all week.  We chalked the door incident up as being a one time problem but boy did we learn. This place is not service friendly for the most part. The maids would clean our room daily (if that's what you want to call it) and take our dirty towels as they usually do-the only thing is that they forgot to replace them. They also didn't replace anything in the fridge including drinking water. So, I would make daily phone calls to get these items. I had to start calling early because they usually said they were on the way but didn't appear for hours if at all. That was only after 2 or 3 more phone calls for these items. We even tried to tip well the first day and they still didn't provide these necessary items. So save your money. At times I would go find a maid in the hall and ask for these items and they didn't understand what you were asking for. The communication barrier was difficult in many ways.  The food at the restaurants wasn't much better than the stuff on the buffet. You had to make reservations with the concierge before 12pm and could only make them for 3 days at a time. We didn't have the VIP package (I think that means you get towels in your room) so we had to pay $25 pp to eat in one of the so called better restaurants. We chose to eat in the seafood place. I had langastinos (small lobsters) and my friend had a shrimp meal. Wow were we disappointed. They use margarine rather than butter-nasty. My friends shrimp plate was something that should have been served with peeled and deveined shrimp. They came in a sauce unpeeled. How are you supposed to eat that? So back to the buffet for pizza. We also were told to eat at the crepe place so we tried it. The food wasn't bad but the service was terrible. The one woman approached our table and appeared to take our order. She didn't speak english but we pointed, she nodded yes and took our menus. I ended up fighting with the waiter after he yelled at us. He told us he took the orders and not her. How am I supposed to know that? I could go on about the quality of food but I think you get my point. we did meet a good bartender. Calvin at the lobby bar. He took care of everybody including us and was very service oriented-one of the few in this resort. The apple tour rep at the resort was pityful. She gave us a lot of wrong info about shopping and shuttle schedule and phone cards so we were pretty much on our own. When we checked out our bill ended up being far more than we expected, when we asked for an itemized bill, I got a fight from the clerk. She was actually throwing things behind the counter. I was never so happy to leave a carribean island in my life and vow I will never go back. Especially to this resort. If you are the type that likes to stay on a resort for your whole vacation find a good one and stay there. There is nothing outside of that compound. The shopping is terrible. The people are trying to get you into their shop and will actually touch you. This completely turned me off. The island has many less than safe areas so stay within those walls! And pick another resort because the Caribe club princess was awful.  
<Date>May 11, 2007

<Author>TammyLM
<Content>Had a FEW drawbacks, but overall, this place is SWEEEEETTT! Like many others on here, I pour through reviews of any destination I book......prior to booking and after...up until the trip. Good reviews, bad reviews.....most of the time, the trip is what you make of it. If you mentally have no idea where/what you are getting into too...you leave yourself WIDE open for disappointment. But, then again, some folks just arent happy unless they are complaining about something, right?That being said........my husband and I just returned from Caribe Club Princess last week. We had a marvelous time! Had a little trouble with flight delays...but that had NOTHING to do with the resort....and that stuff just happens.PUNTA CANA.............When you arrive in Punta Cana....you must expect to pay a $10 tourist fee per person. Your booking agent should have told you this. Dom Rep has had this in place for years. Dont complain, dont get mad, it is not a rip off. Tourism is this country's #1 source of livelyhood....it is only $10 one time....it should not make or break your trip.Also....tipping just a dollar here and there will get you a LONG way. This country survives on tourism......just a dollar or two to you... is MUCH to them. At the airport, there are several fellas waiting around for the very reason of helping you with your bags to your transfer. I would suggest letting the FIRST one carry your bags (and give him a dollar or two for doing it)....saves the hassle of having ALL his friends ask to do the same thing over and over and over.  If you have tranfers arranged....STICK TO THEM! There are several booths at the airport for many of the travel agencies......find yours to meet up with your transfer arrangements if needed. There ARE reps out there offering transfers in exchange for timeshare demos....watch out for them......unless THAT is what you are looking for.Once you have met up with your transfer and you are off to your resort..........please know that you are in a third world country. I saw several reviews complaining of the scenery in route to the resort. Yes, the roads are a bit underdeveloped, the fields...some are baron and there are shacks no bigger than my living room housing entire families....but it is in its own way beautiful. We like to take in the culture of other places......but if nothing else, it should make one feel fortunate to have what they do. If seeing this bothers you, then dont look at it.OH....on the way to the resort, our driver pulled over and let my husband purchase a cold beer. How thoughtful! Also, we had asked him a question....rather then just tell us he didnt speak much English....he got on his phone and found someone who did.....so that we could ask and he could translate. I was impressed that he cared enough about what we were asking to make that much effort.CARIBE CLUB PRINCESS!!!Our check in went well.....only took about 15 minutes. We arrived at 4pm...so not sure if you arrive early (check in time is 3pm) if your room will be ready. If it is NOT ready yet....go check out the bar right in the lobby....and relax! DO DO DO purchase the in room safe....this is NOT included in your stay...but pay the extra for it. It runs $4 a day to have it, but OOOOOHH the headaches it saves. Keep your passports and valuables in it!The resort itself is absolutely gorgeous! This was our second time in Punta Cana....and we liked our first resort...but of course wanted to try something new as well. This place had vibrant colors everywhere...the buildings red and yellow...with some blue. Nice because there was enough blue in the ocean and pools! The pools were always clean, and the beach.....oh my! I have never stepped foot in better sand. Totally like powder! no rocks, broken shells or anything. You MIGHT get tangled in trivial seaweed down by the water, but that is it. Absolutely fabulous! The resort grounds are fabulous lush gardens....with wild peacocks walking around! We even saw a mom and baby! how cute!Oh, it is a small hike from the lobby to the rooms.......but they do have a trolley that goes around constantly 24 hours. I saw the review about carrying your own bags...you dont have too! Just wait for the trolley to come around again! ROOM............. was very nice....nicer than I expected actually. The floors are a marble tile....even out on the balcony. And they looked clean and somewhat new. The room was clean, bed was comfy and we had clean towels.....daily. Even washcloths...two of them.....so yes, the DO have them!Our fridge was stocked daily, and the maid could figure out quickly what we drank and didnt drink....and left a few extra of what we did drink (that make sense?). We left her a dollar or two every day......it goes a long way!Two downfalls to the rooms.....at least potential downfalls. The first....if you plan to shower for dinner......you could be in for an adventure. When showering anytime up till about 4pm...I didnt have a problem. But in the evening during the 5pm and after.....hot water became an issue......or lack there of . The second potential downfall to your room MIGHT be location. My husband and I were on the third floor. If they have elevators, I did not see them....but that worked for us. It did my booty good going up and down those stairs. But third floor also had its advantages......I gathered by the smell.....that the door at the base of each set of stairs might be where the trash accumulates during the day....till it is taken away from the building. In the morning, the smell wasnt that bad, but as the day went on......ugh!! It was bad! I had read a review or two about smell....and if they got one of the rooms around the stairs on the first or even second floor....I totally can see where they were coming from! But the third floor.....you really didnt smell anything up there.FOOD.......once again, keep in mind you are in another country. Burgers are not gonna taste like McDonalds! My husband and I are not picky eaters....and we actually make a point of trying new foods. But if you are picky, you can still find something you like...but might have to look for it....and then wait in line to get it. The omelet bar and pasta bar (in the buffett) were obvious favorites...as there was always a line! But I heard it was worth it....ESPECIALLY the pasta bar!Anyway..the buffet is a nice open air buffet.......and the food was good. But if you sit at one of the outter tables (restaurant is surrounded by gardens)...make sure you have on OFF or something! At night....the 'squitos ate me while I was eating!There are several specialty restaraunts at the resort ....but many you need a reservation to have dinner. This would probably be my BIGGEST negative....the reservation system they have. SUGGESTION!......Once you check into your room...I recommend the first thing you do ...THE FIRST thing you do is go make your reservations. Otherwise, you may not get to eat at a place you want. They book up fast! And I agree with other reviews on this...I dont understand because you can walk by those restaurants that are so called booked....and you will see TONS of open tables!You make your reservations at the conceirge desk ( I believe their hours are 9-5) at the opening to your ROOM building (not the lobby!).......FIND him/her as soon as you get into your room. I think you can book up to two days ahead of time....so book what you can, and go back every day to book another day, etc... Kind of a pain, I agree....but if you want to eat at those places.....We did the Chinese and Mexican. We wanted the Italian but could not get in......bummer. The Mexican was FABULOUS! The Chinese was 'just okay' to me....but if you are a real fan of Chinese, I say try it out! The French is more of just a Crepe place......11am to 11pm. You do not need a reservation here...but you had better want crepes....ha ha SHOPPING.........there are several really cute boutiques just outside the lobby. They have clothing, artwork, cigars, souveniers, etc. They also have stuff like sunblock, shampoo and snacks, etc. They are way more expensive there, but if you need it.......and dont want to leave the resort, there you go.You have other options though.......if you want a stroll on the beach...and shop...there are several market huts up the beach on the left. It is about a mile up the beach.....15-20 minutes. HAGGLE! They expect it and love to do it! Guideline is start your price at about a THIRD of what they quote you first.....and work from there. Most of the time you can meet fairly in the middle....and if you are aggressive enough, you can even get it less than half.If you want to venture out of the resort....there is a decent size shopping plaza very close. You can walk or take a $7 cab ride (recommended) to the plaza only about 5 minutes away. There is a big building that is a flea market ......and across the street has some of the finer shops.Once again...HAGGLE! They expect it and want you to do it!Sometimes the resort hosts a market night...where local merchants set up tables on the sidewalks. These are nice...but many of the items here....you can find at the flea markets starting at a cheaper price. You can haggle here too.DRINKS.........if you are into beverages......what a place to indulge...try something new! Drinks varied in all ways from place to place. Each bartender has his or her own specialty, so if you liked a rum punch from one.........know that it may be different from another. We like to try stuff.....so we usually tried the bartenders specialty....and then went from there. There is a very popular local SHOT.....mamajuana. Worth a try, just to say you did it. It really isnt that bad....it is rum, with a cinnamony taste....not red hot cinnamon...but like danish cinnamon. It has a slight zing going down, but really not bad at all. Overall, be nice to the bartenders....and they will be nice to you. There are many guests that just yell at them....totally uncalled for, these folks work the hardest...and are usually quite friendly.LANGUAGE...........I read a review complaining about the language barrier.....and it was really nasty....condeming the workers for not learning English to cater to their American guest. One must know that the native language is Spanish. For the past 20 years...they have been catering to Europeans.....French, Dutch, Spanish, etc..... The Americans have only just started coming to the area in the last 7 years! If you get an opportunity to talk to one of the staff members that has pretty good English....you might learn that in order for these people to work at these places, they have to take quite a bit of schooling. Many of the workers know not one, or two but THREE AND FOUR languages! English being their newest one.....give them a break!ACTIVITIES......there are a ton of things to do if that is what you are looking for. There are games all day by the main pool (if the noise bothers you, there are quieter pools you can go to).....can be just as much fun to watch as to participate. There are beach games, activites...as well as water activities. The entertainment tries really hard. There are shows each night.....we caught only one...the Magic show. It was pretty amazing actually. Many people just hung out on the beach or at the swim up bar. Oh, and it is true....many people throw their towels over chairs on the beach and at the pool to Reserve them. Many times, my husband and I saw these chairs stay empty all day....but some were occupied all day as well. For what it is worth, there ARE signs posted by the resort stating that you are not allowed to do this. I wouldnt want to just walk up to any chair with a towel and decide it was mine.....but if you watch one for a while and no one shows up...I would say it is fair.All in all, I would absolutely come to this resort again. It had so much to offer for what we paid for it.....and very pretty as well. I know this review was long-winded, but I hope it helped.  
<Date>May 8, 2007

5	37(review):1	72(resort):1	241(complain):1	1035(route):1	2247(scenery):1	

<Author>rabdt55
<Content>Stay some where else! We stayed @ this resort for our 2006 spring break with our 13 year old son. Upon arrival was told that we were on the the third floor .Problem: My hubby has had numerous knee surgeries  there is no elevator. No other room was supposedly available. Next we had no washcloths for bathing  believe me they don't have any. Room was at least clean  had a softer bed than any I ever had in Mexico. Food was not very good. Lived on beans  rice for the week. Fresh fruit was anemic  bananas overipe by a along shot. Had to make reservations each a.m. to get settings for specialty resturants  many days we were refused . Said they were booked, but looked through the doors on the times /days we had requested  saw numerous sitting available. Next, pool area is supposed to be family-friendly, but son went blind when 70 year old Helga dropped her swimsuit top. Unbelievable. We had expected this on the beach, but not @ the pool. Any complaints went unnoticed. Only thing I can say about this area is that the beaches are to die for. If you want to visit Punta Cana, stay @ Ocean Blue, Iberostars or Bahia Principes, in other words the best you can find.  
<Date>May 2, 2007
<Rating>2	2	-1	4	3	2	2	3	
<Aspects>

8	65(visit):1	205(ocean):1	287(cana):1	289(punta):1	571(word):1	694(blue):1	1512(bahia):1	7718(iberostars):1

14	5(time):1	8(day):2	18(book):1	20(look):1	54(door):1	134(available):1	148(request):1	156(reservation):1	169(sit):1	971(numerous):1	1103(refuse):1	1565(resturants):1	1751(specialty):1	4173(setting):1	
6	16(food):1	216(elevator):1	971(numerous):1	2630(hubby):1	3139(knee):1	5984(surgery):1

<Author>jinnefly
<Content>Fun - If 25 people all liked it then what more can I say?! Ok, we went with a group of 25 aged 24-34 from april 15-20. I planned the trip back in November and have been reading this site every week since then and stressing myself out that everyone would hate the place and be mad at me. I mean the review about being trapped....I was terrified about what I had gotten everyone into!Well, forget about it! Sure we can all be picky and complian that we had to wait for towels one day at the beach, but the sun is so warm and inviting you can dry off while taking a walk to the flea market or joining in a game of volleyball, or sit at the beach bar and enjoy a Presidente!Bottom line is all that worrying I did for 5 months about if all my friends would have fun was a waste of my time, I should have been thinking about how much fun we would all have instead!I am a very compulsive Type A person so let me try and do what others have done to break down our vacation.Arrival - Checked in at the lobbey, make sure to ask for the safe key so you dont have to make another trip once you get to the room, it was $18. After you get your room info, walk across the lobbey to the bar and order your first official Caribe Club Princess drink....you are now on vacation! They have a shuttle you can take to your room, but the walk is not bad.Room - Our room was fine, I am not going to say it was perfect and beautiful, but it had a bed and a tv, huge bathroom loveseat, mini fridge (mmmm Coke Light) and other than changing or sleeping please tell me how much time you actually spend in a hotel room? All others had fine rooms too, sure some had better views than others, but what do you need a view for when you can walk a few feet and actually be on the beach?Pool - It was nice, never really crowded, pool bartender's nice and they dont seem to mind if a little bit of your drink sloshes into the pool, they close it around 7pm anyway to clean it I think. Bring a beach ball it's fun to toss around with your friends.Beach - well all brought our own towels and just laid them on the beach anyway, usually chairs opened up and as they did we would start to gather them....obviously not gonna get 25 all together but we never seemed to have a problem getting chairs and even 1 or 2 beach huts. The water is awesome, just enough waves to make it fun but not worry about losing your swimsuit. We did the kayaking, also fun. And there is a $20 snorkling trip that leaves right from the beach, its a fun boat ride and then fun snorkling. I will say to make a reservation for the banana boat, the BEST $7 spent on vacation, sit in the front if you want to bounce around a lot! Walking for 15 minutes to the left there is a flea market, nice tourist type stuff to buy, and tons of art. Like everyone said bargain and you will get what you want to pay for it.Food - Ok i am super picky about food already in the US, so i understood what i was getting myself into coming to the DR. Of course things tasted funny or bad, but the best part is you can go get another plate of something else you like and eat that. I never went hungry, but i did eat really fast as soon as i got the Atlanta airport, hahaha. It's not like i am going to live in the DR it was just a week long vacation and for all the fun and everything else, the food was a non-issue. Restuarants were nice cause they were not crowded and didnt feel like cattle in the buffet lines, nice to have people serve you since you did spend a lot of money to go on vacation, and nice to get dressed up.Nightlife - we went to the disco our first night and it was fun, they played fun music and we were there to have a great time. our free drinks stopped at midnight and we left shortly after to head to the beach bar which must be open 24 hours cause i never saw it closed! Nice to hang out with all of us under the huts drinking all night long. we also went to the casino one night, had some winners and some losers but overall it was fun. Lobbey bar is the happening spot until it closes at midnight, then just head to the beach bar.I am sure i am forgeting something.....but i generally just wanted other readers to know that if i could like it so much anyone can!!  
<Date>May 1, 2007

<Author>lotacolada
<Content>Nothing to worry about Our group always goes on vacation the beginning of June every year. We are lucky as far as the amount of people that go at this time of the year. The resort was pretty much empty and we were all upgraded. We go in a group of 20 or more---mostly family. We were at Caribe Club Princess last June and will say it was Awesome.Our flight was fine--not that has anything to do with the resort. Check in for us was smooth. Room was good, we switched rooms after a few days only to have an ajoining room with another family member. The rooms I considered very clean, maid service every morning with fresh towels and nice animals made out of towels. Stocked refrigerator with h20, coke and sprite. We had a coffee pot and iron/board in our room as well. I am not really very picky about the rooms as we spend very little time in them. The view was ocean for us but really does not matter again as we are not in our rooms much. Food- The restaurants were all good. It was fun to dress nice and go out to eat. Men must wear pants and closed toe shoes to the resturants. We were able to make reservations for 2 days at a time, go to the lobby at the bottem of your hotel building--NOT the main lobby. The buffett was good as well---even if you are picky there is something for everyone there. In the am there are made to order omlets, pancakes, frenchtoast, bacon and on and on.... Lunch was always good with a variety. THe little snack area was just OK for lunch--not that good really and dinner in the buffet was always good with variety. Yes, it is an open air buffett---most places are, this is not out of the ordinary. The nicer reserved restaurants are all air-condiioned. The entertainment staff was good. We enjoyed many activities throughout the week during the day. I have to say they do not cater to children as much as they do in Mexico though. Our kids do like h20 polo and playing together with the adults and staff here did not include them nearly as much. They did however have a nice show after dinner in the eves that the kids always participated in. Adult entertainment was going on every eve but we did not see one show for adults as we were way too tired and just could not stay awake for it. Beach--was the most beautiful I have ever seen!!! Pink/white sand, warm sea h20. It was the best ever!!!Drinks---not the greatest variety menu, but what they had really were always great. The mamajuana was great as well-try it. There are shops by the main lobby as well (expensive). We went down the beach and bought from them---make sure you bargin with them, they may trade you for something and you can get prices down if you work at it.We did not do any off resort excursions so we can not comment.Pools---they were great, always clean. Lots of activities happening all of the time. No snorkling off the resort-the beach is NOT rocky at all--to nice to snorkle at.Hair braiding-offered all over te place.Internet is avalible for a fee however we did not use it.This is a nice clean resort you can go to and really relax at. It really is what you make of it. We usually stay at a 3-5 star and are never disppointed with it. I am amazed when I hear of the bad reviews that are posted!!! Although we never stay at the same place twice(just because we want to experience a different place every year), we would not hesitate to come back to caribe club!!  
<Date>Apr 26, 2007

<Author>PVFV
<Content>Will never return nor recommend to any Couple! My husband and I just returned from our short four days trip to DR. We stayed at Caribe Club Princess for three nights. This trip has been a huge disappointment for both of us. This resort may be ok for people that are traveling in search for a party or ways of getting loaded on drinks from morning till dawn, but for a couple looking for a way to relax and enjoy stress free vacation this is highly NOT recommended place. It is way too overcrowded, and its lack of solid organization causes issues on every step of the way.. like getting a lounger on the beach or by the pool or even getting a dry clean towel. We got a room on the first floor in the second biggest building complex (Catollira smth), cannot vouch for other rooms, but ours was really outdated and not cozy. It was big, but useless. Also, it was unfortunatelly located in close proximity to the kitches, so all the cooking aromas was lingering on our balcony. We tried to spend as little time as possible inside, but that was somewhat difficult due to the afternoon showers. Bottom line: if you are a couple that is looking for a getaway resort to enjoy your time together away from everyday buzz, this resort would not provide you that...

<Author>ocblondie22
<Content>Extremely Fun The Vacation Was Amazing dont listen to the poor reviews after all this is a 4 star resort so if you want everything perfect then go somewhere else. We Stayed 5 nights, 6 Days. Our Room was 1177 lower level but great location, we were across from the main pool  restaurants! We booked our trip though apple vacations and our flight was real good out of chicago, no problems. the punta cana airport is awesome, it is all outside there are huge fans inside so the airport stays cool. our apple rep was named tony, he was extremely cool and very friendly. he made sure your trip was how you wanted it. there were no bugs, which was a good thing, but we packed off just incase. bring lots of sunscreen because in the gift shop for a 2.5 ounce bottle, it is 19 us dollars. RIP OFF! anyways, there are 7 restaurants, 5 are included in the all inclusive, andthe other 2 your have to pay 25 dolars for. the italian restuarant is realllllly good, the dominican was alright, we are very picky eaters so we skipped the others which were mexian, brazilian, chinese and sea food. the buffet was real good too, they had lots and lots of different foods, we always found something to eat. the earlier you go eat the more there is too choose from, it gets picked over fast but they are always refilling. the beach is the best part of the whole trip. it is huge and very clean there is beach bar and all the stafff are real nice. they speak little english but enough to get by. there are 3 pools and they are very clean and big, the main pool has a swim up bar which is real nice. if you want a hut on the beach, your best bet is to get up by 645am other wise they are all gone. our room was always very clean and we always had fresh towel and water. the resort has a casino near by and there is a little trolly that comes to the resort to take and pick u up. the lobby is a little ways away from the rooms but there is also a shuttle that comes alot. we hurd that the shows were very good but we never got a chance to see one. the drinks are very good, for some of the top shelf drinks you need to pay extra for. but the majority are included. the drinks are on ice, so if you want a more slushy drink you need to ask for it to be in the blender. we were very staisifed with this resort and we would return. we had no problems or complaints at all!! very fun!

<Author>SunLoverHalifax
<Content>Fantastic vacation Six of us stayed at the Caribe Princess for one week and had a fantastic trip. As you arrive the staff was very friendly, the lobby is incredible and the grounds were beautiful. Our rooms were very clean, large and the fridge stocked with water and coke. We did run out of towels one day but had them about 2 hours later. We ate at the buffet often, there is a lot of selection, plenty of fresh fruits, breads and several main courses to choose from. We ate the Mexican (the best, have the steak), the Italian (a close second), the Chinese (I loved the lobster pieces) and the Brazilian (great if you are a meat eater). The staff is great and we left a dollar or two tip at each restaurant.The evening entertainment was ok, the sound is really loud and there is about a 10 min wait between the intro and the main event.We did some shopping, there is a large selection of goods to be found on the beach. To the left is about a 15 min walk and to the right is a 30 min walk. Both are filled with vendors eager to show you around. Haggle a bit but remember these people have to make a living as well so pay what you feel is fair. We purchased 2 paintings; one for $10.00 and the other for $7, so shop around and don't be shy. Also, I got a great deal on a Lacoste t-shirt, so have fun shopping. Don't forget your $20.00 departure tax and enjoy! I would definately stay there again.  
<Date>Apr 3, 2007

<Author>marleePhila.areaPA
<Content>Practically Perfect Caribe Club Princess, March 17-24th, 2007 I have traveled extensively over the past 25 years with a special emphasis on beaches. Still, I was a bit concerned when booking this trip because of the wide variety of mixed reviews and because it would be just my 19 year old daughter and I.  We had an absolutely wonderful time start to finish. All of the staff was pleasant and friendly and helpful. Both check in and check out were simple and quick. We asked for and received a TV remote control. Our room was spacious and clean and everything in it worked correctly. There are no clocks in the rooms, but the wakeup call service is reliable, with a second call for snoozers. MEALS - The buffet meals offered an amazing variety of meats, vegetables, fruits, breads, beverages, and sweets. Something was always being offered freshly grilled to order, eggs, burger, fish, pasta, lamb chops, etc. Hot foods were hot, cold foods were cold. (However, it is not Cracker Barrel or McDonalds, if you are afraid of new foods or familiar foods cooked new ways, take your vacation in the states). The buffet waiters were always attentive. We never made it to the reservations desk for restaurants before 11:00 am and always had at least 2 to choose from. We also stopped by the buffet each night to see what we were missing and, !surprise!, the buffet offers a different theme each night reflecting the restaurants with the exact same food and a beautiful presentation, in addition to the regular variety. So, while the restaurants offer menus and personal service, the food is the exact same as the corresponding theme night at the fabulous buffet. If you think you are getting a superior meal in the restaurants, that is just an illusion.Based on various reviews we had read, we brought some snack foods from home just in case and never touched them. Between lunch and dinner and late night, beach bar offered nachos and cheese, salad makings, chicken, pasta, etc. BEACH 鈥?The soft white sand beach is deep and wide in front of this resort, spacious even when every chair is filled. Endless walks are available in either direction. We did bring our own beach towels which was nice only because we on the beach well before the beach towel hut opened, and had no trouble finding loungers as we were up for the glorious sunrise each day. I did notice that by 7 AM each day all the shade chairs were taken on the beach. We took our first sailing lesson on the beach from the resort beach/ocean toy guys and then sailed confidently every day on our own. The water was too choppy the day we wanted a windsurfing lesson, but they were great about letting us take one out anyway in the shallows to just get a feel for it. Yes, there is a small bit of seaweed/sea grass, it is an ocean.Volleyball games and soccer were easy to join into, and with the pool right on the beach, we could just lift our heads to see if that was an activity we were interested in as well.EVENING ENTERTAINMENT - The evening shows, well, ... the choreography lip syncing, and dancing were excellent. Unfortunately, the sound system is just awful, sitting in the very last row made it tolerable. The nightly lobby dances were great, lots of energy, enthusiastic, friendly animation staff. They do enjoy pretty girls and flirt extensively, but will concede to the boundaries set by the guest. They are incredible dancers and happy to gently and patiently teach everyone their steps.TOUR - We did the Apple safari tour early in the week. It is an excellent tour for seeing the country side, learning a lot about the dr, and seeing a completely different beach. We also met some great people who were with us on the tour and it was fun to run into them throughout the week and learn what they had been up to. We had pencils, crayons, colored pencils for the school children which they were very happy to receive. We also took several recorders (penny flutes) and these really lit up their little faces, wish I had brought lots more!!SHOPPING 鈥?Bargains are to be had. Haggle, and haggle some more. Try to pay 1/3 or less of the asking price. If you pay too much in one shop, you are bound to make up for it in the next. There are shops both to the right and left of the resort on the beach. The ones to the left are closer and a bit more relaxed with a wider variety of goods. They are all open approx 9 鈥?5.Of course the prices in the resort shops are high for things you could have brought from home; they have to pay shipping and import taxes and make a profit.TIPPING 鈥?We were haphazard about it, didn鈥檛 always have a wallet with us. Of course everyone likes and deserves to be rewarded for jobs well done, but whether we had a dollar ready or not, we always had a ready smile, good humor and a kind word and always got good service.LANGUAGE 鈥?Neither of us knew any Spanish beforehand. We did make an effort to learn a few basic travelers鈥?phrases on the plane ride such as please, thank you, good morning-afternoon-evening, how are you, what is your name, where is, what is, when is, how much is, too expensive, it鈥檚 delicious, etc, and picked up more as the week went on. It was fun to surprise the staff with our Spanish; they almost always answered us with a big smile and in English. It appeared that only the maids and a few of the wait staff knew very little if any English, but it was not a problem at all.MISC - We, nor any of the folks we met were on the VIP plan and did not miss it or feel the least bit slighted. Brought bug spay, didn鈥檛 need it, got 3 bites between us all week.Had drinks at various times in all the bars and always found the drinks delicious and bartenders fun and eager to serve. COMPLAINTS - #3. We were told by Apple that a hospitality room would be available for us to shower and change after check out on our last day since our flight home was not until 8:00 PM. We went to the desk an hour before our bus to the airport and none were unoccupied, so we had to take our hospitality shower in the open air shower by the pool and change in a nearby restroom. Really, no problem!#2. The maid left no clean towels one day. We called housekeeping mid-morning, but still had no towels in the afternoon. After a second call, we received towels within 30 minutes. We had been tipping her, but stopped after that. #1. Trash left all over the beaches by inconsiderate, lazy resort guest. Yes, there are workers who clean it all up, but why not leave it the way you found it for all to enjoy?OVERALL - This resort is large, but has a compact, cozy feel and is it very simple to find one's way around. The nature walk to and fro the lobby, stores, night show stage, is well lit, lots of peaceful wildlife and interesting vegetation and takes about 5-7 minutes. We always saw trams available especially at night, both after the shows and the lobby dancing. None of my pre-trip worries came true. I would definitely recommend this resort and I would definitely stay here again myself. It is safe, fun, clean, has good food, plenty of activities, wonderful staff, and a great location on a perfect beach. Sure there are ritzier, more posh, and more pampering resorts. You do get what you pay for and sometimes a little more. This resort delivers a lot for a little.Do read and learn from others reviews, but don鈥檛 let the whiners discourage you. We will answer any other questions we can, just ask.Go, Experience, Play, Enjoy!!!

<Author>campramsland
<Content>Beautiful Resort and Beach My girlfriend and I stayed in the Caribe Club Princess, from March 11-18, 2007 , The motel staff was great we enjoyed the grounds and the beaches ,OH the beaches , the best I have seen, The food ,well lets say we were't in Missouri , so you have to pick and choose ,But always something to eat ,TRY the cheeses ,they are great and the breads.Rachel is always there to help no matter the problem she is a perfectionist. HOLA to her , and Tony our Apple Rep,and Many thanks to Manny, for the extra cigars .Our room had a few problems toilet handle feel off one evening and one side of bathroom vanity leaked.The maids are sweet and very helpful ,the language between we Americans and the staff a little problem but was able to make it through most conversations.We enjoyed the grounds its like a Zoo all the birds and fish ponds ,you never knew what you would see on a walk through the resort.The drink were okay but BEWARE of the VIP Upgrade we were told if we upgraded to VIP we would be able to have Budweiser beer ,BUT we only recieved it one day and were told they had no more ,it took two days to get our robes, and bottle of rum and cigars,After speaking with Rachel , she was on top of it and they were in the room,pronto!

<Content>Great Place!!! Ignore the reviews which criticize this resort, the food is great, the service is very good, the beach is awesome, the rooms are excellent and very clean, I could go on and on, I have travelled to nearly every Island in the Carib. and this is one of the better resorts you will go to for the money. <Author>WisconsinTravelitch
<Content>Okay,probably will not return Punta Cana has an amazing beach! You can walk for miles! The grounds of the Caribe Princess are well maintained and beautiful as well. Peacocks, white swans, ponds, very nice.The hotel, well, it looks nice, clean spacious lobby. Our room was acceptable, important note: there is NO clock! Granted we were on vacation, but you do need to know the time occassionally. There are no books or even brochures listing hotel ammenities, activitites, restaurant hours, etc, absolutely nothing. Hotels we've stayed at in Mexico, Jamaicia and the Bahamas have asked for a deposit and provided a lock for your room safe, not so at the Caribe Princess! It cost $24.00. We had visited Puerto Plata in the past, however, this was our first visit to Punta Cana, so for the first time, we opted to do an apple vacation square deal. We found out where we were staying at the airport just prior to departure. Of course, we got the deal that isn't really an all inclusive. According to the apple vacation book, the Princess line appears to be the only one that has a VIP package of significance. Apparently for $21-24.00 per day per person, you would get premium brand liquor and one meal at one of the two restraunts not included in the regular deal. For $25 per person, you could eat at either or both places.The food in the buffet restaurant was okay, breakfast, unless you ordered an omelet, was always cold. The varitey was good, but cold. The five speciality restaurants were good! Food hot and very nice atmosphere.It wasn't just this resort, but yes, you have to get to the beach or pool to get a chair, especially if you want one with a back rest that actually works and if you want shade.The resort staff is nice, but much more reserved than in other countries. I did feel the Europeans were treated better than US people. In fact, interestingly, the Italians have their own section with a theater for evening shows.We did have a great time, weather was fantastic, the beach amazing, but we would not choose to return to this hotel. Most important, bring insect repellent! The bugs are terrible at night!  
<Date>Mar 9, 2007

<Author>DDinPA
<Content>It all depends on what you want I researched Punta Cana and its hotels exhaustively on Trip Advisor and here is my take on the Craibe Club.Know what you want BEFORE you book ANY hotel. We were a group of five women celebrating our 40th birthdays and getting away from children, jobs, responsibility and husbands. We pretty much just wanted a place that was AI, clean, safe and had a consistent flow of food and booze. The Caribe Club did all of that.We were out to have a good time and could have stayed in a cardboard box to achieve that as we slept about 10 hours during our 4n/5d trip.CHECK IN: Piece of cake. Here's a tip: Coming from the airport, sit in the front of the bus. It seems like those of us in the front of the line had less issues. Not sure if that was a personality thing or just the stress of checking in so many people.Only one negative here...what's with the Luggage Nazis? After check-in, we wanted to grab our suits and shorts - we HAd come from 15 degree Pennsylvania, after all - and belly up to the bar. Well, they keep your luggage at the off-load site and do their best to keep you away from it. I am sure there is some security issue or some other reason for this, but hey man, it IS my stuff and it was way creepy the way they shouted and gestured to get away from our own suitcases. However, we just smiled and kept digging around until we got what we wanted, but it was weird.ROOMS: OK. Nothing special. Checked to make sure the toilet flushed - it was clogged -they fixed it immediately - and the shower had pressure and hot water. No problemo there. They were reasonably clean. No bugs. Cool. We were good to go. Fridge only had bottled water in it the first day...we had to track down the housekeeper after that. No big deal but even with a tip...no agua.FOOD: OK. There was always something you could find to soak up the endless stream of rum and mamajuana. Seems to be geared to Europeans...eggplant for breakfast freaked me out but we had a good laugh and the omelette station was good. We did manage to get a reservation at the Chinese/Japenese place - never did find out what it really was - but we cancelled then because after a few days of lying around with no responsibility, a dinner reservation felt like an obligation. Yeah, we were THAT relaxed. DRINKS: Lots. They have to be of a much lower alcohol content though...there is NO way we could drink 18 hours a day at home and not be in a coma. Which, if you ask me, is the way it SHOULD be or no one would have a good time...or at least remember it. The beer never seems that cold, but when it IS that Presidente is some excellent stuff. The coldest beer I had was in the buffet. When we got it at the beach bar, it was pretty warm. The mamajuana is some sharp liquid. If you like jaeger, you will like it. Mixed drinks were NEVER made the same way twice...even from the same bartender. It was hilarious waiting to find out what your next Pina Colada would look and taste like!LOBBY: FABULOUS. We liked it better than the disco...which was younger people. We loved the open-air and the dancing...we then would move over to the beach bar for some incredibly inspiring conversation with our Canadian friends. (Hi Roger and Bruce!)SHOWS: Who goes for that? Not us. Though we did have a blast chanting USA during the Broadway review. Other than that, no thanks.TONY, the APPLE REP: He was a charismatic guy, but we had no problems to report to him so I cannot tell you if he was helpful or not. Real pleasant though.LANGUAGE: We did ok with no Spanish. Agua and cervassa(sp?). Other than that, who cares? They even got the Rum and DIET coke we asked for, so what issues there are, can be overcome.TIPPING: IF you tip, please consider it thusly, I am tipping because these people work hard for little money. I do not expect any difference in service. Tipping made NO difference for our level of service. It was consistently inconsistent...just like the mixed drinks.This was one of the best trips of my life, regardless of hotel class. No, there are not many Americans, but so what...if you want Americans on the beach, go to Jersey. There are tons of Canadians - all of whom I LOVED! what unbelievably nice, laid back people! - and French...which, well, let's just leave it at that.We are certainly going back to PC...next year, in fact. But, for some reason - one I cannot really put my finger on - we would like to try a more upscale resort. Maybe better food or rooms...though again, we weren't in them that much. We had so much fun because we WANTED to and our group of five will be at least 5 times larger next year! If the price was stellar, I WOULD go back to the Caribe Club...but again, we will first check out either the Iberostar or Palladium, etc.Have a blast!  
<Date>Mar 9, 2007

<Author>DKLCt.
<Content>Pick another resort The first thing is be sure your travel agent gives you your choice of what type room you want. We asked for the VIP room because in the room discriptions on the web site Caribeclub princess.com they make it sound like the superior suites is the only type room that has the VIP package, come to find out any room can have the VIP package, The basic room on the first floor was disgusting. Cigarette butts in the bathroom sink drain, sliding glass doors off the tracks and would not lock, lamp in the room broken, toilet seat broken, dresser drawers all broken.... total nightmare! The front desk help barely speak english making the situation horrific! The food was decent. The beaches were beautiful but get up before 7:00 am to put a towel on chairs if you want one because if not you are out of luck! Also you practically have to beg for a beach towel even if you have the VIP package!!! My advice book your vacation some where else!!!!

<Author>coSt.Albert
<Content>no complaints well just got back from punta cana, and it was great!!! don't know what all the bad reviews were about, especially about the workers and the staff, they were so... nice and fun, its all about YOUR attitude, as far as tipping it was not an issue we tipped here and there a few bucks and the a la carte resteraunts a little bit more $5 each couple. We were 9 of us no one got sick, no one had any troubles, just watch the pina colda and drinks with coconut milk, there is a lot of fresh fruit so go easy as this can give you some bathroom problems, and of course the tap water avoid, otherwise we had a blast, drinks aren't as good as mexico if you like tropical drinks, but the rest of the drinks were great. The marinearium swim with the sharks and mantarays was a great trip and well worth it. the jungle ones well it depends what you like and which one you book on. All in all the food was good, and the a la cartes were all good. would go back, OH and the beaches and water and plants were the best i have ever seen!! you can walk for miles and no one bugs you..they love canadians but they love anyone who is nice and treats them the way anyone would like to be treated, and don't forget your not at home your in a different country! Hi to all the Rec guys on the beach, especially - Johnathan...we went for two weeks, feb 15- mar 1/07 and flew air canada which was on time and excellent plane and flite.... edmonton, Alberta -

<Author>Euro_Stud
<Content>Anything you are looking for...... Good times!! :) All I can say is that this was such a fun vacation. Punta Cana has everything you need. If you want to relax you can relax and if you want to go crazzzzzzzy, you can do that as well. :)Caribe Club Princess was a beautiful resort. Very good food  service with a good choice of A La Carte restaraunts.All you have to do is make sure you tip here and there and you are going to have the best vacation you possibly can. The nightly entertainment was fun and the entertainment staff make sure you have a blast.One thing I will warn you about is that if you go to the clubs, the drinks are not all inclusive and are quite expensive. Works out to about $8-10 US.We had the VIP package which was good but if you do go with it, it is better to book when you book the trip. There is a massage, watersports, one gourmet dinner, 1 Hour Free internet and all the room service you like. A big family resort along with the odd singles here and there. This resort had a specific entertainment crew for Italians. Felt like I was in Italy..... :) It was fun!!Would definitely go back!!!BEACH WAS AWESOME!!! Take a look at my pics..... :)I am heading back to Punta Cana in April.. (Shows how much fun I had) Hope this review helps.

<Author>traveller20077
<Content>Awesome time! My boyfriend, myself and five of our friends went to this resort Feb 17th-24th. We loved it. The resort itself is beautiful. The grounds are well kept. The lobby was really nice as were the rooms. We had a room on the third floor with nice high ceilings. Two of our friends had the VIP package, and other then the cigars, bottle of rum and beer stocked in fridge, we didnt notice too many differences. Oh they did get free room service. By the end though our maid was putting beer in all our rooms. The staff was very friendly. I couldnt believe some of the reviews saying that they were not. If you are nice to them they are nice to you. The food was OK, nothing special. We played it safe and ate alot of rice and breads. One day we had hotdogs and two people ended up sick for the night. Just make sure you bring immodium and gravol. It was nothing to ruin our trip but just becareful. We ate at the mexican, which our stomachs didnt agree with. The chinese which was amazing and the dominican one which was also good. The beach was absolutely beautiful, the waves were amazing to swim in. The pools were nice too, sometimes a little chilly but not too bad, its so hot that you dont mind. We went to a couple shows and they were alright. The magic one was really good. The Lion King was obviously catered to kids. I recommend going on the carribean festival, snorkling with sting rays and nurse sharks. The coral they take you to is amazing!We would definately go back to this resort in a heart beat. I wish I was still there :(  
<Date>Feb 26, 2007

<Author>beachlover44
<Content>Loved It! Like many of you reading this review, I had read many reviews prior to vacationing at the CCP. I was starting to question my choice in resorts and wasn't sure what to expect when we got there because of the many negative comments I read. We usually travel to Mexico, so we were expecting it to be a similar experience. We loved the resort. We stayed at the CCP from 2/17 - 2/24 and had a great time. There were 15 of us traveling together (4 families). I'll give you a breakdown of the trip and try to give a few tips as I go. We traveled Apple Vacations. The arrival in the Punta Cana airport was well organized and uneventful. It was very easy to find our bus to the hotel. The ride took about 35 minutes. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00 p.m. Check in was quick and there were no problems getting to our rooms. The buffet was closed, but one of the restaurants was still open and had a small selection of food for us. It was just burgers, hot dogs and fries. They had been sitting for a while, and didn't look very appetizing. We are beach people and are very content just lounging in the sun all day. You do need to get up early and reserve a chair. We were usually out at the beach by 7:00 and reserved our chairs. We then went to breakfast and were back on the beach by 8:30 or so. As long as you put a towel or some sort of personal item on the chair, you won't have a problem. There was a problem with the towels at the beginning of the week. They didn't have enough for the amount of people staying in the resort, so towels were very hard to come by and a lot of people were complaining about the towel service. If this becomes a problem then once you get a towel, keep it overnight, reserve your chairs the next morning and when the towels do finally get delivered, you can change it for a fresh one. The beach is beautiful. There are waves and the kids had a blast body surfing. You can also use boggie boards which are available at the rental hut. The water was clean and very refreshing. The pools were nice. The kids did swim in them quite a bit, but we were very happy at the beach, so only went in the pool once to have a drink in the swim up bar.The food was a bit disappointing. We weren't expecting much as we had read a lot of the reviews - they were right. You could always find something, but we found that a lot of the food was cold at the buffet. We did enjoy the choice of restaurants and the quality of food was better, but they do require reservations, so book these early in the day. They usually start booking reservations around 9:00 a.m.The staff is amazing. They work so hard and really seem to enjoy what they do. They are always talking to the guests and trying to get people involves in activities. There is always something going on either at the beach or pool area so if you are they type that likes to keep busy, go for it - you are on vacation, some of the activities are a lot of fun, especially the dance lessons. The only excursion we took was the ATV's which everyone seemed to like. I don't have any information about anything else. Some people that were there said that the horseback riding wasn't great. A lot of traveling to get to your destinations. The shows were a lot of fun. If you don't want to get picked on then don't sit in the front row. Usually those in the front were targeted for the Ice Breaker which is the pre-show activity. We did sit in the front and had fun with it. The dancers are amazing.The weather was ok. We had two days of rain, but we made the best of it and hung out in the lobby and played cards. The rest of the week was nice. It was in the 80's with a nice breeze. About half of our party did get sick, but nothing debilitating. I guess that's what they call traveler's diahrrea. Make sure you bring imodium, pepto, rolaids, etc. You wil most likely need it. There is a store on the property, but it's very expensive. A bottle of pepto was $16.00 U.S. My daughter wanted potatoe chips and they charged me $5.00 for a canister of lays chips. We liked this resort because it was smaller and everything is close. We had s standard room which was very clean. We did not upgrade to VIP and didn't feel like we missed out on anything. You do get a few extra's but nothing we couldn't do without. We had a pool / ocean view and were about 30 seconds from everything. This was great for the kids as they had their independance to roam about on their own. We also felt very safe.We never really had a problem with the language barrier. Most of the staff speak spanish, so if you know enough to get by, you'll be fine. They don't speak a lot of english, so as long as you know a few spanish words mixed in the the english words, they can usually figure out what you are trying to say. Check out and the trip back to the airport was fine. We would definately go back to this hotel. It was a great week and one we will not soon forget. I was really freaking out after reading some of these reviews. Don't worry - it's going to be great. Just remember that you are in a differently country and things are very laid back. Go and enjoy.A few tips:Bring small denominations of cash - nothing bigger then a 20. Bring a lot of 1's - you are not required to tip, but it's appreciated.You might want to bring your own towel.Bring imodium, pepto, tylenol, air freshner, etc.Learn a bit of spanish before you go - it helps to know a few words.Have fun!  
<Date>Feb 25, 2007

<Author>schultzy63
<Content>Great resort This resort was awesome, the weather was perfect 85 and sunny everyday. The hotel staff was very nice, especially the bartenders I highly recommend the mama juana (a rum based dominican shot). the food at the buffet was average nothing special, but the resturants that required resevations very good. The two best resturants that are included were the Chinese plase and the Brazillian place. you can beat the beach white sand blue water it was amazing. The main pool with the swim up bar was always pretty chilly so we did not spend a lot of time in the pool but the ocean was great. All in all this was the best vaction I have been on, it was very relaxing and and just a great time overall, and you cant beat the price. I would definitely return to this resort.
