<Author>stacy13
<Content>caribe club princess we stayed at the caribe club princess from feb3-10 2007 i am going to break down into seperate categories.Airport arrival: upon arrival we were led from the airplane to the terminal were we paid our 10$ tourist card fee we then went through immigration and on to baggage claim (watch out for the very helpful people wanting to carry your luggage for you they do not do this for free a simple no gracias will suffice! if you do not want this. after obtaining our baggage we then found our tour company which was apple they pointed us to the correct bus for our resort it was approximatley a 25 minute ride(hold on tight for the ride driving is a little rough)Resort: we arrived at approx 11:30 am our room would not be ready until the check in time of 3pm they gave us our bracelets and a map and showed us were we could eat and change until the room was ready. the front desk people seem a little uptight but we had no problems. I also reccomend the vip package it worked out well for us. At 3pm our room was ready it was clean and all the vip ammenites were there ie: bottle of rum,bathrobes,and fully stocked refreigerator with soda water and beer. never had any problems with towels or anything else that we needed. we tipped about 3-4$us per day for the maid and the remote for the t.v. showed up without being asked for as well as a alarm clock and nightly turn down service happened everynight without fail. the room was kept spotless and i am very picky about cleanliness.Food: we ate at the buffet for most of our stay because we did not like to have to be somewhere at a certain time but the food was ok you could always find somthing to eat. we ate at mama mias italian food we did not like it and ended up at the buffet. we also ate at La Cava which we had grilled lobster it was excellent!! we had one meal included in our vip package so we chose this one.there are two resturaunts that are not included the LaCava and EL Pescador. there is a japanese a mexican italinan barzillian and dominican. I did end up getting sick but it only lasted a day or so. the drinks that we had were really good especially the cocoloco!! the wine left little to be desired. my husband said that the beer was ok.the swiiming pools were all very clean but the water cold. the beach is the most beautiful that i have ever seen and that sand so white and soft. we never had a problem getting a beach chair we usually got there around 9am.nightlife: the casino did not impress us at all but if you get bored it is something to do. the shows at least the two that my husband and i went to were very good. we did not go to the disco but some of the people we met did and they were very disappointed.all in all we will stay at this resort again it its a very fun place to be it has something for everybody!!  
<Date>Feb 14, 2007

<Author>Henryfarms
<Content>More than we expected After reading some of the reviews, we were a little concerned, but couldn't have been more pleased! The resort itself was on beautiful grounds, and the beach is wonderful. The resort is planned well, with the pools, rooms, and dining areas all together, and the lobby, stores, and theatre in the same area.The distance from the lobby and theatre to the actual rooms is a good walk, but what a beautiful one! Especially in the evening. My husband is not a walker, and even he took to walking instead of riding the tram. And the trams run constantly, if you want to ride. Our rooms were large, with a step-down sitting area, and the bathroom was big. Our maid service was great. We did leave a small gift for the maid each day, along with $1, and our service couldn't have been better. We did have wash cloths everyday, without having to request one. We had packed washcloths, a cheap pack of 12, and didn't need them. We left them for the maid. One of the other couples room had a leaky ceiling when they checked in, and the next morning they were moved into the same building as the rest of us. We went with two other couples, and found the resort extremely small group friendly, with many places to gather to hang out both during the evenings and the daytime. We've been to other resorts where a table for 6 to be able to eat and drink for the entire evening was a problem, yet here, whether it was the buffet dining area, the lobby bar, or even the specialty restaurants, all they wanted was for us to be enjoying ourselves and each other's company. We ate at the Chinese restaurant--wonderful!-great sushi-and the Italian-delicious, and beautiful presentation-and the Dominican-very different. The buffet seemed to have something for everyone, breakfast, lunch and dinner. We found a table at the buffet dining area that we liked the first night, and tipped our waiting staff $5 per couple. From then on, anytime we went to the buffett, we sat at the same table, and wow! what bar service we had!! The resort was actually larger than what we expected, yet again, user friendly. There are 3 pools, each with a bar, one in the pool, and they range from very noisy to quiet! The palms and landscape surrounding them are lovely. The beach area is great, and very convenient to bars and bathrooms. We didn't have a problem getting chairs at the beach anytime, and at the pool,even at 9am, we could find them for 6 people together. The pool bar pool seemed more crowded, however, and saving towels were out there earlier. We usually used the pool in the middle of the resort. It was right next to the Creperie (good for a snack!) and the lunch restaurant. We did not find the language to be a problem, and the staff seemed happy, and willing to help with anything we needed. I think a lot of times your attitude will determine their attitude, if you know what I mean. A smile goes a long way. I know a little spanish, and would speak and ask them different things, and they were great! Tony in the house (if you're with Apple) is a great resource. We went on the Jungle Tour (1/2 day) and is was great. Highly recommend! This is our second trip to Punta Cana, and we would definitely return to this resort, as we feel that even after 7 days, we didn't get to enjoy all it has to offer!  
<Date>Feb 6, 2007

<Author>coldinto
<Content>Interesting experience We came back from the CCP yesterday and it was an interesting experience. The hotel was nice because it was compact, no excessive travelling to get to the beach, restaurants, or hotel room which was nice because we were travelling with 2 toddlers. Our kids loved playing in the sand and loved the pool because you could walk into it from the shallow end, just like the ocean. The water was a bit rough though and it tended to scare the kids. I liked it because it was clear and there were no rocks around. The food was better than I expected. I read the reviews and I was a bit scared of the poor quality. However, I was traveling with about 9 other people and 6 of us became sick, including both kids. We were very careful about not drinking any water and about what we ate. My husband and I had been to Punta Cana twice before at a different resort and we had never gotten sick before. This was obviously a low point.As for the service, it really depended on who served us. The lady making reservations in buiding 1 was awful. She screwed up tiwice on the dates, even though I speak 3 different languages, I tried in all 3 to correct her the second time which took some doing to put the the right date on our reservations. The pregnant lady at the beach bar was an absolute sweatheart though, as she went out of her way to play with my son as I ate.One of my big beefs though was lack of availabiity of chairs at the beach, they were all gone by 8. We tried saving them but someone took our chairs and our towels. Towels were Ok to get as long as you got there by 10. One thing that was interesting was that there are about 14 Italians in their late teens/early 20's that are paid to basically party it up with the Italian visitors there and they were pretty wild, everywhere from their drag outfits to the nurses uniforms to the human chain of 300 people they made on the beach. At times in the area in front of the 2 -3 buildings, I thought I was in Italy, especially hearingEros Ramazotti in the back.I don't think I would go back to this hotel though because we did get sick which puts a big damper on the trip.  
<Date>Feb 3, 2007

<Author>tttnm
<Content>caribe club princess We booked through TNT. The flight and getting to the hotel was fine. Checking in the hotel was an experience.Not english friendly.We arrived in our room to find outlets out of the wall and a closet door broken and light not working.We ended up paying for an upgrade for the week on the second day, costing $270.00. If you have new US currency change it before you get there.The front desk wouldn't change my $50 dollar bills because they thought they were fake. The property was nice, food was great and the beach was the best.I would just use one of the other resorts before I went back to this one, this resort catered more to french eastern and european guests.

<Author>coffeekitty
<Content>Loved it!! We went to caribe club princess from Jan 6/07 - Jan 13/07. We went for a wedding. The resort was absoluty beautiful. The food was awesome. The best part for me was the beach. The waves were amazing. Any one who says this resort is horrible is wrong. We went VIP and it made a big difference. We got 5 restaurants to choose from for the week, which included italian, mexican, chinese, brazillian, steak or seafood. Every restaurant was great. 24 hr room service. 20 min message on the beach and 1hr of any motorized water sports. The people were great and were always willing to make your stay even better. The rooms were big. Our view was overlooking a pond filled with amazing birds, duck and even peacocks. All I can say is that I will go back in a heart beat and I would recommend this resort to any one.Ontario, Canada  
<Date>Jan 14, 2007

<Author>We-B-Disappointed
<Content>Buyer BEWARE My wife and I stayed at the Princess Caribe Dec. 31/06 thru Jan. 07/07. As a well traveled couple we both conclude this was by far the worst resort we have ever had the misfortune of staying at.Punta Cana is a beautiful beach, one of the best I have seen in my travels, but the Caribe Princess Resort's food, service and most of the staff made it a very ugly week.Firstly I noticed that on many occasions the staff seemed to ignore female concerns in restaurants, room service, or at the front desk but yet seem to act when a male requested the same service.The food was horrible. Almost all the meat we had was under-cooked and when we asked to cook it longer, it always took a couple dollar tip to get results. The restaurants were always fully booked yet always half empty.The staff was always complaining how bad their working conditions were and their service reflected their lack of ambition to serve their customers. They always had their hand out but rarely justified the tip other than claiming poverty.Managers never acted on our complaints or blamed the travel agent for not properly explaining their amenities. The Apple Travel representative on site was also not really interested in our complaints. I asked management for a complaint sheet to voice my concerns to a corporate office and was denied.We purchased the VIP program and were charged for alcohol that was quoted free. We never received the free bottle of rum and cigars stated in the brochure. We never received the beach towels that were promised. Finally received the robes promised on the 6th day of our stay. Never utilized the free motor sports promised because they were booked for the week when you used the VIP bracelet. There were plenty of openings if you offered cash.Workers on the resort would ask us for food because they claimed they worked long hours without food. When some of the top staff came into the restaurants to dine, they were all given preferential treatment over the customers.Tried charging us for a safe in the room and only after a heated discussion allowed us one for free.We were charged for room service when it was told to us on the first day that it was included. This was room service that took two days to get four beers.When we returned home we both were very sick with symptoms consistent with food poisoning. I can list many more incidents that just seemed to accumulate during the week, but I think you get the idea of what kind of place this is.As I said earlier, the beach is post card material. This resort is definitely ruining a beautiful vacation destination and hopefully the other resorts discover how important service is for their tourism to survive.  
<Date>Jan 10, 2007

<Author>teriberry
<Content>Fabulous Vacation! We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from Jan.1 - Jan.5th.I rarely write reviews, but after reading some of the negative ones I feel the need to comment.This resort is absolutely beautiful. The room was clean and comfortable. The towels and other linens may not be ready as soon as the room is cleaned because they are being washed. I think that the staff must get very frustrated by the amount of laundry to be done. Especially since there is a need for many self centered peope to get hotel beach towels, save chairs at the pool AND at the beach (some rude people get up at 6am to save seats and then go back to bed!). This is so foolish. It usually rains in the early morning, briefly. The towels get wet, the selfish tourists trade the wet towels for dry ones, then complain that they don't have towels in their rooms. How many washing machines do you think the resort has???It is annoying to get to the beach or pool and see rows of lounge chairs covered in towels with no one there. In my opinion, the only problem with the resort is the inflexible tourists who think of no one but themselves,The food..well.....it is very good. I recommend the buffet because you can see what you are eating and it is all fresh and delicious. The fish is amazing.I also recommend a trip to the spa. It is lovely.If you want the comforts of home...stay home!You must be flexible and kind. The Dominican people work very hard and they take pride in what they do. Go and relax, it is worth the trip!!  
<Date>Jan 7, 2007

<Author>michiemoo
<Content>Great Time in Dominican This hotel and experience were awesome. I cannot believe how arogant some people are, i'm not really sure what they were expecting for the price, this hotel is just fine, believe methe food - the food was fine, i didn't love the buffet and we didnt eat there when we could avoid it. My boyfriend, on the other hand, was completely fine with it. The food there was just kind of lower-grade. The pasta tasted like beeferoni and not pasta like we're used to - that kinda thing. We went to most of the a-la-carte restaurants and they were awesome. I was so surprised at te selection, in the chinese restaurant there's even sushi! So we really enjoyed those and stuck to those most of the time. If you read the reviews further back, they say they had to wait in a longgg line to reserve a spot in the a-la-cartes for dinner, we did not have the problem and even booked in the afternoon for that night a few timesthe service - the service was awesome, the employees are just great, so much fun. of course there's the odd person with a chip on their shoulder, they're people too...cut them some slack. the worst part was the language barrier, there should definately have been some more english - speaking people in key parts...like check in. that was a a little frusteratingthe room- the room was great. we had a queen bed and our balcony overlooked the pool which was awesome because we could hear what was going on down there. We did have to pay 24 dollars for the key to the safe but it was well worth it. the safe's arent huge, about 1 foot cube, average size. The one thing that was annoying about the room was that everytime the maids would come and clean the ceramic floors would never really fully dry, i guess the moist air is to be expected. we left the maid 1 or 2 bucks every day and never had a problem getting towels or having the room cleaned. the drinks - unbelieveably strong. very good though!the language barrier - we came not knowing a lick of spanish,and did fine, it would have been useful to know some spanish though, like please, thank you, etc my biggest complaint of this hotel is the language barrier and second the food. there were a lot of people who only spoke spanish which got aggrivating, but we dealt with it and were fine. there were a TON of french-speaking guests and a lot of the staff spoke french as well so if you speak french, you're in luckthe beach - just breathtaking! we spent so much time there, my boyfriend played volleyball on the beach and water polo in the pool. you could walk for FOREVER on the beach it was awesome. Also if you come out of the resort and turn left on the beach and walk for about half an hour, there are little shops where you can get souvineers and stuff like that, cigars, booze etc. make sure you bargain with them! dont pay more than half of what they ask -- at least. overall - great experience, we both got sick though so by the end of the trip we just wanted to leave, but now i just want to go back. i would reccomend checking out Sun Village resort in Peurto Plata if you havent already booked this one. apparently it's canadian owned, with tons of english staff and gourmet food but not as nice of a beach. if you've already booked this resort. it is just fine, enjoy your vacation.ps: DEFINATELY bring sunscreen, aloe, advil, and immodium, these things are very expensive on the resort, bringing them was the best thing i did  
<Date>Jan 6, 2007

<Author>OhperoWow
<Content>Horrible! (Terrible!) DO NOT GO THERE! Little did we know what we were getting ourselves into.Here are things to expect:No towels! If you are lucky enough to have towels, you鈥檒l probably not want to use them!No beach towels, even if you get there by 9:00 a.m.Foods at their 鈥渞estaurants鈥?are less then poor, although when making reservations they always seem to be 鈥減acked鈥?but when you are lucky enough to insist in making the reservation, don鈥檛 be surprised if you are the only ones there.Resort employees are very outspoken of how unhappy they are working there, therefore their customer service is less than acceptable.People at 鈥淕uest Services鈥?DON鈥橳 CARE WHAT YOU THINK!You will feel obligated to tip everyone, even if they鈥檝e done nothing for you, since they intimate you that they鈥檒l do something to your dinner and/or service if you don鈥檛.I wouldn鈥檛 be surprised if you DON鈥橳 get food poisoning there (everyone in our party did and we are still trying to recover!)Here鈥檚 an inside tip (if you haven鈥榯 read any previous comments, make sure you read the following): BEWARE!!!!!!!The color of the wrist band determines the level of service you鈥檒l receive (told to us by multiple employees working there since we are bilingual Spanish/English). <Author>miaminemo
<Content>Relaxing beach vacation Let me start of by saying that I got far more than I expected for my money.. We booked through travelByBob and got a great price (685/person from detroit including flight/hotel/all inclusive)The beach is as beautiful as everyone describes. The water is clear (very salty) and the sun is mostly clear except in the early AM. The beach is cleaned every morning. If you get out early enough, you can save your choice seats with a towel. Dont get too close to the volleyball courts if you dont want to be hit with balls.. I expected a small room, but no, we got a HUGE room by my normal standards. Even had a small sitting area and a nice size balcony with a view of one of the pools. (Advice: Ask for a 3rd floor room - there are no elevators, but the high wood ceilings made it worth the walk )The walk to the ocean was about 30 seconds. The walk to the front desk was 5-8 minutes.. But the scenery is great so we enjoyed the walk. So while I loved it there, and will most likely go back - here are some things that you may want to keep in mind - - They dont speak much english there. Tony (the apple rep) was great and very helpful, but the average staff dont speak english at all. When we were there, MANY of the guests were french. Luckily I took 7 years of french growing up so I was able to get by. - There are free drinks everywhere. No problem getting them. Just tip a little and they appreciate it. However - the margaritas have no tequila in them.. they use a mix of vodka, triple-sec, and something in spanish.. While they do have frozen drinks readily available, they are the type made from actual fruit. I personally found it too sunny and hot to drink a ton during the day. Saw many people with sunburn. Wear sunscreen you fools. The food was ok for the first 4 or 5 days, but my stomach eventually rebelled and while I never felt sick, I found myself quickly running to the bathroom after meals.. (But taste wasnt a problem) The breakfast was OUTSTANDING.. I liked the brazilian restaraunt the best, and the chinese (while not really chinese food) was good. I had lasagna at the italian.. it was so bad I went to the buffet afterwards. The staff are all friendly, and greatly appreciate tips. They work entire weeks at a time and sleep in a small work room area at night.. I gave my main my old baseball mit for her kids and she was very happy. We had also taken some sample shampoo and such from various hotels and left them as a gift. The only excursion we did was the marinarium. I loved snorkelling through the reef. Even though you know a nurse shark wont bite you, seeing a 12 ft shark a foot away is still an experience. The host of the marinarium is from chilli and fluent in almost every language you can imagine. Pretty impressive. You have to pay $25 for the safe. we did and figure it was worth it. As far as buying souvenirs, the town is expensive. Go to the shops on the beach. Prices : T-shirts could be had for $5 if you buy enough. The little coconut shaved animals the same. Larimar is everywhere, as is amber, but beware of fake amber. Cofee you can get the big bags for 5, 3 for the small ones. Cigars - I bought a box of 35 cohibas for $35.. They start off at over $100. Even though they are on beach, still better than average cigars back home. I went on a 10 minute ride to the Don Lucas cigar factory. The host was very informative, and they give you 1 free cigar. Thats all you need to know you need to buy some. Far better than any cigar Ive ever had in my life. Im cheap and still spent the $40 for 10 of them. Oh yea - activities at the place: 1. Sunbathing. its great. You learn to block out the old people who seem to have lost their tops. ick. 2. Beach volleyball - so much fun. I normally dont play but couldnt resist. 3. water polo every other day - tons of fun and a great workout. 4 . (i never did these, but the GF did) - They have yoga classes, water aerobics, mereingui classes, etc. They also have beach games that are mildly amusing. Youll have fun if you go there without expecting too much.  
<Date>Dec 29, 2006

<Content>Beach was Great I would first have to say that the beach was great , Not to rough and just enough waves to make it fun to play in, Food was plentiful and I thought it was very good ,Wife was a little fussy but worked her way through it, The first room assigned to us was dark and damp on the ground floor smelled musty , With much effort we managed to get it changed to the top floor ,this room was great with a view of the beach and pool, A bit noisy in the afternoon when they are getting interactive with the guests, and the only other thing I could complain about the room was there appeared to be some sort of bed bugs as I was quite chewed up by the weeks end, We did wittness quite a few people at the resort that got ill , We had a party of ten of which seven ended up sick and four were transported to the hospital, Must have been somesort of parisite or something , The resort itself was very well maintained and clean, I came into the room while they were cleaning and witnessed them on there hands and knees scrubing floors ,very impressed , Staff did not speak much english or cared not to so it was rather hard to comunicate , overall I had a good time but not one person in the party said that they would ever go back , I guess that they did not take the daily dose of booze to kill the bug ,myself ,, NO PROBLEM

<Author>charlene82
<Content>Best Time Ever My friend and I stayed at this resort from dec10/06 to dec 17/06 and we had a blast. We mostly stayed at the pool but we spent one morning at the beach which was fun with the waves.(just hold on to your bathing suit) Our room was clean, no problems with air condioner, buffet was good although by the end of the week I was tired of it. It is a lot of the same stuff everyday but not a big deal. We ate at the mexican twice it was great and brazilian once and left half way through it was taking a long time to bing everything out and we weren't that hungry anyway. We did 2 day trips. We did the saona island which I would not recommend. It started at 0630 in the lobby then 2.5hr bus to the boat then 2 hr on the boat to the island. While at the island you are constantly harrassed by people trying to sell you things. Then it took 1hr back to bus by speedboat then back on the bus for another 2.5hr. When we got back we were so tired we went to bed. The other one was the shopping tour which was excellant for only $22. They take you to the rum factory and show you where to buy things so you won't get ripped off. My tips if you go to this place: bring bug spray, your own facecloth(they don't supply them) and remember if you go looking for faults you are going to find them but this place is great I will definatly go here again.

<Author>calanudinsaguna
<Content>Excellent value Been there with my family of four. From the very beginning we felt welcome. The receptionist was kind and tried to accomodate us as quickly and good as possible. The room was what we expected, with the air conditioning in good condition (and not loud), thoroughly cleaned every day. The resort has three pools (all nice) so there was no way one couldn't find where to put down the towel. The beach was great (you'd expect that in Punta Cana!) and the ocean was clean and wavy, so 90% of the time we spent at the ocean. The personnel was professional and courteous. To those guys complaining about the fact that not everybody speaks great English: what if the Spaniards visiting your country would be annoyed at your lack of Spannish knowledge?!?! Be decent, because anyhow they understand more English than we understand Spannish! The service was great, with or without tips (mind you, I always like to tip them). Talking to other tourists (many Europeans and hardly, if any, Americans) and they were all enjoying their vacation. The a la carte restaurants were okay, with a little plus for the Italian. The Chinese was great once, but not so good the second time (we learned the chef took a few days off, so the replacement cook wasn't as...Chinese). Overall we had a vacation worth more than what we paid for (it was the third cheapest out of about 100 packages!)Lovely people the Dominicans!  
<Date>Dec 20, 2006

<Author>candiesunset
<Content>Just OK...disappointing Just a short review. We have been to DR 3 years ago, and again recently Nov 9th for 3 nites. This hotel was average. My COMPLAINTS and WARNINGS would be, the lobby is much too far from the rooms/pool/beaches- you have to wait for a shuttle/tram to take you to the main lobby, or walk quite a distance. We called for pick up on our departure date, 45 min ahead of time, the shuttle came late (30 min) and we missed our prepaid transfer to the airport- and had to pay for a cab- no replacement was offered by the front desk staff, I think it should have been since it was their delay that caused our problem (we would have walked to the fornt desk if it wasnt 1/2 mile -literally- away.) There really should be more bilingual staff -especially at major points of communication- ie- lobby etc.Our 2 rooms left much to be desired. The 1st was dark and damp, and LOUD- being next to the main restaurant- ALL nite long- noise, loud talking. We asked for a new room, and the new one was nice, bigger, brighter, but the toilet ran constantly. Day and nite- no stopping. NONE of the linens smelled fresh to me! That includes sheets, pillow cases, towels and beach towels. Really, a freshly laundered smelling towel would be great. Food was bland, and presentation was dull and non appealing.Drinks were ok. Dominican restaurant smellled very musty.Drinks served on the beach would be nice, as would a bar directly on the beach. Entertainment staff was good, water aerobics was fun. Variety of nationalities visiting the DR is always is nice and interesting. The beach is BEAUTIFUL. The little huts on the beach are really nice.Activities center on beach was helpful. Massages and availability of them was wonderful. There seemed to be an expectation of staff to be tipped which was annoying after a while.I would not go back to this resort. I would not miss this resort, and that's not a feeling you want to have when you're done with a vacation. They need to work a little harder at understanding what the vacation experince should be for their visitors. The other all inclusive hotel we stayed at in DR was MUCH better.The beautiful beach was the best part of this vacation.  
<Date>Nov 16, 2006

<Author>misterme
<Content>great vacation at ccp Let me begin by saying my wife and I have been to europe ,south america, over half the caribbean islands and more than 30 states so we are not new to travel.Our trip began on 6Nov 06 at phl airport on USA3000. Nice flight we even got in early. Transfer to the resort went smoothly. Once at the resort we were told our room would be ready in 1/2 hr as were we very early. We went and got a bite to eat. Upon returning to the front desk we were given our room key. We went to our room and were pleasantly surprised at the size of it and the location. We were on the first floor with a view of both the pool and the ocean. The room was very clean and very cool as the AC worked great. All week long trhe room was cool and clean. The staff at the resort couldn't have been any nicer when ever there was a communication problem they would try and find someone who could speak English. The food was good the only complait was that the choices at the buffet got old after a week. They did try though. The beach was always clean as were the grounds.We booked the VIP package and it was well worth it. I n all it was a very pleasant vacation the only thing I saw that was wrong was my fellow americans yelling at some of the workers because they didn't speak english well it is their country try spanish or stay home. If we ever return to Punta Cana it would be at the Caribe Club Princess.

<Author>cjy73
<Content>Good Honeymoon My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Caribe Club princess. We arrived Sept 11 and stayed until Sept 18.Lobby: Wonderful and beautiful lobby to hang out in. A nice bar and cocktail tables are located in the lobby along with couches and tables. We spent every night hanging out in the open air lobby watching the dancing and activities that would take place there. Great hang out spot!Room: Our room was a beach front room. Nice sunken living area. The bathroom was o.k. The ceiling was siding, but does it really matter? Our room kinda smelled a little bit, but I think its because all the vents are hooked together from room to room. Overall, the rooms are great. I read that if you bring gifts for the maid that you will get better service from them. So, I brought soaps, lipsticks, bubble bath, mascara....etc. We received extra beach towels the first couple days, and a fully stocked fridge every day. Might be worth to bring small gifts or tip. Our friends who did not tip or bring gifts, did not get more shampoo, or their fridge restocked.( Each room has a mini fridge that is filled with bottled water, glass bottled sprite, coke and diet coke). I reccomend getting the key to the safe. Its 24 dollars, but definitely worth the investment.Pool: Greatest hang out spot. The swim up bar with stools in the water was our everyday hangout. The pool is pretty big and there is always an activity going on at one end--either dancing lessons, volleyball, or silly games. Beach: The beach was pretty good. When we were there, there was alot of seaweed at our part of the beach, but we were told it was because of the hurricanes making the water churn up seaweed that eventually comes to shore. But the last day we were there was the best for the ocean. They have boogie boards on the beach free for anyone's use. Anything else, you have really have to pay for or be registered for. Plus, if you break a piece off of anything you use, it cost big bucks. We never had a problem finding a cabana--even in the middle of the day! Watch out for the locals walking the beach trying to sell you stuff--it can get pretty agravating. I suggest to just walk away. Snack Bar: Good drinks, bad food. The snack bar always has food out. The safest thing to eat is the french fries. The food pretty much sits out most of the day. You can ask for a hamburger and they will grill one up for you while you watch. Buffett: We ate at the buffett every morning. Good breakfast food. Pancakes, french toast, omlettes, and eggs are the best. They make the omlettes while you wait. Very good. I found that there meat tastes alot different. I heard a rumor, but I don't know how true it is--I heard the Caribe Chicken is iguana. Now, I can't imagine that it is, but I figured I would put it out there! We had dinner at the buffett a couple times--it was good, but I wouldn't say its the best. They have good pasta's and pork.Specialty restaurants: These restaurants have the best food on the resort! So make reservations. You can make reservations every morning for the next evening. We ate at the Chinese restaurant which was excellent, the Dominican was also very good-get the beef. We had brazilian as our honeymoon dinner-the beef and fish were perfect! We didn't make it to the mexican, but I heard it wasn't that good. The italian was supposedly awesome, but I can't vouch for that one since I didn't eat there.I got sick when I was there for a couple days. I couldn't say whether it was the food, too much sun, or just being plain old sick. My husband ate the same things as me and didn't get sick one day.Adventures: Be careful which adventures or excursions you book. We booked the ANIMAL ADVENTURE and it took us an hour to get there. They picked us up in an open air bus and took us through Dominican--the parts we went through were not very nice. Ask how far away the park is. The animal adventure park was not worth the money. We swam with the Sea Lions, but that is pretty much all there is to do at the park and the sea lions are only half trained to do what they are supposed to do. The snorkeling at our adventure park was cancelled and we received no partial refund. They just made us sit and wait for the next activity which was over an 1hr.Overall: The resort is beautiful.  
<Date>Sep 22, 2006

<Author>ptit_poulet
<Content>Caribe Princess Paradise !! Ok all you really picky people. For all of you that were so negative I think you should have stayed home. I was there with my 15 year old daughter, my husband and my eldest daughter and her husband, from Aug/6 till the 13th/ 2006 and we had the time of a lifetime. It is what you make of it .The hotel room was large and clean and had everything you would need (except facecloths). The A/C worked just fine, the bed was fine, the pillows were fine (remember you are not at home).The maids didn't speak English, so study a few phrases before you go, they get a laugh out of your effort and eventually get your message. If you leave a tip and a little surprise for them on your pillow in the mornings they are so happy and you won't need for anything.The service in the restaurants was great. A waiter named Dionicio (at the buffet) was excellent , a great man, I wish I could have brought him home.The pool bar waiter (Hector) was another fine man and spoke English too.The a la Carte  restos were good, we preferred the Brazilian and Italian. The pool snackbar wasn't so good so we headed for the buffet. You are sure to find something you will like, it was great !Pools? Oh my! Clean clean. Only thing is they close at night, so there is no night-time swimming, didn't matter, there were so many other things to do.Shows everynight, earlier for the kids, and then we headed off to the lobby for fun or even just to sit and people watch. It was very comfortabe, and you could join in the dancing and fun if you wanted to.Their drinks were great, even the (Presidente) beer, They will suggest one of their native drinks called Mamajuana- it was good. Hubby that hasn't had more than 5 drinks in 21 years with me, had them everyday. Remember to try their pie pie drinks I won't tell you what it is, it's a surprise,and more of a ladies' drink though.The ocean? Turquoise, clear, everything I had only seen in pics or TV. I couldn't believe how warm the water was. It rained twice for 15 min. But we welcomed it for how hot it was, the heat hits you in the face as soon as you get off the plane. There are the occassional bare boobies, but you get over it, you know what I say  if you can't beat them, join them maybe you'll never see them again in your life.All in all, we can't wait to go back, at least we know we'll have a blast. I'm even thinking of taking Spanish lessons.The expeditions we took were great also. We swam with the dolphins at Manati Park and walked with the iguanas on the Safari.When you go shopping outside the resort, be prepared to bargain, they are aggressive but will come down drastically in price. A photo album I wanted, they wanted $50. US, I eventually paid only $15.If you have a potato chip craze be prepared to pay $7 US.Go and have a great time. We did!!Don't bother paying for the VIP package, it is not worth it, just rent a safe in your room and you will be fine.

<Author>airjer124
<Content>Relaxing Vacation I had read numerous negative reviews about this resort but my wife and I wanted to try it anyway. We were there for 4 days/3 nights and we upgraded to VIP when we got there which was well worth it. Without even asking, we were placed into a junior suite which was awesome. We did not care for the buffet but there was always something there we would eat. The beach bars and snack bars were excellent. With the VIP, you get your choice of a meal at 1 of 2 restaurants that others must pay for if you do not go VIP. We chose La Clava and loved it. Very fancy and the food was great. When my wife and I go on vacation without our kids we only want a couple of things. We want a place with a beautiful beach and good drinks. Caribe Club Princess had both of those. This is not a 6 star hotel but I would suggest staying here if you're looking for a nice relaxing vacation with a beautiful beach. The staff is very involved with the tourists and they are very energetic. I read a review before I left that suggested tipping even though it is included in the price. I brought $100.00 USC in singles which went a long way with the maids, waiters/waitresses, and bartenders. I found that when you tip them, they remember who you are, what drinks you want, and how you like them. If I had to give 1 piece of advice, it would be to make sure you tip, even 1 or 2 dollars goes a long way for the locals. Overall, I would recommend this resort....

And what's important, they are trying hard. Caribe Club was great, food was very good, and stuff excellent. Rooms were very clean. We were there 4 days, and had not even one complaint. <Author>anyonebut
<Content>鈥?A Restful Vacation???鈥?#x201d; Caribe Club Princess July 26- August 2, 2006 I traveled to the resort with friends for a restful vacation. I originally stayed at this resort when it first opened under the Hodelpa management. At that time, I felt the resort was impeccable with the exception of the service in main buffet. Waiters used to walk all around you with coffee pots and not wait on you in a timely fashion. While we noticed this again during this trip, we managed to use some our Spanish and got to know some of the wait staff. We also tipped well. This seemed to remedy the problem for the remainder of the trip as we continued to sit where our favorite wait staff was located in the buffet. We loved the service in all of the ala cartes. Even though the resort is under the Princess chain now, they continue to serve Dominican specialties in the buffets which we loved. Other resorts seem to lack that Dominican flair when you look at their bland or greasy buffets geared toward certain nationalities. The food is still very good with plenty of variety but plan on repetition during the course of the week. Repetition was a good thing in this case. Don鈥檛 miss the morning juice bar, the rice and beans, twisted dinner rolls, fried chicken, fried fish, coffee with milk, and lobster night. The two beach snack bars were great. We loved the pizza, crepes and onion rings. The Italian, Dominican and Japanese ala cartes were our favorites. The food was amazing. I would skip the Brazilian which is simply the buffet meats served like appetizers on swords every few minutes. Really strange! We left that one hungry and headed straight for the buffet. We also disliked the Mexican. The sauce tasted like catsup to me.No problems getting reservations each day in our room buildings. We didn鈥檛 try the Gourmet La Cava or the Seafood place and chose to repeat our favorites. BEACH-The beach is still wonderful although the sand seemed tanner than it used to be. The weather was windy and cloudy for the first three days so there was some seagrass in the water. The water is still wavy. The water was great for boogie boarding. Don鈥檛 plan to snorkel on the beach. You will have to book a snorkel tour. We took the Marinarium tour with the sharks and stingrays. Warning!! Skip/Reschedule this tour if it is cloudy and or windy. We had a rough time out there in rough water due to weather. Nothing makes you more nervous than swimming with sharks and stingrays in dark water with no sun. There were plenty of beach chairs and palapas on the resort鈥檚 beach even when we arrived late. ROOM -The room was not without issues on the first day. When I arrived they allowed me to check in immediately without waiting around for hours. However, the toilet was not operational. The television remotes are stored at the front desk and so are the safe keys. I had to return to the front desk in the heat, toting my heavy valuables( documents, cd player, jewelry etc) to get the key and remote. After retrieving the needed items, and returning to the room, I discovered that the previous guest left the removable lock in the safe. I needed to have it removed before I could use the safe. I again returned to the front desk in the heat still toting my valuables. The lobby is about 陆 mile away from the rooms. They handed me a bag of safe keys and told me to try all of the keys and then return the bag of keys to them which required one more trip to the front desk in the heat. Now this was strange VIP service!! They fixed the toilet problem relatively quickly thank goodness. I thought they were going to hand me a plunger. I still lost a couple of hours on this adventure and lost some of my beach day with my friends. I wasn鈥檛 a happy camper on day one. The room was a jr. suite with a view of the pool. It was nice. Maid service was adequate, rum, cigars, fruit platter and VIP nightly turn down mint on the pillow service, which began after day 2 and ended after day 6. I liked the fact that the maids remade the bed and replaced towels when they did the nightly turn down service. I wanted to see them do a better job of getting the sand off of the room floor. It always felt gritty. Resort Appearance 鈥?The resort鈥檚 landscaping was better when it first opened. I was shocked to see a wooden bridge over water at the ala cartes blocked off with red danger tape. The resort grass was completely dead/dry in spots and full of debris( paper, cigarette butts) and rocks. This is not the norm for the DR at all. Ponds are unkempt and brown. Fountains are inoperative. The Dominican music that used to play throughout the mangroves is now inoperative in places. A couple of working speakers blared disco tunes. There were groundskeepers working but they really need to clean up. This resort was gorgeous when it first opened. Landscaping generally improves over time but not in this case. Another Problem- For about 3-4 days of the vacation, the resort which was calm for the first 2 days, filled to capacity with locals and guests from Puerto Rico. These guests took over all three pools and all of the bars. I have heard of this happening at other resorts but never experienced it until this trip. It appeared that entire families with children and extended generations descended upon the resort. We began to wonder what travel deals were available from Puerto Rico and questioned some of the guests. It became a problem because numerous children appeared to be largely unsupervised and continuously jumped into the pools splashing everyone. The also ran, screamed etc. and forced many guests onto the beach. You couldn鈥檛 even reach the swim up bar. The pools were full of loud, drunk people. It was like MTV spring break. Loud behavior could be heard in the hallways at night during this period and I even experienced strange knocks on the door late at night. There are no peep holes in the room doors( a safety concern) so I ignored the knocking. After a few days, this large group of rowdy guests, suddenly departed and a calm was experienced for the final two days of our vacation. ENTERTAINMENT- The entertainment staff is still top notch! They really worked to get everyone involved on the beach and in the available shows. We loved them. The comedy show was hysterical. The dance shows were wonderful and well choreographed. The stage is still the best in Punta Cana with its light and smoke effects. The did preempt shows one night because they brought in a Puerto Rican singing star (coincidentally during the crowded period) in the disco and charged a $10. cover and another night for a disco on the beach. We aren鈥檛 disco people and felt cheated out of two shows.Overall- I had a good vacation with my friends on the beach and enjoyed some great food and service. Unfortunately, the vacation was not as problem free and as restful as I wanted . I hope the Princess resorts works harder to reclaim the luster that this resort once had. It certainly has good bones to build on with decent rooms, food and entertainment. I will certainly return to the DR next year but will continue to search for a new resort to try.  
<Date>Aug 4, 2006

<Author>sms96
<Content>Wonderful!!! My boyfriend and I stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from 7/706-7/14/06. Our trip was booked through Apple Vacations, which was one of the best things we could do. I read this site for about 2 months before our trip, and I did not know what to expect. Some said it was great, others did not have the luck of others. Our stay was wonderful. From the time we stepped off the plane, to the flight home, we had not one problem. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30, which was a little early considering their check in time is normally 3:00pm. When we arrived we were greated by the Apple representative...Tony.. and the staff at the check in counter. They were all very polite, and welcomed us warmly. As soon as we stepped foot into the lobby our vacation started. We got the VIP package, which was well worth it. We spent the day in the pool, drinking by the pool bar, and when 1:00pm came along, we were able to get into our room. Our room was basic, but nice. One of the junior suites. Great view from the balcony. I read in one travelers review that she brought little makeup down and gave to the maids... GREAT IDEA! I also brough little things down (eye shadow, lipsticks, mascara, etc) and left for the maids with a dollar or two. We had maid service each day, and our mini fridge was stocked the entire time. The people who work for the hotel work for the money, so if they do a good job, they are happy with receiving a dollar or two.  We went to the shows, they were good, the workers in the show work really hard to pull it off, and it shows. The food is ok, we ate mostly at the buffet, which is kind of like going to an Old Country Buffet back here. That is probably the only thing we could some what complain about, and it really was not that bad. The staff tries to get everyone involved with the entertainment, games, etc. The beaches are absolutly BEAUTIFUL! The water is about the same temperature as it is out of the water! Amazing.  We did a few activities outside of the resort, that we booked with the Apple reps. We went on quads on the ocean side (booked through Quadventure). This was great. The scenery was amazing. The tour guide was great, friendly, and showed us a lot. I have never been on a quad, and I drove it myself. It is automatic, and real easy. A little hint, if you decide to go on this, take the 1:00 tour, they make it a little longer since it is the last tour of the day. This was probably the best thing we did. We also went on the two seater speed boats, which then leads to snorkling. Again, this was great. The speedboats were cool, just a little too bumpy (wear sunglasses or you will have water in your eye the entire time). The snorkling was really cool. Our guide was Bito, and he took the most awesome pictures of us snorkling.  Along with the VIP package we received 20 fee massage. It was so good, we got an extra 40 min along with the 20min fee, and then the next day (the night before we left) we got another hour. Well worth it, and it is also beautiful inside the spa.  The weather was wonderful. If it rained, it only rained at night for a little bit. One day it rained during the day, and we stayed in the pool during the rain. Also, try going down to the flea markets. Haggle with them the best you can. One shop offered my boyfriend 10 ciggars for $120, and he got them in another shop for $25. Overall, our stay was wonderful. More than we expected. I suggest if you are going, to keep an open mind, and don't be picky. These people work hard, and it shows. We are already planning a trip back next year!!!P.S. When you get there, try a CoCo Loco~~ They are great!!  
<Date>Jul 24, 2006

<Author>anguilla3129
<Content>dont drink the water my wife and 2 children stayed at the caribe club princess from july 9-16. the resort is very nice and the beach is gorgeous. we loved the waves and the tiki huts. the pool was a nice spot with a sunken bar but you had to watch what you drank. i noticed that they fill the machines that had pina colodes and the bahama mammas with tap water which you are told not to drink. the food at the resort was okay. you had to just watch what you ate. the restaurant food which i was not allowed to go in because i had nice dress shorts on but people with torn jeans were allowed to get in . it just didnt make any sense. my daughters said the foos was terribile. so most of the time we ate at the buffet. i got sick for two days with the upset stomach and it was i think from the water. my wife also had stomach problems. we went on a excursion to siona island which was very nice. that was an all day affair. we dont think we will go back to punta cana any time soon. some people say the food is good but we didnt see it that way.it is not a cheap island and watch your prices. you need to bargain with them alot. thanks from cape cod massachusetts

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>It was good but some flaws My boyfriend and I just returned from the Caribe Club princess on June 28th. First of all I'd like to say we are both easygoing and just want to have a good time- we're not picky. Arrival -there was great, we got in our room early which was nice, the room was nice too. I think they messed up and accidentally put us in a VIP room, but oh well I'm not complaining! Staff- Overall the staff was a lot of fun. They made the trip better. The only thing I noticed was everytime my boyfriend would walk away from me for a second, a staff memeber or someone at the casino would hit on me. It didn't bother me too much, but it was kind of annoying. Oh and hopefully you know Spanish or you'll be in trouble. I knew Spanish pretty well so I had fun talking to them, but a lot of them didn't speak English at all.Beach- The beach was great! I had so much fun. We didn't have any troubles finding chairs or shade. There were decent sized waves, which I liked a lot, but some people didn'lt like it. There was lots of things to do, kayak, boogie board, and my favorite Banana boat- definately try that! Pools- They were all nice, we spent most of the time at the beach though. The only thing is you can't ever get a space at the swim up bar. Food- This is what made the trip not the best for my boyfriend and I. I read a lot of people saying on the reviews that the food was bad, but I thought they were being picky and annoying. Well, they were right it was pretty much awful. The buffet was okay because you could always find one thing you liked and live off that for the time, but all the food was barely warm. We only found one restaurant we liked, the brazillian. Everything else just doesn't taste good, the meat doesn't taste like U.S meat. Needless to say, I was sick about 4 of the 7 days we were there. I think it was from the food, that made my trip not the best too. Luckily my boyfriend and I didn't get bent out of shape about the food and just filled up on drinks! Drinks- They were all pretty good, but sometimes they gave you the strongest drinks or a different drink then you asked for, not a big deal though because you can just dump it out. We also did the Safari exursion, which was alright, but it poured the whole day non- stop. It probably would of been a lot of fun if it weren't for the rain. Thats about it, we probably had the most fun at the casino and lobby at night- quite the party. Overall we had a good time, but we probably wouldn't come back.  
<Date>Jul 6, 2006

<Author>rmctague
<Content>Caribe Club Princess is a Great Place Our family just returned from Caribe Club. It exceeded our expectations!The facility overall is very good. Some minor flaws with rooms but no big deal.The food was great, the beach was great, the ocean is beautiful, the drinks were great especially the coco locos, the staff was very friendly.The buffet was very good and there is not really a need to eat any where else. We did not go VIP and had enoughdrinks and food to satisfy us and our two teenagers.The grounds are very clean and well kept. We saw different creatures and small birds and animals everyday on the short walk from our room to the main lobby building.The Animacion Entertainment staff is very friendly and say hello to Jose Louis for us. We met people who were staying at other resorts and they were disappointed in the on site activities. Animacion keeps this resort fun and active.We would return to this resort without hesitation. Don鈥檛 worry-be happy here! We were!

8	39(return):1	72(resort):2	155(happy):1	176(fun):1	908(don):1	1373(hesitation):1	2455(active):1	5285(animacion):1

<Author>joanieh
<Content>Beautiful resort We just returned from a 7 night all inclusive vip package. Well worth the money. The grounds are very beautiful. We arrived at the hotel around 11:00am ,We were in the rooms by noon,which was great because check in is 3:00pm. They have shuttles that take you from the pool area to the lobby, theater,shops. The rooms very nice, we had a suite , king bed and step down area to sofa bed and table and chairs. Maid service was excellent, our room was cleaned and fridge was stocked by 10:00amevery day. There are 3 pools , main pool was whereall the acitivites are, the other two pools very nice ,quiet . We had no problem getting huts at the pool . Beach was nice , went boogie boarding , alot of fun, good waves.We have stayed at 2 other resorts in punta cana ,so we have something to compare this visit too. The speciality Restaurants are the best I've ever eaten in. We had Lobster, Beef filet all excellent. The buffet was not that good, needed more variety. We usually like the buffets for breakfast but we were disappointed with soggy bacon runny scrambled eggs,hardly ever any orange juice. The water sports guy didn't seem to want to let you do any of the things that were included, The water bike was broken (he said) It didn't look broken, just alot of trouble to push you out over the waves. We walked down the beach and watched the guys pushing out people on the water bike atthe other hotel (paradisus). There was always an excuse when we wanted to try something, so we gave up.The shows at night were good, The drinks we good. The had archery,ping pong,pool tables etc. mini golf always something to do. The tours were fun we did the snorkeling with nurse sharks and sting rays (they were big sharks rays, my husband and 12 yr old son went on the dune buggy tour. GREAT FUN. The koni tiki party boat was fun too.This was a great vacation overall , just needs improvements in the buffet and water sports center

<Author>RickyB
<Content>Nice place to visit. I just got back from a stay at the Caribe Club in Punta Cana. This place is very very big and the grounds are very nice. The rooms do need some work and the buffet could be better. The beach is not the nicest beach I have ever seen, but the pool is pretty cool. The staff is helpfull most of the time, but some of the girls in the group thought that the men that worked there were alittle TOO FRIENDLY. The activities at the hotel are fun to watch and be part of once in a while, my only complaints on this are that the banana boat is more like a kiddie ride and the shows arent broadway. Food... the food as I mentioned before, could be alot better and safer I have been sick for three days now and I am still not sure what it was I ate, because I was sure to avoid the water and Ice. But overall, it is a good place and just beware of what you eat and what you do that the disco, it can get a bit rough.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great relaxing vacation Our two couples went to Punta Cana and stayed here late May 2006. The resort was wonderful. Grounds were beautiful and staff was SO NICE. The suite was average but very clean and maid service kept up with our every need. The VIP package was worth it-- though keep in mind Snorkeling is NOT included-- only the equipment. Everything else VIP was great. Restaurants were good except Mexican(go figure), especially Brazilian and La Cava (incl. for VIP only). We ate at the buffet every morning and for snacks and they had a great selection. There are 3 pools, all beautiful and clean, with 2 bar/snack bars close by them. They have plenty of activities on site like mini golf, archery, ping pong, etc. They also have shows each night at the theater which were very nice. We did not go to the disco. Not much night life other than that. Dance lessons and activities during the day by the pool. We chose excursions to the Marinarium for snorkeling which was a GREAT time, and the Safari tour which was just as great. We heard plenty of horror stories from other people staying elsewhere on our flight home, and all we could say was that our hotel was Fantastic!!!!! I'd definitely stay at this hotel again if we ever go back.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Mediocre We travelled to the Caribe Club Princess from April 21st - April 28th. The resort is beautiful. The grounds are very well maintained (except minature golf) and the beach is phenomenal. We travelled with our 2 children ages 3 and 5. Our youngest was too young for the Kids Club and we chose not to use the Kids Club for our oldest because most of the other kids did not speak English. My kids had a great time just playing at the beach in the morning and early afternoon and then making their way to the pool in the late afternoon. All of the pools were beautiful with zero entry. The food was mediocre. We tried to never eat at the buffet - everything tasted the same. I was extremely disappointed with the buffet - even breakfast - the bacon was always shredded or crumbled. The omelettes didn't even have much taste. By the end of the week, we were eating croissants with jelly and some of the homemade juices - they were very good. The ala cartes weren't bad. We tried the Italian, Chinese (the best in our opinion), La Cava Steak House, and the Mexican. The were all decent. The food at the resort was overall disappointing. Since my husband and I were travelling with our children, we looked forward to our relaxing dinners and the food was just OK. I had read that many times on Tripadvisor and thought how bad could it be - we aren't picky people - the food was exactly as people on this website described it - not very good. We had the VIP package mostly for the bigger suite size room - which was nice and very clean. We tipped our maid daily plus left small gifts (lipstick, etc.) She always gave us what we asked for. We would leave her little notes (in Spanish, of course) and she always got us what we needed. I knew there would be no wash cloths, so we brought some from home. In our 4th night of our 7 night stay, the night maid came to our room for turn down service after we had left the room to go to the show. We did not have turn down service any other night that week. Unfortunately, when we left for the show, we forgot to pull the key out of the safe and our closet door was open so the maid could clearly see that the key was still in the safe. We did not notice until the next morning that our envelope with half of our cash (approx $100) was gone. We reported it as soon as we realized. We felt we were given the run around. The security manager felt as though this particular maid would not have stolen the money because she was just promoted to VIP service and did not have prior complaints against her. However, they checked the log of key cards entering our room, and she was the only one to enter after we left. We were told by the Guest Services Manager that when a staff member enters a room and sees the safe open or the key left, they are to call Security immediately and not enter the room. This obviously did not happen in our case because our beds were turned down. The ultimate result - we were told the maid was fired even though she never admitted to taking the money. I am not so sure she was fired. The hotel made no good will effort to try to compensate for our loss - they could have offered us $20 in free pictures or a coupon for a massage - they did nothing. I was angry and started telling people around the pool about our experience to let them know to be careful with their valuables and you wouldn't believe how many people had already experienced what we had. Shirts, DVD's, jewelry stolen. It was an epidemic there so if you already have this resort booked - be very careful with your belongings!! Even though we had this bad experience, the beaches were beautiful and our children had a wonderful time. I will definitely return to Punta Cana but not to this resort.  
<Date>Jun 5, 2006

<Author>dugalus
<Content>Families with kids: awesome We stayed at the CCP from April 16 to 30. For a better understanding of this review please take note of our profile: we go south for the beach, relaxation, sports and activities and not having to make any meals for the family. We do not go south for excursions, historic sites or for discovering the way of life of the natives. Generally, we were very pleased with our stay. This hotel is on perfect key with its rating: 4陆 stars. AIRPORT: Quickly processed upon arrival, no fuss with the departure.ROOM: Very large rooms that can easily accommodate one King bed (or two twin size beds) and two kids single beds. Was clean all the time and when we had the beginning of an invasion of hornig (ants), the maid repulsed them with a magical spray. Haven鈥檛 seem them thereafter.FOOD: This is always a tricky review because it depends on people鈥檚 tastes and adaptability to novelties. We are not fussy. The food was good at the buffet but not great. There was a lot a variety and, for the insecure, there is pasta, fries and meat and potatoes. In the 鈥溍?la carte鈥?restaurants, the food is great. The wine is of dubious quality especially the white wine that tastes more like Welch. To reserve for the restaurants you need to wait in line for at least half and hour in the morning, or to use your persuasion powers to get in at night when you see that they obviously under booked. Be careful, do not barge in with your dollars and with an attitude. Be comprehensive and resolved and after a choreography of-we-will-try-to-do-something, they will let you in.BEACH: You have to be more than an early bird to reserve a palapa. I don鈥檛 know if people are reserving them on their way back from the disco at 4:00A.M.!!! Anyways, there is none left at 7:00 A.M. After reserving, people went back to sleep or they went for a walk. Management tells us that if a person is not back after half an hour, you can ask the security to remove their belongings and take their place鈥?Surely a nice way to make friends!!! Nevertheless, we brought our own beach umbrella and never had to worry about the shade. The beach is clean, waves could be very nice on certain days (perfect for boogie boarding) and you can walk for more than two hours on either sides of the beach. Just a little comment for some pigs: the beach is not a gigantic ashtray, so for the smokers please pick up your butts.POOL: Irreproachable. The swim up bar is effective.HOTEL: The lobby is huge, impressive and open. The gardens are very nice and peacocks, ducks, some kind of roadrunners and a rooster are wandering freely around. The buildings are beautifully designed with interior gardens. They are also very colourful. SERVICE: Tipping is definitely making the employees happier. Just a dollar here and there is sufficient. We always had a quick answer to our demands. Tipping was not a prerequisite. I noticed that there are two kinds of people that gave tips: the heavy and early tipper that tells every employee to remember them (they make me puke). Or, the tipper that rewards good service after it was rendered. All the members of the personnel were friendly and caring. Try a word of Spanish here and there and they will appreciate.BARS:They have a limited choice of drinks. However, sufficient for a cerveza drinker!!! I noticed that impoliteness had no borders. There are many people that don鈥檛 notice if you were there before them and quickly shout their order to the barman. Had to remind some folks of elementary rules of etiquette.ACTIVITIES:The team is quite good. They will leave you alone if you want to stay quiet or they will integrate you in any of the activities you want to participate.MINI-CLUB AND MINI-DISCO: Simply the best entertainment I have seen for kids 6-10.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I cant wait to go back!!!!!!!! I just got back to the states yesterday and i am seriously depressed! I had the time of my life at the caribe club and i am already planning a trip back! I would start by saying that the treatment we recieved was nothing like in the usa. No attitudes, no eye rolling. They only wanted to make us happy and thats important! There were times when we didnt even tip and they were still so friendly to us! The food was soso, i am not a big food person so that didnt bother me in the least. The entertainment staff was awesome- those guys and girls get you involved and make you laugh! I rathered staying at the pool then go to the beach because i didnt want to miss any of the action! I had dance lessons, played darts, and did the aqua gym! It was nice to be friendly with them as well and by the end of the trip i felt like i was leaving friends! The lobby parties at night were great also! The staff once again always tried to get people up and dancing! Those guys work so hard and yet they always had a smile on their faces. I felt the resort offered a lot and you dont even really need to leave it unless you choose to! Its definatley not a place to go and party it up and go wild- its more relaxing and enjoyable! I had such a wonderful time and i was so pleased that i am actually looking forward to going back soon!  
<Date>May 23, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time! We stayed at this resort for two weeks and had a wonderful time. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They went out of their way to make sure we were accomodated and to speak English. The food was great and we had the opportunity to eat at all the restaurnants. We participated in a lot of activites and enjoyed all of them - scub diving, kayaking, boogie boarding, salsa dancing, Spanish lessons, the bike tour, beach volleyball, water polo, water volleyball, darts and archery. We also attended most of the shows. The Comedy show was a definite highlight that I would recommend. Dancing in the evening at the lobby or at the beach was also a great time! Highly recommended.

<Author>beachboat
<Content>Caribe Club Very Nice But some drawbacks too! We visited the CCP from April 29-May 6 with our two children 8 and 11. Flight with Westjet was fine. Resort checkin was ok, we got there 11am in the morning and room was not ready until 3:30pm. When got room, was on bottom floor and not cot as requested. Desk advised booked for that night and come back next day for another room. Had to go to the Desk 3 times before they understood about cot!Thought we wanted a crib for our 11yr old. Finally, full single bed arrived which was better than a cot. Stayed in room for this reason and had no bug problems, water problems, etc in room. No wash cloths. I brought my own. Kids only went to Mini Disco couple nights as it started at 8:30pm and we were all tired. Also, did not wait up for Adult shows which started at 9:45pm. Too long to wait after dinner. P.S. Safe fee was $24US with tax.Beach was great and fairly windy but no problems. Went kayaking. Catamaran you must drive yourself or go on tour. Driver not included in AL unless VIP. Daughter got total head braided by beach spa staff. bartered and got it done for $30US. All 3 pools were great. 3 pool over at Tropical was nice but has palms, etc over it so debris gets in pool. Shopping- Walked left down the beach and went to the markets. Did some hard bartering there. Got windchime (bamboo $15) and some other things. Vendors come to resort on some nights. Got mahogany carving from vendor. Watch prices. They started at $175US and we got it down to $40US after walking away. Also walked out resort and to the left passed casino and to Bavaro Shopping. Got a few things there as well. Tours-Went on Bavaro Runners Tour- $80US per Adult and $40US per Child. Good tour, had gone before but wanted to take kids this time. Took things to the door of a school. Different ranch than last time. Better with horsebacking riding on the beach. Resort- Very clean and people friendly. Staff always working hard. We left gifts and money for maid. Buffet was good, but after 1 week was ready for our food. The big thing we were disappointed in was the A La Carte Restaurants. The restaurants are near the vacinity of the main buffet and they all run off of that for at least a portion of your meals. We went to the Dominican (terrible) Brazilian (good-lots of meat though), Italian(good-get friend ice cream) and Chinese (good). In every restaurant, either you starter (salads, etc would be stuff you had in the buffet already). Also, same for most of the desserts. Also the Italian, the pasta was the same they had in the buffet (pasta section, which they cook in front of you daily if you like). I know this is very long, but wanted to give you as much as possible. Any questions? Feel free. We had a great family vacation, nice resort. Would we revisit this resort? Not if going to the Restaurants, which is half the fun. This was our 2nd trip to Punta Cana. Our kids loved it this time and want to go back but will choose another resort next time.  
<Date>May 22, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyed the Caribe My husband and I booked the Caribe Club Princess from May 5-12th. The one and only complaint we had was the food. The buffet had many selections, but nothing had flavor and it seemed to cater to European types of food. Breakfast was probably the best of the meals. Even the specialty restaurants were just OK. Otherwise, the staff, grounds, beach and entertainment were wonderful. We had three beautiful pools to choose from and delicious drinks all day and evening long! We did not upgrade to the VIP package and were not disappointed with the local alcohol choices. We were glad we did not waste the money. We went on the outback safari and really enjoyed the day...worth the money. The Kon Tiki party boat excursion, we felt was a waste of money. We snorkeled but with at least 50 other people. Very crowded in the water. The weather was beautiful even though on the website that we checked daily said no sunshine and had only gray clouds with lightening bolts through them. It rained only one day. If you don't mind just OK food choices, this stay was otherwise wonderful!  
<Date>May 16, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice, BUTT.......... My husband and I go away every year. This was our third time to Punta Cana. we had two other couple join us from April 21 through April 28. I will start off by saying vacation is what you make of it. We had read several of the reviews on Trip Advisor before leaving for vacation and I must say I was a little nervous... The resort itself was very clean and well kept. Our rooms were standard, we didn't really care if we had an ocean view. How much time do you really spend in the room?!? (unless ofcourse you're on your honeymoon) The beaches were very nice, a little windy. We did the snorkel trip from the resort for $20.00, well worth it!!! We saw plenty of fish and Richard our captain was right in the water with us to show us the hotspots. The restaurants were great going down.... butt (no punn intended) bring plenty of Pepto. I highly recommend Mama Mias, Mexican, and Japanese. We didn't have the VIP package and paid extra to eat at La Cava we felt it was over rated and the service was poor. We took care of the waitstaff at all of the restaurants and bars and they definately took care of us! A few bucks goes a long way... Two of the six of us had to go on antibiotics upon our return to the US. My husband still hasn't been back to work as of 5/10/06. The rest of us bounced back. The stomach thing did cause us to have a few early nights but didn't ruin our vacation. Just be prepared!!There have been alot of negative reviews regarding the language barriers. Yes this is a spanish speaking country so freshen up!! Don't expect them to understand everything you say! My highschool spanish teacher would be very proud of my ability to communicate with the staff at the hotel. It was fun trying to dialect with the staff and found them to be extremley friendly and eager to please. They were all wonderful!!!Be sure to visit Isidro at the Beach Bar, he is so much fun!!!  Oh and beware of the Mamajuana, it creeps up on you!!I would recommend this resort but just be prepared for stomach related illnesses, I may even recommend packing your own bottled water from home to drink during your stay. Who knows what it is that makes you sick?!??Enjoy you stay!  
<Date>May 10, 2006

<Author>spras
<Content>Nice Place Needs fine tunning. Lets start with the language barriers. If you have some spanish it will help greatly. The room we had was a suite. Very nice and clean, spacious, but you need to keep 1 door key in a little box on the wall to keep the power on in your room. It took us about a half a day to figure why the alarm clock, refer, and ac was off. Their are no elevators and their is 3 floors. So if you can't do stairs ask for a 1st floor. Food was ok. What ever is supposed to be hot is warm or cold,and if is supposed to be cold it's warm. La Cava rest. Had bad meat. Others had good meat. Luck of the draw. Mexican, Chinese, Brazillian were very good. Buffet was ok. Lots of choices. The wine soso. The beer Presidente was really good. Had great sevice at the pool bar. The bartender was Smelin. He was great. Pools were very nice. The beach was very nice  clean. The Pina coladas, PiPi's  CocoLoco's were very good. Shopping was fun. You need to barter with them. They start 3 times higher then the real price so don't give up.The staff very friendly and lively. Shows ok but a bit much for younger eyes sometimes. Topples is all over you just deal with it. Overall nice place. We spent 10 days their. We didn't get sick but if you keep highdrated with water in between your drinks it will help. Use sunscreen 30 or higher it's hot. A little tip on saving chairs.Get up by 6 or 7 am and take your towels or beach bag and put them on the chairs. They Love hard candy and any Red sox or Yankees stuff. This is great for tipping. Bring a lot of ones for tips.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awfullllll The island is beautiful and the beach was nice, but, the resort itself was awful. Most of the specialty restaurants were either never open or (as explained in very broken english) BROKE. We questioned this and never got the same answer twice. It was always at least five to ten minutes before we could get a drink. The buffet food was always the same. Usually the left overs from the night before mixed with a new ingredient. The staff was nice but very slow and always seemed to be confused. The room was very clean but came with major problems as well. The beds are lumpy, the toilet seat fell completely off. When the toilet was flushed, water poured out the handle. The tv had to warm up for ten minutes before anything was visible. Would not go back ever again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time I just got back from here, we traveled with a group of 8 and everyone had a wonderful time. The beach is beautiful. The hotel and grounds was beautiful and the staff and people are very friendly and hard working and try hard to make you happy. The food was good for the most part, the pineapple was great. We ate in all the restaurants and enjoyed them all except for the italian ( service and food was to slow in coming) they are definitly worth waiting in line for but get up early because they book fast.We went on the jungle safari and the marinarium tours and enjoyed them both. The safari was a long day but saw the country side and had agreat lunch and loved the boogie boarding. the marinarium was awesome to swim with the sharks and sting rays and the boat ride back the music is playing and people are dancing and having fun. They make a coco loco drink for everyone and hand out fresh cocounut, pineapple and sandwiches. This tour was a half day and just the right amount of time. My friend and i had a massage and this was very relaxing. At night we enjoyed going up tho the lobby and watching everyone dance or they had a singer one night. from 11-12 this place was alot of fun. Our girls went to the disco at night and enjoyed this too. I would definatly go back here remember to just go with the flow and relax and you will have a great time.
