<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>every bit a 4 star!!!! My husband and I stayed from 4/13/2006 to 4/20/2006. We have traveled for several years to different places in the Caribbean. This resort is busy, with children. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>not a 5 star, but great place One thing to remember is that you are going to an underdeveloped country, with limited resources. Do not expect gourmet meals, and big city service. The staff was wonderful, everyone more than willing to help out and serve to the best of their ability. Our room was kept extremely clean, the wait staff very courteous and personable. Converse in Spanish, even if it is very limited, they appreciate it and get a good laugh at your translations. Most everyone speaks some level of English, but it is not the primary language of the island so don't be surprised. The food was adequate, be sure you get a good breakfast in the morning. The reservation system for your evening meal was a hastle, you can only book two days in advance for the theme restaurants, so be ready to stand in line every morning if you want something other than the buffet. All the food is prepared from the same kitchen, so again, if you do not have high expectations when you go in, you will not be disappointed. The Italian seemed to be the most popular, we did not dine at the upcharge restaurants as everyone we spoke with who did said not to waste the money. The beaches were the most beautiful I have ever seen! We heard of frequent water and power outages, but only had one brief experience of that in the eight days that we were there. All in all, a great place to go and just RELAX!  
<Date>Apr 20, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Holiday in the sun I must say I read just about every review I could find of this hotel and knew I would have a wonderful time based on what I read and the pictures I saw. Let's start with the positives. The setting at this resort was just beautiful. The beach was just wonderful with its white sand and clear blue water. The pools were very well maintained, had lots of activities and had just the right temperature. The landscaping is beautifully done, and the grounds include peacocks, koi, turtles, etc. There was plenty of food to be had by all. The resort offers a main buffet as well as numerous a la carte restaurants. I highly recommend the Chinese, Brazilian and Italian. We did not eat at the Steak or Seafood restaurant (more on that later). The buffet was fine, and like others has written, has something on it for everyone. I highly recommend a visit to the spa. They had many services to offer at reasonable (for a spa) prices. There weren't too many negatives. The beds in our room were of pretty pour quality, but we managed just fine. I would avoid the shows. One of the musicals we went to see had the performers lip-sync the same song in four different languages. The service is a bit slow so be prepared to be patient. HELPFUL HINTS: This is the most important part of the review. 1) Hopefully someone you're traveling with is an early riser. You need to be out at the beach or pool at about 6am to reserve a good spot. By about 8am, all the chairs have been reserved. Additionally, you have to reserve your a la carte restaurant reservations starting at 8:30 am. People show up as early as 7am to wait in line. If you end up towards the back of line, odds are you won't get the restaurant you want and/or will be eating at 9pm. Also, it is important to note that the reservation you make is for the NEXT night. The day you arrive, try to make a reservation that day. Otherwise, you're stuck with the buffet for the first two nights. 2) Bring everything you need. Do not forget sunscreen, aloe, zinc, chips, snacks, etc. If you do, the hotel gift shop will charge you more than you ever imagined. My wife bought a tube of aloe and zinc for $39!!! 3) VIP --whether or not this is worth it depends on who you're traveling with. Unless your companions drink lots of premium booze daily, it's probably not worth the extra cost (I believe it's about $300 extra a person) You also get a 20 min message, 3 cigars, a bottle of rum, and you get one night in the steak or seafood restaurant. If you are not VIP, the steak or seafood restaurant costs $31/person (kids too) and another 26% for the hotel fee. I'm told the steak restaurant was the better choice. Overall, my family and I has a wonderful time. They have a kids club where you can drop off your little one for most of the day. My son had a blast when he went. If you are not used to the Caribbean sun, protect yourself with plenty of sun screen; you will burn easy, especially on an overcast day. Please feel free to e-mail me with any questions.  
<Date>Apr 18, 2006

<Author>TravelingAsh
<Content>Beautiful...but very busy. Even though I鈥檓 giving the Caribe Club Princess a 3 star rating does not mean this is a bad review. My review is more like a 3+ star. We did like the Caribe Club! We booked the Caribe Club Princess through TNT Vacations (tntvacations) about 4 weeks before departure. We got a GREAT price and were upgraded to the honeymoon suite since it was our 5 year wedding anniversary. We didn鈥檛 know until we got there that VIP was also included with the honeymoon suite 鈥?we were pleasantly surprised. On a side note, TNT was GREAT! They were wonderfully helpful. The onsite rep Primi was superb. The flights were great and both on time. We do recommend TNT Vacations out of Boston, MA!Arrival:Upon arrival at Caribe Club you see this large open air, thatched roof lobby with a nice bar. Well landscaped, clean, and friendly faces to greet you! It was after 3pm when we arrived and our room was not yet ready. So they directed us to the bar and we waited 2 hours. We made the best of it 鈥?and got a good buzz going. Once our room was ready a wonderful woman names Santa (yes, santa) rode the shuttle with us and walked us up to our room. She said they had us wait because we had emailed them the week before about getting an ocean view 鈥?and they wanted to make sure we got it. Room:We were so happy. We had a complete ocean view from our Jacuzzi and a pool/ocean view from the balcony. It was worth the wait. The room was ok 鈥?nothing special 鈥?except for the VIEW! Room was stocked with beer, soda and water everyday. We also had a fresh fruit platter delivered almost everyday in the afternoon, it was a wonderful snack.Food/Buffet:We got over to the buffet as it was opening and were delighted with the meal. Service was great. As soon as we sat down they brought us water and a beer. Loved the fish, mussels and calamari. We went to bed very happy on our first night. As the week went on we got to the buffet about 30 minutes to 1 hour after it opened and the place was packed. Before when we arrived just as it opened the service was great. But later on in the meals it was horrible. The people working were wonderful, and when you got service it was great. But they were so understaffed in the buffet it was frustrating. For almost every meal I had to go to the wait station and get our own water. Sometimes we didn鈥檛 even get a drink with the meal. But the food overall at the Buffet was good to very good 鈥?we always found something good to eat.Food/Specialty Restaurants:Mid way through our stay we decided to try El Pescador for our anniversary. We got to the lobby of our building at 7:30am to reserve our dinner with the concierge and the line slowly formed. One hour later the concierge arrived and there were about 30 of us waiting. We were the first there and this man cut right in front of us and made a reservation. Then another man did it and the concierge said nothing. Then my husband spoke up and said, 鈥淗ey buddy, we鈥檙e next鈥? Thought there was going to be a fight. We made the reservation and went on our way. Two hours later there was still a line there. It was crazy! So we didn鈥檛 make another reservation that week because it was such a hassle. Every time we walked by there was a long line. The meal at El Pescador was good 鈥?but we liked the Buffet better, probably just because there was more choice.The last two days we were there a friend we met invited us to the Chinese restaurant one night and La Cava the next, we jumped at the opportunity. The Chinese meal was great and quick. Service was perfect. We were very happy with the meal. My husband even tried sushi and liked it! La Cava wasn鈥檛 what we had hoped. We sat for almost 1 hour before even placing an order or getting a glass of wine. Then 2.5 hours later we still hadn鈥檛 gotten our desert and we tried to flag someone down to see if we could leave but we couldn鈥檛 get anyone. So we walked out. My meal was so good (snapper), my husbands wasn鈥檛 edible (steak). We ended up sharing my meal 鈥?which was ok because the portion was big enough for two. Then around 11:30 we were in bed and asleep and they called us asking us to come down and sign for the meal. We couldn鈥檛 believe they would call us at 11:30 at night.Beach:Beach is gorgeous!!!! Water is warm and so much fun to swim in. Sand is soft in and out of the water. This beach is the most beautiful we have ever seen鈥e loved it!! The only problem with the beach was the shortage of chairs and other guests attitudes. We noticed from our room the first morning we awoke that all the chairs were being claimed. So we rushed down at 7:30 to claim ours under the shade. We went to breakfast and came back and found one chair and towel gone. By that time all the other chairs in the shade were gone. So we had to get another towel (luckily our honeymoon suite comes with beach towels in the room or according to our TNT rep, we would have had to pay $20 to replace it!!!). But we enjoyed drinking out of our BubbaKegs and really enjoyed the perfect weather. The following day we claimed chairs again and another chair was taken. This time the woman was sitting right in it. I asked her about and she spoke back in French and then looked the other way. She was so rude. So the whole ordeal on the beach was starting to get old鈥ast. My last gripe with the beach chairs was later in the week we went for a swim only to return and find that someone had pushed our chairs into the sun and put their own three chairs under our shade! They were not sitting in their chairs so my husband pushed theirs out and ours back in. When these people returned they wouldn鈥檛 even look us in the eye. It鈥檚 amazing how when some people are away from home they check their manners at the door. This is the first resort where we have had to save chairs. Shade on the beach was like gold. It would be nice if somehow they could get more chairs and a bit more shade 鈥?then there wouldn鈥檛 be such a battle everyday. The beach was very crowded and walking up the beach was nice but so many people were walking you had to dodge people all the time. The music at our resort was so loud! When they gave the music a break it was so nice. We loved the beach but it was over crowed and very busy鈥ome really like that but we like a quiet beach. So, if we return to Punta Cana we will research a bit more and find a resort on a quiet part of the beach.We loved the beach, loved every person we met working there, the food for the most part was very good, the rooms were ok (our view was spectacular), we all stayed healthy 鈥搉ot a sick one in the bunch, and we met some friends I鈥檓 sure we鈥檒l have for life.A lot of the downside was lack of staff, lack of beach chairs, loud music all day at the pool, a poor method to sign people up for dinner and some rude guests (which is no fault of Caribe Club).So you can see the good definitely out weighs the bad here. We are very glad we went to Caribe Club. We did enjoy ourselves but we won鈥檛 be back. If the price was right I would recommend it to a friend.I hope I didn鈥檛 discourage anyone from going to Caribe Club because it is worth a visit. We meet some on the plane ride home who did not run into the problems we had. In fact they are planning on going back again this fall. They adore the place! It is my own fault for not researching this place enough. It鈥檚 perfect for so many people, just not for us. Next time I will look for a place that is a bit quieter, set more in the mountains (like Puerto Plata or Jamaica), and find out the beach chair situation ahead of time. But I would like to take that beach home! What a beauty!Happy Travels All!Ash  
<Date>Apr 13, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Highly Recommend Caribe Club Princess !!!! We had a wonderful time at the Caribe Club Princess. The hotel staff provided excellent service. No housekeeping problems at all.Very clean rooms. The entertainment was great. The beach was excellent. The food was okay but we understand you can't please everyone. A lot of the dishes were overcooked and greasy.You will be able find something you like ,so stick to it.Our children had a wonderful time. We will definitely be back!!!HIghly recommend!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Our time at the Caribe Club Princess My Husband and I went to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic, March 26 through April 2, 2006. We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess. We went through TNT vacations. We were pleased with TNT per se. When we arrived at Boston, there was a TNT rep there that passed out our Tourist cards ($10 otherwise when you arrive at Punta Cana). Also included was a $20 departure tax. We never received a voucher or anything, just nothing was ever mentioned of it when we left. Be advised that the picture they take of you when you first enter the airport in Punta Cana will be for sale for $7 when you leave, so look for the area selling the photos on your departure.  The morning of our second day there we had a meeting with our TNT rep. It is very important you go to this. Make a list of all your questions and be sure to ask him. He/She is a good resource. We scheduled two tours through him: Santo Domingo and Saona Catamaran. These were in the $80 per person range. Have your VISA with you to pay. I wouldn鈥檛 recommend the Santo Domingo trip. It is about a 4 陆 hour bus ride both ways. The ride itself was an experience. The roads and drivers are terrible. The trip didn鈥檛 really show the best parts of Santo Domingo. It took us to a memorial to Christopher Columbus where his remains are 鈥渟upposedly鈥?in this guarded 鈥渃asket鈥? We went to a church and through the house where his son and daughter in law lived. Then we had 1 陆 hours to shop, which was way too long! We went to a buffet for lunch at a local place that was pretty good. It was a LONG day. If you reserve a restaurant for that night, make it for the 8:00 or later time! The Saona Catamaran trip would have been better had the conditions been better. The TNT rep had told us it was an hour bus ride, but it was two. It wasn鈥檛 good weather to start, cold and windy. We took the catamaran to the island, which was the best part. The island was beautiful and we had a nice buffet there as well. Then began the speed boat trip back to the bus for the trip home!! The motors wouldn鈥檛 start. After several changes, we made it back to the bus. There is a shallow area in the ocean for swimming and seeing starfish. Everyone was so cold and it was so late, that no one wanted to get out of the boat. One of the Dominicans jumped in and found some star fish. So we did see the starfish. . The conditions were deplorable where we were supposed to change and go to the bathroom. I know it is 3rd world, but this was awful. It was a real challenge trying to change and not let anything touch the floor!! So another long day!! Some people we met went on the Bavaro Runner and said it was awesome, worth twice the price.The Caribe Club Princess was a very nice resort. Our room looked out to the ocean and pool. It was quite most of the time. One time there was no water for a short period. You could go about a 20 minute walk down the beach to a flea market. They weren鈥檛 too pushy there, but you have to offer half of what they ask. This resort is also within walking distance into Bavaro, a small tourist town. By contrast they are VERY pushy and you really have to watch what you鈥檙e doing. We felt safe walking there. It was about a 20-25 min walk.  We got the VIP package. I highly recommend it. Included in it is: Safe key (if you don鈥檛 get the VIP, I highly recommend paying $20 for the key. It鈥檚 good peace of mind), beach towels, small bottle of rum, use of bathrobes during the stay, eating at all the restaurants for nothing and an included meal at one of the 2 gourmet restaurants which would be about $30 each plus tax. There is also included a motorized water sport, 20 min massage, upper shelf liquor, and 3 cigars, and some internet time. If you don鈥檛 have the VIP package, you have to pay $8 per person for the other restaurants 鈥?Mexican, Italian, Chinese, Brazilian and Dominican. We chose the fish one for our gourmet one and really liked it. The other option was a steak restaurant. The buffet really gets old very quickly. It is okay for breakfast as they do 鈥渙melets鈥?and there鈥檚 cereal, toast, peanut butter, etc. For lunches, there are several little places having lunch or the buffet is there as well. We avoided it for dinner. We learned that if you don鈥檛 get to reserve your restaurant in time, you can go and if someone doesn鈥檛 show, they will seat you. Every time we went there were empty seats, so this is really worth a try, given the option of the buffet! We were able to reserve all but one night. If you are going on an excursion, they will let you reserve a night ahead.As far as not getting sick, I don鈥檛 have any suggestions. My husband and I avoided salads and tap water (hint here, as soon as you are in your room, put a water bottle next to the faucet to remind you to NOT drink or brush your teeth with the water). We both got sick. His was gone in 2 days, mine longer. I really felt badly just one day. You just need to be aware of where the bathrooms are!! However, it did cut into my beer consumption!! The El Presidente beer was really good. The people next to me on the way home had been sick as well. We got Hepatitis A immunization, but didn鈥檛 take malaria pills. Got some small bites but never felt the need to use bug spray. Really didn鈥檛 see many bugs. Some things to be sure to take: 50+ single dollars for tipping, sunscreen, a hat, imodium, pepto bismol tablets, Tylenol, bug spray with deet. You don鈥檛 need to change any money into Dominican pesos. Everyone takes US $$. In tourist places along the way on the excursions, they do the exchanging right there. We have verizon cell phones, and they worked fine, but you will pay roaming fees. We left the maid a couple of dollars every day. Never saw her, so don鈥檛 know if it made a difference. We always had towels and what we needed. Now that I鈥檝e gone, I'm not sure if I鈥檇 go back. Ask me in a year!! Good weather would have made it more enjoyable, and my husband and I just aren鈥檛 lay in the sun and do nothing people! We like beer and wine, but really aren鈥檛 into the hard liquor. Reserving a chair and umbrella really wasn鈥檛 a problem for us, as we aren鈥檛 sun worshipers! We鈥檇 get our sun walking on the beach or just being outside. This particular trip, getting too much sun wasn鈥檛 a real problem! It was nice getting away and spending time together and seeing a different culture, and I highly recommend the Caribe Club Princess and TNT vacations. The Dominicans are a very friendly, happy people. They try very hard to deal with all the people and I was very impressed with them as a whole. Not speaking Spanish was somewhat of a barrier, but nothing serious. Someone who spoke English was usually nearby. Go, enjoy and have fun.  
<Date>Apr 11, 2006

<Author>kittycgirl
<Content>Beautiful Beach My husband and I and two other couples arrived at this resort April 2nd and stayed for one week. The check in counter was a bit busy. We waited in line for about ten minutes and then we were on our way to the room. The other two couples had great rooms, one of them had a suite. Our room was lacking. We had requested a king size, ocean view room. Our room had two queen beds and a view of the kiddie play area (opposite end of the ocean.)The room looked as though it had not been cleaned that day and could have used some basic maintenance. Luckily the next day we spoke with our Air Canada Vacations rep who was able to get us a new room that was much better with a view of the pool. The Good: The beach was absolutely beautiful. The sand was a soft white and the ocean was a refreshing turqoise blue. The hotel grounds were a joy to walk through. Lot's of beautiful plants, trees, and flowers. I loved all the critters walking around, frogs, peacocks, ducks, turtles, fish.The staff were very friendly and always willing to say hola! The So-So: The food at the buffet was pretty good there was usually something for everyone. We found that sometime's the food wasn't cooked all the way through so be careful. We ate at the Mexican restaurant twice and we all loved it. We ate at the Italian restaurant once and wished we stayed away. The service was very slow compared to the Mexican restaurant. The pasta was under-cooked and cold. I shared my meal with my husband. He had one bite of his risotto and refused to eat the rest. Three others ordered the lasagna and none of them got through half of it. The Bad: Houskeeping. We noticed a stain on two of the bed sheets. One sheet that covered the mattress and one that was used as a blanket. We figured that we would let it go and figured that we would have new sheets that evening after the maids cleaned the room. I was wrong. We returned to our newly cleaned room that evening and turned back the sheets. Both stains were still there in the same spot. We called the front desk to complain. They had a maid arrive ten minutes later with new sheets. After speaking to others at the resort we found out that the maids only make the bed and rinse out the shower when they clean the room. How long had those sheets been on the bed?? Who else had slept in them??Overall we found the Caribe Club a nice resort with just a few problems. The weather was hot and sunny the entire week and we able to have a great relaxing time! We will not return to the Caribe. We don't like to go to the same place twice but we would not recommend it to other either. There are better one's out there.  
<Date>Apr 11, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Can't wait to go back Very clean, awesome beach, wonderful food! We walked up and down the beach past the other resorts and soon realized that we had by far the best beach. It was cleaner and bigger than most. There were always people cleaning the pool, or sweeping the sidewalks, but they were never in your way. They do a great job of keeping kids occupied, because I never really knew that they were even there. The rooms were nice, roomy, and very clean. I have multiple food allergies and found an abundance of wonderful food to choose from. My picky husband even loved the food. Our favorite was the fresh made to order omelets every morning. The staff were very friendly, we got our pictures taken with several of them. The activity directors would let you know what activity was coming up, but if you didn't want to participate, they would leave you alone. There is no way to be bored here. We want to go back!  
<Date>Apr 10, 2006

<Author>asiaf
<Content>what a beautiful beach We just came back on april 7 from punta cana, staying at the Caribe club princess. There was 6 of us, 3 couples. We had a great time. The resort was really beautiful and the beach was by far the best I have seen, and we have been to alot of beaches. The food was good, the buffet was good, but the Italian rest. was the best. The service at the resort was excellent. We had nothing but friendlyness, smiles and good service. After reading some of the reports made at trip advisor, we were a little aprehensive about coming to punta cana. But the people were sooooo friendly and helpful. Yes the rooms we had were o.k. just basic, but some of the people had suites and they didn't pay any extra. I guess it was just how they fell. As far as people trying to get in your room, alot of people arrive in the middle of the night and it is hard to see the room numbers. They do not have any order to them. A couple of times people tried to come in our rooms, mistaken identy of rooms. Our rooms were directly across from the buffet and the rest. I think on the older side, but we loved the area we were in. We had sliders out so that we could all sit together and have drinks or what ever. We had absolutely no problem with any body as far as the language. A couple of us had some spanish, and if you try they love it. I have to say we did have to brush our teeth with bottled water which I found a little annoying. But they give you plenty of water. We did sometimes have to ask for towels, soap, water etc. but they always brought it right up. You have to remember where you are, it is not America. Thankfully none of us got sick, but we did hear of people getting sick, whether they brought it with them or not I don't know. One women that stayed at the Bavaro Princess said she used the tap for brushing her teeth and did not get sick. That would be my only concern especially with children. Would we go back, I really don't know. The beach was astonishingly beautiful, long and wide and tropical. We did have a day of rain, and it rained mostly every night. We had fun, sort of a crash vacation. The casino was a ways away but they had little shuttles to take us there and back. The people are really friendly and pleasant.  
<Date>Apr 9, 2006

<Author>islandlover23
<Content>P-A-R-A-D-I-S-E My husband and I haven't had a vacation alone since our honeymoon eight years ago---and that was only to a resort here in the U.S. This was our very first experience traveling out of the country. Needless to say we were nervous about everything from customs to ending up in a cruddy place. The whole customs thing in and out of U.S and Dominican Republic was a breeze and the place we stayed---FABULOUS!We went through Apple Vacations which was the best thing ever and I will always use them from now on and highly recommend it!! We arrived in the DR and were directed right where to go by an Apple Rep. The bus ride to the hotel was about 30 minutes on a large air conditioned bus. When we arrived at the Caribe Club Princess our mouths dropped open. It was absolutely beautiful. We arrived at 10 AM, too early to check-in, but no worries, we packed our beach stuff in our carry on so we changed and hit the beach. The beach was unbelieveable! Cute little huts and chairs lined the beach on the gorgeous water! (We are frequent Jersy Shore visitors--this was no Atlantic Ocean)We never had a problem getting a chair on the beach. When it was time to check-in we did so, upgraded to VIP, then hit the pool--the pool bar was just too convenient and cool. **VIP package: beware if you are only staying a few days as we did. In only 3 days we did not have enough time to fully appreciate the VIP perks. You get a dinner at one of the not included restauants--but we skipped it b/c the menu was a little too fancy for me. 2 motorized sports--the time we booked for that it rained.A 20 min massage--a definate MUST!! and premium alcohol--if you are a beer drinker you must go VIP. El Presidente-the local beer--is not very good but with VIP you can get Miller, Corona--whatever!The shows each night were amateur at best but still entertaining! My husband was in the Mr Caribe Prince contest on the last night--what a riot!! After the show the lobby turns into a mini disco until midnight!! Plenty of fun and dancing but still ending early enough to get a good rest. They also have a real disco on the grounds open from 11p-5a, we tried it once and felt very out of place--we didnt intend to stay up that late anyway!!Horseback riding on the beach is also a must. The hotel and apple do not endorse it b/c some ranches use very skinny, sickly horses that are upsetting to Americans. Rais Ranch approached us at the hotel and we signed up anyway ($80). The horses were smaller than your average American raised horse but very heatlhy and strong. Riding on the beach, along the water was amazing! I never rode before and was a little afraid to go too fast, but my husband wasn't and it was up to us how fast we wanted to go!! We got a bottle of rum with our picture on the horses as the label, along with a CD of Dominican music.($25)We also took the snorkeling excursion($140). We snorkled right along sharks and rays!! I was expecting little sharkfish or something and was totally terrified when I actually came face-to-face with an 18 foot long nurse shark!! They stay along the bottom while you float on top but those suckers were huge and I totally flipped the first time i saw them but eventually calmed down! After a 1/2 hour of snorkeling we got back on the boat, had a little lunch, and then went out to a natural swimming pool about a 1/2 mile off shore. It was only 4-5 foot deep and we just jumped right off the boat into it. While we enjoyed this magnificent swimming area, a man came around with a floating tray of drinks!! Rum and the caribbean--a perfect match!! After the swim it was meringue time on the boat! It was like a big party and the most fun we had on the whole trip!! If you go Apple you must take this excursion!! The food at the buffet was what you would expect of a buffet. A little bit of everything--nothing amazing but it was ok and you could just show up whenever which was nice! The italian restaurant was really nice.The service we received from every member of the staff from house keeping to gardener to front desk and bartenders was incredible! They totally bend over backwards to say hello and do anything they can to make you happy.The amount of American tourists was the minority and we found it hard to find anyone to actually chit-chat with but that wasn't why we went there anyway. All activities, shows, tours, instructions everything was done in spanish, french,english and dutch! We were the minority but never left out!!All in all our vacation was almost too good to be true! It was over too fast but we will never forget it! **we did use disposable cameras and did not come away with many good photos I would recommend using your own good camera--but we were too afraid of losing or damaging it.If I could have hugged every person at that hotel including the awesome Apple people I would have! It could have turned out to be the worst vaca. ever since it was our first and we planned it alone but it was the exact opposite!!TOTAL relaxation, beauty, paradise, and fun, fun, fun!**I did miss my kids and talked to some moms who had brought theirs--apparantely they have an awesome kids club so next year we intend to go again with the kids!!This hotel is a must stay!!Don't forget--don't dirnk the water, even when you brush your teeth--this is how you don't get sick!!  
<Date>Mar 28, 2006

3	247(min):1	730(massage):1	6739(definate):1	

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>More than I expected Like the rest of you I base some of my pre-booking research on the reviews found on this and other sites - what we've realized over the years is that the same week can yield remarkably different reviews. After being at this resort (March 16-23)I recommend taking extreme reviews with a 'grain of salt'. Because we travel with chidren I'm picky about the basics, ie.food  cleanliness, both of which I found to be very good at this resort. Check in was pretty fast, but half way through I had to remind them we had the VIP package. Quickly changed our wrist bands and provided the safe key etc. Rum, cigars and vouchers for massage etc came next day.Block 34 is where you want to be. I think we got the best room in the resort 2315 - which is a corner suite with 2 balconies one facing pool and a second with an ocean view. Large and clean no complaints. Maid service twice a day, at night, she would change our bathroom towels, provide 4 beach towels, turn down beds and even leave a chocolate. We tipped her both times and she couldn't do enough always asking if we wanted anything more.FOODFood was very good, breakfast was the only routine (but how many different things can you have?) Eggs (every way),pancakes,french toast and a crepe station too. Even peanut butter and Maple Syrup - firsts for me in the Caribbean. Based on past experience ala cartes never seem to live up - but these sure did. Had our VIP dinner at El Pescador. Awesome,never thought I would say that I can't eat another bite of lobster but I swear mine was a good 2lbs. The Mexican restaurant again, I was leary about,not too famliar with Mexican and remember I have picky little kids - again I was impressed with not only the food but the amazing presentation. Same with Mamma Mia's kids loved their Pizza and I enjoyed my Lasagna (ok it's not my moms but it was good). Wine both red and white were light and very drinkable. Rest of the nights we ate at the buffet (try to go after 8pm less crowded)I was shaking my head wondering how posted reviews about bad food could actually be talking about the same place? Just some of the things we ate - roast lamb,turkey,pork, shrimp,freshly made ceasar salad, raw oyster bar, seafood and rice, every kind of cheese, prociutto, pasta bar, mussles, calamari etc etc ENTERTAINMENTBecause we had late dinners we never made it to the 8:30 mini disco at the theater, and because we had kids, waiting until 9:45pm for the show to start was also not an option so no comment here. The lobby is where to be after dinner, only open bar at night. Nice in that its far enough from rooms (good 15 min walk or you can take the trolley)so you are not disturbed if you want to sleep. Great for an end of day cappuccino and sambuca. INTERNET I only saw it working 1 night and it crashed half way through my email so I never did get to use the 2 free VIP hours.MINI CLUB - Mostly young children ie under 5, my 4 year old daughter went one day. Although they keep them busy, because none of the kids spoke english she felt a little left out and didn't want to go back. MINI GOLF big hit with my son who had to play everyday. Overll you could do as much as you wanted always something going on dance lessons, volley ball, aerobics,archery,lawn bolwling etc.BEACH - beautiful, sandy (no water shoes needed). Water was a bit too wavy for the kids to go to far, my son enjoyed using the boogie boards to 'surf'.POOL - 3 to choose from so I was happy to be able to avoid the one with the pool bar which I'm personally not fond of for hygiene reasons ('nuff said). Pool with fountains and bridge our favourite, could even park your lounger on a ledge inside the pool.DOCTOR: My otherwise healthy daughter had croup the first night we arrived. I remembered seeing the Dr's office on our way in. Dr available 24/7. Dr Karina checked her out and gave her some cough syrups etc. Wanted to see her next day to follow up. She was fine rest of the time.None of us got DR (the domenican rumble!) My daughter (and a few other kids) did get sick after the bumpy bus ride back to the airport, so if you get car sick you may want to pop a gravol (or bring a bag).OVERALL - We had a great trip, wish we could have stayed another week. I would highly recommend this resort for families with young kids.  
<Date>Mar 26, 2006

13	2(night):1	8(day):1	46(free):1	60(hour):1	73(etc):1	97(internet):1	283(half):1	730(massage):1	1084(rum):1	1555(vip):1	1750(voucher):1	1834(cigar):1	2192(crash):1	

<Author>gottagetaway
<Content>Good Last Minute Holiday Caribe Club Princess / Tropical Princess We travelled to Punta Cana March 11 to 18th 2006 for the Ontario March Break and stayed at the Tropical Princess / Caribe Club Princess. We are 3 adults in their 30s with much travel experience in the Caribbean and with all inclusive resorts. Keep in mind we booked this holiday 3 weeks prior to departure so there was not much to choose from. We were a little concerned that there was so little reviews on the Tropical Princess but upon arrival we discovered why. The Tropical Princess / Caribe Club Princess are the same complex that share same facilities. The only difference in the 2 鈥渉otels鈥?is the type of room you receive and where it is in the complex. So if you are looking for Tropical reviews, read also the Caribe Club reviews. Furthermore the Punta Cana Princess is in the same complex, a 2 minute walk away. They have their own restaurants but shared in our trolley service, spa, etc. ( a side note I visited the Punta Cana Princess on walks daily and once at night and it is far more quiet, sedate, and smaller than the Tropical and Carib) Our flight to Punta Cana was uneventful. The drive to the hotel was an hour despite the guides saying 20 min. from airport as they stopped at 5 hotels before ours.The lobby at the Tropical/Carib is nice. The interesting concept of this resort is the lobby/nightly entertainment/disco/shops/internet/guide tours/theatre are nowhere near the rooms. In fact you have to take a trolley from the above places or walk about 7 minutes to the complex where the room buildings/restaurants/pools are. This has pros and cons. On the one hand the area between the two areas is beautifully manicured/gardened almost with a 鈥榬ainforest鈥?theme which makes for a wonderful stroll. However there are times when you need to be at the above places i.e. lobby to complain or pick up things or when it is raining that the distance is a pain. Further the trolley is on Dominican time and there are times when the wait is much longer than the 15 min. they promise. If you book at the Tropical 鈥?pay for the VIP program once you arrive. Don鈥檛 give your North American travel agent the extra commission. We bought it in the lobby upon arrival and do not regret it all! It goes into effect the next day after arrival. You get the items listed: 1 bottle rum, cigars, bathrobes, night turn down service, premium liquor (Absolut/Bacardi) 1 hour internet service, but most importantly you get a free dinner at La Cava and a free 25 minute massage in the spa!!! Well worth the $90 we spent. All the restaurants are included except La Cava and El S鈥?La Cava is $25 per person for Carib Club and $50 per person for Tropical guests. With the VIP bracelet, you get there for free and the lobster and steak dinner was definitely worth it! Further we all used the spa 2 more times after our free massage as it was at par with most North American spas. Prices were reasonable. Food: For the most part, the dinners at the specialty restaurants are good. We ate at all of them and were impressed with presentation and choices. Service was slow at most of them but what can you expect? The buffet restaurant was frustrating at breakfast and lunch. You can鈥檛 get your own pop/water/coffee so have to constantly be flagging down waiters even though the machines are accessible. Further they usually only have 1 cook for most popular items: omelets, crepes, meat, pasta etc. which generated lineups making most food warm or even cold by time you reach your table. We felt the food at the buffet was mediocre at best when compared to other resorts in Dominican and elsewhere. Where was the fresh orange juice? It was concentrated. Rooms: On arrival our door lock was broken and we refused to stay in room until it was fixed. Looked like a forced entry had been done. It was around 10:45 p.m. We got the 鈥渄on鈥檛 worry, no problem鈥?line that they would take care of it tomorrow. No way. Not with reports of thefts etc. on previous reviews plus our concerns for our own security. We had also requested a room not on the first floor which it was. Since it was Sat. night there were no other rooms available so we couldn鈥檛 leave our room for drinks etc. and had room service. They did temporarily fix it by 1:30 a.m. and promised us a new room on 2nd floor next day. This did happen by 3:00 p.m. next day and we were happy with our new room. Most rooms in the Tropical are Suites 鈥?2 rooms and 2 bathrooms. Perfect for stretching out. Our maid service was not the greatest at all despite leaving many gifts and cash but didn鈥檛 feel like complaining about it as yes, you are rarely in room anyway. Resort: We have been to countless resorts in Caribbean so have much to compare to. We swear people at this resort stayed up all night or get up at 5:00 to reserve beach chairs. This was very frustrating as we are sun-worshippers and were on the beach by 7:30 every single day and never once got seats that we wanted but further back under huts. We know pools were easier but we are not pool people. These resorts need to get more chairs to met demand, it baffles me that this is an issue at most resorts despite people complaining. There were constant chair stealers we saw and battles. Its not worth it. Invest in as many chairs as you have guests. Logic? A majority of the guests were French from France. They had their own French entertainment staff that combined with the Dominican staff who were generally Spanish only with some French and little English made interactions with the English speaking guests fairly limited. We were blatantly ignored most of the time when they were scouring the beach / pool for people for activities. It was only on the 3rd day when we realized that the guests had different wristband colours. All guests who were French had blue so staff would know the French. VIP was orange and everybody else was grey. Interesting dynamics to watch. Overall: We did not have one daylight hour of rain and clouds were minimal so how can one complain too much about a holiday? We knew going in that this was a last minute holiday at a 4* resort in Dominican. So with the exception of the broken door, mediocre food at lunch, and generally being ignored by the staff, we had a great holiday with good times in our group and the people we met. Would we go back? Almost definitely not, but that is because we never return to the same resort as we like new experiences in new places. Would we recommend Tropical/Carib? With some reservations of what to expect, to definitely buy the VIP plan, and to request a Carib room or a Tropical suite.Beach itself is beautiful and you can鈥檛 go wrong with that.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Honeymoon! We loved it!To be honest, we both got a bit scared after reading so many negative reviews, but we had a great time!The hotel was in great shape, the room was huge and clean.I will review everything as I remember...Food:The food was good!We had an option of different restaurants for dinner each night(chinese, mexican, italian, dominican)*Reservations did have to be made, but was not a problem and restuarants were not fullthe buffets has a great selection, and different items every day.Beach  Pools:The water was beautiful, it was very windy while we were there. There were lots of topless european women and the beaches were also fairly crowded so that was a negative.Overall I would probably go back, I live on the west coast and Hawaii is alot better price wise, but I wouldnt mind paying another visit to punta cana**the staff speaks very limited english, my wife spoke spanish which was a life saver!do your best to brush up on your spanish and it will make your trip 1000 times better!!! we wouldnt of recieved half the favors we did if she didnt speak spanish!oh yeah, they gave us a free upgrade too becuase they had a mix up with some of the paper work-Phil

<Author>ziacd
<Content>Not the vacation we were expecting! We actually booked and paid for a vacation to the Iberostar in Puerto Plata, but upon arrival at the airport we found out that TNT Vacations had cancelled our entire trip! After a day of phone calls, we were rebooked to this All-inclusive in Punta Cana-it was all that was still available and we soon found out why.So this resort is a four-star. Yes it is clean, but it seemed to be quite small compared to other resorts. We were at least upgraded to VIP, but it doesn't seem to be worth paying for. The free rum we were entitled to was not given to us until the last day (and we asked EVERY day).The food was ok. There is one main buffet (which gets crowded by 7 at dinner time) and 6 restaurants, plus 2 which you must pay for, except if you are VIP. The Dominican, Brazilian, Mexican and Seafood restaurants were quite good. There are lunch buffets by the beach at the Seafood and Brazilian restaurants, so you can take the food to your chair. My favorite dishes were the fish and fried chicken by far. None of us got sick, including our 20 month old, and we ate everything except salads.The beach is of course beautiful, and there are activities going on ALL day. It is quite a walk down to the shops, but the walk is a nice diversion. There are 3 pools, one with a sunken bar. The pool was a little chilly, so we stuck to the beach.Rooms - nice enough. Full tubs in the bathroom. VIPs get a separate seating area with pull-out sofa bed. Our room had a slight ocean view.Staff- couldn't have been nicer. They were so wonderful to our son. Aside from a couple of buffet waitpersons, we received incredible service and attention. We tipped our first waitress at breakfast, and she always went to get the highchair as soon as we walked in and got the drinks we preferred without asking (Ana is her name). So all-in-all, this resort is nice, but when you have stayed at a resort like Iberostar or nicer, you have higher expectations which this resort doesn't meet. If you have never been to an all-inclusive, I think you would be quite satisfied here. It's not the worst choice, but there are nicer places to stay. We are still waiting for TNT to rectify the situation, and so far they have only offered $150 in vouchers for the inconvenience. Not good enough when you realize you have paid for a trip that you never would have chosen to book in the first place!We also went to Manati Park, which is NOT worth it, unless you have never been to a zoo or aquarium, or if you have young children, like us, who would enjoy it anyway.  
<Date>Mar 18, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>my opinion of the Caribe Club Princess We arrived on a Monday, March 6,2006, weather was great. Staff friendly and personable.Our rooms were clean, nice and a beautiful view of the ocean. Food was good at the buffet, (I'm picky)but there was so many things to choose from for a picky eater as well as one who likes everything. Only complaint is the coffee, my goodness is it strong. They should cut back a little, and then they wouldn't need so much milk and it would stay hot longer. Would take the buffet over the ala carte restaurants anytime. The ala carte restaurants were ok, nothing to rave about. Had the vip package which was wonderful, the 20 min. massage was very nice. There was enough activity for everyone from just doing nothing to playing bocci ball. Language a small problem, but if you asked for English, they would find someone that could speak it and bring them to you or have them come to the telephone. Only other small issue was wash cloths, hard to get from staff. If I were to go again, I would take some wash cloths with me or someone said if you tipped them everyday, you would get washcloths. All in all we had a very good experience and would definetly stay at the Caribe Princess again. Ellen Brawdy, Finleyville, Pennsylvania  
<Date>Mar 16, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Brutally Awful!! I am not one to complain but this resort was the worst one I have ever stayed in. Both my husband and I got sick from the very first day. I have read all the reviews and can only say that the poor reviews say it all. It's exactly how we experienced this resort. It was awful and I feared for my health. We got back early yesterday and we are still suffering from diarrhea and have been to the doctors this morning.We ate at the hotel main restaurant on Sunday for breakfast and lunch - the choice was fairly limited to what we have experienced at other vacation resorts. The food was bland and all tasted the same and was not very appertizing. I started vomiting in the afternoon. On Sunday evening we both ate at the Italian restaurant. Afterwards we both felt ill and retired to our room - my husband started with diarrhea that evening and it continued thoughout the night. I started with it in the early hours of Monday morning. We both lay in our room for most of the day - feeling terrible. We did not eat anything that day but went down on Tuesday morning for breakfast hoping to get some cereal and toast, both of which were awful, the line for toast was quite long, I wonder why ?? On Tuesday evening we went to the Dominican Restaurant but had to walk out before the meal was served as we both felt sick. By Wednesday we were both suffering continually from diarhea and had sworn that we would not eat anything more from that main restaurant. We made a trip to the store and bought chips to eat as we knew they were made in USA and would be safe! I asked for orange juice at one of the bars and got a glass of lukewarm water with orange food colouring in it! None of the drinks were cold except that the beer was a little colder - iced water just never seemed available - we survived the week on warm bottled water, Imodium, Gravol and Heineken (we knew that this was safe to drink, even though our stomachs told us that beer wasn't the best thing to drink in our condition!) Thursday was one of the best days for me - I had not eaten at all and felt very weak but at least I did not have diarrhea that day. My husband still continued with it though. Thursday I managed to eat a small amount of mashed potato at the Italian Restaurant - my husband took one look of his dinner and left. On Friday I was so ill I did not leave the room - I won't bore you with the details - it would make you sick! We managed to survive on Saturday with a bag of chips and bottled water on the beach (we had a late flight) - we refused to eat anything more from that hotel! While we were waiting for the bus to return to the airport we discovered that others on the trip had experienced the same kind of problems. I would not advise anyone to go to this hotel. It would have been a great holiday had it not been for the food - the beach was lovely and the room had a lovely view and was mainly clean - I found most of the staff fairly unexcited about their jobs and really felt that if we asked for something (like a knife and fork to eat with!!!) that we were asking for the world from them! I was really glad to get back home.  
<Date>Mar 13, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutely beautiful!! Stayed at the resort from Jan.29-Feb.5, 2006.We went to the resort for our honeymoon, and reading some of the reviews, it made us sceptical of where we were going. I dont know what people were complaining about, because we had absolutely NO problems with ANYTHING there! We went to the steak house (La Cava) and it was great! The presentation was awesome and you get large portion meals there. Only I would recommend eating INSIDE the restaurant, instead of eating outside...I got bitten by some flies/bugs out there (about 30 bites on my legs, which were VERY itchy). We also tried the Mexican and Italian restaurants. My husband and I both didnt much care for the Italian food, however many others seemed to enjoy it. Our favorite was the Mexican restaurant, in fact we ended up going there twice during our stay!! The buffet was quite well...we really enjoyed the omlettes in the mornings!! There was a LARGE variety of foods to choose from at the buffet and they all had good flavor.I would HIGHLY recommend getting the VIP package....its worth the few extra bucks! With this you recieve a VERY relaxing massasge, premium brand drinks, and lots of other little extras. However, you have to mention to the bartenders that you are VIP and tell them that you want 'Brugal' rum (the better rum), and the more expensive vodka...otherwise they might mistake you for NOT being VIP and not receiving the better alcohol.Our room service from our maids was great, but it also helps if you tip them. We had brought them alot of gifts from home (ex. shampoos, soaps, books, paper, pens, clothes...) We have no complaints about our room AT ALL!!! It was amazing, LARGE bathroom, and a sunk-in living room....it had everything we needed.We spent half of our stay sun-tanning on the beach, and NEVER had trouble finding a hut or chairs to sit on...dont know what other guests were complaing that they couldnt find a place to sit by the beach. The other half of the time we tanned by the pool (the one with the swim up bar). There we had to wake up a bit earlier to find chairs to sit on. The sun seemed hotter by the pool, but then again you dont have the ocean breeze blowing and cooling you down....which was nice, because we both got bad wind/sun burns sitting by the beach one afternoon. The main bars that we went to were the swim-up bar during the day and the lobby bar during the evening. The lobby bar is quite beautiful and relaxing. We had booked a tour with Turinter (Air Canada affiliated) for the Sanoa Island tour, however that morning the bus that was suppose to pick us up, along with 8 others from our resort, accidentaly missed our resort and left without us all. It was no problem at all dealing with them about this issue. They were more than willing to either re-book us, or return our money back IN FULL. We decided not to re-book seeing it was one of our last days there, and heard from others that went on the tour that it actually wasnt worth the $80 american/person. They didnt have entertainment on the boat ride at all and never saw ANY fish on their whole tour. Overall, my husband and I would definately recommend the resort though. It was absolutely gorgeous and the staff there was amazing. We did ALOT of walking along the beach everyday there, and thought that our resort had the best part of the beach BY FAR!! It was clean and had the most huts and chairs!We would definately go back, and to those of you who are going you'll have a blast!!  
<Date>Mar 7, 2006

<Author>livefromcanada
<Content>Look for another hotel I read the reviews and believed that you alone can make or break a vacation. I went with an opened mind, and was sadly disappointed. Even the little things I wanted to overlook kept accumulating. I was glad to leave.Hotel: beautiful grounds, but many unsafe spots, potholes, loose tiling, mats that trip, cords, etc. Food:-buffet was the same every morning, lunch and night-tables weren't cleaned fast enough, dirty things left for awhile-forget about getting a good hot cup of coffee, just dream about Tim Hortons-my husband and I both got sick and another woman we spoke to had food poisoning (this was just eating at the hotel)-a-la-carts were easy to book and they were okayRooms:-we upgraded to a suite, which as nothing special- a little run down, but okay-cleaning service was horrible! I only had my room cleaned once before 2pm, the rest of the time they cleaned the room by 5-6:30pm (forget about relaxing before dinner)-Maids just enter the rooms whenever they wanted, they would knock 2 times quickly and open. I started putting the safety lock on whenever in the room-towels were stiff and they didn't give you enough, had to go look for a maid for more towels, water or soap- drain was very slow, but it was nice that shower had a hand-held faucet, great for childrenVIP Package (good idea to get this):-24 hr room service-premium drinks (Heinekens, but some bars ran out)- 1hr motorized water sport (banana boat, or speed boat tour of Bavaro beach, etc)- La Cava or another seafood restaurant (seafood restaurant was under renovation)-charge for the TV remote and safety lock key, unless you upgrade to VIP- Swedish massage Pool:- hard to get a chair, everyone reserved their chairs early morning-cold water-Main pool was loud with the entertainment crew, and it did get a little annoying, but you can always go to the other poolsOcean/Beach:To die for, very beautiful...good luck getting a chair!-beach towels in short supply, ran out of clean towels several times and had to come back-Very crowded, people everywhere-many European women were topless, got used to it in the endStaff:THIS IS WHAT MADE THE WHOLE EXPERIENCE HORRIBLE:-At times had difficulty getting what you wanted due to the language barrier, but to be expected when travelling to the Dominican Republic. What I didn't expect was that 75% of hotel staff went out of their way to help make your stay pleasant, while others really didn't care-Front desk staff I found rude, and sorry to say...lazy. Some came across like it was an inconvenience to help you, or just wouldn't give you the right information-We had an experience that I will not publish, but it was horrible and I felt we were treated unfairly and unjustly....We were threatened by the hotel manager and was told we could not check out with our two small children unless they got their way...meaning they wanted $$$$. Don't make your Dominican experience a bad one, don't go here, look elsewhere. FIRST TIME AND LAST IN PUNTA CANA  
<Date>Mar 5, 2006

<Author>lite&lively
<Content>Not Impressed Well having stayed at a few very nice AI's I will say CCP is not top of my list and won't be returning.First the good news. The beach is to die for. Soft white sandy running for ever. Busy but nothing you can't handle, always an open area availble. Our VIP suite was as close to the beach as I have ever been...perfect?? Yes but we had big problems with the room inside. I needed a knife and fork to open the patio door everytime. The knife to slit it open as the lock was broken, then the fork to pry it the rest of the way. Our TV buzzed a horrid noise constantly and our coffee maker would only stay on for 10 seconds then shut off. We had requested 2 double beds but got a king. No problem they would switch the bed........a small single mattress, looked like it had been used for toilet training. arrived and was place in the middle of our sitting area, defeating the porpuse of having a suite. Just take it away and we will sleep in the king. The mattress remained up against our wall all week. Every time we called they just rushed us off the phone and said ok we come. We had no problems with the air or the hot water both worked great.My biggest problem of the week by far was the food. The buffet is just horrid. I am not picky but I really stuggled to find an item or two that looked or tasted nice. We ate at La Cava 3 times and found it wonderful...everytime. The chicken at the beach was also very good. The other issue I had with the buffet was that the tables were not cleaned, plates were removed but no clean place mats were set out, if you were not first at a table you were eating with someone elses mess left.The grounds are lovely, well maintained and worth a trip on the bus to see them all.The pool was cooler than the ocean but very nice.We had a lovely vacation, enjoyed ourselves but having just returned from Puerto Plata in January found the CCP just not up to scratch. As for the VIP package we had, well lets just say we did save the price of atleast one meal at La Cava but other than that was nothing special.  
<Date>Feb 25, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Second Honeymoon!! My husband and I just returned from a 5 day, 4 night vacation to Caribe Club in the Dominican Republic. We decided at the last minute to take a vacation (first time without kids) and we a little nervous about flying out of the country. Left Philadlephia airport the day a blizzard was to hit and arrived in 85 degree weather!! Beautiful! The airport at Punta Cana was very easy to maneuver through. Filling out tourist cards was easy (they just want your $10). The ride to the resort was interesting watching and seeing all the countryside. When we arrived at our resort, the front desk people were wonderful. They told us we had the best room in the place (yeah, right we thought, they tell that to everyone), actually we did, the honeymoon suite!!! Complete with a loft and sunken tub. Room was clean, organized and very, very nice. Our maid service was very good. We tipped every day and it paid off, we had fresh towels every day and room was picked up before late morning every day. At night the bed was turned down and chocolates on our pillows. One night we needed washcloths. After tracking the maid down she didn't understand but we wrote down what we needed and were taken care of immediately. The food was great! We didn't try any of the other restaurants. Ate at the buffet every day, which satisfied us completely. Beach restaurant wasn't the greatest. My husband ordered hamburgers twice and each time they weren't cooked long enough. We tried to make them understand, but didn't get through. The beach is beautiful, got a little crowded at the beginning of the week, but other than that was beautiful. Have to be up early to reserve a chair or a shade booth, but was worth it. The beach vendors were great! We caught onto the bartering and was pleased with our purchases and the prices. Nightly entertainment was pretty good, not professional but nice. Drinks were great, Coco Locos were the best!Would definitely return again, maybe bring kids the next time (or maybe not!) No complaints whatsoever.  
<Date>Feb 24, 2006

<Author>NHTraveler
<Content>Caribe Club Princess - loved it I have never written a reveiw before, so please bear with me. Just spent a week as a VIP at the CCP - what can I say awesome had a great time.Dinning/Food - was okay. Went to each of the restaurants for dinner. Mexican was the best. La Cava food wise was better than great, but the wait was way too long. It was my b-day when I ate there and a cake was delivered and the staff sang happy b-day - very memorableRoom - had a suite that over looked the VIP pool and had a side view of the beach. The view was great. Spent many a morn w/ coffee on my 3rd floor balcony; very relaxing.Entertainment - from what I hear was great. I entered a couple of dart tournaments and was a spectator for the rest of the activities. I did not make it to one of the nightly shows. Though I heard they were great as well. I could hear the shows and see glimpses of them while at the Lobby bar area.Beach - the water was gorgeous. The beach bar was great; service was great.Pool - the water was quite cold, but towards the end of the week it warmed up considerably and I then enjoyed a couple of beers at the pool bar.Lobby bar was very nice. Went there to hang out each night. Casino - fabulous. Quiet and clean. I went there at about 10pm and stayed until close 545am and took the train back. I was alone and felt quite safe. Shopping on the resort - only needed to p/u a pair of sunglasses and they were $11 - not a bad price at all.I did not tip the bartenders and was treated very well. No complaints. That could be because I had the VIP braclet, but we'll never know.Room service was great - my husband had pizza and beer delivered nightly. I ordered coffee in the early evening.Language barrier - not many of the employees speak english and I don't speak another language - I could, for the most part, understand. however, my husband could not understand them.I would definitely recommend this hotel and advise you to upgrade to VIP the extras you get are well worth it; massages (20 minute swedish upper body), bottled premium beer and premium alcohol, et al., 1 hour each of motorized water sports (did not use it though), 1 hour each of free internet service which I waited too long to use. Was booked up by the time I went to log on...

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A very good resort I just came back from a one week vacation at the Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana. It is a sure value. The beach is gorgeous, the complex is just big enough, the pools are clean and beautiful, staff is friendly and always eager to give you good service. The Caribe is on the same complex as the Tropical Princess so you get to enjoy the infrastructure of two hotels. There are three pools, 7 (if I remember correctly) 脿 la carte restaurants, a big buffet restaurant, a long beach etc. Food was very good, even at the buffet. There was a wide selection of food. We didn't enjoy the El Pilon, a dominican 脿 la carte restaurant but it's just a matter of our taste. The rooms were ok. A little too much of little ants and we had the surprise to discover what seemed to be a big cockroach in our bathroom. It seemed it had crawled through the bathroom drain. A stinky smell was always present at the entrance of the building. Don't know where it came from but it was gross. So all in all, it was a great resort apart from these little problems. Grounds were beautiful, beach is more than fabulous, staff was great, pools were excellent, food was very good. Go take a drink at the pool bar and talk with Francisco, he's a real great guy.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Pretty good I was satisfied with my vacation in Caribe Club. Beach was beautiful, weather was pleasant, grounds are well maintained, there was plenty of food. If you are too picky probably you will find lots of problems - life is slow there, nobody is in a hurry. If you want to sit on the table and have your coffee/beer immediately give them 5 bucks in the beginning and then 2 after each meal and they'll run like crazy but it's unnecessary expence for me. The locals don't know a lot of English but it's even funnier to try to explain them something and my English is not perfect too so I don't care.We had VIP package and I was happy about that. There's a good kids club and they take care of the children, the only problem was that not a lot of the other kids spoke English.Lots of activities - archery, darts, tennis, volleyball, dancing so if you are there for 1 week you can stay at the resort, if you are there for 2 weeks you can go for some trip.They cleaned the rooms 3 times per day, water was hot from the shower and I had no problems with my stomach - I drank mamajuana and beer so you have to be concerned only if you drink 10 cocktails per day. Thats the answer to the main concerns of the others.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The truth from a vertern May I start by saying the my wife and myself have been to Punta Cana a half a dozen different times. We find good in everything and hate to read reviews from people that you sense would not be happy with anything. With that said, here we go. Five years ago we traveled to the same location by the name of Hodelpa Caribe. The Beaches and the water are the best in the world. Service then was excellent and made us come back for more. Three years ago the Caribe Club Princess took over and all has changed. The Beach and the ocean are the same, but that is where everything changes. There are a few people that go out of thier way to see that you are enjoying yourself. Yet unfortunately a large number of our hosts made you feel that you were bothering them for any request from the smallest to the lack of hot water. We go to the DR because of the cultural differnces, not to be slighted and looked down on. We will continue to travel to the DR hopefully for years to come. If you have reservations, cancel them. If you are debating this hotel, run for your life!  
<Date>Jan 24, 2006

<Author>canuckgoesplaces
<Content>Looks Are Deceiving... In terms of all-inclusive resorts, this was - on the surface - as fine as any I've been to -- decent rooms, decent (though repetitive) food, great staff, nice beaches, etc.My main problem here was that I contracted cryptosporidium - most likely from the swimming pool water, back in May '05. For those who don't know, crypto is a water-borne parasite much like giardia, with many of the same symptoms. Unlike giardia, there's nothing you can take to get rid of it, you just have to let it work through your system. Most people suffer for two weeks, but some - like me - suffer longer (I really didn't kick it until 3 months after the trip). Chlorine doesn't kill it, which is why pool water is such an easy infection route. I can't say for sure I got it that way (you can also catch it through food, etc.), but my traveling companion didn't get sick, and she ate/drank all the same stuff I did. But she didn't swim.The resort wasn't dirty at all - I actually had a great time until I fell ill, and found the staff friendly and very hospitable. However - and this probably goes for all resorts in developing nations - just be extra careful with everything, including pool water.We also had a lot of rain while down there (May is the start of the rainy season) - and one night the water that was collecting outside of our room actually seeped in under the door by morning. No big deal, but I wouldn't want to be there in a tropical storm...  
<Date>Jan 8, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly Our family just returned from a one week all-inclusive vactation at the Caribe Club Princess Resort in Punta Cana. We spent the week with about 40 family and friends and overall everyone had an excellent holiday. I would definitely recommend the resort, especially for the price we paid ($1500 Canadian, taxes included) and I would not hesitate to return for that price. I do, however, recommend the VIP package for an additional weekly fee (at least for one person in the booking group) because it gives you access to 24 hour free room service and the food is definitely better ordered through room service than in the restuarants.The Good: beautiful grounds, unbelieveable weather, very comfortable rooms, beautiful beaches, lobby, and poolsThe Bad: the food, the drinks (except for the local rum and local beer), the limited number of staff that speak English (especially the front desk and the secrity staff)The Ugly: housekeeping staff stealing money, clothing, and personal items from guest rooms and Juan Carlos (who promises the world and delivers 'nada')

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>why you should stay here.. Let's face it, almost all 4+star level resorts who operate with a reputable tour company will meet a basic standard. This one fits within that range. Tour companies go through great lengths to ensure appropriate ratings. Any discrepancies are a matter of personal taste. That being said, none of these reviews will really make a difference to you and your vacation if you don't have the right attitude. (This is speaking from experience of going to various resorts in Santo Domingo, Varadero and Cancun)One exceptional thing about booking a vacation to Punta Cana in general is the PRICE. You can get this resort at a far lesser cost than a comparable resort in another city/country (which we managed to do last minute). Not only that, we had booked the Tropical Princess (sister resort) for a far lesser price, and got a complimentary UPGRADE to the Club Caribe Princess. (Tip: if you want an upgrade, be friendly to the front desk staff. it may take a couple visits, but you may have to build a rapport. you don't need to speak spanish to do it either -- i don't)If you're wondering what's the difference b/w all the Princess resorts, here's what I know. The Bavaro Princess sits entirely on it's own, in a separate location, however, the Punta Cana, Club Caribe and Tropical Princesses all occupy the same area (ordered from highest rating to lowest). If you stay at the PC, all rooms are deluxe suites, with a sunken living area; you get access to 10 a la carte (specialty) restaurants (dinner only, but how can you eat 10 dinners anyway?). At CC, you could be in a 'superior room' or suite ; with access to 5 a la cartes. At TC, standard room or family suite; access to 3 a la cartes.Important things to note... FOOD: like most people have said, the buffet food isn't great.. but reality is, you don't want to be pigging out all day anyway. the a la cartes are great. be sure to get up b/w 8am-8:30am to get the time you're interested in, otherwise risk getting a bad time, or not getting any reservation. BEACH: there were plenty of palapas and chairs to go around. even if we got out in the late morning or earlier afternoon, it wasn't impossible to find a spot, which is sooo amazing and surprising. the beach itself was beautiful!POOL: good quality if you're a 'pool' person.STAFF: for me, the staff was hit or miss, but i know this is just my subjective experience, so you may find it to be different. For example, the person who helped us at the front desk, and the animation team were incredibly friendly. Our cleaning lady and the beach bartender, not so much. But, they should not be what makes/breaks your experience anyway.ROOMS: everything worked. no complaints.ENTERTAINMENT: Everything is as expected as any other resort: animation team has several daily activies (ie, darts, water aerobics, ping pong, bocce ball, stretching, dance and spanish lessons, etc.), as well as nightly shows (worth watching if you've never seen them before). There's a disco at the front entrance of the resort, which we never got a chance to check out. Be aware of the night you want to go there because, if they have a 'featured performer' they may actually charge $20-30USD cover, while usually it's free. Finally, there's a free shuttle to the bavaro princess casino.BUGS: I brought bug spray, just in case, but after no signs of insects the first day I didn't bother. Beware, if you walk to the lobby from the resort you will pass 'natural gardens/groves' where bugs thrive (I learned this the hard way). Even if you don't notice them, if you're prone to getting bitten in Canada, during the summer, make sure you protect yourself. There are little gnats and mosquitos. I, of course came back with several bites from both bugs on my back, arms and neck. My partner (who is not prone to insect bites here) did not have one single bite.Last thoughts..wherever you stay, remember you're on vacation.. try not to dwell on the little things, and enjoy your time away.  
<Date>Dec 19, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Resort, Beach  My best friend and I went to Punta Cana to celebrate both of our 40th birthdays. We were very pleased with The Caribe Club Princess. The beach was breathtaking!!! Worth it just to lay on that stretch of white powder!!! The pools were also very, very nice. The rooms were decent and clean (and I'm picky!), but definitely not luxurious in anyway. I found the bed and pillows to be very comfortable! We thought the staff were wonderful, especially Robert at the front desk who on several occassions went out of his way to help us. The recreation employees at our pool who were trying to create a fun atmosphere for everyone were a bit loud and annoying after a few days, but the other pools had no activity and were very peaceful. The food was just OK. The Shaghay (Chinese/Japanese) restaurant was good and so was the Italian. The buffet was just ok, but at least there was an abundance of choices, so everyone should find a few things they'd like. The french fries were great! The last review I read on this site mentioned that the fruit was terrible. The fruit was the one thing my friend and I ate everyday, we found it awesome!! The atmosphere is very laid back, so don't expect service to be fast, that's just their way of life. We did swim with the dolphins at Manati Park, which was great! You're only in the pool with them for maybe 10 minutes, but it is unbelievable how these powerful creatures allowed us to pet them and honestly seemed to want to play with us. Well worth it!!!! The Outback Safari was fun too, a little long of a ride and the beach they took us to had a lot of trash on it, but worth doing to get a true feeling of Dominican life. My only true complaint at the resort was that there was no waiters/waitresses to bring me a drink as I soaked up the sun on the beach. I actually had to get up and walk about 50 feet to the bar!!!! We had a GREAT time and would definitely go back! Can't beat the price!GLLCleveland, Ohio  
<Date>Dec 15, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Amazing I will start by saying I am amazed by the comments I have just read before beginning to write this review. Did I stay in a different hotel to these people or what? As i travel agent, i have stayed in many hotels in my time  this tops the whole lot. Where do I start, I had originally booked into the Punta Cana Princess (same group of hotels but next door), however, when we arrived at the transfer coach, we had been moved to the Caribe Club Princess, which i wasnt too happy about until we arrived at the lobby/reception of the hotel, what a great move. We even had a ride over on the free shuttle bus to the other hotel  was actually pleased we'd been moved as this hotel was way too quiet for us. I'll begin by telling you about the staff, because overall, it was these people that made our holiday. The staff are fantastic, talk about go out of your way to make you feel welcome is an understatement. The whole animation team need a medal. I cannot believe that such young human beings can put on shows  activities EVERYDAY  EVERY EVENING to keep us entertained  to say multilingual... wow, half of the staff spoke better English than myself!! I read that somebody said the entertainment was the same thing every night... well i suggest when you go you see for yourself because this was far from true. Infact, I have never seen so many smoothly run  professional shows in all of my life  you can actually see the genuine enjoyment on these guys faces no matter how many times they've done the same one of the past year. As for the food, what a great choice. This is what i dreaded most about going to the Dom Republic as i'm not a great eater but what a buffet it was, I've never seen so much choice in all of my life, I have stayed in 5 star hotels  to say this was a 4 star, i couldn't believe it, a variety of different cooking stations where they make you omelettes, your own choice of spaghetti bolognase.. you name it, it was there  you could eat it. There are also a variety of speciality restaurants that you don't have to pay for... Mexican, Chinese, A la Carte, Italian, Tex Mex Steakhouse  many many more these were all great as well. Anyway, I better go because I could go on about this property all year. But please, please trust me when i say, you will not find a single fault with this property!! The Best Yet!! Oh  say a big Hola to Carlos  Rodolfo from us!! :D
