<Author>Nippersinker
<Content>Excellent choice! We (my parents, fiance and I) ended up at this resort after our trip was rerouted from Cozumel because of the hurricane. Other than a few slight details, we all loved the resort. The beach was beautiful, the three pools were great and the staff was wonderful. The rooms weren't anything spectacular (we didn't have a suite, or anything, but just a simple room) but were always clean and attended to. We ate at the buffet, Chinese, Mexican, Dominican and Brazilian restaurants, as well as the Crepeire for lunch. While sometimes the food wasn't amazing, there was always something we could find any enjoy. I believe we all throughly enjoyed the short walk from the pool/hotel room area to the lobby, as it was beautiful and peaceful with lots of foliage and birds, fish, and turtles to look at. For those who didn't want to walk or couldn't, a bus would take you back and forth. I agree with other postings that the drinks didn't always turn out right: sometimes we would get drinks with all alcohol, with no alcohol or just the wrong drinks. I recommend going with beer or Cuba Libres (rum and cokes) if you like either. They seemed to always get those right. While many of the staff didn't know too much English, I don't go to foreign countries expecting the locals to speak my language. The shopping area wasn't too far from the resort, and there were plenty of souvenirs to buy and two bar/restaurant areas if you wanted to get out of the all-inclusive for a while. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Punta Cana.  
<Date>Dec 11, 2005

<Author>seniortraveagent
<Content>What you see in the brochure is different from what you experience there We have purchased an all inclusive package at this particulr hotel which comes highly recommended by Air Canada Vacations. Upon arriving in the hotel the whole group had to wait 30-40 minutes as the 2 receptionists on duty were very busy talking to somebody else, instead of paying attention to the guests and start the check in.Rooms were not ready until 3PM, we got ours after many interventions, meanwhile my daughter who was sick and had temperature had to wait for the housekeeping to finish as well. Our room was right opposite the housekeeping headquarters, there was noise all the time, one afternoon I was trying to take a nap and the chambermaid came to make up the rooms at 4PM that was the usual time that my room would have been done and the head housekeeper came in the room (and with no respect for me whatsoever that was trying to rest), starting to shout and talk loud to the chambermaid, so I had to invite her politely to take her issues outside of my room.Kidsclub - my son went there 2 times, last time left his swimming trunk on the table in front of him on a supervised facility and they were gone.Food - in the main restauarant was terrible, I was getting sick only when I was seeing the same type of food and leftovers from lunch recooked and served for dinner or the next day.One day there was a barbecue grill, (which was delicious compared to the day to day food) and people were ready and eager to have a bite, only to discover that meat was kept outside with no ice or any other culinary precautions taken when you are cooking, hundreds of meat slices turning brown or black in the Carribean sun, have these people ever heard of ice packed coolers?I went on an early morning to make restaurant reservations for the other specialty restaurants and was told by the customer service that he can not find me a decent restaurant seat as he is only a hotel employee, to which I told him that people like me fill this hotel and other the same and that the hotel will stay in business, if we as Travel agents will advise that this is a property well worth while (obviuosly not).Towards the end being pretty fed up with lack of services got my Travel Agent card out and solicited a meeting with the General Manager in regards to this particular resort and advised him about the way the hotel is ran. We couldn't wait for the week to finish and get back to Canada. There was a total lack of services at this property, people waiting to be tipped when the property is all inclusive with gratuities and taxes and tips included.My son was sick upon returning to Canada for 1 week with fever and Salmonela aquired while there and so was I.The beach was nice, the room decorations were very artistic and the weather was decent, however I had my worst vacation in the last 20 years.I have advised the Manager of that hotel that will be turning people away from Dominican Republic, which I did recently. Advised one of my clients to go to Jamaica to one of the RIU HOTELS in Negril, which she did and came back and had only praises for me and for sending her to that particular hotel in Jamaica. So, if you go to Dominican Republic and in particular to this hotel, you enter at your own risk, hope that you will get out of it OK, though..M.N. - Travel AgentAmerican Express Toronto, Canada

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Ok stay, beautiful resort, bad Food! My wife and I just got back from a 1 week stay (Nov. 20th-27th) at the Caribe princess. Overall it was a lousy place to stay, but very beautiful as well. We arrived at 5:30 pm, way past the 3 pm check in time so we got our room promptly. The put us on the shuttle bus to take us with our luggage to our room because they are too far to walk with bags in tow. The room was simple, clean, but basic. Fridge had 4 bottles of pop and a large bottle of water, restocked everyday. Good AC, safe costs $20 per week extra, TV had decent channel selection (including HBO, showtime), but need top request the remote from the reception. We are easy to please, so no problem with the room. The beach was beautiful, clean, with white sand and blue water. Some waves but remember all these hotels are on the Atlantic side of the island, so waves are expected, even though they get broken down significantly by the barrier reef infront of the beach. Many topless women from europe which were heavily represented by the spanish tourists. The activities staff worked long hours and tried hard to keep the atmosphere funlike. The 3 swiming pools were beautiful, eventhough sometimes they had some tree leaves blown into by the wind. The bars were ok, typical of the all inclusive, in general the tropical drinks had plenty of alcohol, too much for our tatse, so often we asked for little alcohol. Try the Banana mama, great taste! The beer was below ok, but again no big complains.They had a show everynight at 9:45 pm, which was very boting, mostly spoked in spanish with little translations, and repetitive music, dancing, basically a waste of time.We went to the disco one night after the show, around 11:15 pm. They were playing merenge music, and had free drinks only until midnight. We waited for them to vary the music, and finally gave up at 12:40 am, so we left, not worth paying for drinks to listen to the same music.The biggest problem was the food, it was horrible, the worst of any all inclusive we had in as many as 7 other resorts from previous trips. The buffet food had weird taste, looked ok, but smelled and tasted bland or funny. The fuits were a disastor, the water melon were practically white in color, often cut p into small pieces as if for a fruit salad. The meloon was tasteless, so was the pinaple. The bana were ok. After the first night at the buffet we decided we will only eat the specialty resturants. Well, the next 5 nights we tried them all (1 per night, as we had to reserve every morning starting at 8:30 am). 1- The chinese (Shanghai) resturant: Was overall the best of the bunch, nice seating, somewhat attentive staff. when you sit down they bring you plate of 3 sushi pieces, which my wife loved (I gave her mine). Next they bring a tasty appetiser of egg rolls, chicken and meet on skewers, very good. We ordered siup which was bad, basically soy sauce with pieces of chicken and other stuff. The main dishes selection were below average to average, nothing fancy. The desert was fried icecream which was good.2- The Brazilian (Rodizio) resturant:. Was terribe fake, an abomination of a brazilian food. My wife is Brazilian and I have been to Brazil 8 times, love the Churasco food from there. We went with big anticipation and walked out angry , disappointed, and my wife embarressed for all brazilians to have anyone think that food was brazilian. It turns out they have a Dominican cook making his version of he he thought was Brazilian food, so the result was a disastor. AVOID!3- The Mexican (Sombrero) resturant: This one was ok, the slasa and chips were bad, the food was below average but ok. The service was very slow here, unorganized, as the staff are over worked. My wife's chicken Fahita was small bits of fatty chicked, came cold (not to mention no sizzle in the skillet). My steak was lukework, rather thin, but ok. 4- The Italian (Mama mia) resturant: THis one was ok to good, the salad bar was well presented , tried hard to look like italian, but tasted somewhat lacking, yet good enough (considering our expectations were lowered in the last 3 days already). Go eat there, your best choice anyway.5- The Dominican resturant: SIMPLY Gross, horrible food, came cold, propably was taken from the buffet section that was having a Domincan night. Please don't go there, my wife almost vomited on the table. We walked out hungry and ate some fruit and desert from the buffet.Take a bike (a clunker ) from the hotel and ride to the Bavaro shopping (5 minutes away) where you can get some souvenirs, bargain hard, and start walking out to see the prices drop 50-75%.The resort had good tennis courts and decent rackets!We took a tour to Marinarium, snorkel with the Nurse sharks and sting rays, don't be afraid, those sharks are well fed and not interested in people. For scuba divers, don't waste ur money diving on the atlantic side, very rough, bad visibility, little sea life. I took instead a dive tour to Catalina Island, well worth it, and by the way, walk to the Paradisius hotel beach to the right and get the much better price for that 2 dive tour to Catalina (Certified only ) for $130 total instead of the $176 at the Caribe dive shop.Finally, the Manati park tour was ok, cost 25 with out dolphine swim, or $75 with Dolphine swim. I opted for no swim, but wife did it, it was an 8 minute encounter with 3 dolphines, good for those who love this stuff.Hope I was able to help you all decide.  
<Date>Nov 29, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Mexico is better My husband and I just returned from Punta Cana staying at the Caribe Princess. This was our anniversary present to each other. We found the hotel accomodations average, the food was terrible, and the service poor. The hotel was all inclusive, however, you had to make reservations to eat and if you wanted a brand name alcohol, i.e. Absolute, Heineken, etc., you had to pay extra. We were never told that men had to wear long pants in order to have dinner at the restaurants. Note, that we never go to places that require dressing up on vacation. I must admit, that the beaches were beautiful as well as the weather. I was just expecting a little more since my vacation last year was an all inclusive in Mexico. We upgraded our room so that the refrigerator would be stocked with beer and soda, however, unless we begged everyday for the beer and soda, it was not there. Next year we are heading back to Mexico. Another note, unless you speak Spanish, French or German, you will not understand or be understood.

<Author>theNYUkie
<Content>Stay Away from this one Let's begin by saying that although there were some good things about this resort, everyone in our transfer bus who stayed at Caribe Club Princess felt like they have wasted their vacation. THE GOOD: Spacious, well air conditioned rooms with king size beds. Soda mini bar restocked generously with every service. Three huge gorgeous swimming pools. Great beach. Even better TV channel line-up (HBO, Stars, USA, FX, TNT, TBS, ESPN, CNN HN, etc.) THE BAD: The rooms are a walk from the lobby and the theater (there's a shuttle running all the time), which makes for a hectic check-out and is an inconvenience. The swimming pools are poorly cleaned. The towels, beach towels, and the linens are in desperate shape, with stains and holes. Our sheets covered only about 80% of the king-size mattress, exposing what lies beneath. The evening shows ---- (what did you exect? you have to wait for every phrase to be poorly translated into four languages). You have to pay for your drinks at the disco after midnight. No waiters around the pools. Maids forget to service your room some days (one out of seven for us). NOBODY speaks English - a whole lot worse than at the other resorts we've been to, it creats a lot of frustration when you want a drink, when you order your meal at the restaurant, when you need something repaired, when you ask something out of the ordinary from the front desk, etc. etc. The restaurants are understaffed making for a super slow service. Ok, enough bad. Now...THE UGLY: Two words: the food. Both me and my fiancee got food poisoning. Mine lasted for three days, after which I only consumed rice for the rest of the vacation. Hers started after I was healed and is still with her five days later. At the buffet, the selection is miserable and repetitive. 8 choices of dishes for every meal, plus a pasta guy, some sort of a grill or paella guy, sandwich stand, french fries and hot dogs. Everything is undercooked, greasy, exposed to heat and humidity all day long in an open structure. Not much better at the restaurants. Some dishes simply tasted awful. Others were taken from the buffet. I can't say enough horrible things about the food at this resort, and for an all-inclusive that's a huge deal. One more word of advice: if you take a late shuttle flight, you will still be kicked out at 12pm on your last day, and then offerred a filthy courtesy room to change and shower before your flight. I was fine with it, but it's not for the more squeemish.  
<Date>Nov 21, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wavy waters. My fiance茅 and I just returned from Club Caribe staying Oct 30th to Nov 6th. We had a wonderful time. But before you go, determine if you are a beach person or a water person. The sandy beaches stretch for miles. This is great if you enjoy long walks along the shore. The water however is constantly moving with waves above 4 feet. The undertoe is very strong so I advise parents to keep a close eye on their young ones.Swimming: The booey marks the boundries which a swimmer should remain in. Otherwise the motorboats that frequent outside these boundries will run you over with very little regards to your safety. Snorkeling: There are none within resort beaches since the booey usually stays within coral regions. You can however take 1 hour trips outside these boundries to snorkel costing you 20$ us per person.Sunbathing: There are more than enough parasol (beach huts) to go around for everyone. The sand is gorgeous and I reccomend the walk along the beaches at night.Excursions: Please take the time to do Marinarium. This is a 4 hour excursion provided by your travel agency. The fun includes swimming out in the BEST coral reefs in Punta Cana (by the way,... bring your flippers,... even if you have to rent them out of your resort, and if you are a good swimmer, ditch the floating device). Bring bread and stuff them in an empty bottle. Bring this with you and you will see all types of fishes dance around you for food. You also get to swim with Nurse Sharks and Sting rays. This happens in the enclosed area for about an hour. There are about 4 sharks and 3 Stingrays. It was really cool to see them up close. Finally this trip ends with a dip into the natural pool. This is the clearest, freashest and the most calmest water you will see in a natural environment. I thought this was heavenly. When you dip into this pool, most people just stand around and drink,... please please please,... ignore the booze for just a moment,.. I reccomend that you dip your head in and open your eyes,... you will be transformed into another place. Parasailing. Do this. Tip the captain an extra 3$ and he will take you out where you can see Bull Sharks, Sturgeons, Finned Fish, and Turtles from above. We saw them all. All in all,.. food was average, room service was good. It's a wonderful place to take your kids as well.So go there and bring lots of US $. The Machines only spit out pesos.  
<Date>Nov 12, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Caribe Club Princess! We were at the Caribe Club Princess ( 2 women in their mid-thirties) October 9 to the 16th and we just loved it! The room, the food, the drinks, the beach and pools, all were quite nice, the weather was not great but we made the best of it. What makes this hotel is the staff. We have been to several hotels in Punta Cana, and the staff at the Caribe Club Princess go out of their way to make you happy. The disco was fun (too bad you must pay your drinks after 12:00) we partied until dawn a few nights. Room service is included with VIP package, and yes, the VIP package is worth it. Massage on the beach, La Cava restaurant was excellent, Budweiser beer, Heineken, etc. is available at the lobby bar. We had such a good time that we shall return to this hotel in the near future. Thanks Caribe Club Princess, we felts like royalty!

<Author>lenny403
<Content>Beautiful, friendly people We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess and we had such a good time.  There was a language barrier but remember you're in an entirely different country! My cousins and I brought our spanish dictionary and when the staff saw that we were making an effort to speak their language they kept smiling! The staff were so friendly that it made the trip even more fun! Every day we met up with my cousins at the buffet and the waiters would always have our tables ready and set up for us! It seemed like they were so ready to make sure we had such a good time! We took the day trip to Santo Domingo and Saona Island pn a catamaran.. You have to do this when you visit DR! The only problem was that the guys we went with got sick off of the food... That was their problem!All of them were lactose intolerant and ate ice cream and any milky food item every day! Overall the people are tremendously friendly, the grounds gorgeous, and the sites were great!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not worth the Money Just returned from Punta Cana. We reserved a room for 4 nights/5 days. The language barrier was quite frustrating, no one spoke English. We purchased the VIP which entitles you to top-shelf liquor, a 20 minute massage, three cigars, a small bottle of rum, a dinner at either the lobster or steak house, which are not included in the all-inclusive, use of bathrobes, beach towels brought nightly to room, and nightly bedding turn-down. Never saw any top-shelf liquor. Whenever we tried to order a drink, the bartender could not understand us, so we got whatever he made us. Asked for a rum  coke and got a frozen banana drink??? The massage was the best! We had dinner at the lobster house which was very nice. Never received beach towels. Only one night our beds were turned down. When I tried to get a remote control, they told me the office was closed and one would be brought to me the next day, never happened. When I called room service to have beer put in the mini bar, it never came. The first time we left our room, when we returned, our key wouldn't work. Come to find out, you must remove the key out of the slot inside the room which controls the electricity or your door key will not function. Waited over an hour for someone to come and let us in. The food was poor, definitely make sure to bring Imodium! I purchased little gifts to give room service along with a tip. Didn't make a difference. One night, we returned to our room at 8:00 to find out that our room had not been cleaned. When we called (only because we needed fresh towels for showers), they never came. We had to track down a maid on our own and ask for towels. Yes, the ladies go topless on the beach. I was glad I didn't bring my teenage boys; they would have never left the beach! Overall, I would not return to DR mainly because of the language barrier. When you need something, it is very difficult to communicate. I believe sometimes even ignored because of it.  
<Date>Oct 11, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>would definitely go back ! I went to the caribe club princess with my boyfriend in september 2005. we are in our mid-20's and we absolutely loved it ! if you are planning to go to this hotel, here are some suggestions:-food: italian and mexican: excellent. dominican: AMAZING (we went twice in 1 week) chinese: ok, we had to re-order two other plates because the lobster was discusting, the beef chow ming was good. buffet: was very good, breakfast and lunch was excellent-beach: amazing !!!!-shopping: you HAVE to bargain, they tell you ridiculous prices, and they hassle you ALOT !!! you'll hear LOOKY LOOKY alot while shopping-staff: if you are nice to them, they are nice to you, and you don't have to give tip to get service, although they apreciate tip at the bars and especially at the club.-discotheque: not very busy but the animators make it fun, the alcoohol is only free until midnight, so drink up !-animation/activities: loved the poolside animations, did the banana boat (fun but your legs and arms are gonna hurt), and the snorkling was fun.we would definitely go back to this resort, this hotel was everything we were expecting, good food, nice beach and relaxing !!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place to vacation My boyfriend travelled to Punta Cana from September 24 to October 1 to the Caribe Club Princess on an all inclusive vacation. I have to rate it as an above average vacation due to a many factors I will list.1. We went at low season so the place was not busy during the week which gave us the opportunity to eat in the nice restaurants each night; at high season it is almost impossible to eat in the restaurants because of limited seating2. the beach. We always got a chair under the palm trees now matter what time of day3. the pool. we always got a chair under the palm trees now matter what time of day.4. very peaceful due to the lack of alot of people; there were alot of people but not overcrowded5. we got prompt and good service from the bars and restaurants 6. The only down part of the whole trip was the buffet; they are feeding alot of people so the food is not always the greatest but most of it is ok; if you can get into the restaurants at night you're doing better and will have a much nicer stay7. the shopping was unlike Canadian shopping; barter barter barter; start by knocking 50% off there asking price and then barter down from thereBring lots of sunscreen; you're going to need it; it's very expensive to buy more in the stores; about three times as much in CanadaAll in all a very enjoyable week; I would definately go back and would recommend Punta Cana to my friends; I got back here today about 2 p.m. and I'm ready to go back

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful Resort We booked the Tropical Princess VIP package for Aug. 28 - Sept. 4/05. However, when we arrived at the resort we were provided with Caribe Club Princess bands as they were the ones that gave us the VIP status. First of all I must say depending on when you travel to Punta Cana will determine whether or not you should purchase the VIP status. Since we went during a non-peak season we found the VIP very useful. VIP included premium drinks (e.g. Johnny Walker Black and Red Label, Heineken, Miller Genuine Draft, amaretto), two twenty minute massages, one a'la carte restaurant either at the La Cava (steakhouse) or El Pescador (seafood) - 25 USD if purchased at the resort, two scuba dives if certified (would cost 49 USD/dive or discounted 2 USD for each additional dive you plan to do if you don't have this package), for each member you travel with you get one hour of internet for free (5 USD for 30 minutes if you have to pay at the hotel), but the best part of the VIP status was the fact that you can go to ALL of the restaurants on the hotel grounds for FREE (e.g. Shangai (chinese), Mexican, Mama Mia (Italian). Without the VIP it will cost you 8 USD / person to dine in those restaurants. Just a side note if you choose just a standard room, you will get to dine in the buffet, and two a'la carte restaurants which are the Brazillian and the El Pilon (Dominican). We did not enjoy the Brazillian restaurant - should have listened to the other reviews on this site as I found we wasted our evening dinner dining there. I was advised by one of the bartenders that the VIP is a good purchase right now since there were maybe 500 people at this resort and we were able to use all the services without any problems, however, during their peak season (approx 2500 people at the resort) it may be difficult to book restaurants, massages, diving, etc since they are limited on space. For example in the restaurants excluding the buffet you may be able to seat between 20 - 30 people every hour. And since there are only three different times to choose from - the reservations will fill up quickly. Therefore, watch the timing when you plan to book the VIP status. Our room was good it had a king sized bed, couch, table and fridge which was always stocked up with a large container of water, two cokes and two sprite bottles. Our TV worked and the water pressure was okay in the washroom. Just a note on the last day at the resort, we think they turned off the hot water in the shower as everyone who decided to take a shower before home time got a cold shower. In addition, the phone lines were cut off so you are unable to make calls out to your friends to wake them up so make sure you ask the front desk for a wake up call.The diving was alright. Maximum dive was about 14 metres. They offered various dive sites including caves and wreck dives. We went to the disco one night but found it played a lot of Rap music. In general, the service was very good there. The food was good, especially the El Pescador restaurant. If you can you should request to have them serve you the El Pescador menu inside the La Cava restaurant (as this is air conditioned and the other is outside by the beach). Just a side note- the meal is worth the 25 USD if you have to pay for it. We had the grilled lobster (it was HUGE) dinner, and seafood salad which was absolutely delicious!!!! The Shangai restaurant was also good.. you must try the deep fried ice cream!! Mama mia was alright, El Pilon (Domincian is good.. must try the steak but stay away from the crab with cream sauce unless you like to eat the shell pieces, never got to try the Mexican so I can't comment on that one. For those of you who want to buy souveniors, you must go into town. If you wish to take a cab it will costs you 5 USD one way. Go to hut number 14 first as you will meet a guy there named Frank. He speaks English and used to live in Scarborough, Ontario. He also does not give you the run around on prices and will give you an honest price on all this items in his store. Make sure you check him out first so you don't end up paying something outrageous for an item you could have got for a heck of a lot cheaper.Overall I would rate this as an above average resort. The beach is white sand and just amazing!!!  
<Date>Sep 6, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>out of this world trip my husband and two kids travelled to punta cana and stayed at the caribe clubfrom aug 14-21aug2005. we had the most amazing time of our life. Therewere lots of activities. The food at the buffet was almost the same everyday but what you do i try something different everyday because you cannot all thatfood in one day. The line up for the a la carte was long but if you got there early before 8:30 a.m. that was not a problem. The best a la carte restaurant was the pilon which was the local dominican food. the hotel room was clean,no problems with the washroom or airconditioning. I do not know what people expect when they go on a trip and stay in a hotel. The pressure in the showerwas a little bit slow at times but remember how many people are showeringat the same time. The air canada rep was kind of helpful. He was mainly trying to get us to buy one of the tours that he was on. I think he works on a commission. The staff was always friendly greeting you with hola. The animation staff was amazing and the all spoke many different languages. The chairs at the beach was not a problem. You get up early usually we sat the same spot so our chairs were always available. Then we would go havebreakfast and back to the beach to either bathe or suntan. I participated inmost of the actitivities daily and was very sad to go. The shows at night were awesome. They would always have audience participation in a game show before the actual show started and that was funny to look at. Theirtheme song on the pool and at the closing of every show is to die for. i would recommend this hotel and trip to anyone of my friends and family. i had a great time and would go back next week if i could. There is a gift shop on the compound but i woud not recommend buying there, it is really overpriced. we went to the local flea market where you can bargain but i hate how the locals hustle you in their stores and even on the streets walking back to the hotel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Caribe Club was amazing! We stayed at Caribe Club Princess for one week from August 21st-August 28th/05. My boyfriend and myself (both in our 20s) think that this resort deserves at least 4 stars, if not 4.5. Flight was great. We flew with Air Canada vacations and they put us in first class both ways which was awesome.Resort is beautiful. Lots of plantation and beautiful scenery. You have to walk or take the shuttle bus to get around but we enjoyed the leisurely walks and found the shuttle to run quite frequently.Rooms were great. We had a huge room and bed. Had a coffee table, desk, couch and dining table. Maids kept the room very clean. One criticism - mini bar was not always stocked.Buffet was not amazing, but I always found something to eat..and I am quite a picky eater. A la carte restaurants were really, really good. We ate at them every night. Two favorites were Shanghia and Mama Mia. Fried ice cream at shanghai is to die for! We had to line up to make reservations, but it was worth it. We are not big drinkers so I can't really critique the bars, but the wait staff always refilled drinks before you were finished.Service was great. Most staff spoke English..and French..and Italian..and Dutch. Everyone was very helpful, especially restaurant staff. Animation and entertainment were amazing. We went to three shows and they were all great. Daytime activities included archery, ping pong, water aerobics, spanish dancing, water polo and many more.We never had a problem getting a chair at the beach or at the pool, regardless of what time we went. I was a bit disappointed with the beach though....I expected clear waters but there were a lot of waves and the water was murky. We opted to stay at the pool for the majority of our stay.We didn't go to the night club at all so can't comment on it. Went to the casino once...not many people there. We one $4.Try not to buy anything on the resort, everthing is overpriced (as with any resort). Be sure to bargain (a lot!) if you buy souveniers off the resort. Overall, we had an amazing vacation. I would go back there in a second. If you have specific questions, feel free to email.  
<Date>Aug 29, 2005

<Content>Wow, wow, wow!!!!!!!!!! My family and I just came back from this resort. We loved it. Our three teenagers just had a blast. While they were involved in many activities, my husband and I sat by the pool or just sat under a palapa on the beach with a nice cold drink in our hands. I will have to say, that this has been one of the best vacations ever. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Pleasant, Enjoyable, Relaxing Vacation My husband and I stayed here from the 3rd through the 7th and we will return here before going anywhere else in the Caribbean. From check-in to check-out the service was excellent. There's a tram which transports you from the reception area to the rooms/villas.....but if you're impatient, I can see you walking. The entire resort is very inviting with a large reception area where you can enjoy your drinks before the show. The landscaping is well kept and well lit for nightly walks.If you're an active person, their staff keeps you busy with daily activities and tours. They even approach you so you can participate and are very informative. Just the same, if you just want to be a couch potatoe, they get the hint and leave you alone.The ocean, the best I've seen on the East Coast. Not Cancun, Puerto Rico, Cuba, Florida can compare. THIS IS A BEACH. It is clean, clear, sandy in/out; no shells/rocks; kinda like Florida eight years ago.Food/water, no complaints. My husband has a sensitive stomach and the Pepto came back to the states sealed. The repellent spray also came back sealed. Amazingly with all their woody-beautiful landscaping, not one mosquito bit me. What we did use was the Advils after the nights of drinking. And yes they do know how to make american drinks. They might be weak but if you communicate they'll make it stronger. If you're nice to them they're NICER.....no problems anywhere. Highly recommend the Buffet at all times. They do a great job in accomodating foreigners. Even a picky eater will find something appetizing to eat.Only downfall was that my expectations of a five star hotel was going to compare with those of the states and reality is that they have their own standards. But just the same, it was very clean, great service and well stocked.Suggestion, everybody is different! You have to try it for yourself. After reading some reviews before our vacation we actually considered changing the location, but boy are we glad we didn't.All-in-all, a great vacation!  
<Date>Aug 21, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it!!!! Absolutely Fantastic My friends and I went the first week of august with air transat and I can honnestly say that it was a perfect vacation from the beginning to end. I loved that resort, everything about it. First of my vacation was so unexpected I never wanted to go in the first place to Punt cana but my friends really wanted to and then why not after all a week of relaxation and beautiful beach. I had the best time and I would so go back there, it definitely is a 4 +star resort. First it's a huge resort and we were well located. When we got there, I told the guy at teh desk that I wanted to be well centered in the middle of everything and he did. We were in the third building which is perfect 2 sec from the swim up bar pool and beach and right in across the buffet. BTW, when we reserved it says that this hotel has 1 pool, nope there are 4 pools I don't know why it said that. The best pool is the one with the swim up bar because all the animation and all the fun is there. Beautiful pool perfect water and very clean. The people there are constantly working to keep everything intact and perfect.The location is beautiful with its gorgeous vegetation and amazing weather, not one day it rained. Now, I have to say that normally I never really pay attention to the animation but this rseort no wonder it is known for that, AMAZING animation. The people there are awesome super nice and there is so much animation from early the morning till late at night. I loved their theme song that played everyday at the pool and people dancing salsa to it. We would get up early tan at the pool watch the animation a little-take a drink and then afterwards to the beach since it's right there and then go back at the pool. You have the choice to have fun with them at the pool or relax at the beach. BTW Chopel Israel you rock man! I really was sad to leave I had so much fun with the people that worked over there as well as the people that come from different countries to work there such as Italie, France and others so overally there was an excellent blend of different people. I made so many new friends. Now there are many different restaurants and 1 great huge buffet. I loved the buffet there was everythingfor every taste, I'll be honest I tried only 2 restaurants, they were not bad at all. Loved the creperie amazing we would all go there during the middle of the day and order different crepes delicious. I would always try to eat well because I was scared to get stomache ache which I didn't get the whole trip fewww. Although I did eat a lot, but not eating too much meat, more salads with pizza fish rice etc. At night, there are a lot of shows and then we would go at the club. I can honnestly say that I had an amazing time with my friends and with my new friends. I so did not expect all of this; I really thought it'd be maybe boring vacation was so wrong. I relaxed while enjoying myself. If anyone wonder this hotel is really for everyone. There were families with their grown up children, young and old couples everything. Before I left i was scare that there would only be families or grown ups not at all, we were all around the age of 22- 28 and there were a lot of people around our age, it was a blast, I'll never forget this vacation. There are also a couple of shops close to the hotel, btw I would recommend this hotel because we would always walk on the beach and this hotel is really well center, some hotels are really far from everything. I will definitely go back there again very soon. For anyone who is going try to go when it's really happening probably july, august or the winter that's when it's really fun and animated. I'll never forget my vacation, FANTASTIC HOTEL , I'm not surprise all the princess hotels are amazing and I've travelled a lot!  
<Date>Aug 15, 2005

<Author>krisinspace
<Content>Our Family Had A Great Time Our family of 4 stayed at the Caribe Club Princess August 3 - August 10, 2005. My husband and I are in our 30's and we have two boys ages 8 and 11. We had a wonderful time in Punta Cana and thought the Caribe Club Princess hotel was great.When we arrived at the hotel, we were able to check in immediately and went to our room. Our luggage arrived within 10 - 15 minutes. We had the Caribe Suite which had 2 double beds and a sofa that was actually a 3rd bed.The hotel grounds are beautiful. The Dominicans who work at the hotel were all very friendly and very helpful. The two pools were very big and were always clean when we were there. The only issue with the pools is you have to be out to reserve your chairs by 7:00AM, if not, you most likely would not be able to have a chair to lounge in that day.The beach is gorgeous. There were workers out raking the seaweed first thing every morning.I thought the different restaurants catered to just about everyone's wants. My children and I are picky eaters, and always managed to find something we liked to eat. The 2 restaurants we did not care for were the Mexican and the Brazillian. The main buffet always had a good selection of foods and mixed it up a little every day. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel to others.  
<Date>Aug 13, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great stay My wife and I, and our two kids stayed a week in early July. The flight on USA 3000 was not too bad; for most airlines the days of comfort and good food are gone. We didn't expect too much, so we weren't disappointed. Arriving at the Punta Cana airport we had a wait of about 45 minutes. The officials were poker faced but not unfriendly. We had some difficulty finding our Apple guide, but once on the bus we were headed the right way. The ride was bumpy, and we had our first introduction to roads in this country - equivalent to a long ride on a stallion barely broken in. Another wait, this time a longer one, in the lobby of the Hotel Carribe Princess. We walked about in the scorching hot sun, parched  exhausted, then returned to the lobby. We did this several times, and each time learned the room was still not ready. The desk people said the problem was a late check out as if this was sufficient explanation and a complete justification. We finally got keys to our room around 5:30 pm. The keys did not fit. And that brings us to the only serious deficiency in the service -- the front desk was badly organized in every respect -- more about this later. English was minimal, and you must not expect any real fluency. A cram course in basic Spanish two weeks before we left Cleveland helped somewhat. Before jumping into the positives, which are many, I will complete my criticism of the front desk by saying that on the morning of our departure they forgot our wake-up call, throwing us into a panic and the only really unpleasant exchange I had with the staff. But that was the front desk. Now on to the good things. The grounds are gorgeous, and the beach perfect. This must be one of the most beautiful beach strips in the world. Last year we were at Cancun (Playa Maya, or something like) and this beach was even cleaner. Our hotel room was very good. Maid service was adequate, with a bit of prompting. As other tourists have remarked, a few dollar bills handed out here and there did not seem to be appreciated as much as our thanks and friendliness -- a phenomenon rare in the States, to say the least. Hotel staff were extremely accommodating, and when they discovered you had a preference for something, they brought you great quantities of it. The television channels were fascinating, especially if you enjoy foreign cultures and know a bit of other languages. Our balcony overlooked the most popular pool, and the leader of the water games, which commenced every morning, was a bit too loud, but we got used to it. We slept well at night, and noticed very few insects.  The food was excellent. A few times we were not completely sure what we were eating, but it was always delicious. The blends of fruit juices were especially appreciated. The Pescador, basically a fish restaurant but with all-around snacks, helped fill in between the three meals of the day. The largest and main restaurant (whose name I forget) was always well supplied with food of every description. To see the staff at work was amazing. The Prussian army was never better organized or harder working. Staff seemed actually to enjoy serving you and going out of their way to make you happy. I should mention a quaint shortage of spoons that seemed to recur every day, but that was a very minor occurrence. We had a meal at three of the other restaurants (Chinese, Italian, and Brazilian), but the main restaurant was the best. We missed the bus trip to Santa Domingo, but we did take the Safari bus through the Eastern part of the country. I can only say this is the most beautiful terrain I have ever seen. The plant life is a miracle, and if you have a scientific bent, you will enjoy taking in some of the marvelous ecosystems.  Finally, the people. They are universally sweet, friendly and good looking. Of course they are poor, and I wonder whether, if riches from industrialization ever come to this place, they will change. I hope not. We stayed a week, mainly because an ill-informed travel agent said there was a risk of being bored on a longer stay. I wish we could have stayed a month.  
<Date>Aug 12, 2005

<Author>augustpalmer
<Content>4 star is accurate We had a fabulous time 鈥?we really enjoyed it. There were a few not so great points - but if we were to do it all again - we'd book again. Price was right and we had fun. I think we may have been disappointed if we had paid what the brochure listed as full price. Don't think we'd go back for a second time to this one though. Once was great - but enough. The resort is definitely a 4 star (or maybe 3.5) - but not more. VIP was offered at an extra $100 US each. We declined and did not miss it at all - it was not necessary.  Beach was fabulous - waves were really rough though. We loved the waves - but if we had kids I might be concerned about them in the water.  Food was not so good. The buffet rarely changed and the a la cartes (when you could get in) were basically the same food on the buffet - only they brought it to you. The restaurants were very noisy and there was always a crying child at the next table. We stopped going to the al a cartes for these reasons and because you had to line up for reservations on a daily basis. We didn鈥檛 go to the restaurants that cost extra; everything seemed to come out of the same kitchen, so we didn鈥檛 feel like the extra cost would be worth it. If we were going to spend extra 鈥?we鈥檇 spend at a local restaurant off the resort. We ended up going to The Jellyfish Restaurant, and it was amazing - the food was so good! It was a beautiful place on what seemed like a deserted beach (there were resorts on either side - but you couldn't really tell from where we were sitting). We'd go back to Punta Cana just to eat there again... The resort staff was really great - with a couple exceptions everyone went out of their way to make you happy (we tipped quite a bit). The maid that did our room was really good 鈥?remembering to stock our fridge with beer and diet coke (I requested diet instead of regular on our first day). The only disappointing service we had was on check in when the man at the front desk kept on asking for my boyfriend. He didn't seem to want to deal with a woman. He gave us the keys to the room 鈥?but we had to ask repeatedly for a key to the safe and for a remote for the television. I also asked if we had a third floor room he ensured us that we did - and then flagged the person behind us up to the counter - dismissing us. He did not tell us where our room was - didn't offer any direction whatsoever. The resort is quite spread out - the walk was about 10 minutes from lobby to rooms... so it took us a quite some time to find the room, we carried our own bags.Carrying our bags was not such a big deal - we are young - but I wouldn't really think my Father would appreciate that service. We found our room on the ground floor (not the 3rd). The sliding door lock was broken... toilet ran too. I had to walk back to the lobby because the operator hung up on me every time I tried using the phone. This time, I spoke to someone different (who was great), but resort was over booked - not enough rooms to go around so there was no switching of rooms - but he sent someone over immediately to fix the door (there was a repair man there before I made it back to the room). We kept the room - didn't ask to change again. Room was clean and maids were great.... air conditioning was wonderful. The only other service issue we had was with the on site Air Canada rep 鈥?it seemed to us that their positions must be commission based. The rep didn't seem too interested in giving us any direction on anything other than the tours they were selling. We don't like tours - we like to explore on our own - just would have liked to have the guidance of a local who understood what we were looking for - not what we would pay for. Once the rep realised that 鈥?it became clear that that we were not going to get much in the advice department. We inquired about another restaurant that we heard was great and asked for advice on the best way to get there. We were told us it was quite far and we should eat at the resort restaurants that the resort charged extra for. We had no interest in that option - so the Captain Cook package was recommended. We also asked about the public busses - but the rep made it obvious we were not going to receive any help by turning away and making a cell phone call.  The rep did give good general tips at the welcoming - warning about drinking the water, and the coconut drinks... told us approximate prices of rum and cigars - and talked about bargaining with the locals on the beach. It was then suggested, if we were interested, that we visit a friend's factory - fixed prices and good jewellery. We did go there - but it was a small room with rum, some jewellery, which was a bit over priced, and one guy rolling cigars. Cigars were good quality - but the prices were in line with the established brands.  The pools were nice, but not very relaxing; the 2 main pools had loud music and constant activities and the 鈥渜uiet鈥?pool was over run with children. The pools closed at 7 for cleaning. We didn鈥檛 find that at the adult only resorts 鈥?but I suppose with that many kids in the pools, a major chemical cleaning is needed on a daily basis.The bar staff was excellent 鈥?but the drinks were very inconsistent - never tasted the same - but they did have a ton of alcohol... what more do you need? Always some place to sit at the beach and at the pool, but you did have to get up early if you wanted to reserve a lounger with shade. Animation staff was good - not too pushy - but were inviting enough if you could be swayed to join in. Never hit the casino or the club... can't stay up that long anymore.We loved our vacation ... would recommend it to some friends - but not to others... if you are looking for a great beach and a relaxing time and food is not your main concern - it's great. I would also recommend it for families. I鈥檓 glad we went, the price was right and we had a great time!

<Author>SouthernTravelerOhio
<Content>If you want this ocean, stay in the states While the resort was nice, I was very disappointed in the ocean. I had never been to the Dominican and expected a tropical paradise. What I found was a beach and ocean that looked exactly like Panama City Beach, FL! Granted, palm trees do not exist on Panama City Beach like they do in Punta Cana, but if you're going to trade ocean for ocean, Florida is more beautiful AND American! I don't care what anyone tells you, the language IS a barrier! They take a stab at Americanizing the food, but it's just plain awful (I admit, I'm a fairly picky eater and if you are too, good luck!). I tried ordering room service our last morning there and the person who answered said she did not speak English and hung up on me! I called customer service and they said they would order room service for me - but it never came. To give them credit, I did order room service several times before that with no problem and it was promptly delivered.If you don't drink beer, good luck finding a consistent drink to order. Every bartender has their own way of making a drink. I finally happened upon the Blue Caribbean which was pretty good (make sure you tell them you want rum in it and ask for mucho ice - they are very skimpy on the ice and your drink is warm before you even make it back to the beach)The grounds are wonderfully kept, our room was nice  cold, and the maid service was excellent. I've read differing views on the VIP - I think it was worth it. We had a complimentary small bottle of rum and cigars in our room. We had nice terry cloth robes to wear and slippers. We received vouchers for a free 20 minute massage, and vouchers for a free hour of a water sport. What we did was turn our 20 minute massage into an hour by paying an additional $35 - it was worth it! The massage was great! The guys got to drink Heineken, Bud  Miller Lite (the Bud  Miller where a little harder to come by though)This did look like a kid friendly place, although there is major toplessness going on. We've been to Tulum, Mexico and Cancun and the toplessness there was probably 10%. I would say the toplessness in Punta Cana is more like 50%. You certainly get an eye full but it's amazing how quickly you getted used to it.I have maybe become a little jaded now with all-inclusive resorts because they are starting to all seem the same. That's why I was hoping for breathtaking scenery because I knew the food wouldn't be so good. Don't let anyone tell you there's great bargains to be had here - there aren't. If you walk towards the ocean from the resort and go to your left about a 1/2 mile (around the bend), there is a row of vendors out to make a buck. You might find something to take home after some haggling but no great deals because everything is pretty much junk to begin with.All in all, it's a vacation and who can't have a good time on vacation? You're getting away from it all, drinking all you want for free. Chill out and enjoy it and maybe stockpile some food in your luggage from the gool 'ole US of A :)  
<Date>Aug 10, 2005

<Author>LANDE710
<Content>Beautiful scenery I Have to say the scenery at this hotel was beautiful. I don't want to discourage anyone who has booked a trip there already. i only had a problem with the food. it looked good and tasted good, but i had stomach problems. the bars were ok. every drink tasted different. they do not use premium liquor, so if your looking for that....you better get VIP, and then only at the main lobby bar can you get premium. My travel agent advised against me getting VIP, and i am sorry i didint get it. The pool and the beach were very beautiful. This is a great place to bring small children, but there really isnt any thing for teens( 10-15) to do. I didint see any bugs at all. the rooms were very clean and so were the grounds. Rooms service was always prompt. Most of the people are pleasant, but some are not. you need to brush up on your spanish. When you arrive at the airport.. be prepares to fill out a green card and pay 10.00 to enter the country. the green cards are located in the center of the lobby when you get off the plane. use the bell boys at the airport, they are very helpful and make sure you tip them. they appreicate the tip, not like the pool bartenders. tip the lobby bar tenders and the food servers, they appreciate it. as far as the maids, well....i tipped them every day and didint get what i asked for, my daughters never tipped and got anything they wanted. it really was beautiful though.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>SUCKED Hi Debby,We left from July 24 to July 31 to Punta Cana, and stayed at the Caribe Club Princess.The Hotel is beautiful but it is the food and the service that really really sucks.When we arrived on July 24, it took so long for them to serve us, and before we left my travel agency made sure we would get a room on the main floor because we are travelling with our daughter that is disabled. We get check in and they gave us a room on the 3rd floor, I started to pull a fit saying I cannot bring up a wheelchair on the 3rd floor you have no elevators, they kept saying I have no choice. I got so pissed off and started to scream and let everyone hear that they are the worst hotel I have seen for service, then the manager came out I explained my problem and finally after 3 hours in that heat we finally got our room on the main floor.Now for the luggage check in I noticed if you tell them bring my luggage in 10 minutes and I will tip you they fly there, that is what we did our luggages where in front of our room in 10 minutes.The thing that sucks about this is hotel is that the Reception and all the entertainment is very far from the rooms and the pool, it took us about 15 minutes to walk to the reception. It is a pain when you want to go see entertainment or shows at night to walk that distance and we got caught in the rain while walking there. There is the golf cart bus picks you up, by the time that bus comes you get there first on foot. Now the serves I would rate is Zero, I had to ask for my coffee, every morning they pretend as if they don't see you, they have no smile on there faces, it feels as if I was bothering them everytime I would ask for something. I noticed the key is to tip them, then you get good service. I feel as if I have to blackmale them for me to get served. Everytime I would ask for a towel or whatever I needed in my room I never got it.The food sucked everything did, the buffet was the same thing day in day out not alot of choice they had no hashbrown, or waffles, there fruits tasted bad ask if they were roten, the food taste as if they cook everything in one big barrel, everything I tried it had the same taste.The worst thing is that every morning you have to get up to go reserve if you want to go to A La Carte Restaurant, it is a pain to get up everymorning to go reserve they will not allow you to reserve for the week, one morning I wanted to reserve 8:00 pm for the mexican restaurant and they told me if was fully booked, I gave a her a $5 dollars US and there was room all of a sudden, I don't find that right. We went to try the brazilian restaurant guess what I told them I did not know french fries is considered brazialian the waiter gave me a dirty look, the best part they serve you the wine with an opened bottle, I told the waiter you probably fill up your bottles in the back everytime this one empty's out, and I told I am sure it is your domincan wine not Italian wine as is said on the bottle Oh yes it is Italian wine, I said really then go to the bar and get me a new bottle of wine and oped it in front of me, he started to laugh I told I am serious, so he went and get the bottle opened and poured in in my glass, the taste was 100% different from the one they pour you, I told them don't take us guest for a fool, just tell us it is Domincan wine don't lie in my face and take me for an idot, I turned around and asked the other guest that was sitting beside us to try the wine and he agreed with me it was not the same wine that he had poured from the open bottle. The other thing I find is that there is not enough bar on the resort you have to walk pretty distance to go get a drink.The have no milk in carton, when you go there it is there milk they make with powder, so if you are travelling with a child bring your own milk.The beach was nice but it was to wave for us to bring our daughter.Overall I would rate this hotel as a 2 star not 4. My best choice of hotel so far in the Domincan is Sunescape Casa Del Mar in Bayahibe, La Romana, here I feel I get treated like a queen and the ocean is to calm you can go snorling. If you want to email me at: felicia_gallo@yahoo.com

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great time My first trip to the Carribean and I must say it was EXCELLENT!!! I definitely recommend this resort to everyone going to Punta Cana. You won't get a better beach anywhere in Punta Cana. The food was excellent, with choices ranging from fries, burgers and pizza at the lowest to exotic seafood specialties and caribbean kitchen. Lots and lots of different refreshing drinks and don't forget to try Presidente, Dominican top beer brand (better than Heineken Coronna and Stella put together, mark my words!). Weather was excellent, sunny, not too humid and the sea was not the boring calm water. We had small fun waves all week long.Cheers,

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Spend quality time with your family! HOLA! Just came back today from the resort and wanted to give my two cents worth. I traveled with my husband and three teens (17,13  13) from the 23rd till the 29th and I must say we had the best vacation ever! Sure there is going to be slight problems with the langage barrier but you will have that in any country you visit. The staff was VERY friendly (especially FABIO at the pool bar) and did their very best to accomidate our needs. The buffet was OK (go for the specialty resturants if you can, but make sure gentlemen have long pants with them because you will not be seated!). You will need to get to the concierage desk in your building by 8:00 am to wait in line to make a reservation for the speciality resturants. You will also need to get to the pool or beach by 7:00-7:30 am to reserve lounge chairs under a hut (believe me you will need that hut for the shade!) even though they say no reserving is permitted. Our suite (2 full beds and pull out couch) was clean, plently of fresh towels twice daily, 2 robes and slippers to use during the stay. The only problem with the room was the air conditioning was not cool enough. We had a problem on the second night with our door key and we called for an hour and a half before we approched management who had fixed the problem while we were at dinner. Listen if you are expecting a 5 star resort it's not. If you want a fun place to go and spend quality time with your family try it. We had the time of our life!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Leaves a lot to be desired I was here 7/20/- 7/27/05. The trip to Punta Cana was fine. We entered the hotel lobby and thats when all heck broke loose. We had the VIP package and that was our first mistake. We checked in a 1:00 p.m. The front desk said our room would be available after 3:00 p.m.. No problem or so I thought. At 3:30 we went back to hte front counter and tried to get a room. Thats when the staff looks at you kinda wierd and disappears in the back room for about 30 minutes, then return to tell you that in still not available. I came to find out that people had been there since 10:00 a.m. and still had no rooms. They were from the New York area. At approx. 6:00 p.m. there was a room available. Dont be suckered in by the superior rooms they talk about, these are just a regular room with two beds. Not much better than a cheap hotel room back here in the states. I was told that the room had a pullout couch so one of my children could sleep on that. Low and behold, we walked in and no couch. I went back to the front desk and spoke with the clerk who all of a sudden didnt understand English. It was so funny because when hear you are from the USA they start talking in Spanish not knowing that some of us spoke Spanish quite fluently. The things they said about us leaves a lot to be desired. And the faces they made when after their conversation you responded in Spanish was to die for.  I remember something my grandfather taught me and should have lsitened again to him. He said Something good aint cheap and something cheap ain't good Man was he right. Please, Please spend a few extra dollors and stay in a nicer hotel, where the staff at least speaks a little english. Everyone and I mean everyone has their hand out for a tip, good service or not. ITs a shame that to get into the fancier restaurant that you have to wait everyday at 9:00 a.m. to make the reservation. This can take at least an hour every day. I dont know about you but I want to relax on vacation, not wait in line to make a reservatio only to be told that the restaurant I want is full that night. P.S. Slip the guy a $10.00 and he will get you a reservation. This is ALL INCLUSIVE? NO money no reservation. What you have read about premium liquor in other reviews is true. This option is a joke. The only place you might, get a top shelf drink is in the lobby. Don't expect this in any other area. I was drinking whiskey and water and was told they ran out of whiskey at every bar around the pool area. Really, I dont drink that much.  One woman that came on the early flight was really upset. I felt so bad for her. She was in teas most of the time I saw her because the hotel was really sticking it to her. She got so fed up that she had gone next door to the Paradisus Hotel, paid an addtional $1400.00, yes $1400.00. to get a better hotel than this one. It was one thing after another. She understood and spoke the language. She really had em fooled. We met with the asst mgr of the hotel. his name was Ray. He kepted apologizing for his staff. Running a hotel like this is not rocket science. YOu have to have qualified staff. THIS HOTEL DOES NOT! Believe me. Thats why Im leaving my e-mail address for anyone who reads this, or for those whom I met at the hotel. Let me know how the tape turned out. You know who you are.The Apple reps on site are a joke. They couldn't answer one of our concerns or questions. The main thing they try to do is sell you these side trips. Thats how they make a commission. We woudn't buy anything unless we were compensated somehow. They just kept saying NO PROBLEM. They never did a thing.The food in the buffet was less than what I had expected. Very limited on choice of meats. Desert table was very samll with only stuff that looked like it came out of a box. YUK!. I am also adventurous when it comes to trying native dishes. Man that was a mistake. Got sick for 2 days. It seemed that the busiest table at the buffet was the one serving pasta every night. No noodles for me at these all inclusive prices. I tried to have on chef carve me a piece of smoked hame one night and he told me NO, they are serving pork on the other table. I was furious. How dare they not give you what you want. Shame Shame.  I would return to Punta Cana again, but never, never, ever recommend this hotel to anyone at this time. Maybe in a few years they might get it right. Stay away for now.  REMEMBER GRANDPA'S SAYING AS WRITTEN ABOVE.

<Author>HUBBCHICK
<Content>Didn't feel like a princess I would NOT recommend this hotel. My husband and I travel each April alone without kids. The previous year we stayed at Puerto Plata and LOVED it (Viva Tangarine/Wyndham), although activities were limited there. We decided Punta Cana since thats were the activities are.We paid the extra to be upgraded to VIP. BIG BIG BIG MISTAKE....DON'T DO IT. Not worth the freebie meal.Check in - there is a line for VIP, you'll quickly realize it doesn't matterLuggage, we brought our luggage up to the check in counter, then he tells us to bring it back over to the entrance way (loved that VIP service) only for it to sit in the sea of other pieces. Waiting for the tram to take us to our rooms we realized we'd be better off to walk. So we went back for the luggage and walked it. Again, loving that VIP service.First room (yes I did say first). HORRIBLE!!!! I was crying in the room. 1. Right next to the busiest pool, loud, loud, loud.....2. Holes in the shower wall, AC unit was moldy and practically falling from the ceiling.3. TV only worked when you jiggled the electrical cord, no remote control4. Couldn't open slider door to mini balcony5. Two queen beds, we specifically asked for a KING during booking. I had it in writing!6. No lock for the safetwo hours later, we were moved to another room on the third floor (oh there are no elevators either). The room didn't have a great view but we were away from the noise and it was much cleaner. I was at least satisfied for the upcoming stay. Oh by the way, the remote control and lock for the safe....you have to get them from the front desk. Now wouldn't you think on VIP check in, those would be common items, such as a room key??? That still amazes me that we had to walk back for them. VIP service still hasn't kicked in.....the tears are still flowing.Food....it was fair, typical buffet style, the specialty restaurants were ok too. I don't go to an AI for the food.Drink....humm another so called benefit of VIP, you're entitled to premium brands....if available. Thats key...if available. We approched one of the bars and asked for a Budweiser, got two bottles then they were OUT. All of the other bars were out of BUD too. They had plenty of the local beer. It was like that for the entire stay. Never restocked. Again, VIP service....not worth it. Oh when you did get premium you'd have to sign for it. I guess my VIP braclet wasn't good enough.Specialty restuarant. We ordered a bottle of wine, price list stated $40 usd, on check out it was $45 usd. I asked why the change? He actually tried to pull off the exchange rate BS story. I quickly reminded him that the menu stated $40, I would only pay $40 and NOT a dime more. The menu did not identify an exchange ratio for wine. Nice try. They will attempt to nickle and dime you on everything.Limited english speaking employees, grounds were clean, front desk service horrible, cafeteria service horrible. Groundkeepers were the nicest and deserved the most respect. Hard workers.Activies were fun, although we had a long day trip to Catalina Island. The best times we had were the extras that we paid for.The resort is large, plenty of beach area with huts for shade, 3 pools to choose from. It would be fun for families, not very romantic but the money we paid had high expectations, they were not fulfilled. Go if you can get a budget deal, DONT PAY FOR ANYTHING UPGRADING, you'll be sorryWe paid twice the amount compared to our Puerto Plata trip and it was wasted on this crap hotel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>it was so-so me and my boyfriend travelled to punta cana this past june. one thing you need to remember is a pen....when u go to buy ur travellers card to get into the country they dont give u one...luckily we found someone nice enough to let us take theirs (its a long card to fill out). The resort was gorgeous, but it did have a nasty smell coming out of the swamp. The food however was not so good, and trust me i am not a picky eater. I was sick from it the whole week and pepto bismal is extremely expensive..$13 for a tiny bottle. Before we were able to check-in to our room we stopped at the snack bar to get a hot dog. they were on one of those heating things that you'd find in a gas station and the hot dogs were ice cold...the heater was barely on! We did eventually find some pretty good barbecue chicken by mid-week. i guess when its all-inclusive they dont really worry about the food since u already paid for it... The drinks were good but very small so we'd just order 2 or 3 at a time. and even though u don't have to tip, we did every time, its just not right not to since the staff is so nice, especially hector the pool bartender he was awesome. the staff was hard to understand but still extremely nice...everyone greeted us with an hola. it is very humid there we would put our swimsuits out to dry and they would still be soaked the next day. I would suggest the $20 snorkeling trip not the $70 from apple, it was just as nice but only an hour long as opposed to the whole day apple one, an hour was more than enough time. and the parasailing was gorgeous and not too scary coming from someone who HATES any sort of flying. we did get the VIP package but didnt even use our hour of watersports...it only included banana boats or a boat trip up and down the beach... which we basically did going to our snorkeling adventure...the water was gorgeous but hardly any waves....the free massage was very nice too... Before we left for punta cana i checked the weather forecast and it said showers and a high around 85 every day, which i thought this is great its nicer here in pittsburgh...but it only rained twice for very brief periods of time the rest of the time it was sunny and hot, perfect beach weather!! i was a little disappointed that when we talked to another couple on our plane ride home that their hotel served them fun flaming drinks and ours didnt....only being 20 we like fun stuff like that...we can drink beer out of plastic cups at home. me and the boyfriend are big gamblers so we were excited for the casino...but it was sooo small, our first night there we were the only ones in the whole place! it was kinda scary. but the later we went (it opened at 7 pm) like around 1 or 2 am the more crowded it got...we ended up coming home with what we left with so that was nice.besides that we didnt go to the club..it was only free drinks till 11 and then u had to pay and all the other bars closed at 12 which didnt leave much to do the rest of the night.. all in all we had fun, im happy just being at a beach period, and it was a very relaxing vacation but i wouldnt go back to this hotel  
<Date>Jul 20, 2005

<Author>smclau01
<Content>Paradise on a budget We had the pleasure of staying here from June 9-16, 2005--Caribe Club was simply paradise on a budget....the grounds were lovely,the white sand beach  crystal blue waters were awesome  the staff were friendly and eager to make our stay a memorable one. The maids did a great job keeping up with our sandy mess  keeping our frig stocked with bottled water  beer! We did the VIP which includes unlimited room service, a massage, an hour of water sports, a half hour on the internet,  a dinner at a specialty restaurant. VIP also gives you the option of American beer (Miller Genuine Draft or Budweiser)  some top line liquors. I recommend VIP if you have it in your budget but it's certainly not necessary unless those things are important to you.Upon arrival at the Punta Cana airport you do have to purchase a tourist card ($10 US)--(they also take a festive tourist picture which you'll be able to purchase upon your departure for $8 US) The airport experience was incredible as we were whisked through customs (I think being with Apple Vacations helped here)  we were on our way to the resort by air conditioned bus within minutes after our landing!!We were greeted at the resort desk by Harry (whom we nicknamed Harry Potter)...We had a group of 9 traveling together and managed to get 3 adjacent rooms which made things easier. Don't forget to purchase your safe key at the front desk ($20 week)--I know I had read in previous reviews that you must ask for a remote for the TV at the front desk too but ours was already in our room....We had plenty of English channels (HBO  Cinnemax with plenty of great movies to choose from)  even though the majority of the staff spoke Spanish, we could convey our needs easily so the language barrier was not that big of a deal....Rooms were colorful and clean (thanx Ana)-- although one room did tend to have a musty smell (probably due to recent rains) I'm sure they would've given us a different room but we never complained... Fortunately, we didn't spend much time in the room and I had packed Bounce dryer sheets to put among our clothes to keep them smelling fresh...I had also packed citronella incense --thinking it would ward off mosquitos...we used it to cover the musty smell...I had packed insect repellent also, but honestly didn't have much of a problem with bugs all week..I recommend packing nice sized mugs to take along with you to the bars (We were celebrating PC's graduation  my friend thought to order keepsakes for us with Punta Cana 2005 engraved -Thanx C!!) The bartenders were fabulous--they'd rinse out and refill our mugs with a smile..Thanx Hector  Jaquin)...Pina Coladas were yummy!!!JC (from the activities staff) did his best to try and keep us active...although we loved the lazy days just laying on the beach. The younger crowd with us tried parasailing,kayaking,the water bike,snorkeling,pool olympics,horseshoes,ping-pong, banana boat ride  took the ATV tour through the jungle. (It tires me out just thinking about it--but I did have fun learning to dance the salsa  mu-cha-cha)  I had fun at the shopping market on the beach (a ten minute walk to the left when facing the ocean)--You must barter (offer half of what they ask)  be prepared for them to be pushy...don't back down!!Food was plentiful -even for picky eaters -My favorites were French toast  fresh fruit at the breakfast buffet, BBQ chicken  french fries at the beach bar for lunch  Mama Mias Italian lasagna for dinner--theres enough variety available for anyone but you must make reservations early each day for the restaurants unless you just want to enjoy the buffet...We were careful to only drink/use bottled water but we did have a few in our group that suffered a day or two of stomache upset (pack Immodium AD  Pepto Bismo just in case as the price at the resort is extreme). The night time entertainment was great  the activities team deserves applause for putting in some very long hours ( how they don't collapse by dancing in those colorful costumes in the heat amazes me)--There was dancing every night following the show in the open air lobby....then for those who could stay awake the disco...Although I never ventured there myself, I heard the late night disco was wild (especially Wed ? and Sat. nights when the locals are allowed in). Pack lots of sunscreen  bring lots of one dollar bills to hand out as tips throughout your stay. Tip maids, bartenders, gardeners, waiters, bellhops,desk clerks,chefs(don't forget the grill tender at the beach bar -what a hot job he has).... And the maitenance people who come out in the early morning and rake the seaweed so the Caribe has the best beach around...try to tip them all if you can as they certainly deserve it!The week went by too quickly as most vacations do but spending the week with my most favorite people made it an unforgettable trip  I would go again in a heartbeat!! Enjoy....  
<Date>Jun 29, 2005
