<Author>BeachBum13
<Content>Nice Hotel...something missing? My husband and I just returned from the Caribe Club Princess a few days ago. We both had a great time but, couldn't help to wonder what was missing compared to other hotels we've stayed at. We went to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversay. I emailed the resort before we got there and they upgraded us to VIP for free. That was a nice surprise. With VIP we received a complimentary massage, premium drinks, room service and reservations at either the pay seafood or steak restaurant. We chose the seafood restaurant and it was one of the best meals I've ever eaten! We both had lobster...delicious! VIP does not affect the room type you were assigned. Our room was quite small compared to some others right by us. I know this because we were assigned our first room, which was quite large. While we were changing in the first room, another couple (assigned the same room) walked in on us while we were naked. To fix the problem, they moved us to another room down the hall from that one (which took an hour and half for them to do while we stood in the hallway with all of our luggage and no where to go.) The resort itself is beautiful. The food at the ala carte's is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!! Definately get in line before 9:00 to make your reservations. At 8:30 there were atleast 20 people in line already and the line goes SLOW. Neither of us liked the buffets very much. It seemed to be a lot of the same foods daily. Once in a while something new would be put out that we enjoyed but, that only happened 2 days out of 10. The creperie was delicious. Room service was top notch and great for ordering after a late night at the disco. Try the garlic shrimp and the pizza. The pizza was so much better from room service than from the snack bars. The drinks need some improvement. I would order the same drink from each of the bars and 4 out of 5 times each bartender would give me a totally different drink. We couldn't figure that one out. The frozen drinks were never frozen, just cold syrupy drinks. They didn't use any real fruit in the drinks either. It was all from concentrate. The house white wine was very good! The caprihna (sp?) was also a great drink if you like limes. We found to be in the minority the week we were there. There were very few English speaking guests. So we didn't meet very many people which was a little disappointing. Some people were just down right rude. I was pushed around and stepped on a million times at the bar waiting in line to get drinks. One day, when we left our chairs at the beach to get lunch, we came back to find our chairs were taken over by a family of 10 and our beach bag and all of our belongings were thrown on to the sand. When we confronted them about moving our things they were rude and pretended to not speak any English at all. I can assure you I witnessed this same family speaking in English throughout the resort the rest of the week. The shows in the evening were ok. Some of the people are very talented but, they just weren't our cup of tea. There were a lot of musical type shows. This is usually something we look forward to in the evening after dinner at other hotels we've been to. Here we were lucky to have stayed for the whole show only a couple of nights. The lobby was always a good time after the show. Everyone was always dancing and having a good time. The only downside to that was there was never any live entertainment. They only had a DJ. Every other resort I've been too has always had a caribbean band playing in the evening. We did have a good time, afterall how can you not when you're in paradise?!? We both left the resort feeling that it lacked something but, can't quite put our finger on it. If you've already booked this hotel. Don't worry. You'll have a good time and there is good food to be had in the ala carte restaurants. The beach is the absolute most gorgeous beach I've ever been on! It just didn't leave me with an unforgettable feeling like some other hotels have.  
<Date>Jun 28, 2005

<Author>Harmar
<Content>good and bad points Our specs: We are a middle-aged, well travelled couple with adult children.We stayed at the Caribe Club May 14-21, 2005. We had a few rain days but also some lovely sunshine. The resort was pretty with a well groomed landscape.The staff were very friendly and efficent. The theme restaurants were good.The resort was relatively quiet and peaceful. Food was nutritious. Pool was great. Lots of wildlife. Kds on the resort seemed to have a great time at the kids club. We did not suffer any GI illness. Our major complaint was the mold/mildew and condensation in our room. The AC system is obviously not up to par as we have never experienced this at any resort before. Mold was even found on our pillows. The buffett was very poor in choice and meats were of poorer quality than we've seen before. Overall, compared to other 4 star Caribean resorts that we have stayed at we would not consider this up to standard. We felt we paid too much for the standard of the resort. The VIP upgrade which we received free from our travel provider is silly. Paying for this is a waste of extra money. There was an abundance of mosquitos during the time of our stay. We won't return to this resort and unlikely return to the DR.  
<Date>May 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Paradise Just want to tell anyone considering going to the Caribe Club Princess that it will be a decision you will not regret. My sister and I stayed there for a week in April and even though it was our first trip down south, it certainly won't be our last. Like everyone, we had read reviews and though most were quite positive, there were always some that made us wonder if our decision was the right one. Without any hesitation, I would highly recommend this resort. The staff were absolutely wonderful and of coure you always pick out a few favorites. Israel from the annimation staff and Hector, one of the maintenance boys were our pick. Of course, the bartenders were in a category of their own. They can make a mighty fine drink. The food, the service and the beach were awsome. The rooms (although not fancy) were very clean . The grounds are spotless and please dont forget to tip or give little gifts to some of these men who do such a fine job of keeping the grounds so clean.The only complaint that I would have is that some of these tourists need to lighten up and enjoy the beauty of the resort. This is a vacation!! How about trying to crack a smile and being nice to people. Maybe I am being prejudiced but Canadians are by far the most fun and friendliest.So pack your bags, bring your sunscreen and stop worrying. You can have a fantastic vacation . The choice is yours.  
<Date>May 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful vacation spot with great animation team My sister and I visited the Caribe Club Princess in April. There were a few minor inconveniences when we arrived, but we just laughed them off. After all, you are in a different country. The rooms were clean and there was always friendly staff around if we needed anything. Although neither one of us can speak spanish, there didn't seem to be a communication problem. We looked up a few phrases in a spanish book that we brought and they appreciated that.  The food on the resort was excellent! If you can't find something that you like, you must be hard to please. Try a lobster crepe with a presidente on a hot afternoon. Delicious!!!!!Many of the tourists were unfriendly. The nicest ones were the people from Canada. The staff were so helpful and could not do enough for us.A special thanks to Israel - animation team; Raoul, Jauquin, and Sandy - bartenders; and of course, Hector. You made our trip memorable.Hopefully, we will see you again next year.

<Author>bustravel001
<Content>Disappointing Glorious beach, but bland food and boring buffets compared to other Caribbean island resorts (even Cuba, given its restrictions, delivers better fares), and a very annoying animation team overdoing it on the sound system. A la carte restaurants were less than average, except for the Dominican themed one which delivered succulent traditional local cuisine. Cocktail drinks were served erratically by staff who obviously did not always master the basics such as Mojitos, Daiquiris and the like.We had a junior suite which overlooked the pool and was very spacious. Some problems with the hot water, but we were there in the busiest week of the year and I imagine the resort was at full capacity. Lots of families with early rising kids.Would not return there to relax, but I imagine it must be fun for groups and families.  
<Date>May 7, 2005

<Author>NS
<Content>Great time Just returned from Caribe Club Princess April 9-16 2005.Weather : Fantastic. Pretty well 31 degrees everyday with cloudy skies at times.Beach : Beautiful. Tons of white sand. I know some people complained about it being windy all of the time. I found that it was great. It created nice waves for kids and adults to play in ( boogie boarding etc...) It also gave you the opportunity to lay around on the beach and not really feel that blistering heat which you do feel by the pools. But to each thier own !!! I loved it.Resort.: Very clean. rooms were better than the Club Med at Punta Cana which I stayed at 2 yrs earlier. We had the VIP package with superior room 3328. We had two kids (10 and 14) and there was plenty of room. 2 single beds and 2 double beds. I had my own bed for a week !!! Tons of hot water for showers and the blow dryers worked great.  Food: A huge selection at the buffet. There are also several a la carte restaurants on the grounds which you have to reserve between 9-12 each day. I thought they served excellent food in a nice arrangement. you have to dress casual,(no shorts) which isnt a bad thing. Even our kids enjoyed it.The El Pecador was very good. go for the Langostines.Check in : At the time we arrived it was very fast.Check out : It was not bad, however we needed a courtesy room to shower up before we left because we had a late flight. Get there early because they seemed overwhelmed. then to top it off the guy gives us the key card for the courtesy room and it turned out to be the wrong one !! Luckily we a custodian walking by and he just let us in.The reception area is located away from the rooms,pools and restaurants so if you have any concerns you have to wait for the shuttle of make the walk. Its only a 5 minute walk and we really didnt mind it , especially after dinner as it gave us the opportunity to 'walk off dinner' after suffing our pie holes.!!We would then go to the bar at the reception area for the customary 'after dinner' drink ( or three).As mentioned in the other reviews , the activities are pretty lame, but if you dont get up and try the dancing or something why not stay home !.( a few drinks always help things along!) n The nightly entertainment, show etc.. are again very amateurish but the staff tries real hard. There is a disco or a casino right next door but no where near close enough that yo ucan hear it because all of the rooms are closer to the beach area.There are three pools onthe grounds with bars in very close proximity. By the beach is the Pelicano Divers who take care of lending out the boogie boards, life jackets. catamarans, windsurfers etc... you get them for an hour at a time but after an hour youre pretty well beat !!We took the Pelicano dive intro and my son and I enjoyed it so much that we ended going for the certification for scuba diving. We certainly dont regret it and they were nice to deal with.I met several couples who were there for two weeks and they stated that they had been to many different resort in the Punta Cana area and they felt that this place was the best overall. Again dont expect much night life , but make the best of the days!!I would go back in a hart beat...........If you are thinking of going and need more info to make you mind up ..snd me a line.  
<Date>Apr 17, 2005

<Author>jackyleesam
<Content>great for the Price we paid... Hi, we were a family of 4 with kids 75yrs. Our room was a suite on the second floor, and we did not do the VIP option. We had only a few minor things go on that could have been improved on... The kids liked the lizzards we saw every day at the restauraunt and the near the room. The monkey and the mcaws that went around we also a hit $7 for the photos in the front lobby. We also spotted a bull frog and many different birds right on the resort... The resort itself was tremendous, bigger than we thought. Everything we found was very clean lush and the staff always eager to say HOLA. Only spot that was gross were the public restrooms by the beach and by the restaurants (yikes!) The restaurants are located all together and pretty central to the 3 main buildings.The food was fresh and contantly refreshed. There were cold cuts out so if you did excursions you could pack a light lunch. We were able to get plastic bags for travelling home with some extra doughnuts. *** We did opt to tip our waiters and the Drink girls***... after being offered no reservations to super late ones, We did try one restauraunt La Cueva and it was suposed to be a STEAK place, however most of the items on the menu are seafood and after eating the steak I'd stick to seafood there, aps and starters were all seafood based. The presentation was fantastic there. We discovered Why it is so difficult to get EARLY reservations (I just do not want to eat at 10 pm with little kids)... for the 6 different places, it is because each restaurant only have seating for about 90 each in total seats. Not enough for 500 plus rooms. The pools were large and very clean we opted for the quieter one as 1/2 the pool was under 2ft and perfect for the kids. We did have to get up early for the pool spots with an umbrella before 7 am. I would suggest to Bring lots of SPF and block. It is over 25US$ per bottle at teh resort shop. We brought 3 bottles thinking it would do, but being in the water mostly for 8am-5pm was just not enough. Getting drinks was tricky we speak a bit of spanish and took a book of translations. We found service excellent or realy bad. If you read the name tags and called them by name I never had to wait unlike some others. ***Again we tipped all the time*** We found it difficult to get a Strawberry drink? But the pina coladas were good... The Creperie was excellent and served ice cream, The kids got a kick out of that feature and the Philliy Crepe was Delish!  We spent mornings at the beach,The waves were rolling, you could go out aways before it got deep. You could walk forever on this white POWDERY sand and see the different resorts. By far the nicest beach sand. Watersports were readily available and easy to take part in. Friendly staff and we loved the boogie boarding!The animation staff work so hard here and would keep you busy if you wanted. Or leave you alone if you wanted too. Very well done just wish the resort put the same effort into other aspects of the service.If you want hair braids they do it everywhere and very inexpensively 20-35$us takes about 45-50 mins for just below the shoulder length hair. Our Daughter loves hers! We did 2 excursions, We went to the Manati park where you could swim with the dolphins $80us for 6 mins. If you opt for this plan to do the park in the am and the swim is at 2 pm.expect to wait for this, as they do all the swims at one time 50+ at 6 mins each. Depending where you are on the list, you could wait until 4pm. The park itself was easy to get through, not terribly exciting, the igguanas are loose and very cool to see up close. the pony show was well done and there were no sharks as advertised. The staff are very apt at asking for $ for putting birds on your shoulder. I did a fishing excursion on the Marlin boat. The boat was less than stellar, I did catch a dolphin fish about 100lbs... and was pleased with myself. Well worth the 89 us$. There was a little market there where I got some little items to bring home. I also went to El Torpedo factory 1 hour long in total and got hand made cigars and Larimar silver jewlery. Well worth the apointment. All excursions were arranged thorugh my travel advisor on the site. *** beware of the 10%- 20% + they add when you use a creditcard...*** Use Cash.Here were the little glitches we had. We arrived in at 11 pm on the Sat night and were caught after a bus had just unloaded, so needless to say it took over an 1.5 hrs to check in with 2 tired little kids who just wanted to go to bed. Our luggage arrived at the room by 1: 30am and only after calling. They wont allow you to take it with you, we tried. Nothing was explained( which block we were in... so we wandered though 2 buildings 'till we found our room) We never got beach towel cards and had to go back to ask for them... Bit of a nuisance. We were told you could $55pp and Check out late. This service is really, unavailable so have your travel agent book you the extra night ahead of time to save a headache if you leave later in the day. Luggage is really left unattended, so make sure to have luggage locks for all compartments or check your luggage before you leave. They supplied a room for 45 mins that would make you loose your lunch, not cleaned and wet towels on the bathroom floor from the 20 or so before us was not pleasant. We just changed and got out of there... Realy easy fixes for this resort to make it better ...Have more staff at the front desk, and have the rooms used for courtesy, cleaned in between uses. Have at least one desk staff knowing a different language fluently to handle any problems, or questions you may have. And enlarge the resevation only restaurants so as to eliminate the frustration for guests trying to get reasonable reservations.All in all A fantastic trip, At a Bargain Price, 85deg every day and RR That is all we could ask for for the $3500 for all four of us Over Easter weekend Mar 26th-Apr 02, 2005. Hope this helps in your holiday quest!  
<Date>Apr 6, 2005

<Author>margib
<Content>depends on what's important to you We're 2 families with teenagers. Have been to many all inclusives over the years. Here's our impressions:Beach - Outstanding! You won't find much nicer anywhere (I'm very fussy about this). You do need to be up early to reserve a grass hut. There's really no snorkelingRooms - Nice. A little worn but clean and fairly spacious. Nice balcony.Food - The worst AI food we have ever been served. However, we all  managed, did not get sick and enjoyed our stay.Service - This isn't the USA nor is it Jamaica or Mexico. Sometimes service was good, sometimes not. You need to extend yourself by  a) being friendly b) attempting spanish c) tipping  bribing Pools - Three nice, immaculate pools. One had tons of activities, two  others were quiet.Staff - The activities staff was the best we have ever seen. They really extend themselves to interact with everyone - old and young alike. I typically avoid them and even though I didn't  participate in pool games etc. I had nice conversations with several of them every day.Spa - Nice little surprise here. Good little gym too.Outside activities: Unlike some other caribbean spots, there's very little worth doing in Punta Cana. The resort is pretty much it.Other Guests: Many Europeans  Canadiens. We met plenty of people  from usa too. VIP option: Don't leave home without it, you can't get it once you're there and it's well worth it. There's a bunch of nice  amenities but most importantly it gives you top shelf liquor.Overall: This is a very lively resort on a pretty property with a fantastic  beach. The food is awful but we had a wonderful time anyway.  You can't compare the DR to Mexico or Jamaica's service but  remember you can't compare the price either. We paid about  $2,700 for 3 people, VIP, non-stop air during easter break. This same week was 3x the price elswhere. We had a great week and would return again for that price.  
<Date>Apr 4, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wonderful vacation! Our family of four returned from Caribe Club Princess on March 19, 2005. We spent a week there and enjoyed every minute of it. We have stayed at a lot of different resorts in the Caribbean. Caribe Club Princess was definately the nicest. The staff there is so friendly and helpful. You have plenty of choices for food at the buffet and it is all very good. The resteraunts are good as well. Make your reservations as soon as possible because they fill up quick. The pools are spectacular and very clean. We spent a lot of time in them. Our children (12 yr. old girl and 9 yr old boy) had a great time. There are plenty of activites to keep them busy. If you are taking young children I want to share something with you that you might not be prepared for. There are women on the beach AND by the pool that do go topless. They are everywhere. Our 9 year old boy did get an education that I wasn't prepared for but, I do have to admit that after a few days you do get used to it and he really could of cared a less so I got over it. The beach was great and we were in it every day. Our room was very clean as well as the whole resort. We had such a great time. We are looking forward to going back again.  
<Date>Apr 2, 2005

<Content>Terrible Service All Around 1 Star My family and I travel every Winter break somewhere in the Carribbean and did we make a mistake with this Hotel.First when you check in make sure you ask for your V.I.P. bracelet as if you are American they will look on and place you as standard. Not that even the bracelet makes a differance they treat any Americans in a lower standard then Europeons. (Rooms, Food, overall Guest Services).We had a family Emergancy on our 2nd day my Father was admitted to the Hopital I.C.U. unit with a critical Heart condition and while the family tried calling each one of them were Hung up on by the front desk. I had just called my travel agent to inform her of the conditions of our room and the complaints I had made, and nothing was being done. When finally I was called by my brother who speaks fluent Spanish informed me that he and 2 of my other family members had been calling for days, and they just Hung up.I was furious, and called my travel agent again to make flight arrangements for the following day and to add this to my complaint.I have all the phone bills from every family member and they all match what the Hotel has listed totaling over $300.00 US dollars. it averages $4.00 a minute calling from the States, which gives you an idea of how many calls were made from January 4th- January 7th when I was finally notified.Needless to say the Hotel Manager and the staff were of no help , the following day we were to be at the front desk at 12:00 P.M. and they didn't have are tickets, the Apple Representative who we spoke with the night before had taken everything with her and could not be reached.We finally were told to go to the airport and someone would help us.We arrived home and I was able to spend a few days with my Father before he passed away. Had the communication been better I would have had more time with him.I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Amazing Vacation! I just got back from a 7 night stay at the Caribe Club Princess and I had an amazing time. Me and a friend opted for an alternative spring break trip this year and chose punta cana to avoid the crazyness that we've experienced in Cancun, Panama City, and other spring break hot spots. We were more than pleased. This was one of the most relaxing vacations Ive ever had and I came back with an amazing tan. The food was good, the drinks were good, and the beach was gorgeous. My only recommendations are to bring a spanish dictionary because they don't understand much english there. The crowd is very diverse with many european vacationers so its hard to find someone who knows english well. Also if you want a spot by the pool or the beach get up early and claim your chairs! Other than that our vacation was great! If you're looking for an excursion the Outback Safari is GREAT! Our tour guide Alex was hysterical so request him if possible! I can't wait to go back next year!!!  
<Date>Mar 27, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Okay Resort We just returned from this resort on Saturday. I've stayed at several all inclusive resorts, this was my third trip to Dominican. The resort was nice, it was definately a nicer 4* resort, but not a 5*. You will probably want to bring along your own snack food as I found the buffets to be very disappointing, quite disgusting actually. It works out to be a pretty good dieting tactic while vacationing. Fortunately, at this resort, you are not limited to the number of restaurant reservations during your stay. The restaurant food is good, the buffet food is not. I would recommend standing in the line every morning. Even if you can't get a reservation until 9:45 - trust me, it's worth the wait.Walking around the resort, the lobby, trails, pool, spa, theater, sound system, etc. were very nice and well maintained. The staff is fun, it's really a nice place. The main areas I think this resort need to improve on is the rooms , and the buffet. I think if the resort invested the same amount of $ into the rooms and the buffet as it did the remainder of the areas, they could come close to qualifing as a 5*.There were a number of spring breakers there, but that is to be expected this time of year. The only other complaint I had, is on Friday night, our last night, the property owner next door was burning trash. The entire resort was covered with smoke. We tried to enjoy our time outside as long as we could, but our lungs just couldn't take it any more. We ended up having to retire early.I talked to a couple that paid the extra money for the VIP. They were pretty disappointed, as their room was not upgraded and they didn't see the benefit other then getting checked into their room right away.For an all inclusive, this was the most un all inclusive. There is 24 hr room service, but you have to pay extra. Only $3 US for a pizza, so not alot, but I thought it was a bit ridiclous when staying at an all inclusive. Top shelf liquor is available, but you need to pay extra.I would have to get a pretty good deal to stay at this resort again. Overall the food and the property owner next door would keep me from booking this resort again.  
<Date>Mar 24, 2005

<Author>KHKU
<Content>favorite vacation ever, great for kids! All I can say is WOW!!! Went to Caribe club with two friends, and five boys ages 11, 10, 9, 7, and 5, from March 11-18. What a wonderful time we ALL had! Direct flight on US Air was quick and enjoyable. Once we arrived in paradise we were met by Apple Vacation representative and then driven through town to our hotel. Lots of good info given on the ride to the hotel. Hotel is beautiful!! Open air with a lovely lobby, nice breeze and refreshing drinks. Check in was easy and we waited on the beach for our room. Staff is VERY friendly and very good with children, made you feel very welcome. Felt very comfortable about letting the children roam freely. There seemed to always be someone looking out for their safety and eager to entertain them. Restaurants were great and so was the buffet with many many choices for everyone. Room service, free, was well used for snacks or very late night snacks. The excursions are all wonderful but our favorite was swimming with sharks and sting rays. Yes, we were actually in the same water with them nothing between us. Very cool. Shopping on the beach is very fun and entertaining. Great products for great prices, after bargaining of course!!!! Night life for everyone. I would recommend this vacation to evryone of all ages. We met a ton of new friends from Canada, Paris, New York, Mexico, Arizona, etc. You can eat the ice and frozen drinks but not the tap water. Bottled water was everywhere and fridge in room was restocked everyday with sodas and beer. Thigs to take with you would be sunscreen(it cost about $25 a bottle once you get there), candy for the maids and hotel workers, and Livestrong bracelets. Even the kind you buy at 7-11, the rubber kind. My children had several on and the natives were going crazy for them and our candy!!! We even got to trade these items for boat rides, products, or just plain fun!!!! We want to go back but don't think we can wait a whole year!! Weather was beautiful and the partying never stopped!!! One last thing, when they say all inclusive they mean it!!!! Once we got into the hotel we did not have to pay for ANY food, drinks, nightlife, shows, non-motorized sports etc. Take a calling card and it only cost you a service fee of $1 to use it from the Dominican. WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL!!!!!!  
<Date>Mar 20, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Love the Caribe Club Princess Stayed at Caribe Club Princess and it was great. The rooms were great, the food was good, 7 restaurants, something for everyone, don't be afraid to try new things. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of hot water and all the topless women on the beach and at the pool, there was just too many. The staff were nice and always greeted us in a nice way Hola.There are 3 pools, one for the people who like to party. another pool a little more relaxed and finaly the third one with no music, no activities, just a quiet place to relax with your family.The beach is beautifull, you can walk for miles.The nightly activities started at 9:45pm a little too late for us because we have little kids which needed to go to bed early. There is some nightly entertainment for kids which starts I believe at 8:45 for an hour. We attended one night but it's not much of a show and our kids said that the music was too loud for them.Go to your meeting with the rep, they give good info.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>22 Americans having fun What can I say but GREAT TIME. Every time you travel, you will hear negative people complaining, as did we. I have been to Mexico several times, and thought the beach was nicer than that in Playa del Carmen. I myself am an above average cook, and thought the food was great! Anytime you change your environment or your routine you will feel the effects to some degree, if you know what I mean. I thought the Mexican Resturant was great (but it was not authentic). The Chinese and Italian were the same. The dissappointment was the steakhouse, whichyou paid for and was less desirable. The weather was beautiful, the grounds and staff were very pleasant. I would say that it is three europeans to one american among the guests, so if that is a problem for you, beware. the staff doesnt treat you any differently, but the european guests, (german, french, spanish) are definitely pushy and seem to feel like they are more important, not surprisingly.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Better than we thought it would be We left Phila on 3/21 in a snow storm and after de-icing the plane we were on our way. Arrived in Punta Cana to beautiful sunny skies with a temp of 80. Stayed from Feb 21 to Feb 28, 2005.Fortunately, since we were there last year, we were familiar with the need for a tourist card. Many people did not know this or that it cost $10.00/person. We were ready for this and whisked right through. We found the Apple rep and located the bus to our hotel without problems. Within 1/2 hour of leaving the airport, we arrived at the Caribe Princess at 11:30 AM. The Apple rep on the bus told us that check in wasn't till 3 PM but that all the rooms were ready and we could get our rooms after we checked in. Unfortunately, that was not true. We never established with the registration people if our room was ready. He kept repeating that check in was at 3 PM. That didn't bother us though as there was a bar in the lobby and we embellished a few. When we felt our thirsts were quenched, we found the buffet restaurant and had lunch. By the time we were finished lunch, we got into our rooms. Our room was a superior garden view. Well, it wasn't quite superior. It was on the first floor with a king sized bed (as requested) but it looked onto a walkway and shed. We're easy to please and we knew we would be in the room only to sleep. Well, on the third day, the ceiling in the bathroom began to leak. We found this out at 3 PM and reported it immediately. We had a 6 PM dinner reservation and the leak still hadn't been fixed. We spoke to a person at the front desk and he said he would have it fixed by the time we were finished our dinner. We came back after dinner and found there was dirt over the sink and floor were they fixed the ceiling. We called and asked that the bathroom be cleaned and was told that someone would be there immediately. Immediately after we placed the call, we realized that the ceiling was still leaking. I called the front desk and told them we needed another room. Within 40 minutes, we had a room on the second floor with a wonderful view of the pool and ocean. The remainder of our stay with the accommodations went fine.The restaurants were okay. There was a steakhouse and seafood place that was not included. It cost $35.00/person to eat there. Luckily, we did the VIP and it included one meal at either place. (I'll talk about the VIP later). We choose the seafood as we had read reviews that the steakhouse wasn't too good. Our meal at the seafood place was good. We each had lobster that was grilled to perfection. Also, there are 5 other restaurants that were Mexican, Chinese/Japanese, Italian, Dominican and Brazilian. You need to make reservations for these and the 2 pay restaurants every day with the concierge. The concierge begins taking reservations at 8:30 AM till 11:30 AM. If you are not in line by 8:15, you will not get the restaurant of your choice. There was much grumbling in line about this. We ate in the Mexican, Japanese/Chinese, and Italian. They were all good not great. Each had its pros and cons. We wanted to eat in the Brazilian, but the reservation got cancelled as the restaurant was closed the night we chose. We were told that the Dominican was terrible, so we avoided that. There is a large buffet restaurant that is open all but 3 hours a day. The food was just okay. The grounds were lovely. The lobby is separated from the room/pool/ocean area. It is about a five minute walk. The walk is very naturalistic. Lots of trees and flowers and birds. There is a tram that you can ride but we usually walked. The tram was not on any kind of schedule. You just had to wait till one came by. There was a couple of stores and a chapel on the site. The pools were nice. We were connected with the Tropical Princess which had 2 pools. The Caribe had only one but that one had the swim up bar. We only visited that pool once and only for the bar. The ocean was great. When we arrived on Monday, the weather was very windy. It was the same for Tuesday. We were wondering if that was because of the area we were in. Fortunately, by Wed., the winds stopped. If you were on the beach on those 2 days, it wasn't very relaxing. The water temp kept getting better and better each day. We are real beach bums, so we were in the water and on the beach every day. We did not feel the surf was rough as we had read. One thing we found is that there was not beach service. If you wanted a drink, you had to get it yourself. That wasn't a problem, I kept sending my husband up there. The staff was wonderful. They seemed to try to be as helpful as possible. When we had all that room trouble, the front desk never gave us a hassle about getting another room. The room services and the staff in the restaurants do not speak much English. I know a little Spanish and with the help of my Spanish dictionary, was able to ask for washcloths and small bottles of water to be in our room everyday. (They give you a gallon bottle of water in every room). I did go to the dollar store and bought the maid little things. I left them on the bed everyday with a muchas gracias. The activities staff are very outgoing. There is something going on most of the day. They try to recruit everyone to join in. The nightly shows were not very good. There did things like imitating rock stars or skits from Lion King. We avoided them after the first couple of days.VIP is the way to go. Some of the things it included were: a bottle of rum, 3 cigars, one/person complimentary dinner in the pay restaurants, one/person 20 minute massage (the spa staff was great), one/person motorized sport (we did the banana boat - had lots of fun), 2 beach towels in our room (otherwise, you had to get towels everyday from the activities desk), 2 hours of internet, and premium liquors. Those who didn't do VIP had to pay $3.00 to $4.00 for premium drinks. There is a shopping district about a 5 minute bike ride away. We rode bikes there twice. The stores sell most of the same things. Bartering was pretty easy. The Dominicans don't seem to be high pressured. If we saw something in one store we liked but didn't like the price, we went to another till we got what we wanted for the price we wanted to pay. Around this same district is a casino. We had a trams that ran from our hotel to the casino. We did go one night and won some money playing slot machines. Overall, we had a wonderful time. We stayed at Secrets last year that was a 6 golden apple and were not too sure what the Caribe would be like as it was only a 4 apple. Believe me, we were very well pleased. I would recommend this as a great place to vacation. I know this was pretty wordy, but I just want to let you know that we really enjoyed ourselves and you should put this on your list of great vacation spots.  
<Date>Mar 5, 2005

<Author>Garfield1
<Content>Loved It Just got back from this resort, we were originally booked for a week at the Hamaca Hilton but they over booked by 28 couples and we were deverted to the Caribe Club Princess with an upgrade to VIP. First, let me say thanks to Air Canada for their quick work and the upgrades, you did a great job given the time frame. Second this resort was just wonderfull, food was great, room fantastic and the service was quick and friendly. If you are planning a trip for your family or as a couple give this place a second look the surroundings were beautiful and so was the beach. All the staff were helpfull and friendly, bus ride from the airport (La Romana) was a little long but when we arrived we were quickly registered and on our way to our room. Third if you are someone that can't roll with the punchs when traveling, I suggest you stay at home, travellers have to be prepared to make changes quickly and sometimes may not be able to go to the location they planned on going to, its no one persons fault sometimes it just happens. So make your compaint and then be done with it. Because frankly no one wants to hear about your childish complaining all week, I make this statement to just 2 couples from our friends in the United Statesmost of which were a pleasure to be with and I'm happy to say I'm glad we met and look forward to meeting again some day.Have a great trip to CARIBE CLUB PRINCESS RESORT

<Author>TravelingMomClev
<Content>Great hotel at a great price. We traveled with 2 children, 8yr old and 1yrd. and my mother. Used Apple Vacations. Direct flight out of Cleveland Feb 19-25. What a wonderful trip!!!!!Flight was fast and comfortable. USA 3000 staff very helpful with the children.Ride from airport also fast only 30 minutes if that. Nice bus with AC.Check in at hotel again easy with a little bump. We got there at noon, you can arrange your room but not check in till 3 pm. we knew this ahead of time. We had requested connecting rooms or at least on same floor ahead of time. But were given rooms in seperate bldg. not going to work. After much conversation they made a few changes. My mom was in our building but not our entrance or floor. Made for some running around but they tried.We had a Jr. Suite, two rooms and two baths. A little worn but clean and nice set up. Maid, Maria, wonderful woman. Knew VERY little english but this did not stop us from connecting. She tried very hard and worked very hard for us and the children.Activities galor. If you cant find some fun at this hotel dont bother going on vacation because something is wrong with you. The beach is close, again great when you have kids, the pool was wonderful a little cool but you got used to that. The animation staff, works their butts off. Tip them all whenever you see them they deserve it.Food -- Well depends what you expect. For an all inclusive trip that cost us less than $900 a person I cant complain. The ala carte rest. were very good. The buffet fed a lot of people and for the most part is very good. Just a little bland for my taste. But the variety is definately there. The fresh fruit I loved and the oatmeal at breakfest was to die for. No kidding you got to try it!!!!NO One in my party got even the slightest sick from the food or water. And all of us have touchy stomachs. Even the baby ate off the buffet and had no problems.To address some things I have read before.English not spoken, NOT TRUE. They try very hard to comunicate with you LEARN some spanish before you go. Its their country not ours. Be respectful.NO hot water -- NOT TRUE - yes it is better to shower after 5 pm everyday for the hotest water. Why shower before the beach anyway.Weather - was wonderful. Two days of off and on rain then clear sailing. It is windy but that adds to the beach fun and keeps you cool when the sun is out. Use lots of sunscreen. The sun is decieving.Last the staff. I NEVER met a rude person. The smiles were everywhere.My son was sick 2 days, he got it before we left I am sure, cold. When he got sick at the breakfest table I did not even have a chance to help him. The waiter scooped him up and headed to the bath before I could blink and then would not accept a tip for all her help. They are lovely people who appreciate our visit and the TIPS please tip them well they work so hard. They also love children VERY much. Fell very safe if you are traveling with children. I was worried after reading some posts and feel that it was all a waste of time.Go relax and enjoy yourself. This hotel is worth the cost and worthy of more attention.The VIP program is worth every penny get it if you can.

<Author>emma'smom
<Content>What a wonderful Resort! This resort is a little piece of paradise! My husband and I just got back from spending a week there, and we would both highly recommend this resort.Our check-in went smooth. Make sure to put the tags they tell you to on your bags, then after a drink at the lobby bar, your bags will be waiting for you at your room. We ate the following restaurants: Mexican (okay), Italian (would go back), Chinese (we at there twice!), and Brazilian (would go back to also). Make sure you also check out the Creperie, it's a nice break from pizza and fries for lunch. We tried the lobster, salmon, ham and cheese, spinach and a few dessert ones and they were all wonderful!We went to almost every nightly show on the main stage, and they do a good job of entertaining the variety of nationalities in the crowd. Note: the Animation staff that tries so hard to get you to do activities all day, is the same people on stage for over an hour at night. And after the lobby bar party gets done, they rehearse until 2 or 3 in the morning. They work very hard to make sure everyone is having a great time, and they are really good at remembering your name. We can't say enough great things about the animation staff.There is so much to do during the day: bocce ball, shuffle board, darts, archery, ping pong, volleyball (sand or pool), scuba lessons, dance lessons, stretching, water aerobics, water polo, mini golf, spanish lessons, or our favorite, just relaxing by the pool and soaking up the sun.If you want to do some shopping, I would recommend walking down the beach (toward the Riu), it's about a 10 minute walk, and the shop workers aren't as pushy as the ones in the shopping area.I wouldn't recommend the casino, but we would recommend the disco at least once. Drinks are only free though from 11 - 12 there.Make sure to also bring your own drink glass, as the drinks come in smaller glasses, and if you're really thirsty, you'll have it down by the time you get back to your chair.The walk through the mangroves isn't bad at all, and you get to see many different flowers and small animals.There are 3 pools, so check them all out before you give up on finding chairs, as a lot of people save them very early in the morning.I hope this helps, and enjoy your vacation in paradise!  
<Date>Feb 24, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Had a lot of fun and rum  Background:3rd AI trip. I'm 30, wife is 27. From Minnesota. Went Feb 12 - 19, 2005Check-InFast and easy. They take your luggage to your room and leave it at the door (not inside). Had a few drinks at the lobby bar before venturing to the room. It is maybe a 1/4 mile walk from the lobby to the rooms. There is a trolly, but we only took it once. The walk through the mangroves is kinda nice, especially after dinner. RoomsWe had a JR suite (#3354) which had a sitting room with a daybed and TV, and then the bedroom with 2 full size beds. Vaulted ceilings were nice. Mini fridge had 2 cokes, and 2 Sprites as well as a jug of bottled water. No beer or alcohol. Only real problem in the room has been mentioned many times here was hot water. Either was luke warm or took 30 minutes to get warm. Bars9 including the temporary one during the shows and the one in the disco. The one in the buffet by the Shanghay restaurant is 24 hours.PoolsThere are 3 pools. 2 where the Animation staff gets you involved, and one that was virtually always empty that was a quiet pool to just lounge around. Always seats and no thumping music. The main pool with the swim up bar has all the seats reserved by 8am. I wanted to play devils advocate once and gather all the towels up to see what would happen, but chickened out. FoodBuffet was OK. Not as good as RIU in Playa. After the first 2 nights, we ate at the ala carte places in this order: Italian, Chinese, Mexican, Brazillian, Chinese. They were all very good. The one place that is different is Le Creperie. Crepes and ice cream. The ham/cheese crepe is a great change for lunch. The lobster one was also good. The sweet ones are also wonderful. Seems that many people must not know about this because they don't adventure around the resort.BeachBeautiful beach. Lots of of the little shade huts to use. Maybe a 1/2 - 3/4 mile walk to the flea market (to the left if you are looking at the ocean). ShowsSome were very good, others OK. They have 14 different ones so they don't overlap for the Europeans who go for 2 weeks. After the shows they also entertain in the lobby bar until midnight. We saw the staff practicing one night. Makes you realize how hard they work. They were up until between 2 and 3 am rehearsing. WeatherVery windy the first few days. Changed to breezy after that. Two cloudy days. The sun was HOT, so the breeze actually helped out a lot. TripsWe booked the Monster Truck with Fast Eddie in the lobby. $85 each. It was well worth it. Saw a real home, a cock fight (they had protective stuff on the spurs so they didn't hurt eachother), fruit plantation, school, store, witch doctor, and more poverty than I'd like to. We read before to bring stuff to give to kids and glad we did. School supplies and candy. Other people brought clothes, shoes, baseball caps, toys. They give them to the poor Hatian kids towards the end of the trip. (Their parents make $6 a day!) Full day getting picked up at 7:15 and getting back at 6:30.StaffVery friendly. Limited English on a lot, but you can get around it. JC, and Isreal were awesome to talk to. They let us know their lifestyles, and how things worked there. CasinoSmall. Drinks are free as long as you are playing. 8 deck blackjack shoes. Weird thing was you could get insurance with a face card up on the dealer, not just an ace. Kinda goofy. OverallAll in all we had a fabulous time. Met some new friends (Sarah and Mike), and got a lot of sun. I'd recommend the VIP (we didn't). You can get bottles of beer rather than tap, and also premium drinks like Kahlua. For the $75 I hear it is per person, it is well worth it. There really isn't much to do outside the resort, as far as a city center to visit. Daily excursions are your only real choice. I would definately go back here but there are too many other places to see in the world before going back to DR anytime soon. I would recommend it though to anyone looking at going. If I never hear Welcome to the Club Man and Mueve Mueve again, that will be perfectly fine with me. People who have been there will understand, and probably laugh.   
<Date>Feb 21, 2005

<Author>7asprinter
<Content>Caribe was nice We stayed at the Caribe from 1/29-2/05, It was quite lovely....The beach was absolutely beautiful!! Beware of the sun, it is extreme sunlight there and please bring your sunblock....There were a couple nights that I didn't feel well and I am sure it was because of having to much sun.....We had nice weather, when we came in (sat) it was cloudy and cool, and it rained really hard that night or the next I cannot remember, but it is always very windy there, which is nice because the sun is so hot, but when it is cloudy, it is cool....We had a poolview room, which we were very satisfied, we could have been stuck on other side and seen nothing....We also brought the maid personal items and they were nice...I realize that when you go to a foreign country you have to account for non english speaking people, but we really had a hard time sometimes, you sometimes had to point at pictures for certain drinks, they have a drink book at the bars....The flea market down the beach to the left was quite a walk, I would guesstimate it at 35-45 minutes..,,, which is ok for younger people but if you are elderly, you might want to take a cab, my mom is 70 and she did it once but she wouldn't have walked it again...We had a really good time with some on the animation staff, Papi and Juan Carlos were really fun....The food, WELL----------I would highly recomment the Mexican restaurant or any dish with Chicken.... The main Buffet that you didn't have to have reservations for well it was like a lot of the food tasted the same like they use a main spice in all their dishes and it makes a lot of it taste the same, I am not really picky, but by end of week I survived on Pizza and french fries....We also ate at the italian rest and the brazilian, and the seafood, and I don't have much to say about them in terms of goodness, we had lobster one night and it was not good.... the Brazilian restaurant was nice cause they just brought a bunch of stuff to try, you didn't order off a menu....We ended up being Vip, We didn't know it but I guess it was because we booked early, I also booked a 1 hr massage at spa in addition to our free 20 min one for being vip, but I wish I would have saved my money and had my regular girl back home do it.... I mean it was ok but she just did a hard rub, something my 9 year old could have accomplished.. I am not complaining at all but I probably would not return to this resort because of the food, I would try something on the other side like La romana....Also if you are going Apple beware, our return flight ended up being delayed like 7 hours... And since our reg apple girl at hotel was off that day, noone bothered to come and tell us and we ended up in the hotel lobby for 7.5 hours, good thing they have comfy couches..... After our bus never came and picked us up, we got the emergency apple # and called and they said oh your plane is delayed 2 hours and we were like well was anyone going to let us know that, then approx 1.5 hours later an Apple rep came to tell us that is was delayed an additional 4 hours, he was very very rude, and didn't offer us a room to go to while we waited, use of the phone or anything....It made for a very long day...., the thing that really made us mad was that when we finally got picked up that night, we went to the other resorts to pick the other people up and everyone at every one ot the resorts were informed by noon that there was a delay, and we didn't get told until 4:30pm.....I really recommend the trip to Saona Island, it was beautiful and you can find many many cool shells and coral there.....If anyone has any questions please feel free to email me....thanks Tina

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Most amazing vacation ever! Me and 5 other friends went to Caribe Club on May 8 of last year. We are all 20  21 years-old from Toronto and let me tell you, we couldn't have picked a better resort. We had the most amazing experience at Caribe Club and we would definetely recommend it to anyone wanting to visit Punta Cana. Arrival: When we arrived at the resort, we knew automatically we would have a blast, just from the look of the lobby. It was big and gorgeous. We were checked-in right away and served a drink as we were checking in! Since our rooms weren't ready for another few hours, we decided to hit up the lobby bar (the staff at the lobby bar is amazing) and go swimming. A great way to start the vacation, except me and my best friend both lost our sunglasses in the ocean! Not cool. Rooms: The rooms were extremely nice. We had 3 people in each room and 2 beds, but the beds were big and we all had lots of space. Don't bring any food into your hotel room. One person did that and they attracted ants. But you won't get ants if you keep the food out of your room! The maids cleaned our rooms every day. They were really sweet, we brought them some gifts (perfume, makeup, etc.) and they were very grateful. One maid gave us chocolate one day!Food: The food was fine. I know everyone expects the worst when they go to the Caribbean, but really it was fine. The buffet was huge with lots of variety. The Pasta Bar was the best, the chef lets you choose your own noodles, sauce and toppings and makes it right in front of you. Just stay away from anything you don't think will sit right. We never went hungry, we ate like pigs! Just be careful of the eggs, someone was sick one day and we narrowed it down to possibly the eggs. The a-la-cartes were ok, the Chinese one was probably the best. We weren't too impressed with the Italian or the Mexican, but again, you never go hungry. The 24 hr bar has good food too (fries, pizza, hot dogs) if you really need something to eat.Staff: Well what is there to say about the animation staff at Caribe Club? They were probably one of the reasons we had such an amazing trip. Even though they would make us do dance lessons when we were hung over by the pool, we still loved them. They put on an amazing show every night and it's obvious they work very hard to make sure you have fun! If you are a girl between the ages of 18-25, they will love you even more. They were really funny and sweet. I miss them!Other stuff: There is one disco at the resort where locals come to party too. The disco is great, they play a variety of Dominican music and American music like Britney Spears, 50 Cent, etc. It was a blast. Watch out for the locals though, they will constantly hit on you if you're a girl but they are generally nice.The beer at Caribe is probably the best beer I've ever had. Presidente all the way!! The fruity drinks are good too. My recommedation for drinks is Tequila Sunrise and Long Island Iced Tea. The bartenders at Caribe know how to make a mean drink!The beach and pool are awesome. Don't forget there is a beach BBQ grill, right beside the 24 hr bar. We didn't notice it there until our last day! They have burgers, ribs, baked potatoes, etc.Walk up to the straw market, about a 15 minute walk down the beach to the left. Lots of vendors, and although they are sometimes hard to bargain with, we got some great stuff to bring home for good prices.The mangrove is awesome, it was always fun stumbling through it at 3am after a night at the disco. It leads from the hotel rooms to the lobby. But if you can't walk through it, there is a little train that makes stops at all the buildings. It was so much fun and dropped you right off in front of your building or the lobby.If you want to go to Punta Cana, I strongly recommend this resort. When trying to think of any negative feedback, I honestly couldn't think of any. We had the most amazing time and met some great people from around the world. The resort is gorgeous, the food is good and the staff is amazing. What more can I say?  
<Date>Feb 7, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best vacation ever! I went with 5 other people to Caribe Club Princess in May/2004. We were in the age group of (20-21). We paid approx 1200$ canadian and I have to say it was worth every penny. I will try to be as detailed as possible:When we arrived at the hotel, the first thing we saw was the lobby, and lets just say from there we knew we had picked the right resort. The lobby is huge and beautiful with plently of comfortable couch like chairs and a big bar. We went to the front desk to get our rooms and were greated with friendly smiles and drinks were put in our hands. Our rooms weren't ready when we got there, but no big deal, we hit the bar at the lobby and were already pretty drunk within 45min of being there. I am not sure if this is because we were younger or not, but the bartenders were NOT stingy with the booze and were pouring at least 3/4 of the cup with rum or whatever booze you wanted! I would say our rooms were ready within an hour or an hour and a half, but who's counting, just sit back and relax with a drink and wait. Also if you have never traveled before, you should always bring your bathing suit and a towel with you in your carry-on bag, as there is washrooms that you can change in and you can go lay by the pool, or go to the beach just remember to bring the important stuff with you if your rooms aren't ready..such as digital cameras, money, passports..etc..and keep them in your carry-on bag and bring the bag with you to the pool or beach.Now this place is huge! The lobby is about 10min walk from the beach and your hotel room, however there is a little train (golf-cart type) that will pick you up from the lobby and take you to your hotel room (it runs about 14 hours out of the day). However the walk was nice as you walk through a man-grove which for those who don't know what that is: it is a beautiful pathway surrounded by trees, flowers...etc and it was very nice walking through it and they also played music from little speakers while you passed. But if you were too drunk, or tired to walk, just wait a few minutes for the train. Also if you started walk cause the train was taking a bit longer if the train was passing by while you walked it would stop and pick you up if you waved them down.The Hotel was very nice as were our rooms....we were 3 people in each room and had asked to be placed close together and we managed to get rooms side by side which was great. Rooms were very clean...actually I found my room cleaner then hotels here in Canada and the Maids are just wonderful! We each pitched in about 15$ (all 6 of us) and went to the dollar store before we left to get things to give the maids (we bought those little b-day bags to put the stuff in and we gavew our maid something everyday and she loved it. We did tip the bartenders quite a lot and we did get better service...also we were with 4 attractive girls so that may have helped when they went up for drinks too. Either weay I always had a drink. The middle of the hotel was open air so if it rained it would rain in the middle of the hotel into the gardens at the bottom, and it was very pretty (the hallways were very wide and well protected if it rained). Do watch out for the stairs if it rains, as they do get a little wet and slippery (no one fell that I know of)The beach was fantastic! White sand...clear water, and we did walk up and down the beach and saw other resorts and I can honestly say we had the best part of the beach. The LTI resort is beside ours..but quite a walk away and that resorts beach had quite a lot of seaweed and darker waters (little scary for my liking). The Pool was huge! and the swim-up bar was great...if you are a smoker, remember to remove your smokes before going in the water as I ruined 2 full packs that way...but then again I was drunk.Ok the food...Actually in my opinion it was great....I had no bath-room problems the entire week...a few of my friends did...nothing serious that ruined there vacation but we believe this was more do to the excessive drinking, laying in the sun, the food, and the fruity drinks (natural laxitive people - coconut). And it isn't like anyone really had the runs but they just went to the bathroom more frequently....but I guess you would when you start drinking at 10am and don't stop until about 6am then sleep for like 4 hours. I found the fresh made pasta bar to be the safest and best way to go with the food. The Chinese a la carte was excellent....we were a little nervous about that one....but it was great....stay away from the Mexican a la carte...we all hated it and had to go to the buffet right after for some proper food. And the Italian was excellent as well!There is a 24 hour bar that is by the beach and right by the hotel/your rooms and was great for drinking the rest of the night away after the DISCO! The disco was actually at another resort, that is beside us, but it is about a 3 minute walk from the lobby and completely safe as you are still on the grounds and don't have to leave the grounds to go. The disco was a hit and miss....but we made some good friends there and we owned that club! If you are looking for Cancun type place then don't bother, we made our own fun and had a blast and it was great to meet people from Canada/Toronto/Montreal. We had a Canadian theme night the we planed with the others that we met and did that at the 24 hour bar and had a blast withabout 20 people.The animation staff are great! they trying everything to get you off your --- and get involved in the activities....girls beware...they come on strong...and it seem the whiter you are the more they want you...so if you are really pasty and big chested beware!Ok this is getting a bit long...so to wrasp it up....the place is huge...great big pool, lobby is beautiful!, the beach is excellent...foood was not bad in my opinion, but if you were to ask my friend who is a picky eater she wouldn't agree, but she didn't starve either and always found something to eat. If you are young and you can get a good deal on this resort then do it!!!!! you won't regret....just make sure to have a good size group (5 or 6 people) and make your own fun..thats what we did and had the best time of our lives! And if you go here I hope you do to.  
<Date>Feb 7, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>One Short Week In Paradise WOW! How time flys when you have fun. My wife and I returned from Punta Cana on the 29th of January. We were there for a week, and all we can think about is the fantastic time we had. At firsth the arrival at the airport seemed a bit overwhelming, but once we met with our Air Canada rep, we were directed on which of the many buses to go on. Hang onto your bags at the airport, the locals like to help out by loading luggage onto a cart and take it to your bus. Little did I know, the expected a $5/bag tip. The trip to the hotel was a bit longer then we expected, but the view from the bus window was well worth the trip. Once arriving to the hotel, the first thing you notice is the size of the lobby and the shiny floors, and friendly staff whom immediately offer you a non-alcoholic drink. We were at the counter almost immediately, recived our wrist bands and were whisked off to our hotel by the shuttle (with our baggage). As we have read about complaints of the distant walk from the lobby to the hotel, it is a very beautiful walk along that path, and we did not use the shuttle our entire time there for that reason. Although we were supposed to recieve an ocean/pool view, once arriving to the room, we noticed the view was a garden view. If we looked to the left, we could however see the ocean. The said they would change it the next day, but we enjoyed the peacefull view.. and needless to say, it is not every moring you can wake up, look from your bed to see a palm tree with coconuts. The staff was wonderful, helful and funny. We tiped the maid daily, and she made beautiful arrangements with the towels and real flowers each morning and evening. The room was cleaned throughout the day. Never once did we have to ask for clean towels. The food  drinks were great. We tried almost all foods and drinks. It was fantastic. We did not get sick, nor did we know of anyone that was. If anyone was not feeling well, it had to do with geting too much sunshine. (People, USE SUNSCREEN). It is nice to be tanned, but even in the shade of the grass umbrellas, you still get tanned. The sun rays are that intense. We loved it. We would go back to the Caribe Club Princess in a minute. The beaches were clean, the ocean was beautiful and warm and boogie boarding was a blast. IF you want to be busy, you can. If you want to relax you can. There is always something to do there as the staff animation crew invites you to the activities. The theatre shows are spectacular which start at 9:45pm to 11:00pm. THe disco however was a bit on the loud side for us, but we went to check it out and to our surprise, it was quite fun. If you don't try things, you'll never know what you missed. One excursion we recommend is the catamaran trip to Saona Island. For $80 US/person, it was a day trip we will never forget. THere is snorkleing, crusing for hours on a big, fun catamaran while dancing and drinking rum. You end up on one of the most beautiful secluded virgin Islands. On our way back, the speedboat dropped us off in an Ocean pool where you are chest high in crystal clear Caribbean water with starfish all around you. THere are other fun excursions, depending on the amount of time you want to be away from the resort, and how much money you want to spend. We went VIP all inclusive. One tip ... book your meals and massage early. We waited a few days to book our massage, and we only got it at noon the last day. They were kind enough to extend our last day stay by a one hour to shower up after the massage. All in all, we had the trip of a lifetime. We highly recommend it. If anyone has anything to complain about a trip to the Caribe Club Princess, get a life. A special thanks to Mylene (Air Canada Rep.), Ingrid (our maid), Eduard  Hector (Bartenders), Isabell (Shangay Restaurant), Onix (Staff Animation) and Tony from the Cigar Shop, you and many others made our stay a very enjoyable one.  
<Date>Feb 6, 2005

<Author>Koh_Nat
<Content>Great experience !!! Hello everybodyI hope this review can give you a lot of useful information! If you like luxury, good food, delicious drinks and a tropical atmosphere, THIS IS YOUR PLACE!I stayed there together with my boyfriend (we are in our early twenties) for one week in the beginning of January 2005. This was my second time in the Dominican Republic - I was there a couple of years ago, but in another hotel! Enjoy reading my comments!Check-in was very easy, we arrived late at night, everthing was ready, the lady at the reception was friendly and did speak English! When we entered the room, we noticed immediately - WE GOT AN UPGRADE!!! We stayed in a room consisting out of two rooms and two bathrooms! One room had two sofas, a television and a bathroom with extremely large shower, a toilet and a wash basin. The other room had two double beds, a minibar and a huge bathroom with toilet, bath and wash basin! Our minibar was stocked with 7-up, coke and a big bottle of still water every day. Unfortunately we had no seaview, but I am not going to complain... we had a nice and spacious balcony with poolview!The maid service was very good - they know how to keep it clean, and I think that is very important! About the restaurants : we tried most of them! Generally very good and tasteful food. The buffet is huge which means there is something for everybody. At the buffet I especially liked the pastabar. You can choose your own pasta + ingredients and a waiter makes it for you while you are waiting! In the morning you can eat whatever you like and they have also fresh tropical juices, yes... even in an all inclusive-resort: mango, passionfruit, pine-apple,... Diner :The Mexican restaurant is the best! I really enjoyed the fajitas with chicken! You get a nice portion of chicken on a warm plate and you make them yourself! The food is nicely presented on beautiful plates, nearly a piece of art! The Brazilian restaurant is very cozy and romantic... it is near the sea! They come with huge pieces of roasted meat to the table and give you what you want from it! It is served with fresh salad and french fries.The Italian restaurant is also delicious - try as a starter the mozzarella! The plates are extremely beautiful and taste like in Italy, believe me! In general the service of the waiters couldn't be better! They are friendly, smile a lot and are helpful! The grounds and the beach couldn't be more beautiful... nice, soft, white sand and turquoise water - no seaweed or rocks! The weather was not always fine, but we didn't care... we got some rain, but after a couple of minutes, it was sunny!When you walk to the left on the beach, there are a few shops (jewellery, souvenirs,...) It is worth a visit!I hope lots of people visit this hotel in the near future, because the Dominican people deserve it! And I can assure you... when you look at the other hotels... The Caribe Club Princess looks really cosy and beautiful!  
<Date>Feb 4, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved It I just returned last night from the Caribe Club Princess. My Finance and I now wife got married at the resort. It was absolutely perfect. I have to admit we were scared at first, but everything was planned to a T. After some of the reviews I was really scared. The resort was so beautiful; the people were so nice and if you plan to get married there definitely go for the Honeymoon package. The room was spectacular. Be very patient if you only speak English, some people can?????????t understand you. We found that to be one of the best parts of the trip is learning some Spanish. I would recommend this Island to everyone, best trip so far.

<Author>divetraveler
<Content>All inclusive??? Got there after customs stole our New Years Eve meal from us at the airport. There was a 3+ hour wait for the room (expected as warned here) and we were afraid to leave the suitcase un-attended (after the kind welcome) so we spent the time in the lobby. Had to beg and advise the staff as to what is included in the VIP package. The room was nice enough and the view on the courtyard was nice. No ocean view from the balcony, but I could judge the wind speed, which was a constant 12-20 knots. The afternoons were cooled by a little drizzle every day and a healthy rain in the early am. The pool was nice and cool, a bit too cool to spend much time in as it was about 70 deg as was the jacuzzi. The beach was very nice, but festooned with plastic beach chairs, so there was a jumble of man made stuff on the sand. The shore is a windward shore so the sea is a bit rough for kids or elderly. All the food was pretty poor and there is no fresh fish to be had in this ISLAND PARADISE (hmm!!) and not much ripe fruit either. The fruity rum drinks? All powdered mixes {:-( Want a cappuccino? Go to the lobby since all the other restaurants have machines with mechanical problems (I suspect, no flavored cofee mixes supplied) so they are simply effigys to a cappuccino!! The ala carte restaurants? Don't! You can prepare a better meal from scavenging the buffet and creating your own dish. All the cuts of beef were magically a ribeye (butchered incorrectly so as to be stringy and chewy) cooked reasonably well. The service is pitiful!! A full house in a restaurant is 3-5 tables in a 12-25 table setting. 1.5-2.5 hours to get a meal served. You order a coke and it comes in 15-30 mins. I know we live in an I want it now society, but these folks would die if they worked in a Manhattan restaurant. The scene is geared to loud music and partying so if it's the sea you want to hear, go down to the waters edge. The motorized water sports are represented as a ride on a banana boat, an elongated float towed behind a boat, or a sail in a Hobie 14. I inquired about the sailing and found I needed a 15 minute test sail (as a certified racing crew of class boats I have a bit of experience) and this is included in your half hour a day. Thats 15 minutes with the guy and 15 minutes with my fiancee. I foolishly thought we might get two hours of sailing. I thought 1 hour + 1 hour equalled 2 hours. I guess that 19 years of engineering was all for naught! {:-) Ah well!!We went fishing nearshore on a 35 foot sport fisherman and the seas were running 4-7'. A bit rough for novices. Everyone but me and a kid got violently ill so we returned to shore. I went back out and spent a bit of time showing the guys how to place the baits in the wake and tie a few new knots. Decent boat and the captain and mates were pretty good for being somewhat new to this stuff. Sorry to sound a bit snobby... I simply have fished offshore for over 25 years and learned and worked with some very good captains.The resort is quite commercialized and seems geared to a theme park crowd. Not my style, but to each his/her own.Would I go back? Naah... I can do far better for the money and live among the locals, on their terms and have a culturally enriching and fun time. I love to fish and dive, so I get to learn and teach as well as experience the real deal in a place.  
<Date>Jan 17, 2005
