<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Four Star Resort in a Third World Country My daughter and I just returned from a week at the Caribe Club Princess resort in Punta Cana. We booked our trip through Apple Vacations and paid for the upgrade to the VIP package. A phenomenal deal for an all inclusive for two people at a cost of less than $2,000. This week in paradise was part of my daughter鈥檚 college graduation gift. Paradise it was! To leave Philadelphia鈥檚 30 degree weather and bask in the warmth of the Caribbean sun for 5 days was pure heaven. The Dominican people who work at the resort are warm, friendly and always anxious to please. The resort is abundantly staffed with these nice people; it sometimes seemed the ratio of guest to staff was 1 to 1.We truly had a wonderful time and it was hard to leave at the end of our stay. What is necessary to remember while at any resort in the Dominican Republic is the fact that it is a third world country and a country that鈥檚 been in the tourism business for a relatively short period of time. I believe I read that 80% of the resorts are less than 10 years old with half of those built in the last 5 years. If you鈥檝e never visited a third-world country and can鈥檛 imagine what it鈥檚 like, it will become abundantly clear to you on the ride from the airport to your resort. I鈥檓 going to list some of the things that can be upsetting to you in the hopes that your awareness will enable you to overcome and enjoy your stay:鈥anguage. Spanish is the primary language of Dominicans and the majority of the resort staff speak no English at all. Even the Guest Services staff and the folks behind the front desk spoke very little English. Buy a small translation book and you鈥檒l get your messages across adequately enough.鈥ater. Don鈥檛 drink the tap water and use bottled water when brushing your teeth. They told us that the water served at the tables in the restaurants had been purified; however we didn鈥檛 trust it and drank only bottled. Bottled water is abundant and available at all restaurants and bars. We had also heard not to eat fresh fruits and vegetables because they are rinsed in the water. My daughter is a vegetarian, and if she couldn鈥檛 eat salads, her diet would have been limited to fruit and cheese. We both ate the salads and fresh vegetables and did not get sick. I鈥檓 happy to report that the Imodium and nausea medicine I packed was not needed!鈥ood. If you鈥檙e adventurous and like to experience new foods, this is the place for you. There was 鈥済oat鈥?on the buffet one day and all types of sausages the likes of which I鈥檝e never seen before. However, if you鈥檙e like me and enjoy eating foods you know the origin of, there is plenty for you as well. The fruits are wonderful: guava, mango, papaya, pineapple, banana. The breads are freshly baked and come in a wide variety. The cheeses are also quite good. Don鈥檛 expect margarine as there鈥檚 only butter; don鈥檛 look for sour cream for your nachos; the coffee is adequate, not great. oAnother very important thing you need to know about dining is that it will be necessary to make dinner reservations for any of the five restaurants each morning between the hours of 8:30 and 11:30. This cannot be done by phone, but rather by standing in line to sit with the Guest Services person. Even though I said the resort was well staffed, there is a serious misallocation of resources in this area as there is only one person to take restaurant reservations for the entire resort. Be prepared to waste valuable beach time in line 鈥?it could take up to an hour to get your turn with him. Also, if you have an excursion planned in the morning and cannot be there to make the reservation, you鈥檒l eat at the buffet that night. There are three seatings at the restaurants: 6:00, 8:00 and 9:30. The 6 and 8 seatings book first, so unless you get in line early, you may have to settle for a very late dinner.鈥oom.  oThere are no washcloths provided, you must specifically ask your maid for them. I spoke with a gentleman in the reservation line one morning who had asked his maid several times for washcloths and when she finally provided them, she removed all his towels so he was left with only washcloths. The lesson here is 鈥榖e careful what you ask for.鈥?The housekeeping and facilities staff do not speak or understand a word of English. 鈥淧lease provide both towels and wash cloths. Thank you.鈥?Translated to Spanish is: 鈥淧roporcione por favor afelpan y lavan telas. Gracias.鈥?You can write this and leave it near the sink for your maid. oThere are no instructions in the rooms for anything. Most resorts provide written directions for the phone and some information about the channels on the TV as well as the restaurants and activities available at the resort, but not here. And, unless you speak fluent Spanish, calling the front desk or guest services is not much help. We finally found out the secret to voice mail is dialing ext. 7000 to set up your mailbox message and retrieve messages.  oThere is no clock in the room, and I didn鈥檛 bother to find out if a wake up service is available because I wouldn鈥檛 have trusted it anyway. When you book an excursion in the morning, you have to be in the lobby to catch a bus at 7 am. There鈥檚 also the reservation line you want to get to early as well as the specific seating times for dinner, so it鈥檚 surprising that clocks are not provided. I had my husband call us from PA to wake us; you might want to pack a small alarm clock. oElectricity box. On the wall just inside the door there is a small box that takes the same key card as the door. There are no instructions on or near this box and my daughter and I had no idea why the card was there. Since the card didn鈥檛 work in the door, I assumed it was inadvertently left by the previous guests and I returned it to the front desk. When we returned to the room there was no power. After several hours and many calls to the front desk, they finally sent a person out to check our electricity. It turns out that the key card must be in that box in order for the room electricity to be on. Who knew!@? oShower. The best shower is the 'after beach' shower. The water pressure is surprisingly great; there is a handheld shower head (great to get sand out of those hard-to-reach-places!); the temperature was not hot enough for my daughter, but I thought it was just fine. o If you get a room on the third floor, be prepared to hike up and down the stairs as there are no elevators. This might be an issue for older folks, those with young children in strollers, or for someone like myself with a bad ankle. We were originally booked on the third floor, but were able to get it changed to a first-floor room with some persistent discussion. oMaid service. I had read in these reviews that it is customary to leave your maid small gifts instead of cash. Before I left home I wrapped up a few sample size body lotions and a couple of other items and left one on my pillow each morning. I know she appreciated these because our room was the first one cleaned every morning (before we returned from breakfast) and she straightened up after us at least three times each day. Each time we returned from the beach or pool we left a trail of sand and piles of clothes; but, miraculously, when next we returned to our room, the sand was gone and the clothes were neatly folded on the corner of the bed. Wow! She even returned each evening with an offering of fresh towels and wrapped chocolates. oTV 鈥?a remote control is available at the front desk, but you can鈥檛 get one until after you鈥檝e checked into your room because they need to know what kind of TV you have. You鈥檇 think they鈥檇 know this stuff, but they don鈥檛. So, if you want the use of a remote control, it will require an extra trip to the lobby (more about lobby trips later). There are about 10 channels on the tube, CNN is one of them along with a couple of movie channels. I was never able to find a local news or weather channel; I ended up using the internet in the lobby to find out the weather for the week oLocked safe. There鈥檚 a lockable safe in the closet which requires a lock and key from the front desk at $3 day. You鈥檒l need to get it before 4:00 because the person who handles them is gone after that. Since the maids do come and go from your room several times a day, it鈥檚 not a bad idea to keep your passport and jewelry locked up. oCheck in time is 3:00, but most flights arrive in the morning. We were actually at the resort before noon, but had no place to change into our suits for a swim because they don鈥檛 provide a hospitality suite for guests. Next time we鈥檒l wear our suits under our clothes so we鈥檙e not wasting beach time.鈥each. There are waves and the water is rough which surprised me. I had thought all of the Caribbean was calm, but since this beach is toward to north side (Atlantic side), there are waves. The water is blue and very clean 鈥?no seaweed, no fish. They keep the beach clean by raking each morning. Topless sunbathing is not unusual, but not real prevalent either. The beach chairs get claimed by around 10, but you can usually get one during the lunch hour if you miss the morning rush.鈥ools. There are three, but we only used one 鈥?the one with the swim-up bar. The poolside lounge chairs get claimed early; it seems to be common practice for towels to be placed to claim a chair and then to take off for three hours selfishly making the chair unavailable to those who are actually using the pool.鈥obby. The open-air lobby is breathtaking and a great place to sit on very plush, comfortable sofas and chairs, be refreshed by a constant Caribbean breeze and enjoy a book, a drink and just relax. To get there, however, is a hike from the rooms. The walk is about 10 minutes through a rather odorous mangrove or you could catch the bus that circulates continually around the resort. The bus is basically a golf cart pulling eight rows of seats.鈥IP upgrade. Last but not least is the very mysterious VIP upgrade. Mysterious because there is much discrepancy as to exactly what is provided in the upgrade and little direction on how to receive them. The Apple Vacation brochure list one group of items, the resort web site lists another, and the brochure at the check-in desk lists yet another. Naturally, the VIP upgrade we were to receive did not include nearly as many items as I thought it should and after much discussion with the front desk manager (whose English is poor) we finally agreed on the list in the brochure they provide. The next challenge was to actually obtain those items. Two of the items, a bottle of rum and cigars, weren鈥檛 delivered to our room until the evening before we checked out 鈥?and that was due only to repeated calls to guest services. The 20-minute massage requires a wait on line to make a reservation with, you guessed it, only one guest services person between the hours of 8:30 and 11:30. This is not the same guy with whom you make your dinner reservations... that would just be too easy. Different line, different building 鈥?AND, trial and error to find all this out because it鈥檚 not told to you by anyone, it鈥檚 not written anywhere and not everyone who works there knows about it. At one point I asked the staff working at the poolside activities desk where I needed to go to make my massage reservation and he pointed to a man walking away from me. I followed him for a few minutes and when I saw him join his family on the beach I realized he was merely another guest and I had been misdirected. I was just glad I hadn鈥檛 reached him before he reached his destination because I would have asked a perfect stranger for a massage! The free massage was given not at any of the four beachside massage cabanas, but rather at an interior courtyard cabana the location of which was not mentioned by my reservationist at the time of booking, but learned the hard way, by going to the wrong place and being redirected several times. However, I can say that the free meal at the seafood restaurant 鈥?a huge lobster tail grilled to perfection (that would have cost $25) and the 20-minute massage (as difficult as it was to book) was worth the price we paid for the upgrade.Enjoy paradise and remember 鈥?this is not the USA.

86	1(location):1	3(clean):1	5(time):4	7(walk):1	18(book):2	29(minute):2	30(beach):4	37(review):1	43(leave):1	46(free):1	54(door):2	56(morning):1	60(hour):1	67(call):1	72(resort):2	88(read):1	91(guest):1	105(husband):1	106(family):1	120(bus):2	144(short):1	147(business):1	162(hard):1	183(wall):1	188(line):1	244(mention):1	272(world):1	280(buy):1	292(card):1	300(maid):1	339(key):1	353(instead):1	375(remember):1	408(inside):1	427(wrong):1	435(courtyard):1	460(prepare):1	482(follow):1	504(seat):1	514(dominican):1	530(country):2	532(third):1	540(catch):1	554(wake):1	607(realize):1	684(North):1	703(learn):1	715(pack):1	730(massage):2	790(basically):1	836(wave):1	852(gift):1	858(pull):1	913(relatively):1	928(waste):1	931(caribbean):1	945(box):1	1012(golf):1	1026(interior):1	1082(cash):1	1134(republic):1	1155(calm):1	1290(join):1	1291(clock):1	1322(cart):1	1331(period):1	1380(alarm):1	1638(row):1	1809(message):1	1935(valuable):1	2494(atlantic):1	2897(tourism):1	2963(cabana):1	3209(beachside):1	3239(adequately):1	3322(cabanas):1	3378(merely):1	3382(rake):1	3831(continually):1	4358(translation):1	6211(circulate):1	6228(mangrove):1	6424(p.a):1	7291(reservationist):1	7464(customary):1	11729(redirect):1

<Author>david04047
<Content>Great Resort Caribe Club PrincessLinda and Dave, Maine, USADecember 11th 鈥?19th My husband and I just returned from the Caribe Club Princess, we decided to book a last minute trip to Punta Cana. We had picked the Caribe Club Princess, so I decided to read the reviews. I am so glad I did not listen to what I had read. This is our 6th trip to the Dominican Republic, and 2nd one to Punta Cana. I love the Punta Cana Airport. Leaving the plane into that Caribbean air is so great. The process from the Plane through the airport went quickly with no problems at all. From Punta Cana airport it was about 陆 hr trip to the resort. We found the lobby beautiful. Very large and very clean. The Floors were so shinny, you could almost see yourself in them. The check in was very quick and very pleasant. They tag your luggage and it was at the room before we got there. Of course we had to try the Bar in the Lobby before we set off to find our room. Richard at the reception spoke very good English and was a GREAT help to us. We took a 鈥渢rolly鈥?to the room. We were disappointed in the room, as we wanted at least a Pool View Balcony, and got a terrace room by the kiddie section. I went back to reception and talked to Richard. He told me to come back the next day and things would be changed. True to his word he had a different room for us. It was a great room, Pool/Ocean View Balcony. The room was very nice and very clean. Not sure what time the maid got there to clean daily because were on the beach or at the pool all day. I didn鈥檛 go on vacation to stay in my room, but we love to sit there in the morning and the evening and enjoy we view and warm weather. The Beach was great, always clean and always plenty of room. We had no problem getting a hut for shade every day. The Pool had plenty for room and the Pool Bar was great. The food was the best of any resort that we have been to. We never did get to the Buffet for Lunch, but we ate at the Beach Grill, the food there was great. The Ribs were the best ever, inside they had a variety of food, and hot sandwiches which you could make yourself. We tried the Italian and Chinese Ala Cart Restaurants and found them VERY GOOD. We did not get a chance to try the other two. The Buffet was so good that we ate there most nights. After reading some of the other reviews I didn鈥檛 know what to expect of the Food. If you cant find something good to eat then I am not sure what the problem is. We found the food Excellent and never once got sick. They had such a variety for all types of people. The Pasta was super, cooked to your liking, as well as the breakfast with the omelets, cooked to your liking. Of course all that food with Desserts every night, I managed to put on a few pounds. The staff was all great and very helpful. If they did not understand English they would find someone that did. I could not find anything wrong with this resort. It was a very pleasant,excellent vacation. The one day that it rained all day, the staff kept you busy. So the day was not a total loss. We walked the beach a lot and went to the 鈥渇lee market鈥?and dickered with the dominicans. We had a great time talking with them. And came home with a few treasures. As well as shirts for everyone鈥?Lots of Shirts. We already knew not to take the first price they give you, so I drove a hard bargain. But also gave them a gift from the States. I did leave a gift along with a tip for the maid every day as well as a tip for the bartenders that waited on us. They were all so nice and friendly that they deserved something. I cant say enough great things about this resort. The check in, rooms, food, beach, Pool, bars, etc all rate a 6 star with us. We did not try the Disco nor make the entertainment at night. Too much Beach and Bar made us tired after we had supper. The Disco and Entertainment was up by the lobby so you never got disturbed by the noise. We made several trips to the lobby, but always walked, we didn鈥檛 find it that far and the exercise was much needed. I would definitely go back as well as recommend this resort to anyone. Remember to ask for Richard at the reception if you have any trouble, he was a GREAT help. SUPER VACATION !!!, GREAT RESORT.

<Author>mariect
<Content>5 Stars Hotel =) Let me start saying that this is the second review I wrote and that the Hotel is classifed as a 4 * Sup but for me is a 5 Star all the way. The first time I go was on July and my second was from November 25 to November 28, 2004. Imaging how much fun I have that I allready separted my third trip in the travel agency to the last week of March. I have to admit that my first language is spanish so language no was a problem. But I look every single person in the Hotel and every employee do the best to treat them like kings and Queens. The Animation Staff work so hard from 8 Am to 12 AM with no break no rest. They are amazing and from July I have a new group of friends. I visit Dominican Republic many times and this is the only Hotel I like from the lobby to the room, two beautiful pools, the clean and sweet beach and the amazaing hospitality of their people. People need to understand that you go to a different country where people have million of problems and they do their best to get a little money. If you want to have a great vacation Caribe Club Princess is the Hotel you should visit.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Beach Resort was very nice and the beach was great. Been to many other places in the Carribean, and found that the staff spoke liitle or no English (even at the front desk), the food was the most bland (bring your own hot sauce or spices) and the alcoholic beverages were awful. Every drink I had was like rubbing alcohol. Even the beer was like beer flavored rubbing alcohol. I'm not a picky eater or drinker by any means. Entertainment wasn't worth while, and the same music was played day and night for the whole week. A cheap place to visit, but just bring your own booze and spices. Have fun

<Author>Travelingshow
<Content>First class all the way Reading some reviews makes me wonder if the critical reviewers were at the same resort. Our week (Nov. 7-14) was first class all the way. Excellent and clean accomodation, good service, freindly hotel staff and great food. Fully deserving of its 4-star rating. A very tastefully decorated resort with three magnificient pools and one of the best beaches anywhere; no rocks, no weeds, in fact... no fish! We even wondered where the fauna was; no flies (during our stay), no birds picking at your food (in fact we only saw 4-5 birds all week) and I only saw one lizzard and one cat all week. Oh yes, and three dogs about one kilometer up the beach. The idea of being able to eat at full service restaurants instead of the usual buffet was refreshing and the food excellent. We particularly enjoyed the Pescatore, the Chinese, and the Italian. Apparently the best might be La Cava but we didn't get a chance to try it out. Honestly, these are the islands and visitors should not expect a replica of the USA. This resort is excellent and very clean, Dominicans smiley and friendly, the beach outstanding and you have to be unlucky not to be happy here. Three little points to watch for however:1. If you want a more quiet area ask for a room away from the main pool where all the action is.2. Exercise programs (stretching, fitness, etc...) are weak (compared to Club Med).3. Be careful with the exchange rate. The Spa within the resort has a different rate from the hotel; this is not right. They should coordinate. Otherwise enjoy this great resort. We came with Air Canada Vacations; the on-site rep was most knowledgeable and helpful. GT  
<Date>Nov 16, 2004

<Author>jamaicasun
<Content>Planning my 2nd trip back to this great hotel! I have been a travel agent for over 20years and have stayed in everything from budget to 5Star properties. I have to admit after reading some reviews, I was surprised at how incredibly picky some travellers are!!!!In the Caribbean, chances are you will wait a bit for you room to be ready. So drop your bags and go have a cold drink at the bar once you have recieved your bracelet! Bugs??? of course you will see some!!! It is the Caribbean!! So bring a bit of bug spray and dont leave food OR drinks in your room. When we got to our room it was clean and orderly. We met the maids early on, and like most Caribbean hotels, a small tip and greeting at the beginning of the week to the maid goes a verrrrry long way! I didn't know Spanish at the time, but the maid and I always could communicate by gesturing and a word here and there.English is limited with the serving staff, but they do try hard. Don't go to a Spanish speaking country if you expect 100% fluent English by everyone you encounter!! My non English waiter always could figure out what I was requesting.Daytime activities and nightlife at this place is wonderful! And isn't that more important than swiping a way a couple bugs?? The staff tries very hard to make sure everyone is smiling and encourages everyone to participate. The evening shows WERE AMAZING! The high energy, complex coreography, and multiple set changes were exceptional for a 4Star resort. Then at the end of the show the party moves to the huge lobby where the activity staff and the show dancers all come to get you warmed up for dancing. At 11pm, if you have the energy, you can move to Arieto disco to dance to a mix of latin and north american music.Food - the main buffet was always well stocked and had more variety than most all-inclusive buttets. The beach grill wasn't quite as varied but the food there was ok. The a la carte restaurants were all good - especially my favourite, the Brazilian. Note: to avoid tummy troubles, make sure any dairy products you consume are cold, and take it easy on Pina Colodas - too much coconut will guarantee you some time in the bathroom! One thing I was REALLLLLY IMPRESSED WITH was the layout of the property. It was very spread out.....the lobby area had a chapel, the evening theatre area, and the shops and internet cafe. Then, you either walked or were shuttled through a luscious garden/rain forest pathway  entered into the hotel room section with pools, restaurants, and activities. It was a great layout because it kept the evening noise far away from the guest rooms. There is a little fantasy island kind of shuttle that runs through the property 24hrs a day.Some GENERAL TIPS........ relax, have some patience, shed that hyper way of life we North Americans have.........a smile, and an attempt at communication goes a long way........dont let a late taxi, one rude employee, or a broken air conditioner be the first things you mention in remembering a trip - all of those things can happen right at home! I can hardly wait for April to come so I can head back to this great resort!  
<Date>Nov 7, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not what I expected First, when we arrived at the Caribe Club Princess at 4pm, our room was not ready. We waited four additional hours. Our luggage was lost on the way there. No one at the resort cared to help. Our room did not have a working telephone. We paid for a deluxe room and ended up on the far back corner. We were without running water in our room for a day. The people were not friendly or helpful, not what I expected at all. I would not return to this resort.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fun on a Tropical Island our visit on June 20-28, 2004 Our family (3 of us) decided in May to take this trip. I admit I did very little research because a friend, who is a travel agent said she goes here every year and every year she has a great time. So we decided to book the vacation through her. We only had her word on it. Once the vacation was booked and it was getting closer and closer to leave I got to thinking that maybe we should learn more about this resort. So I found this website and started reading the reviews. First let me say all you people that had a BAD time. You must not travel often becuase your taste in hotels are the worst. The HOTEL was the greatest, we had food anytime we wanted, drinks anytime we wanted, the pool swim up bar was the greatest. There were activities every night. We have never been outside the United States except to Canada and this trip made us not only want to come back to this Island but to the resort as well. We never got sick. When we arrived we were greated with friendly smiles, drinks and very nice people. The people there loved my son, who is half mexican but at the time didn't speak an ounce of Spanish (but is now learning it as a second language for the next time), learned that his last name (different than mine), meant Rib Bones and when we signed up for the trips we used his last name and all of the tour guides would welcome us by saying Welcome Home to your homeland.However, there was one small problem, the first day we arrived we had in our room bedspreads - the next day the bedspreads were gone - and we never got them back, but that's ok we didn't need bedspreads anyways. We did take advantage of the Apple Vacation tours, which were presented to us by our Apple Vacation Representative. We wanted to learn more about the Island Hispanola and the Dominician Republic, here are the list of tours we took:Outback Safari tour on Monday, which was the greatest. Our guide and driver were awesome and got everyone involved including the shy ones. We toured the jungles of the Dominician, Went to a Dominician Ranch and had lunch, visited a typical Dominician Family, Rum-Coffee-Cocoa farm, and went boogie boarding. 5 Stars to this trip.Sanoa Island tour on Tuesday, which was again the greatest. Our guide and crew were again awesome we partied on the boat and on the beach. We had probably the best food around. Fresh grilled fish steaks, chicken, pork chops, veggies, rice, fruit and all the drinks you can drink. After spending several hours on the beach we loaded up everyone on speedboats and went to a Natural Swimming pool out in the middle of the ocean and saw giant Star Fish (HUGE), I have never seen those big of star fish before. 5 Stars to this trip.Marinarium tour on Wednesday, which again was the greatest. Our guides were great. My male friend has Asthma and was having difficulty swimming to the Shark/Ray tank and they helped him into the tank. The Dominicians are the most friendliest people I know. We spent an hour with the Sharks, Rays and Fish and had a great time. This was my sons all time dream was to swim with Sharks and he got to do it. 5 Stars to this trip.Santo Domingo tour on Thursday, which was an okay trip. This trip was more for the History Buffs, who wanted to learn more about Christopher Columbus and the Cathloic Church. We were disappointed of the amount of time we actually got to shop, only 45 minutes and two different places, not alot of choices. 2.5 Stars to t his tirp.We were leaving on Sunday so we decided not to take anymore trips but we diffently got a cultural shock when we decided to take a taxi to Plaza Bavaro. The store keepers would literally grab your arm and try to get you to go into their stores. I understand they are trying to make a living. However my motto is If you are nice to me and don't invade my physical space, I will be glad to come into your store. But all in all it was an experience and would probably go to Plaza Bavaro again and again.We are looking on our calendar for the next time we can go to the Punta Cana, Dominician Republic and visit this hotel again and again!!!!!!  
<Date>Sep 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beatiful is the Landascape, but from the resort you must Escape !! We have just returned from 3 weeks from this supposed to be a 4 superior star resort !!!Arrived at 21.30 on the 9th of August, check in was quite quick (obviously without a wellcome cocktail!), we got a single and a double room and the luggage arrived with us, so far so good !The single was ok but when we tried to get into the double room, first problem: the magnetic key didn't work.... Went back to ring reception from the single room and we were told No problems, 5 minutes(if you decide to go there you'll hear a lot this sentence, so keep it in mind!!). After 15 mins I decided to go personally to receiption (which is a long way about 10 mins walk!).Half an hour later we finally got into the room.The room was very nice and big, quite clean apart from the bedding, the fridge was stocked with water and 2 Cokes and 2 Sevenup (in the next days something was always missing!). Tried to phone the single room, but obviously the phone did not work! As it was late, we decided to leave it to the next day!Next day we got up quite early 鈥榗ause of jet lag (about seven!) , and we noticed that the beach was already completely full of towels! We wondered how that could be possible! It took some days to realize that a lot of people got up at six to take even more than a sunbed each (by the pool and on the beach!), plus the resort was overfull, about 1900 people and when we complained the first time, they told us that there were 2000 sunbeds, so we should have found some free!!We tried to forget about the incoveniences (room not properly cleaned and cleaned whenever they wanted, no telephone, no sunbeds, impossible to book restaurants without queuing for at least an hour, impossible to book the 2 catamarans, as they were always booked and so on鈥?) and enjoy ourselves, but after 10 days enough was enough.We got the solution to all the problems : THREATHEN AND DOLLARS !What a good thing for a 4 $$$$tar $uperior !!So here鈥檚 what happened next鈥?Went the 11th day to receiption, asked for a manager (in this case Mr. Louis) said I wanted my money back 鈥榗ause I wanted to move to next door resort and then I got my place on the beach booked nearly everyday (although sometimes they forgot). The phone in the afternoon was fixed and I gave a tip to the maid and the room was cleaned properly everyday.I had to become friend鈥檚 with the manager of water sport centre, luckily he was italian like me so I could get also the catamaran at leat nearly once a day.As for the bars, if you want cold water, forget it! Warmer than in the shower!Restaurants are ok but not amazing although Italians are very demanding about the standard of food. Wine is very good to use as vinegar!The beach is wonderfull, white sand and torqouise sea (that鈥檚 why we chose this resort), although unless you鈥檚tay on the first line of sunbeds, you鈥檒l not be able to see it 鈥榗ause everything and everyone is so squashed together.Apart from all this the rest is fine as a 2 star hotel, so if you really want a 4 star don鈥檛 even consider this place cause, I repeat again, it is very badly managed. Bavaro has plenty of other resorts鈥︹€?

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Read this and you'll truly understand What a trip!! We left on July 31st and came back on August 7th, 2004. I thought for a long time how I would write this review. What I wanted to do was write something that addressed both the previous negatives and positives of this trip. First of all, before we had even picked this trip, we read hundreds of reviews including this one to Punta Cana Caribe Club Princess alone. We looked at all the pros and cons of the trip and took that into consideration. Just to give you a small background of us, we are Chinese born Canadians. We stood out like there was no tomorrow. We were not Europeans and we had the VIP package. The flight in was very nice. Although I agree that the check in time was rather unusual at 3:30 since we got in around noon time, we had the opportunity to leave our bags at the front, take the little bus that toured the entire resort and have a buffet lunch. We did not waste time as every minute counted. By the time we ate and finished with the tour it was already 3:30. When we checked in, there was a host named Angel Nunez (hotel PR rep). If anybody runs into this guy, please tell him that we are trying to locate him. His e-mail address did not work and we are trying to reach him to let him know what a fantastic time we had. We had 2 long hours of conversation with this gentleman and he even spent a night out with us at one of the restaurants. Deller, our AC rep was amazing. This man is one of the friendliest person in the world. We took 2 trips from the guy. Both $70 US each, one to the Marinarium excursion and the other to the Manati Park. The first was worth it, the latter maybe not. Read below.Since we had the VIP package, we had the opportunity to sample all the fine restaurants. From Italian, to Mexican, to Brazilian, to Chinese and of course Dominican, not to mention the seafood restaurant. Honestly, it beats the buffet. We would eat at those restaurants and go back to the buffet just to see what was served that night at the buffet and the restaurants far out weighed the buffet. Dominican was probably the least favorite next to Brazilian while the seafood place and Chinese were awesome!!! The lobster at the seafood place was A++++ . Someone wrote about the flies in the buffet lounge and all I have to say about that is that the place is wide open. There are no windows so therefore there will be flies. PEOPLE IT鈥橲 NOT THE END OF THE WORLD! We had flies but it was not like they were swarming around you. Treat it like an outdoor picnic. Our stomachs were fine until the very last day when it started to grumble but by then, we were going home. We couldn鈥檛 pin point it but it might had something to do with the fact that we accidentally gulped some ocean water as we were swimming in the ocean during a fairly windy day on the beach. There were many negative views on how Europeans were treated better and that the staff spoke very little English. As far as I鈥檓 concern, ignore these people. The challenge to be able to speak to the Dominicans in any language besides English is fun. I know no Spanish yet I felt I was treated equally. Everybody on the island knew I spoke no Spanish since I was Chinese and looked it of course. The staff would speak broken English to you and I would not want it any other way. That鈥檚 the beauty of a vacation especially if it's in another foreign country. To understand other people鈥檚 culture. The experience was fabulous. I learned a few new Spanish words. One bus driver, Johnny was his name, speaks perfect Spanish and okay English but he taught me a lot. The man would say good morning to me almost every morning and drive me wherever I wanted to go on the resort. If I went to Cuba, Italy or anywhere else where English is not the first language, then that is what I would want. It鈥檚 true that if you try to speak their language, that they treat you with even more respect. For all those North American tourists who complained that communication was a problem, my advice to them would be to stay home. At least, you鈥檒l be speaking perfect English there. The Dominican is just fine thank you very much.Someone else wrote in about bugs or ants in there room. I wanted to test this theory out. What on earth were these people talking about since the maids were in there cleaning our rooms non stop for about 3 times a day. One night, we snuck huge plates of food into our hotel room and left the mess on the table. The next morning, tons of ants were swarming the table. Like anywhere else in the world, if you leave scrap pieces of food lying around, there will be bugs. Enough said.As for the Marinarium, we had a blast! I know the last Torontonian who wrote, who evidently was on the same tour bus as were, said it was not the best experience. We would have to disagree. The 1 hour snorkeling trip to watch the sting rays and sharks swim was awesome. We took so many photographs. We had good underwater pictures taken with both ourselves and the sharks and sting rays in the picture at the same time. One hour was more than enough. You are so exhausted which is great. The trip afterwards around the beach and partying in the ocean with cocktails and rums was awesome. It was simply terrific. The Manati Park was a little interesting and boring at the same time. For $70 US, we swam with the dolphins and walked in the area where the iguanas were lurking. We took some nice photos and the pictures with the dolphins were awesome. The problem is that the zoo is small and there is not much to do. Although initially we thought $70US was very expensive for this trip, I found out from some American tourists that they charge $130 US to swim with the dolphins at Disney Land. As a VIP, we also had 1 hour motorized motor sports which we spent tubing, 30 minutes of horseback riding where we took this beautiful trip down by the ocean with literally nothing but sand and water in sight. No resorts, no people鈥othing. Just water and sand. As well, we also had a free 30 minute massage which helped soothed any achy muscles. We also played outdoor ping pong and tennis. For those who are super adventurous, we even encourage you to go out into the local town. Plaza Bavaro is where we went and we went there twice. Again, we spoke no Spanish but we were just fine. The locals treat you like gold as they know you are tourists. I felt fairly safe as there are policeman standing at almost every corner. All in all, we had an amazing time. We took almost 300 pictures. The place is perfect. Some people, not all, just need to get rid of their snobbish, spoon fed North American developed country attitude. For us, it was a great experience. We understand the nature of the atmosphere and that even though it is a resort, the people who work there represent their country and not Canada or the United States. If they worked and behave like we did in North America, it would be a rather boring place. If that is the case, I think I would rather stay home instead. Feel free to e-mail me whether good or bad. I speak the honest truth. I will give you as much advice as I can to make this one of your best trips ever. My last advice is take the VIP package as it would be the best extra 200 dollars you will ever spend.  
<Date>Sep 2, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Lot to be desired Arrived at the lobby at 2:30 was told check in was at 3:00 did not get into the room until after 5:00 They say the room has a completely stocked wet bar. Well that means two Pepsi and two 7 up bottles and one gallon of water - no joke. By the way your wet bar is built into your bureau which means you only have three small drawers to put your clothes in. Plan on living mostly out of your suitcases. The grounds and pools are very well kept. The place is clean and the food is O.K. Their web site will tell you they have 355 rooms. What they do not tell you is they have three buildings with 355 in each. So we were dissapointed it was so big. The beach was beautiful every dayThey are very stingy on their alcohol so just tell them to give you more if that's what you want. Frozen drinks are limited to two, Banana Mama and Pina Colata. More variety of frozen drinks would be nice.The lobby seems to be the hang out at night, very large , clean and a nice lobby type bar. You don't get towels until about 6:00 pm and might want to bring your own face cloth [ they don't believe in them ]Lastly, if you are from America you may want to re-think your vacation. This place is about 95% European and is not very American friendly.  
<Date>Aug 30, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Honeymoon Disappointment Never Again!!!!!! To Whom It May Concern:The purpose of this letter is to voice our discontent with the honeymoon package that we purchased through AGENCE DE VOYAGE SEARS and VACANCES SIGNATURE. As is plain and evident a honeymoon (Aug 16 2003) comes only once in a lifetime and can never be redone, so we try to deal with reputable companies so as to minimise the risk of things going wrong and increase the probabilities that we will be treated with 鈥淭LC鈥?especially that it is our honeymoon. With this in mind we chose SEARS and SIGNATURE to be the ones to handle our special two weeks together. I guess they can not be held responsible for the actions of the people at Caribe Club PrincessWell, let the journey begin鈥?br/>We arrive to the Dominican Republic bright eyed and as happy as two little puppies who just found a new home. We stood there in the lobby waiting for our special greeting and express check in, which of course was promised to us as part of the honeymoon package. We stood there for a good 15 min, only to realise that that was not going to happen. Well the next step was to wait in line behind the 20 or so people that ended up in front of us since we waited for the express check in. About 45 min later we get to the front desk, a little bit tired, yet still happy to be there. That quickly changed.. They dropped a bomb on us, we were told that we were not booked in the honeymoon package. After a good argument and a nice little bribe to one of the employees (50.00 USD) it was settled.. We miraculously seemed to be booked in the honeymoon suite (which was not on two floors as promised by the representative at SEARS). Ok so on to the room, the bellboy takes our luggage and leaves, we assume to bring it to our rooms. So we follow the person from the front desk. It seems that since we gave a little gift he now wanted to treat us as if we were VIP鈥檚. We arrive to the room all happy, we open the door I pick up my new bride and carry her through the customary threshold and put her on the bed. Only to realise that the bed had no sheets鈥ot to mention it did have a few stains on it 鈥it of a turn off you could say. No matter, it is our honeymoon so let it slide, we call for sheets and were told that they would be there in 5 minutes, we say ok no big deal. Ok so lets open the bottle of champagne that was supposed have been there, guess what? No champagne, and we just realised that there were no flowers as promised. What else was missing? Our luggage was still not in the room even though it was taken from us before we left the front desk, so of course we start to panic and call the front desk again. We were told it would be there in 5 minutes, ok we say. We ended up waiting an hour before we get our luggage and we never got the bed sheets until the next day. The next morning we laughed at what had transpired the night before and said we would not let it affect our honeymoon. The room was beautiful in the day light and we wanted to open the beautiful wood blinds that surrounded the Jacuzzi that faced the ocean, only to realise that they were broken. Well once again we call the front desk to get some one to come and fix them; they transfer us to another department who only spoke Spanish, which is ok because I speak Spanish. About an hour and a half later a person came to look at the blinds and told us that they can鈥檛 be fixed, we told them that that was an unacceptable answer. They told us that is was no big deal, all there was to see was the beach, nothing really interesting (hello!!! we came to this country to see exactly that...THE BEACH). As you can imagine, we stood there completely stunned at his answer. The person left and we decided to roll up the blinds ourselves and tie them up with the cords that were supposed to make them rise.(we could finally almost see the beach) When we opened them we realised that the windows were so dirty that it was hard to see the beach. Then all of a sudden some one is at the door guess who? The cleaning lady with our bed sheets... glad to see her we introduced our selves and asked her politely to please clean the windows or have the person who cleans the windows do so. She said it would be taken care of later, we thanked her, and then asked her what these strange looking things in wood were around the Jacuzzi? She said that they were candle holders and that we should have candles on them, she said she would take care of that also. We thanked her again and she left after putting the bed sheets on the bed, who by the way were absolutely amazing and very clean. Well we now decide to go to the beach and work on our tans. When we get back we are stunned to see the place was filled with cockroaches! We killed three of them and left them on the floor so as to show the people working there that we are not just complaining. They sent someone there right away he then starts to fumigate the room. We told him to hold on because our clothes were out of our bags, but he continued and for the next three days our room smelled really bad not to mention our clothes stunk. When we asked the front desk for another room we were told there were none available. A couple of days go by, all is well.... We called a few more times for them to clean the windows and bring the candles they never did so we decide to clean the windows as well as we could without any cleaning products. This, as you could imagine, angered us but we gave up trying to get things done by calling. Not surprisingly, every day we went to the front desk to speak to our SIGNATURE representative and he was never there! When we would ask where he was, we were told that he just stepped away for a few minutes. After a week of trying we realised that we were on our own and gave up leaving messages for him. A day later, after going to the beach we come back to the room around 7 pm to realise that they had left with the bed sheets again, but this time they had taken our bath robes as well. I was not going to let this happen. ESPECIALLY since there was a nice little sign in the room that states that if we decide to keep any bath robes we would be charged 50.00 USD, so I call for the sheets and the robes, we go to eat supper and around 11.30 pm we return to find that they have brought the bed sheets but not the bath robes so we call to make a complaint.The next day we met our saviour 鈥淒aniela鈥? She did as much as one person could possibly do, she got our bath robes back, she got our candles (a week later) to us. She also made us realise that we should have gotten a bottle of wine in our room, which she tried to get us for a few days before we actually did. She also tried to get us the champagne and flowers in our room but as hard as she tried she could not do everything and we were grateful just for the effort that she was doing.(an excellent employee by the way鈥? The next day, which I do believe was on the seventh day, the key to our room stopped working and we were told that we were only booked for one week, that was when I could not take it any more. I called and gave a piece of my mind to the front desk. They then told me to wait in my room until they will send some one there to fix the problem. The person showed up and told me that I had to go to the front desk to fix the problem so I sent my wife to the beach so she would not lose the sun and I went to the front desk. They apologised to me and gave me two new keys. I left from there frustrated but decided to go to the room and test the key鈥uess what? It did not work, so off to the front desk where on my way I met up with Daniela. She told me that she would take care of the problem for us again when she called she was told that I should stay in the room waiting and they would come to bring me the new keys.. So I did it took 3 hours and Daniela and I could not believe what was going on. Just to say once again, Daniela saved us鈥?Lets talk about the room service that did not exist. Not once of the 5 or so times that we ordered did they get the order correct. Not to mention, the only reason that we could use room service is because I speak Spanish, otherwise if you do not they will not understand you. To the point where once my wife called to order and they did not understand what she was saying so they left the phone off the hook with her waiting for 15 minutes until I got to the room and decided to call the front desk and complain. So the front desk tried to get through and could not because the phone was off the hook with us on the other line. The person at reception could not believe what was going on. Once again we let that slide but we were not happy at all鈥?Let鈥檚 talk about the supposed included activities. What a joke鈥?You cannot make an appointment unless you come at a certain time in the morning to do so, and you cannot make an appointment for a future date (only for the same day). For example, the horseback riding, every day we arrived at the time specified and it was already booked we did not understand how this could be. (you can not book for the next day but we show up before the girl that takes the appointments does and it was already booked). But we did realise that when we decided to pay for a ride that all of a sudden they had room and could take us for the same day, so we did because we love riding鈥?the same scenario holds true for just about all the activities when you pay or bribe you get things, when you simply ask, nothing happens鈥ad to think this occurs at a 4 star hotel I wonder who actually rates these hotels. I should not be so negative.... the hotel actually is beautiful and the food was great just the service needs serious help.Well to all....Think twice....

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>great time The resort was beautiful and an enjoyable place to be. Junior from the lobby is the greatest, he is very helpful and a cool person. Hope me and my boyfriend can see him again soon. The bar was great and a place where we met a lot of friends including the bartender Alejandro. Try mamijuana or cocoloco. the buffet is okay but soon you will probably want to order nuggets and fries from room service. the pools and the beaches are beautiful. The room could have been better, there were tiny bugs on the wall. there were even the same small bugs all in the ham and cheese sandwich i got from room service. watch out for that. The resort is okay but if you want to truly enjoy your vacation i would suggest you leave and see what the REAL dominican republic is like. the people are so friendly. go on the four wheeling trip and the outback safari with omar and tony the are a fun team.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Time of my life as a Caribe Princess I traveled to the Dominican Republic for the first time last July 31st and stayed in a suite at Club Caribe Princess. I was a solo vacationer who craved a last-minute escape from the stresses of work and home life. It was to be a quiet, writing holiday where I could relax and be inspired. I must say that overall, with a few minor glitches, I was exceedingly impressed by the tropical beauty and simple splendor of this Caribbean dream resort. In fact, so impressed was I by this fabulous all-inclusive, the gentle Dominican people, idyllic land and seascapes that I am going back in a month. I tried to extend my stay while I was there but the resort was full, not surprisingly. HIGHLIGHTS OF MY STAY AT THE CARIBE CLUBFirst, kudos to Air Canada Vacations 鈥?first-rate on the ground and in the air, in T.O. and Punta Cana (special mention goes to Deller, the AC destination representative in DR who did a great job listening to my concerns re the Marinarium excursion -- which I do NOT recommend for US $70. You swim with sharks and sting rays for about an hour and spend the rest of the time waiting impatiently for this group to get its act together. Ask Deller about the other, better organized tours.) The BEACH was postcard perfect. No vendors or children aggressively offering to braid your hair or otherwise beg for money. Just gorgeous white, velvety sand and turquoise waves (that may be too big and playful for laid-back beachgoers). The banana boat is a must! I rode with three French kids whose mission was to ruthlessly rock the boat during the entire ride and have us all tumble into the sea. SWIMMING POOL is aesthetic and romantic, especially at night, when they are all lit up. Once I went swimming at night because it was tranquil and devoid of daytime noise and activity. A restaurant worker passed by and told me it was not healthy for me to be doing that. (Maybe that鈥檚 why I kept having headaches all week.)I spent many a relaxing moment in the gorgeous  breezy LOBBY  atrium reading and writing whilst enjoying brightly coloured  exotic libations. You will love the open air concept, thatched, high-ceilinged roof, gleaming marble floors  warm tropical d茅cor. Be sure to look for Martha, the attractive morning bartender. She is remarkably kind, even when busy and I had run out of bills to tip her with! My last day, she made me a special rum drink in a coconut shell. The often alluded to MANGROVE PATH was one of the main reasons I chose the Caribe Club over other resorts. Here, you will find a plethora of gorgeous jungle plants and pink and purple flowers. Traveling at sluggish speed through the mangroves were the 24-hour TRAMS that circle this huge resort, taking guests from the lobby to their rooms and other areas. One tram goes to Caribe Club  Tropical Princess, the other to Punta Cana Princess - PAY ATTENTION TO THE SIGNS. Drivers are wonderfully alive and happy, adding to the fun and friendly ambience of the resort (Please tell Eduardo, one of the drivers 鈥淢aria from Toronto, Canada says 鈥淗i!鈥?I was in a lovely, meticulously clean CARIBE SUITE #2321, building Coralillo, which had an envious view of the pool and distant ocean. Because I requested and was given a room on the third floor, my room had a fantastic cathedral ceiling. And because I had paid for an upgraded Suite, I had the privilege of nightly turn down service replete with chocolate mints; two phones, one of which was in the bathroom, a coffee maker, iron and board, free use of the safety deposit box, a sunken living room, and more. Satellite TV, 24-hour room service and free mini-bar (daily restocked with pop, water and beer), are standard fare for all room types. (One astonishing discovery I made was that all the employees I met, from bartender to bellboy, had cell phones and satellite TV in their homes!) My building, CORALILLO, was strategically located. One entrance led to the El Higuero restaurant/ buffet, another to the beach, and pools were on either side. Coralillo also featured two courtyards, one with a massage hut and Jacuzzi. ROOM ATTENDANTS wore pretty uniforms to match their friendly personalities but the one grievance I had was that they consistently came late in the afternoon, if not evening, to clean. I think it was because they knew I was by myself, was very neat  tidy to begin with, and did not require major attention. Another thing: the TV repairman came by several hours after I had called, apologizing that he was busy. After identifying the problem, he never came back to fix it. I just decided that I was on vacation and could do without CNN and the world鈥檚 problems for one week. A reassuring and pleasing sight you will oft see is conscientious staff working from sunrise to sunset in order to maintain the SPIC AND SPAN CLEANLINESS of this resort. Guests will note that this sparkling environment, whose accompanying beach is protected by law, is tainted only by disrespectful tourists who thoughtlessly strew plastic bottles, cigarette butts and other litter even when there are garbage cans everywhere. I was peeved by the negative reviews written by ignorant and inexperienced travelers regarding WATER AND ELECTRICITY. These spoiled inhabitants of the so-called first world do not know that brown outs are not uncommon in developing countries such as the Dominican. If you are just such a pampered elitist with an attitude problem, better for you to vacation in Hawaii or Disneyworld. The water and electricity did give out twice during my stay but I expected this as an educated and culturally sensitive tourist. Incidentally, when the AC did work, which was 98% of the time, it worked perfectly and was the reason my room was evaded by ants and other insects. I ate a lot of late-night snacks and sometimes found myself too tired to properly dispose of the leftovers. I was amazed that I had no problems whatsoever. Even MOSQUITOS were non-existent at this resort. I suspect that Caribe invests heavily in fumigation because as soon as I went off the property to hang out at local bars and restaurants, my poor arms and legs were attacked by flying pests. RESTAURANTS 鈥?I loved the Domincan restaurant/ buffet, El Higuero and thought the food was delicious, colourful and well presented. The staff make every effort to be creative, attentive and pay attention to small details. One morning, I indulged in thick pieces of toast which concealed medium-boiled eggs inside. There should be two Italian food stations though because there was always a line-up. 鈥?After hearing rave reviews about the Italian a la carte, Mama Mia, I was disappointed with my risotto. 鈥?I abhorred the instant coffee machines at the snack shacks as I expected fresh and authentic Dominican coffee at all times. 鈥?Food at this resort is 24 hours, unlike others in the area that stop serving anything at 2 AM. 鈥?When the restaurants close for the evening, there are two beach grills and snack shacks where I got rice and chicken, slices of tasty ham, fries, pizza and hamburgers. 鈥?I took stomach medication (immodium or pepto) every blessed day except the last, which is when I got sick; Oh well. Indeed, it was agonizing and inconvenient, especially on the return flight home but I like to think that if not for my illness I would have gained 10 pounds. I had booked an aromatherapy massage and jacuzzi at the newly opened and lovely SPA but was not able to enjoy these as the clerk could not do a manual authorization on my credit card. I had run out of cash by my last day and I explained there was a problem with my stripe, which was probably demagnetized. I was disappointed because the front desk agent did a telephone authorization when I went to pay my hotel bill. Despite his inability to help me, the clerk at the spa was very polite  professional, taking care not to embarrass me in front of the other clients. OUTSIDE VENDORS 鈥?My only complaint about the resort is that on Tuesdays they allow outside vendors to come in. If you see a bespectacled man, usually seated at a table selling jewelry, or if you see a petite, slim sales lady, with shoulder-length hair, RUN. She introduced herself as Lenny and walks around engaging people in her deceitful scams. From these dishonest merchants, I had bought larrimar, amber with an insect inside, shell necklaces, cigars and rum. The next day, I discovered to my dismay that the larrimar was of poor quality (not smooth and chipped in places) and the amber was FALSE!!! The ENGLISH LANGUAGE is extremely limited by most everyone at the resort, if not in all of DR. This striking lack was not a concern for me, personally, but I witnessed other English-only guests who expected to communicate in basic English at a four star and thus became acutely frustrated with the language barrier. Many Dominicans in key service positions actually speak the fundamentals of German and even French (albeit with a crappy accent) only because they have been catering to these long-time Europeans who dominate the resorts. The DR must be given time to implement hospitality English in their school system if they want to start accommodating more lucrative (American) markets. But then, maybe they don鈥檛. After having stayed at resort hotels in the Bahamas, Cuba, Costa Rica and Mexico, I am pleased to say that my experience at the Caribe Club Princess was by far the best and most beautiful in this part of the globe. I think my only real surprise and criticism is that there were no dolphins and so few butterflies鈥?But then, Club Caribe has no control over such things. Thanks to all the staff and management for making my vacation dreams come true... Maria

<Author>j4wagner
<Content>love / hate relationship with the Caribe Club The Caribe Club Princess has the potential to be a bargain location if management would only pay attention to some important details......mainly.....CUSTOMER SERVICE! The front desk personell set new standards for indifference and incompetence. I could not get anyone to give me basic information (ie: location of our rooms etc) and arranging for a courtesy room after the 12PM checkout for a shower before our 4:30 departure was frustrating. They just flat out don't care about helping you out or making you feel comfortable. We really don't mind putting up with mistakes, problems and inconveniences as long as everyone if FRIENDLY! The grounds, buildings and beach are terrific. Clean, well maintained and appealing. The beach has a great sand bottom, no shels, rocks or sharp object....perfect for bodysurfing or boogie boarding when there is a swell.Some of the staff are friendly and helpful (especially Poppi from Animation) but overall they lack the friendliness and interest that we found last summer at Secrets Excellence. However, everyone worked diligently and tirelessly but infortunately without smiles or casual conversation.Our room was marginally comfortable because it was underfurnished and eventually a mirror appeared but not the table and chairs we needed. Our friends had a room that was so cold and humid that the walls and doors and furniture were always wet. I had never seen anything like it before anywhere. The food ranged from unappetizing (Dominican) to good (Italian) and the buffet always had enough to satisfy our 11 year old.The signup system for dinner reservations is inefficient and a waste of valuable vacation time .....get on line at 7:45 am because the desk opens at 8:30am with no guarantee of a definite reservation.Unfortunately, our 11 year old son was usually ignored by the bartenders except for the good guys at the beach bar at the Seafood restaurant. The adult drinks are not made with premium liquors; the wines were awful.We had a very enjoyable time especially since every Canadian we met went out of their way to be friendly and engaging.....and that was very much appreciated.Our catamaran trip to Soana island was exceptional. Great staff, (the rum flows freely and the dancing starts up at 10 am) ........beautiful island with fine beaches and swimming....well worth the time and money. We heard horror stories about the free horseback riding trips offered by Apple Vacations at the neighboring resorts. Apparently they give the local hopsital a lot of business.At this point, this vacation was our 3rd trip to the D. R. in 12 months and we would recommend Secrets as the best place to stay (if you are traveling without children). We love the culture and the atmosphere of the D.R. but it is not for the traveler who is expecting the commerically sanitized world of Disney, Las Vegas or Honolulu. If you can accept and tolerate all that can (and will) go wrong (at any time or place and respond with a laugh and and a smile, then this island is for you. I sincerely hope that the Caribe Club Princess staff changes their attitude and and brings their level of service up to the standards of Secrets Excellence.  
<Date>Aug 10, 2004

<Author>MontrealDuke
<Content>What!!! a 4+ resort with no water for two days???? I will not be that negative because the Caribe Princess is a beautiful resort with a staff that is as helpfull as any other staff in Punta Cana.But what i dont get is the boring lobby at night with no entertainment at all. Is it that hard to have a musician playing guitar or a magician doing tricks for the kids or maybe a coffee bar making irish coffees or what not. Speaking of coffee, Hey Senor, do you guys hide the cups in the morning ,i could not get a coffee cup unless i stole one the night before and please fix at least the instant coffee machine. The ride from the lobby to the hotel complex is a nice idea but dont sit in the back seats unless you wear a gas mask. The rooms are 4 stars and the cleaning staff are very concerned with your well being. The buffet is like all resorts catering to a variety of tourists, you cant please everyone all the time. The choice of a la carte restaurants are fine and most of the staff are trying very hard to give you the best service that they know,they have not been trained in the Hotelerie schools of the world or in Roco`s restaurants so be patient and enjoy yourself. The beach is I am in heaven and you wont have to get up at 5 a.m. to reserve a Palapas. Plenty of room at the 3 pools also, I`d get Mister NO smile out of the pool bar and make him pick up weeds in the morning on the beach then maybe he would appreciate working in the shade. The FUN IN THE SUN staff are great for all ages and all languages, they try hard to entertain you. Could you please tell me how they ran out of water for two days and almost no pressure for four. I was so ------ it made this resort a 2 stars. The basic needs of a guest is --------? water. Have you ever washed your hair at the pools outside shower with 30 other guests in a 4+ resort . They should maybe ad this adventure to the list of activities. Other than that,the resort is well worth the price and should be tried by all you travel adviser bargain hunters.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beautiful resort, but... We stayed at Caribe Club Princess from July 16-23. It was really a beautiful resort, but we'll not do it again. I guess we are just not beach people. The language was really an issue. I'm fluent enough in Spanish that I could understand most of the staff, but sometimes we almost got the impression that English speakers were 2nd class citizens. I agree with the earlier post that the reception staff are surly. This morning when I went to check out, the first thing she said to me (in a curt tone) was You owe me $20 for the safe. Of course I knew I owed it, but it came across to me as extremely rude. So then the bell service didn't pick up our luggage, even after I called and then about 1/2 hour later I had the front desk call. So my husband and 9 year old son ended up carrying four suitcases down three flights of stairs (because there is no elevator) and up the quarter mile path to the lobby. But I get ahead of myself. Let's see. We were promised a kids' club. We imagined something like they do on the cruises. Well, the club that handles the English speaking kids was closed this week, so we tried the German speaking club. No one spoke English well enough to communicate with our son (who is 9, not a baby). The schedule was posted every day-- in German. We had thought to bring a Spanish dictionary, but not a German one! So, he pretty much stayed in the room and watched cable TV. The room was fine, though if you leave food out, ants WILL get it. For parts of 2 days there was no water. The activities were mostly not to our liking, and the ones that did sound fun were in the middle of the day (3-4 p.m.) and in the extreme heat with very little shade. Food was fine, we enjoyed most of the restaurants. The Mexican and Chinese didn't live up to what we're used to here, but weren't revolting. The Italian was fine. The Dominican and Brazilian, well, we don't have anything to compare them to. I think I chose the wrong entree in the Dominican (ended up with some kind of spaghetti). The Brazilian there is no menu, you just get one kind of meat after another. The fish was the best. I stopped after about 4, but I counted at least 8 kinds of meat! The phone in our room rang at sporadic intervals round the clock, so we learned to take it off the hook. The locks were very stiff in the room doors, so in order to close them you had to slam very hard. This became a problem when people were doing it all hours of the night (coming back from the disco, etc.) Literally you'd wake up thinking someone shot a gun in your ear. The pools were all beautiful. The waves were great for boogie boarding. Oh, our check-in info sheet said that horseback riding was included, but when we tried to sign up we were denied that. I was pretty sick of the resort by the last day, so we signed up for the Outback tour. It was the highlight of the trip-- a chance to see some of the (almost) real Dominican Republic. Now, I know this comes across pretty negative, really, we didn't have a bad time, though. But it was definitely different to be a minority language, especially where our son was concerned. p.s., while we enjoyed trying new foods on the buffet, he lived mostly the entire week on donuts and french fries. Oh well, it was just one week.  
<Date>Jul 23, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Love the beach, bad choice of resort Returned from Punta Cana July 4 after a week, a little mixed in our experience with the trip. We are a family of 4 with 2 teenage children 18 and 16. Read some of the reviews from trip advisor before we went, so we were aware of some issues but got to experience them first hand now. To start off, the resort is fairly decent. Rooms were clean and maid service was very good, overall I would say the service staff was accomodating and friendly. They don't look for tips when serving you and most of them smiles when you approach them. Most buildings are fairly new and well kept. The resort however does not cater to english speaking guest, most staff even though they smile at you when questioned does not have any idea of what you are asking for. The constellation was the beach on the property, it was beautiful , the only caution I would make is beware of what time of year you go. We waited for the kids to be out of school and this was a mistake. Constant 34 degree temperature and the Carabean sun was more than we could take, had to stay inside the room until about 3 o'clock in the afternoon before we dare to venture outside or else you would melt in the sun. It was so hot that I found myself sweating while standing in the pool ( the water was bath water warm ). The only place that I can say I don't like was the pathway that you have to take from the main entrance lobby to your rooms, it takes you through a heavy jungle type are that had a awful smell. I suspect there may be some storm or sewage water piped back into the jungle to recycle the water. Otherwise I would agree this is a 3-4 star resort. Our experience with the food and the other staff in the resort was not so pleasant. The buffet they serve is out doors. They make an effort to keep the place clean but there were flies on most of the food stations, and although most of the staff are pleasant, not many of them speaks english. We struggled just to get simple things such as a glass of coke or extra napkins. We also found most of the food very very salty. After the 3rd day my daughter and wife got sick. My daughter was more or less ok with Imodium but my wife could not eat for the rest of the week and only drank fluids. I would also caution about the medical care that was available at the resort, when my wife got sick we went to see the doctor on site. She seemed concerned about my wife's condition but I think she over prescribe medication. We ended up with over 8 items and spend $200 u.s. ( when we returned home and visited our family doctor. he said the medication is for malaria and not for simple diarrea ). Last and worst of all are the people at the main lobby. They had to be the worst I have experienced. They are rude and not helpful, on our second day we went on an excursion to one of the island and was told to bring beach towels. The resort supply the towels at the pool area but I was told by my Sun Holiday rep that I could get this from the lobby. The lady at the lobby scolded me for asking for a towel and told me they are only available from the pool house, she then turned and just walked away. The rest of the lobby staff are the same, they never smile and do not acknowledge you when you walk up to them, and I would agree with other reviews that they seem to cater to the spanish speaking guest. My experience have not been a positive one and for sure we will not be return to this resort. Cancun and Cuba was much more pleasant for the same or a little more money.  
<Date>Jul 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>AAAAHHHHHHH PARADISE.. Let me tell you how much fun i had at this resort. This was my second year in Punta Cana. I went with my best friend, her sister, her parents and a friend of the family. We went on June 20th and came back june 27th.Check-in: Check-in was ok when we got out of the bus, my mouth dropped..The lobby was absolutely huge and beautiful. We were wondering where our rooms were and then we saw a tram-car that picks us up to bring us to our rooms and back to the lobby. That was cute.Rooms: The rooms were ok we had the view of the pool and the beach on the 3rd floor. Although the balcony door was busted, we still enjoyed it.Food: Do not be picky about the food, because its just ok. The buffet was good, they changed their food every night. The restaurants have bad service and they were slow, but that was the only complaint i have. The grill was also very good.Beach/Pool: The pool was nice with a bar in the middle and the animation stand next to the beach and the pool. We would play volleyball and do aerobics in the pool. At around 3 p.m., the animators would teach bachata and we would have activities. The beach was awesome. One day one of the animators took us on a boat ride and the water was absolutely gorgeous. It was turquoise and crystal clear. Activities were also available.Staff/Entertainment: This was the highlight of my week. I give props to these animators, because they worked really hard everyday. And they were absolutely hilarious!!!! We did not stop laughing, because they would get everyone pumped up. The shows varied, but the dancers amazed me. They were amazing. During the shows, they would give out diplomas and a bottle of rum to the winners of the daily activities and i was one of them! After the shows, there would be a party at our lobby since it was so big. The party would last about an hour and at midnight we headed off to the disco. The disco was very nice and accomadated the 4 hotels around us. The last night we were there, belly dancers came to perform and that was really cool. They danced with swords on their heads. But the animators and dancers made the party. It was like we knew them forever, they were like our friends. (and they were very charming....and cute!) Overall this trip was fun and exciting. I cried when we left..Last year i went to breezes. It was much bigger and nicer, but at Caribe Club Princess, i had alot more fun. Everybody is very friendly and very nice. And dont forget to take pics with the monkey and the parrots. 6$ each pic. If you want braids i suggest you go to the city, which is 5 minutes away. They charge 20$.  
<Date>Jul 14, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great, but.......... This hotel was large and beautiful. We stayed from May 22-29, 04. It was awesome. Good things first: We stayed in a Caribe Suite, it was an average room but with a couch and coffee table, we stayed in building #2, we didn't have a great view but we didn't stay in the room much. The refrigerator was stocked daily with 7-up, Pepsi, beer and water. (Maids come 2 times per day, for turn down service.) We left the maids a little something everyday and that really seemed to help, we never ran out of drinks and always had plenty of towels.The hotel grounds were very beautiful, indeed there is a shuttle that goes around this resort 24/7 but it is worth a walk at least once a day! There are 3 huge pools, we didn't have any problem finding a chair at the beach or the pool. The beaches are full of topless women, if you like that kind of thing. Occasionally there are topless women at the pool with the swim-up bar. Our package included a free 30 minute massage, this was wonderful. There is a Spa on the premises for other things such as pedicure, manicure and such. I had a pedicure and it was great.The restaurants, were good. My favorite was probably the Chinese, the Italian was good too. The mexican restaurant was really bland. The Brazilian restaurant was OK, but I wasn't feeling too well that night. I really don't care much for Buffet's, but everyone in our group seemed to like it. Our package also included one meal at the Seafood or Steak house. We chose the Seafood, We had lobster, it was OK. The others in our group had Steak and they said it was awful. I definately would not pay the $25 for either meal. Stick with the other restaurants. We didn't have any trouble making reservations, you can make reservations in the mornings or during lunch hours at the buffet restaurant.Now the not so good:Not really a whole lot to mention here. I guess the worse thing was the language barrier, not much English spoken here. Mostly French and German tourists. Of course the native language is Spanish, but the natives don't know much English, sometimes it is really hard to communicate. We know some Spanish, but are not very fluent.There is not much going on at this resort, not many activities or things to do. Just lay by the pool all day long. The highlight of our days was eating supper. By the way, a meal at the restaurants take at least 2 hours, so don't be in a hurry. We went downtown 2 times to shop and the people here are very pushy, worst than Cancun. If you are going to relax and do absolutely nothing than this is the place for you, it does get boring after a few days. I would say in about 5 years, this place will be hopping like Cancun, as for now it is very beautiful to see but BORING.  
<Date>Jul 6, 2004
