<Author>sun-fun
<Content>Wonderful, Wonderful I have been to several all exclusive resorts, none compare to the Caribe Club Princess. We were treated wonderful. Everyone was very accommodating, the food was great (keep in mind if you eat in one of the restaurants, no shorts the buffet you can wear shorts) the activities were superb! Massages were to die for!!!!!!!! Our room was absolutely the ultimate, very clean and beautiful. The cleaning staff does an excellent job in keeping the resort immaculate. Beach was beautiful and clean. When I read other reviews and saw the compliants I am shocked, of course, some people will never be happy. We had a wonderful experience and will be going back to this resort. The only complaint is that Vacation Express was never on time and their representative over there was not dependable. We had to wait at every airport and had to reschedule our time with their rep because they did not show up.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Vacation, But A Problem with the Maids Stealing Hey:  We got back from a wonderful stay in The Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana. Overall, it was the vacation of a lifetime. The activities staff is awesome. The shows at night were great, the food was delicious, and the beach was so beautiful. I would reccomend this resort to anyone in a heartbeat if it wasn't for the maids. THE MAIDS: On our first full day, my mother took her wallet with her down to the beach thinking that there was nothing left in her purse. She forgot, however, that she left about 200 US dollars extra cash in her purse. We came back in the room later to get some cash and noticed that 150 dollars was missing. I am 14, and love handbagas and purses so i brought 3 purses. All of the zippers and compartments were all open in my purses and 20 dolloars out of my 60 was gone. We flipped out and went to the front desk. The maid was obviously on a search for money.  Our room is on the third floor and the balcony door was locked so no one could have climbed up and robbed it. We filed a report at the front desk for missing money. They did an investigation and the only employees that used cards to get in our room was our MAID. We of course, knew it was her. However, the front desk wouldn't get us ANY compensation. The front desk took no responsibility for it either.  We loved the resort!!!! And, truth be told, we really want to go back there. I just wanted to let all know what happened and to tell u guys to get the safe. I would reccomend this resort if u are a person that is trustworthy and having money stolen wouldn't ruin your vacation. It didn't ruin ours, but we are still upset about it and i just wanted to let all know! Once again, i loved this resort and so did my family. It was the best vacation we have ever been on, even though we had money taken from us.   
<Date>Jun 26, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>made me feel like a princess I Love This Place. I had a wonderful time. I arrived on Thursday, June 10th and my other 3 friends arrived the Monday before. We all enjoyed our stay in DR. The rooms were very clean, cool, and the mini bar was always well stocked. The staff was fabulous. They don't speak much English but they do try to work with Americans. There was a trolley that took you around the ground if you didnt feel like walking. The scenery was beautiful. Great for pictures. The beach was clean. The club played a variety of music for everyone. It was always something to do.The pools were always clean and the entertainment staff was great. They performed in the theatre every night and danced their assess off. I enjoyed everything. The Lobby was the fun part with staff. We danced to this step they have specifically for the hotel and it was so much fun. The food was great! The Brazillian restaurant had the best food out of them all. I have no complaints and will definitely come back. Well worth the money. I give this hotel a thumbs up!

Handicap facilities, kids,  teens club, playground, shopping area, beauty parlor, photo shop, wedding and honeymoon packages and more. There are 355 Superior rooms, Caribe, Royal  Honeymoon Suites fully equipped with A/C, ceiling fan, mini bar, telephone, safe deposit boxes, cable TV, hairdryer, iron and board, Royal Suite with 2 floor, living and dinning room, 2 full bathroom, 2 balconies, Jacuzzi, CD  VHS system, clock radio.Also it has 8 restaurants: Buffet, Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Seafood, Dominican, Wine Cellar, Grill. 4 bars. 24 hours room service. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Paradise! I don't know where to start....The Caribe Club Princess was WONDERFUL!! I went with 4 friends we had connecting rooms so it was great to have 2 bathrooms. The service was above great. I must admit that my favorite part was the FOOD! Everything was delicious. We ate from the 'Dominican Station' every day! The staff is what makes this place great. Everyone when out of their way to make us feel welcomed. I was disappointed that there weren't more Americans vacationing there, I guess Punta Cana is still a secret to most Americans. I've never gotten so much for my money. Even though everything was included we made sure we to leave a tip for our maid: Leonida and our favorite waiters at the buffet: Jacinto and Nelson!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it!! The best resort and the best vacation!!!! We had the VIP package! For an extra 40$, you get a free massage, access to all a la cate restaurants (free of charge) horse back riding, 2 hours of motorized sports, free scuba lesson in the pool, and much more. Not to mention the best service!! You won't be bored and if you're not the outgoing type, you can always enjoy the beach! it's beautiful! The rooms are beautiful and the mini bar is always full. One warning: don't drink the water unless it's bottled, and DO BRUSH YOUR TEETH WITH BOTTLED WATER. I didn't listen and got sick after I came back. But it didn't spoil my vacation and I would definately go back to the same resort again!ciao ciao micky mao!! :)

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wow. Amazing...all I can say. I went to Caribe club princess in June of 2003. All I can say about this hotel, is that it is absoloutly amazing. Im not just saying that. It really was. I will definatly be going back there soon. After we got off the plane, we arrived at the Punta Cana airport, where we had to wait a pretty long time to get our passports stamped and such. Then we hopped onto a shuttle bus which took us right to the hotel at about 45 minutes later. It was nice to see how the Dominican People live. After the ride, we were greeted at the main lobby where people got our luggage off the bus. Then we checked in, and let me tell you, the lobby is GORGEOUS. One of the nicest lobby's I have ever seen. There was a bar right there, and the stage where there was shows on at night is right behind it, and you could see all of the action going on. One of the first things I noticed was how lush the gardens were. Everything was green and full of life. After we checked in (which took about 15 minutes), we waited for the shuttle bus to come and take our luggage and oursleves to the hotel. After waiting quite a while for it to come, we were unfortunatly too late to hop on. You have to be very fast to get on it when new people are arriving. So we had to wait again and then soon enough we did hop on, and the shuttle bus takes you through this BEAUTIFUL lush path of very lush gardens. There is music playing throughout the resort, and it is nice spanish carribean music. Once we arrived at the hotel we noticed how beautiful it was inside....or you could say outside. It was open in the middle of the hotel, so there was many wild things growing. I loved it. When we got to our room, the AC was on full blast and we fell asleep almost right away. Everything in the hotel room was really neat and tidy. There is a mini fridge that gets restocked woth Pepsi and 7up all the time, and a TV for your kids which has many movies and other interesting shows to watch. One of the only things I would have to complain about would be the people next to us. It sounded like he was abusing his girfreind or wife, and there was non stop swearing and yelling at even 3 in the morning. We complained about this, and security did talk to them and it soon stopped after a few days. When it rained there, it POURED, and there was no leaks or cracks in the hotel roof, so we were fine. The food there was amazing, lots of variety, and fruit and fruit juices and omlets etc. Lunch was nice, beacuse you could go to either the beach buffet or the A la carte resturaunts, where the food was apparently delicous, (as my brother says.) There was a different theme every night for dinner at the buffet, which was fun. The beach was pretty nice, white sand and blue water. However, there were many waves, which was ok, because we ended up going boogie boarding, which was really fun once we got the hang of it. There is also kayaks, banana boats and catamarans that you can rent for an hour or 2. The pools were very nice, always clean, and there was a swim up bar where there was many assorted drinks and all the alcohol and juices you could get. There is also a hot tub, which I saw no point in going into, because it was already extremely hot. Every hour or so, the staff will come up to the front of the pool where you can dance and do the traditonal dominican dance. I had a blast watching the staff and guests dancing. They have many activities that you can sign up for, volleyball, water polo, ATV'ing, spanish lessons, etc. You can also sign up for out trips, such as horseback riding(AI), snorkeling with sharks (which let me tell you is SOO amazing, I did it and I definatly recomend it,) and safaris into the domincan jungle where you can meet the village people. The staff there were extremly nice and always greeted you with an OHLA! It was fun. You may want to bring little things for the maids like toothbrushes, gum, soap, money etc, for they will greatly appreciate it, and maybe even leave you a little something extra. I could really go on about this place forever, however I would probably keep on going. Overall Caribe Club Princess was one of the most amazing times of my life, and I will most definatly be going back there soon! I hope you will be able to enjoy this resort as much I did.  
<Date>May 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved it! I came back from the Caribe Club Princess VERY pleased...Bus ride: we got off the plane and all we could say was o my god this is amazing!! went right into the airport to get our things checked and we were right out. we got into a bus and it took us a little while to leave but when we were off we were OFF...they drive like maniacks! but it was ok because we got to the hotel in 45 minutes exactly.hotel: the hotel was beautiful! when we got of the bus we were surounded by beauty already... we came to a loby and it had a bar and it had couches and chairs to sit in. right when you walk up to the people to check into your room they are so friendly. they get you checked into your room right away and they have a bus to take all of your lugage to the hotel and you take a shuttle bus. when we got to the hotel it was SO beautiful. we walked inside and inside was outside if you get what im saying. there were lizards and birds in the hotel area. we walked up some stairs and into our hotel room and it was airconditioned already. we had a mini fridge and everyday the maids come in a restock it with 7up and Pepsi in these old bottles. The hotel was very clean.Grounds: the grounds were very well kept and there were trees and pretty flowers everywhere(for people who love palm trees there is tons) everything is really close together so you dont have to walk in all different places to get everywhere.Pool: there are two pools that i knew of. there was areally quiet one at the hotel that i didnt stay in and there was the one where i did stay in. This one had a swim up bar with all you can drink and a warm tub i would say. If it were any hotter you would probably roast. it was always kept clean just like everything else there. some of the staff there will bring tropical animals around so that you can get your picture taken with them. to buy the pictures is 5 dollars and they are pretty big.(you pick them up at the main loby)Restaurants: there were three restaurants there that you had to make reservations for and a buffet and a 24 hour snack bar. i never had the chance to go into the reserved ones but my brother said they were amazing. i ate mostly in the buffet restaurant and the food there was amazing! i only heard of one person getting sick and thats because they ate the sea food (i would recomend to try it). they always had a different theme to it and it was laways clean. there were so many varieties of food that you could have. the night entertainers would come around and you could get your pictures taken with them. the snack bar always had hot dogs, fries, hamburgers and pasta. and you could sit in there or bring your food to the pool.Beach: the beach had white beautiful sand, but when i went the water had lots of waves. it was ok though because we had a chance to go boogie boarding and it takes a while to get used to it but we did finally catch on. you can rent things from kayaks to wind surfing. so there is lots to do. if you want to get your hair braided i wouldnt go to the people that work at the resort. if you walk up the beach you will find a little place that sells art and things like that and the woman there and her sister braid hair. they will bargin with you for about $20 amerian. they really do need the money. the resort woman charges $50 american per head. we did have a chance to see horses get lose and run on the beach and you can always take long walks anywhere because it really never ends.Staff/Entertainment: the staff there were very nice to everyone but i would suggest learnig a bit of spainish. they always had something at the pool where they let everyone get up out of the pool and do a dance with the very funny staff to there song that they always play there. the nightly entertainment was really funny. they had a couples night where 4 couples had to get up and do crazy things.Trips: they have a meeting where you can go find a day trip to take and pay for it. they are all differents prices but i had a chance to go on two. the one was swimming with sharks and sting rays. we went out on a glass bottom boat and got to look at the underwater life. they surved us drinks and fruit. they have alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks. after that they tought us how to snorkle and told us to get out of the boat. we went to a neted area that had beatuful stingrays and fish and there were nurse sharks that had just givin birth. we came out of the neted area and brought some bananas along. we broke them up and out of no where came all these tropical fish. it was amazing!!the second trip was horseback riding. someone takes you out but you prettymuch do what you want. me being a horse lover galloped and cantered all the time. the horses are all well fed and gorgeous!the only thing wrong with this trip was going home!!i hope this helped alot!! i recomend this trip for all ages and anyone that could go! i plan to go again...  
<Date>May 13, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good resort, but the beach ... I could tell by my experience, the resort, the food and the room was great. The room service was ok, the bartender were funny. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Relaxing and fun Hi,My husband and I must have gone at the right time of the year, because there was just the right amount of people there, not to crowded. We were there April 29th to May 6/04. We had the time of our lives! This resort is beautiful and I have been to two other resorts that are 4 stars at the Dominiican, so I know what I am talking about. We found that the a la carte restaurants were very good, better than the buffet. The buffet was still good to though. We didn't bring our kids with us, but if you have kids, this is a great place to bring them. The kids around looked like they were having a great time. Lots for them to do. I would definetly go back. The entertainment was fun and there was lots of space to relax. The beach here was the best I have seen so far in the Dominican. My favorite restaurants at this resort was La Cava and Mama Mia. We also had a big room and nice size bathroom. There is a shopping plaza not far from the resort. My husband and I used the bicycles from the resort to bike there. It was about a 7 minute bike ride. There is also shopping along the beach, but more expensive. Keep in mind if they say $40 for the item you want, you say 20$, don't ever pay what they want. You can get them. down.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would not go back At best the resort was fair. The beach was beautiful and well taken care of at all times. The rooms were okay however the maid service was very erratic. Sometimes we would get washcloths, sometimes not. The maid would sometimes comes at 8am before we were dressed and other times not come until 5pm when we were taking showers after the beach! My teenagers room was left dirty when the maid went in to turn down the bed. Bring your own alarm clock if you go. The electicity goes out every night so the clock will not go off if you set it. Forget trying to get a wake up call. My son asked for a wakeup call at 8am three times. Got a call only one day and then got 2 at 2 different times. The service in all areas was extremely slow- whether at the restuarants, buffet or the front desk. The bars at the beach could only make certain drinks so chices were limited there. The food at the buffet and all of the restaurants was fair at best. It would take quite a while to get a drink with dinner, sometimes 15 to 20 minutes. We did have a good time at the beach and went scuba diving which was great. I would however not go back to this resort. There are too many other places to go for the money where the service and facilities are better. We did two trips off of the resort. One was the safari outback. It was nice to see the countryside but the trip was little more than a sales trip. First stop was a school where the stopped the class for us to go in. I felt sorry for the kids having all these tourists staring at them. Then they hit us up for donations. The next stop was a coffee plantation another sales oppotunity...coffee, coco, vanilla extract. Third stop an outdoor store to buy rum and cigarettes..Last stop was a beach for boogie boarding..they had only half the amount of boogie boards for the number of people on the tour so we had to share....The beach was Filthy!!!! Garbage, plastic everywhere and the beach was also used for horseback riding and not cleaned up from that either. Not a nice beach. We did enjoy a trip called Maranarium. Snorkeling, bosting...fun and a beautiful trip. I would definitely go back to the Dominican Republic but would pick and differnet resort.  
<Date>Apr 27, 2004

<Author>LiseOntario_Canada
<Content>What a Great Vacation! Our Trip March 27 to April 3rd 2004One word I kept repeating while at Punta Cana, Caribe Club Princess Resort was... PARADISE! A very clean, friendly resort. Anyone who complains about this resort has to be a very hard person to please. One has to remember you are not in your homeland. Customs are different everywhere you go. RELAX AND ENJOY! The staff there are great, make you feel welcome. The evening shows surprised us as to how talented they were and how many languages they speak. Not all staff speak English but have fun with it, there are ways to get your requests across. They certainly don't snub you. Laugh it off. If your room isn't ready when you get there, nothing you can do about it just be patient, relax at the bar have a drink or two. They come get you and drvie you to your room with your luggage. We arrived at 2:40 and our room was ready at 3:40. This is a large beautiful resort! You can be shuttled around but we preferred to walk everywhere. We felt we had to walk so that we wouldn't put on the extra pounds from eating all that great food. We ate mainly at the buffet restaurant. So much to choose from. You'll never go hungry. As for the beach....WOW! the sand is white and like flour, very fine. CLEAN! The water Beautiful! Aqua green. Waves. As I mentioned earlier, can't control other nationalities. Yes there are many topless women on the beach. Its a Mans paradise for sure! Personally, the only thing I would of preferred was that the women respect other people and not go topless on the resort itself. Some resorts don't allow it but the Caribe Club Princess have alot of Europeans and they just did as they pleased. As for going back. YES, MOST DEFINATELY! We LOVED it. Word of advice...check the weather site to choose the best months to go. We had both Sun and rain.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not Bad At All! We were at the Tropical Princess (same thing as the Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana in April 2004. Overall the resort was amazing, great beach and pools....I've listed the pro and cons below:Pros/Cons1. Beach Towels are always in shortage, you won't always get clean towels unless you go V.I.P. (pay extra) and you will get the towels in your room every night!2. Food - Buffet -Huge selection of food, including endless shrimp (Huge Shrimps) every night. Food although plentiful was very bland, everything tasted the same, very little flavor or spices used...everything lacked salt as well. Lamb and Steak were readly available, but we all found the meats were tough and chewy. Overall the food was acceptable, with something for everyone.3. Food - Ala Cart restaurants, if you were staying at the Tropical Princess then you only got to sit in two ala cart restarurants, if you went V.I.P. you got six different restaurants. We weren't really happy with the sit down dinners, again food wasn't that great, it was nice atmosphere....the only sit down that everyone agreed was the italian restaurant mama mia. The Steak House La Cava was ok, since it was included in our package, but I wouldn't fork out $25.00 USD per person for it.4. Beach - Excellent, clean and beautiful. White powder sand, not a single rock or shell for your feet to step on. The only problem was finding a shaded area to sit in. This resort is very popular with the Germans and let me tell you, they get up early in the morning (5-6am) to reserve their chairs. Definately an issue here, same as towels.5. The resort is HUGE, the walk from the lobby to the rooms is a good 10minutes. Although they have a beautiful path of mangroves, this quickly gets tiring, especially if you are lugging kids around. A tram is available to take you between the lobby, rooms and restaurants.6. Very good entertainment, with shows and movies every night. The shows consisted of song/dance and just plain comedy with active participation from the audience.7. Make sure to brink everything with you, if you need to buy film or sunscreen, you will regret not bringing it.....very expensive! Leave your CDN Dollars, bring USD, the exchange rage is much better...you don't really have to convert your USD to pesos as everyone accepts both.8. Bottled water is readily available, fresh juices (a little watered down),

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>What an experience! My family (10 in all) visited the Caribe Club Princess from April 9th through the 16th. The weather was perfect the whole time with upper 80's during the day and always a great breeze blowing to keep you comfortable. We booked our vacation at the recommendation of our travel agent through Apple Vacations. The people at Apple were great!! Now for the resort. The check-in went smoothly although we arrived at noon and our rooms weren't ready yet so we had lunch and came back to check in. The girl at the desk was quite bothersome. She obviously didn't want to be bothered with us. I had requested a roll-away bed and she kept telling me it would be there and it was not in the room and it took me most of the day and many phone calls before I could get the bed. We also requested adjoining rooms (3 of them) and we were all spread out but in the same building. She just kept telling me the hotel was full. The first night we experienced a water leak from the ceiling vent in the bathroom, right over the toilet. It took me 48 hours of phone calls and visits to the desk before the leak was stopped! The buffet was great, never tried the other restaurants. No one in our party got sick from the food. Our days consisted of staying by the pool (which are beautiful) and then to the lobby for the evening!!! Being our first excursion out of the country, I think it went well. You can't beat the weather and set up of an all-inclusive resort!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would not go back A group of us just got back from the Caribe Club Princess. We are in our 40's with teenagers and kids as young as 10. I read many of the reviews prior to our trip and was really concerned. As it turned out, most of the reviews were right on target. For the positives: The beach is very beautiful. The resort itself was fine. The staff is friendly and works very hard to make the hotel fun. Communication was not a problem.The food, however, was not very good. We went to the Brazilian restaurant, called the Rodizio. We named it the Spit and Chew because the meat was so tough that it would barely go down your throat. The Italian and Chinese restaurants were acceptable. The Mexican was ok if you like bones and grissle in your fajita. If your package includes the seafood restaurant, then go. If not, I would not suggest paying $25.00 per person to to there. Many people in our group got sick. Don't expect good frozen drinks at the bars. The only place to get a good drink was at the bar in the lobby. If you want to go to a beautiful beach and don't care about good food, then the Caribe Club Princess would be ok. If you expect good food while on vacation, then select another hotel. We have traveled to many all - inclusive resorts and by far, the Caribe Club Princess was the worst. I also want to mention the Disco. The hotel management allows locals to go to the Disco -- watch your teenage girls as many of them try to hit on the girls. All things considered, I would not go back to this hotel. We didn't pay enough attention to the reviews on this site. We kept thinking that some people will complain about anything. I am not that type of person but believe me when I say pick another hotel.  
<Date>Apr 19, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyed myself My girlfriend and I stayed at the Caribe Club Princess 4/3 - 4/10. We chose the hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent and booked the tour thru GWV. I have no complaints with GWV or our tour rep..she was great (Sophie from Montreal). We found the property and our room to be neat and clean. Check-in and check-out went smoothly depsite the language barrier. We did leave gifts for the maid along with $1.00 each day. By mid week we were getting clean beach towels every day. After reading countless reviews about this property and all the other properties in Punta Cana , I have to say I was a little concerned about what I read about the food. As it turned out, the food was fine. It was not gourment but I always had plenty to eat . Some food tasted a little different than what I was used to but for the most part it was quite good. I never got sick. I brushed my teeth with the tap water. I did not take pepto bismal before I left like some reviewers suggested. Frankly, I don't understand why so many people say they got sick from the food. The beach was great!! It was a great beach to walk. The water was clean and warm. Youd do need to get to the beach early to get a decent plalapa. One morning we got there at 7 and they were all taken. Two morinings I got there at 6:15, got a decent spot, had a cup of coffee and a crosisant from the bar on the beach and watched the sun rise. Even though you are not supposed to reserve a spot, everyone does, but you don't have to worry about someone taking your place. We left our spot for 4 hours and everything was right where we left it when we got back. We did not see any of the shows...after spending the entire day on the beach, eating dinner at 8, we were pooped and went to bed early. It was kind of noisy but I slept well and I thought the beds were quite comfortable. Early in the week we started out tipping the bartenders $1.00. They seemed surprised but thankful. I found it helpful to have a $1.00 in my hand when there were a lot of people waiting at the bar. The bartenders are not in any hurry to wait on you and there is no such thing as first come, first serve. You just need to speak up and order your drink. As far as brinigng an insulated mug with you like some reviewsrs suggest... I wouldn't. I saw one bartender roll his eyes when a woman asked him for a drink in her mug and be sure you rinse it out first. By the end of the week we weren't tipping at all. For the amount of people at the property I was amazed that there were only a few people at the bar whenever I went up for a drink.. I never had to wait long to be waited on. Speaking of the bar, this was one of my few disappointments. The alcohol had to be watered down. I watched them make the drinks, pour rum into the cup but it never tasted like there was much in there. The wine at dinner was awful..if you were lucky enough to even get any. Onc night I had 3 large glasses of wine and never felt like I was drinking any alcohol. I was disappointed that there was no beer in our mini bar...just water and soda which was always plentiful. I just assumed we would have beer, not the hotel's fault. Going back to the food and the restuarants...the buffet was fine, coffee was slow in coming...but if you can deal with that, than you have nothing to worry about. We ate at 4 of the restaurants...we did find that you needed to make reservations early...8:30AM or shortly thereafter , to get the time and place that you wanted. I was disappointed with La Cava, the steak and wine restaurant. The food was fine but we did have to pay $25.00 for this one which we knew in advance. The problem was that the lighting was so poor, you couldn't read the menu. I went thru 3 candles from different tables to use as lights so I could read the menu. The service was very slow...it took over 2 hours to eat or meal. It was warm in the restuarant and there is no bathroom. I would skip this place if I were you. I like the Brazilian the best. It was more or less outodoors, there was a lot of meat (good for you South Beach dieters) and the after dinner coffee was awesome! We did not have to pay extra for this one. The most stressful thing about the whole week is dealing with the vendors if you go shopping. You have to bargain for everything and you don't know if you are getting screwed or not. My advice is to pay in American dollars. Forget pesos and forget credit cards. I think I got screwed when I used my debit card. I was supposed to pay $18.00 for a couple of items at the market in Bavarro Plaza but when I got home I saw that I was charged $28.28. Speaking of credit cards: Notify your credit card companies that you are traveling in the Domincian Republic. Capital One would not honer my credit card purchases. It is pretty embarassing to be declined! I talked to them when I got home and they reccomended that you call their security department before traveling abroad. So, to wrap this up, this is my advice: Don't worry about any bad reviews you have read..some people expect to much and are just miserable by nature. The food is good, the rooms are nice, the beach and pools are great. Language can be a barrier but you will survive. If you want to relax, lay in the sun and play in the water this is the place for you. Do not expect gourmet food or hand and foot service. There is no reason why you should not have a good time. Feel free to eamil me if you have any questions. Sue from Maine

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>I LOVED THIS RESORT..beat Sandals by far I just returned from this resort on April 9/2004 ..I had a great time there ..Beautiful clean resort..with friendly  helpful staff on hand..I stayed in a suite ..Big clean rooms..comfy bed..great view of the pool and ocean ..Room # 2323 ..Second building ..I recommend if you are going to stay here you upgrade to VIP ..The money is well worth it..You get alot of extras ...Any problems at all that you may have they will look after you ASAP..I never had any problem with getting sick ..the FOOD there was incredible..I visited 5 of the Al acarte Restaurants which is included in the VIP ..and the food was better then the food that I had at the 2 SANDALS I stayed at...The ocean was amazing..The 3 pools were large and I never had a problem getting a lounge chair ..The shows at night from 9:30pm-10:45pm amazing ..The dancers are a great bunch of people..Most can speak good english..they won't hestitate to get you up dancing and get involved with their shows..I plan on going back to this resort in November..Take little things with you to bargain with the locals at the markets..I left stuff for our Maid and she greatly appreciated it !Hope this helps you out..Don't pay any attention to the people who left poor reviews..I give this place a 6 star ...Paula from Canada

<Author>Luba459
<Content>You'll Love it if you Want When i started to go here i had every intention of having the worst time, but then the people there just wouldn't let me. From day one i had a positively fab time. The room was good, two twin size beds, one t.v(only problem was getting a remote for the t.v.) The first day, the maid cleaned the room a little late, but then it was all good after that. The activities by the pool are amazing and they have something for everyone. The food is delicious and i absolutely suggest that you never make a reservation. There is no need to, they serve the same exact food in the buffet without the hassel. There is a little bus that goes around the resort which you can easily ride, but by the last day, the resort doesn't seem that big and you almost dont wanna by it. If you start walking to the left on the beach there is a little bazar and you can get your hair braided a lot cheaper, i highly suggest going there, also to buy suvinors, so much cheaper, remember to haggle. The shows are good, except when there is a cultural show, i almost fell asleep during that. I suggest going to the lobby after the show, because they have a mini-dance part between 11 and 12 before the disco. If your under 18 they wont allow you into the disco and there for this is the only amount of dancing you will get. As for the drinks, the menu is absolutely bare for children under 18, so all they can drink is water and soda. The thing i didn't like about the resort was that is was totally seperating different cultures. Half of it was for dutchland, and the other half was for every other country. Not only that, but the country you are from depended on the color of your braclet, i believe that is very racy. It's a four star resort, and i do suggest going there if it's the best price you can get, however, make sure you WANNA have a good time!

<Author>Sunsetlover08
<Content>Lovely Resort - Bring your raingear We visited the Caribe Club Princess 3/31/04 - 4/7/04. The Resort is wonderful the staff friendly and everything is very well kept. Unfortunately it rained three full days in a row and almost every evening. The huge umbrella in our room and the floor drains should have been our first clue. Our friends room flooded. All of their activities are outside so when it rains there is nothing to do except pray it stops - we did alot of that. We did make the best of it - swimming in the rain, and trying to play the outside activities. But this gets old when you've spent a small fortune on the vacation of your dreams. The food is very different. Not bad but different. Take lots of snacks from home if you have children with you. The sand fleas are also a problem 11 bites in one day, very irritating. It is beautiful when the sun shines. The nightly entertainment is not very good, we had to leave one show it was too vulger for our teenagers. Again it is a lovely resort but we wouldn't return.

<Author>oh_gifted_one
<Content>relax and enjoy This was our first trip to an all inclusive (April 1-7), so we had no expectations other than what we read (which covered everything from terrible to wonderful). There ended up being about 30 of us from PA, CA, and Germany for a friend's wedding, and out of the 30 of us, only my girlfriend and I got sick (and only for a day and a half...Immodium is a must to bring with you!). Most of the staff (except the maids) speak limited English - but I noticed their English was far better than the Spanish spoken by most of the guests. If you know any Spanish, use it - it's a fun way to improve your language skills. Besides, you are going to a country where Spanish is the national language, not English. At least be respectful enough to learn a few phrases - a little effort on your part will go a long way. Remember - they'll understand bad Spanish better than good English. The food was decent (except for whatever made us sick). I actually think the buffet was better than the restaurants. Avoid the beef though - they have a different breed of cattle, and the meat is very tough. The goat is good though. The activities were great, and the staff made them a lot of fun with a lot of joking around. The beach was clean (except for seaweed, but that's just nature for you). We had no problem getting chairs at the pool or the beach. We didn't even bother reserving them - when we wanted a couple chairs, we just wandered a few minutes will we found them. At the pool, if we couldn't find a chair, we just put our stuff near the bar, jumped in the pool, and picked up our stuff when we got out. We never had a problem with towels - they were always changed every day, even though we purposly hung them to dry so they wouldn't have to be changed on a daily basis. Beach towels we just dried and re-used. The room was cleaned every day, which was nice, since we were constantly tracking sand into it. The only bug problem we had was when we left food out one afternoon and there were a few ants on it. Not a problem - just make sure any food goes in the refrigerator and utensils get washed immediatlely (preferably with bottle water). We left the maids small gifts when we left our room for the day. Tips are also appreciated by bartenders and such. Defintely do the outback safari. the guys are great and really funny (and they speak English, which will make most tourists happy). One last note...haggle hard with the shop merchants. I'm lousy at it, but my girlfriend isn't. They start unrealisticly high, so be prepared to start unrealisticly low, and pay less than half what they are asking (usually about a quarter the starting price). Yes there were a few annoyances, but if you relax and just tell yourself you're on Dominican time, you'll have a lot more fun!  
<Date>Apr 9, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>All Inclusive Runs Guaranteed! We were a party of 6 with a 77 yr. old, 5, 10, 17 and two adults. Everyone but one adult who refrained from eating much got sick from eating the food from the buffet. This is not right when your package includes their food. They provide you with bottled water because you cannot drink the water from the taps. So why do they not provide you with food that doesn't make you sick. If you don't bring Imodium, Gravol or Pepto count on a terrible, terrible holiday with cramps, runs, fever and not enough energy to get out of bed. The 77 yr. old is still sick with the same symptons after a week back. This is absolutely unconscienable that this resort would be so lax in what comes out of the kitchen to have this routinely happen to people. Read the reports, it is like every second report contains a complaint with respect to the food and people getting sick. Plan and simple, when you make people eat your food because you are an all inclusive, your food shouldn't make people sick. Doesn't matter how nice the resort was b/c you are sick 80% of the time. What fun is that when you go for a swim and have to run to the nearest toilet. The Chef stands proudly in the buffet and adminsters the no shoes in the restaurant rule, he should be in the kitchen finding out what his staff are or are not doing with the food preparation that makes people sick. From the reports, I have just read....it almost seems like people accept this food issue as part of the deal. That is absolutely absurd and unacceptable.For all future travellers, ensure that your agent has an explaination for this or go at your own risk. If this resort was in North American, it would be closed by the public health authority!!! What makes anyone think that it is acceptable just because the hotel is in the DR. The irony is that they feed you food that makes you sick b/c there is no other alerternative in an AI resort.This is unfortunate because the rest of the staff do try hard to please.Still Sick about it all!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Not for us Our trip was booked through Apple Vacations. We were fairly defined in the type of vacation we wanted. APPLE VACATIONS TOTALLY MISSED THE MARK!We indicated we preferred smaller Resorts, they told us the Resort had 350 rooms, NOT TRUE, TRY CLOSE TO A 1000, ALL USING THE SAME RESTURANTS  BEACH AND OTHER HOTEL SERVICES!! You could walk from one end of the beach to the other, probably a 1000 ft., on the beach chairs of the hoards of people that were there. For the first 3 days beach towels were not available due to amount of guests at the Resort.We will be very leary of staying at any Resort in the Princess chain. The Resort was totally understaffed which we could assume but for no other reason but for the financial gain of the establishment. An example: at the breakfast and lunch buffet, we observed no more than 4 staff members for 100 plus tables. Most mornings we cleared and set up our table so that breakfast would not become a 3 hour ordeal! We were congratulationg ourselves in obtaining a cup of coffee while our breakfast was still warm.The rooms provided us were in need of maintanence and decorating.The Resort Spa - we had massages, facial, body scrub, hair and nail treatments, from staff obviously lacking professional training in these areas. Our massages were comperable to a back rub given by your spouse!The food was at the low end of an all inclusive resort, no frills or extra taste! Several of the resort resturants were not included in our package and a supplemental fee was charged, which Apple did not advise us of.Luckily we went for the golf. The golf course had no affiliation with the Resort. We golfed most days at Cocotal and had a wonderful time on the beautiful course and enjoyed the professional staff.If we sound a bit bitter know that we have 15 years of experience of vacationing in the high season in the Caribbean. This was hands down our worst experience ever! We won't even go into the overbooking of our flight provided by Apple through US Air!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Loved the Beach but not the Resort Our trip to Punta Cana was from March 13, 2004 through the 20th of March. When we first arrived at the Hotel Resort we were very much impressed. The resort is beautiful and very clean. The beach is fantastic. One of the best beaches on the Carribean, if you like to play with the waves. The water is a beautiful blue with white sand. The waves are just the right size. Not too big and not too small. Now for the resort. If you are a light sleeper, this resort may not be for you. There are 3 buildings. Building 1  2 are 3 stories high. No elevators. As soon as you walk into the building everything echoes. So if you are on the first floor and near the entrance of the building you will hear constant talking from your room. Not to stress on the fact that there is a disco for the young adults that is open from 11pm until 6am. This means that it is possible that you may hear someone coming back to their room all hours of the night. Which happened to us. We were on the first floor near the entrance. We complained the following morning and the only rooms they said they had available for the 6 of us would be a down grade in the other building on the 3rd floor, which may be a little quieter. We took those rooms and they were quieter except that for when it rained (every night) you could hear the rain really well on the roof top. The food was not the greatest. We've had much better at all of the other resorts we've been to. We were all a little sick from the food, if you know what I mean. There was a buffet that you could go to without making reservations and also a couple of snack bars by the beach for lunch. At night you had a choice of 7 different restaurants, but you had to make reservations daily in the lobby of your building, between 8:30am and 10:30am. You did not have the choice of what time you wanted. There were only 2 choices, like for example 6pm or 8pm. Some of the staff people that worked with the visitors could have known more english. Like for instance - the operator did not know any english. All in all Punta Cana is worth visting but I would not return to this resort.  
<Date>Mar 23, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wish I was still there... I am a student at Denison University and a group including myself and 6 others went to Punta Cana for our spring break (March 13-20). We had an absolutely fantastic time, and we wish we could still be there. We organized the trip through Apple Vacations, and they made the trip go very smoothly.So where to begin? We arrived at the airport around 6:30 on Saturday night. The airport was very crowded, as a huge AirFrance plane had landed at the same time. However, we still got through the airport rather quickly. Just be prepared for some pushing and shoving through the crowds. From the airport, it was about a 45 minute ride to our hotel, because the bus stopped at some other resorts along the way. It was dark at this point, so we didn't really get a good view of the real people on our way in.I'm going to lay the rest of this out so you can decide what you want to read about.Check-in/Check-Out: Both of these went very quickly and smoothly. The people behind the desk could speak English well enough to understand. We requested to have the TV remote when we checked in, as suggested in another review. The bellboys took our luggage straight to our room, while we took the tram. We wouldn't have taken it if we had realized how short of a walk it was to our rooms. It's really only about 5 minutes and you get to walk through the beautiful mangroves. Our departing flight did not leave until 8:30, so we planned to stay at the resort until 5, but checkout was at noon. The front desk assured us that we could use the showers in the spa so we could go to the beach for the day. However, there was a fiasco and we went to the spa and they wouldn't let us use the showers. So, after some begging and pleading with the front desk, they were nice enough to allow us to use 2 hospitality rooms to shower in.The rooms: Among us we had 1 room with a king, 1 with 2 doubles, and 1 room with 2 double beds and a couch. The rooms were very nice, all on the first floor with views of Pool 1. 2 of us were in Building 1 and the triple was in Building 2. On the first night, we requested blankets for the couch in the triple, but they never came. The room I was in was at the end of the buiding, closest to the beach and the 24 hour bar, so we usually used the sliding door on our terrace rather than the real door. The maids were very nice and cleaned every day, sometimes they would even arrange our towels in neat patterns or leave flowers for us.The beach: Very beautiful. We found it best to wake up early and put your towels on some chairs in order to get a front-row cabana. If you didn't do this, you could still find chairs, you just weren't in the ideal spot. We never had a problem getting towels, I never used the one that I brought. Lots of topless women and men in Speedos. You could walk up and down the beach for several miles. The water was fairly clear, and not too seaweedy. We noticed that the waves by our resort were bigger than many of the others.Food: There are 5 a la carte restaurants and the buffet available. We ate at all 5 and had a different experience at each one. You need to make reservations in the morning at the concierge in your building. We usually did this fairly early, but found that the lines were much shorter in Building 2 than they were in Building 1. On our first night, we went to the Dominican restaurant and had an amazing time. We couldnt get a reservation until 9:45, so we were the last people there. The servers were incredibly friendly (especially Angel) and we all danced and took shots of Mamajuana together. It was definitely the most fun night. Foodwise, I thought the Italian restaurant was the best. We ended up eating there twice. Be sure to order the risotto- its wonderful. There were two other restaurants, but they were $25 a person extra, so we never went there. We had breakfast at the buffet... lots of wonderful bread and fruit. For lunch, we either went to the buffet again or had a hamburger from the grill at the beach. The hamburgers were really good. Great bread and even better if you put some lime juice on them. I personally had no stomach problems, although several in the group did. My advice is, if you have a weak stomach, make sure you bring the Pepto.Activities: There were several excursions offered through Apple vacations. We never went on any of them- simply because we enjoyed our beach time so much. We also decided against snorkeling because there is really no decent place to go at the resort, and you have to pay to be taken out to quality areas. Some members of the group got really into playing volleyball, and we met some other people from other countries that way. The animation team worked incredibly hard all day. There was something going on non-stop from 11:30 to 5:30. The European techno is playing at Pool 1 most of the day. They seem to have 1 CD that they just put on repeat, and you will hear the same songs over and over again. We didn't really mind this and now we miss a lot of this music, but we can see how others might find it annoying. The animation team would also wander the beach and try to make small talk. Many times, their English was not very good and it was hard to understand them. Often times they were VERY friendly to the girls on the trip, showering you with compliments.Souvenirs: There are a couple of gift shops at the resort. In my opinion, don't buy ANYTHING here if you can help it. They are very overpriced: $3 for a bag of M  Ms. On Tuesday nights, local merchants come into the resort and they sell jewelry, artwork, cigars and all sorts of things. They are fairly aggressive, and we learned that you just have to be aggressive back. If you are a woman, make sure you have a guy with you, as the vendors will often try to pull you aside and haggle with you privately. However, we found that women usually get better prices on things anyways. You should be able to get at least half of of the original price, but usually a lot more than that. My friend got a mask for $20 that was originally $250!. The vendors are very willing to take US dollars. If you walk down the beach to the left, there is a market with lots of vendors selling similar items. We bought things in both places, so just shop around and find the best price. Of course, each vendor will tell you that for you, its a special price... but they all say that. We were even told that he would give us 99% off! The vendors speak very good English as well. We also found that you can trade American merchandise for their products. My friend was wearing a $4 Wal-mart Texas visor and she traded it for a sarong! We also saw a man trade his shirt for some cigars.Nightlife: We would usually just go up to the lobby to hang out. They had a great bar, and the animation team would play music and dance for about an hour. They would occasionally have theme events like the Tequila Zombie (a coffin-shaped beer bong except with tequila!) and karaoke. This would usually shut down around 12:30, and by then we were usually exhausted and ready for bed. We would sometimes go to the 24 hour bar that's on the beach. Lots of people go to the disco that is on site, however we found this place pretty sketchy. Most of the group usually opted not to go there.Overall, we had a great time. Most everyone spoke at least a little English, although they really appreciated it when you tried to speak Spanish. It was a great, laid-back vacation for us and it could not have been more fun. I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants a great all-inclusive for a great value. We can't believe everything that we got for such a low price.I know that this review is incredibly long, but I just figured that more information is always better. If you have any questions at all about the hotel or anything, feel free to email me. I also have TONS of pictures of the grounds. Ferris2002@aol.com  
<Date>Mar 23, 2004

<Author>ShadowCanada
<Content>Superb! Hola,  Let me begin by writing that I left for the Caribe Club with some apprehension based on some of the negative reviews I had read on this and another site. My concerns were quickly and permanently alleviated as soon as we walked into the magnificent reception area. Check-in was quick and efficient However, because we had arrived at a little past noon, our room (which had been without a request upgraded to a suite) was understandably not ready. No problem as we had prepared for this - bathing suits and towels in our carry-on bags.. We grabbed a drink, walked through the Dominican mangrove forest which separates the reception area from the rest of the resort, toured the immense, beautifully maintained property, had lunch at the buffet and went for a swim. By 2:30 pm our room was ready. Our luggage was taken to out suite and our vacation was underway.  We stayed in building two overlooking pool one close to the buffet. The room was large and comfortable. Usually, it was cleaned by 11:00 am. Clean towels were readily available and face cloths were supplied. We had brought some along but we never used them. The maids did an excellent job and were very appreciative of the gifts and tips we left. I suggest you go to the dollar store and pick up soaps, nylons, toothpastes and other personal items and leave one or two things each morning for the maid. Rooms were tidied a second time in the evening and beds were turned back. This was done by a diiferent maid, so leave something for her as well.  The food at the huge buffet and a la carte restaurants was very good. At the buffet there was always much to choose from and the home baked breads and rolls were excellent. There always was much fresh fruits and vegetables and very tasty desserts. During our stay, there were several theme nights at the buffet featuring a particular national cuisine. Service was very good even if some times we would have to wait a few moments for our table to be reset or for coffee. Keep in mind that thousands of people are served each day and the buffet does not close to allow the staff to prepare for the next meal without guests being seated. The staff work very hard and they work non-stop. They are always polite and helpful. Learn a few Spanish words and phrases. It is really appreciated by the staff and it is seen as a sign of respect. As well, tip occasionally, you'll be remembered If you prefer a less formal dinner both beach front bar and grills serve lunch from about 11:30 to 4:00 so you never have to leave the beach or pools. Reservations are required for the a la cartes. These can be easily made in the morning with your building's concierge.  There are three pools on the property which contains the Tropical Princess and the Punta Cana Princess. Why this distinction exists is not clear because it is infact one resort and everybody uses the same facilities for the most part. Pool one has a swim up bar and most of the more loud and energetic activities organised by the animators take place there. It is the noisiest of the three pools, but the one to be at if you like a lot of activity. Pool two is less noisy, but the language of animation is German. But, it is far less active than pool one. Great music, reggae, merengue, salsa, and contemporary pop, is played there. Pool three is very quiet - great for an afternoon siesta. There are a total of four bars available to guests close to pools and the beach. The bartenders are friendly and fast. They understand many languages, but learn how to order in Spanish; they really like. Again, leave a tip once in a while. There is no need to bring insulated mugs. One of the strangest sights was watching sunburnt Canadians lugging their enormous Tim Horton coffee mugs from beach to bar.  The beach is extraordinary, beautiful white coral sand as for as you can see and warm aqua marine ocean water - truly remarkable. The only criticism I would have is the disregard that some tourists have for the environment and think nothing of littering the beach the beach with butts, straws and cups. The beach is cleaned every morning and seaweed is removed.  The rules regarding the reservations of chairs at the beach and the pool is not respected. This is true for all of Punta Cana. It's not a big deal. Play the game. If you get your towels down by 7:30 you have the spot you want. It's worth being up to see the sun rise and have your first coffee on the beach anyway.  The resort is host to a very interesting international mix - English is understood! No problem! You'll have a great time  
<Date>Mar 15, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Vacation of my Life! Our vacation was Feb 20-27 2004. My experience at the Caribe Club Princess was unforgettable I will be boring my community for quite some time. The lobby truly took my breath away. The hotel rooms were lovely and the view from our balcony was like a picture. The beach was clean and peaceful. The grounds were beautiful. I for one enjoyed the food experience and had to wait for coffee maybe twice, but it didn't matter I was there to enjoy myself and we truly left our stressful lifestyle at home. Didn't wait for the tram my husband and I and friends enjoyed our stroll through the gardens we were in no hurry. We were immediately relaxed a feeling we don't get much of. The daily pool actitivies were a blast and the young people who instructed the dancing and pool aerobics were so adorable. Especially our Cho Cho. We love you!! I don't think the people of this resort ever met a stranger they are wonderful and even if you don't speak their language they were eager show kindness. Our lady of housekeeping was terrific she had fresh towels everyday and one day the towels were late and she obviously brought them straight from the dryer still hot. No problem with bottle water or drinks. It poured rain one night and I got up to look out and the pool workers were cleaning the pool for the next day, in the rain! They are truly dedicated to making this a great resort. The Kontiki  Calypso Double decker boat excusion was one of the most enjoyable. The crew was a blast and so entertaining. As I look at my pictures I smile and laugh as I remember the best vacation of my life. Thanks, Caribe Club Princess and your many wonderful employees!! I would go back in a heartbeat!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Vacation Spot We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess from Feb. 20-27, 2004 and had a GREAT vacation at this resort. Before we left I had read reviews on this hotel and was a little skeptical, but the people who wrote bad reviews proved to be a little dramatic in their complaints. The staff during the daily activities and entertainment are UNBELIEVABLE!!! They work very hard to please everyone. They try to get people to participate in activities, but they are certainly not annoying. The rooms were very clean. Only once did we need more towels in our room and before we even realized it, the maid knocked on the door with clean warm towels, fresh out of the dryer. Our refridgerator was stocked daily with drinks. The restaurants were nice. The food is different than what we are accustomed to, but we can't complain about that because we were in a different country, of course the food is going to taste different. There was such a variety of different types of food, I don't know how anyone could complain about the food. We always rec'd bottle water when we asked for it. There was always a supply of bottled water, never a problem. The buffet restaurant has so much to offer. The refill on coffee was only upsetting if you'd let it upset you. That certainly didn't ruin our vacation and we only had that happen to us twice out of the seven days there. They just don't seem to service one area, they walk around all over the restaurant trying to refill everyone's cups. The drinks were awesome! They had beach party - we had a great time dancing. We would certainly recommend the Kontiki Calypso Snorkeling/Party excusion. It was probably one of our best days there. The staff on the Kontiki boat are awesome!!! The gardens at the Caribe Club are just amazing. Every day we saw someone working in the landscaping adding more things. We seldom used the tram to get around because we enjoyed the walkways so much. It's worth walking. Take advantage of the spa if you stay here, it's worth the extra money. The beach is very nice. We only spent one day at the pool, but the music wasn't extra loud, and didn't bother us at all. The other days we spent at the beach, OH MY WORD, IT WAS GREAT!!! We were one of those persons who put our towels out to reserve a spot, but only until we had breakfast. We probably didn't even need to do that because we were on the beach by 8 or 8:30 every day. No vendors pestering you like in the Bahamas. For anyone who had complaints, I think they've forgotten they had CHOSEN A 4 STAR HOTEL. We (4 of us) have no complaints and are certainly looking forward to going back again.  
<Date>Mar 5, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Perfect winter get away!!!!! Sadly, we just returned home from our trip to Punta Cana. We were there from February 21 - February 28. A group of ten of us went down from NH - 7 adults and 3 teenagers. We loved it!!!!I must admit I was pleasantly surprised. I did not have really high expectations based on the reasonable price and feared mediocre food and drinks at an all-inclusive. Boy was I wrong. We arrived at night so were not able to really take in how beautiful the resort was until the next morning. We woke up and found a little bit of paradise. We basically walked out of our room right out to one of the pools - the one with the swim up bar. The pools were great - big enough so that people could lounge around at one end and have aqua aerobics or volleyball at the other. I found the pools to be kept very clean too.From there, you just had to walk to the end of the pool to find the most beautiful strecth of beach - white, white sand, blue, blue water with lots of waves to play in - just perfect. We did walk the beach for quite a distance in both directions and I truly believe that the Caribe Club Princess had the best stretch of beach - wide enough so that people did not have to feel crowded.As others have recommended, whether you want to spend your day at the pool or at the beach, make sure that someone from your group gets up early to save chairs with towels. Even more important if you are hoping to get one of the little cabanas. We really never had a problem getting great spots - someone was almost always up and about by around 8:00.I will admit I was pleasantly surprised by the food. I am not usually a big buffet person but I thought the buffet was wonderful - there was definitely something for everyone. I am not a big meat eater so I mostly went for the wonderful fresh fruits, vegetables, pastas and rices. I was pleased with everything that I ate - even doing a little experimenting with some unusual things. And happily, my stomach was not bothered at all by any of the foods. Some in our group suffered a little but not to the point of putting a damper on the trip. We did manage to get reservations at the Italian and Brazilian restaurants. I highly recommend the Italian restaurant - the food and the service were excellent!!!!! I personally did not care for the Brazilian as it was centered around various meats - though very plentiful.I worried with an all-inclusive that drinks would be watered down. I found the exact opposite to be true. Strong drinks - however, cheap liquors. Our joke of the week was - Tastes like rum - since all of the drinks seemed to have about the same taste. Can't really complain though. After experimenting, everyone found something that they liked.In general, we found the resort to be well kept and clean. We found the staff to be excellent - very friendly and accomodating. We did find that tips went a long way with the wait staff especially at the bars.Having never been on an all-inclusive vacation, again, I was pleasantly surprised. Is it the equivalent of a 5 star resort - no, but for the money, I thought it was excellent. I would recommend this resort and would consider going back myself. And you absolutely could not beat the weather - sun everyday and high in the 80's - the perfect winter escape!!!!!!  
<Date>Mar 3, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Missing the beach.... My parents (47 and 53), my sister (15) and I (17) are all very activce people who never stop when we are home. Dance lessons, drama at school, basket-ball, volley ball, squash and an important social life are all part of our everyday life, and we looked for this type of entertainement while searching for the perfect resort. On top of relaxing on the beach or by the pool, we wanted to have a good time, dance, party and stay as active as we could. Without a doubt, the Caribe Club Princess provided us with everything we could have desired. When we first got there, on Febuary 3rd, 2004, they welcomed us with cold sented towels to wash our faces after the long plane ride and banana mama drinks to refresh us! We thought right away, you gotta be kidding!! The palm trees, the long white beach that goes on for miles, 3 pools, a really fun disco and an even more amazing crew of animators that kept everyone busy and excited during the day with a variety of activities and entertained us all at night with the many shows. They were all really friendly and outgoing, and really made you feel at home. As for the room, we thought we were getting 2 seperate rooms; one for the girls and one for the parents, but it ended up being 2 room linked together with a door, 2 bathrooms and 1 balcony. We were satisfied with the room, since it was clean, we always had fresh towels and the mini-bar was always full ect... although we didn't have too much extra space, we weren't in the room often anyways. We had problems with the air conditionning, and it was fixed right away, in a couple hours, no questions asked. The staff in general keep the resort really clean and beautiful. The food was fantastic, the buffet always had diffrent items everyday and it was HUGE, with everything you can imagine. Always leave some room for the amazing deserts. We tried 3 a la carte restaurants (the italian, the mexican and the italian) and although the atmosphere and the staff were great, the food was rather dissapointing, and we could have stuck to the buffet. The drinks were always flowing, and they had a really good selection, with the friendliest bartenders. Honnestly, there's nothing we could really complain about! After reading other comments, I can agree that you will probably need immodium, but just for a couple days and we never experienced slow service at this resort but if we did, we wouldn't have minded, we were in paradise! As for the roaches... we only saw one, and a heavy shoe got rid of it. Future incounters were avoided by putting a towel under the door. I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for an amazing time, young or not so young, you will have a blast for sure!  
<Date>Feb 21, 2004

<Author>脡laine03
<Content>A week in paradise First of all, since I am french canadian, please forgive my english. We (a couple in our late thirties) were at the Caribe Club Princess from February 7th to February 13th, 2004. We arrived at the hotel at 12:30 in the middle of the night, in a rain storm and strong winds. The electricity was out so we did the check in at candle light, but it went smoothly anyway. The electricity came back before we left the lobby so we could see how beautiful the lobby was. They took us to our room, but we had to wait about 45 minutes to get our luggage. We booked a VIP suite and it was worth the money: we were on the second of three floors, we had a spacious room with a living room area, a king size bed, a nice bathroom with two sinks, but most of all, we had a breathtaking direct view of the sea: we could see the ocean even from our bed, and we could see the sunrise from our balcony (room 2211). The only thing missing was the remote control for the tv, but we did not even ask for it since we did not watch the tv at all. The safe (don?t forget to ask the key when you check in) was at no charge because of our VIP suite.We found the hotel buildings and grounds absolutely beautiful. The buildings are painted with many warm colours (yellow, orange, blue, green) and it is done with a lot of taste. The lobby area and the theatre are separated from the room buildings with a nice path in the middle of a mangrove forest which we enjoyed to walk through a lot (five to ten minutes walk depending where your room is). Since the theatre was away from the rooms, it makes it quiet at night. We saw a couple of shows at the lobby theatre, and they were ordinary, but still entertaining.The guests at this hotel is a nice mix of nationalities, mostly from Germany, France, Canada and USA. Also there were people of all ages, with no concentration of old or young. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. Most of the animation and lobby staff, and the people at the nautical activities can answer in English, and sometimes even in french. But learn a few useful Spanish words: it is fun and they appreciate the effort (at least know por favor, gracias, hola, buenos dias, buenas noches, como esta / muy bien and cerveza?) We tipped one dollar now and then, sometimes at the restaurant or at the bar, but every day for our room lady, and with a little gift for her too (they particularly appreciate makeup stuff). Our room was done every morning and kept very clean, and they even came back in the evening to change the towels and empty the bin, and sometimes left us a few mint chocolates. They kept the refrigerator filled with water bottles, beer ?El Presidente?, pepsi and 7-up.The food at the buffet was ok. When we found nothing we liked for the evening theme, there was always the pasta bar which was very good. We tried the Italian and the fish restaurants. They were both good. For the fish restaurant, you have to pay 20 $ per person, but one visit there was included in our VIP suite. You have to make reservation for the ?a la carte? restaurants in the morning, between 8:30 and 10:30 in the entrance of your room building: it is simple and we never waited in line for more than 10 minutes.The beach is absolutely gorgeous, just a few seaweeds, and nice waves. But a message to the smokers: please do not take the beach as a big ashtray !!! You better reserve your chairs and cabana in the morning if you want to be sure to get some. The three pools are very nice and clean, we particularly enjoyed the third one (the one near the Tropical Princess section): it was a calm place to read.Activities: we did the Marinarium tour (snorkelling with rays and sharks) and we enjoyed it very much. We did parasailing: very fun, but the 10 minutes go by too fast. We took nice walks along the beach in both directions. If you buy stuff at the little shops along the beach, bargain a lot. We took a diving lesson and went for a dive in the ocean and it was also very nice. If you do snorkelling, the trick is to bring peaces of bread in a plastic bottle of water. You squeeze it to give out bread to the fish, and they gather around you.Internet access: very easy, near the lobby besides the boutiques. 5 $ for half an hour: if you take only 15 minutes, ask for a credit note before you leave: they give you a coupon for a free 15 minutes the next time.If one day we go back to Punta Cana (there are so many other places to visit), we would certainly go back to the Caribe Club Princess. Enjoy your vacation !!!  
<Date>Feb 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Do not recommend I read reviews for months before we left for our vacation. They were certainly very mixed. My husband and I went with another couple and we had a good time, but only because we made it good. The accomodations were average, but the rooms were kept clean. Originally they booked our rooms far apart and the next day moved our friends to a room next door. The Staff was friendly and did what they could, but certainly not in a reasonable time frame. We checked in @ 3:00 and our room wasn't cleaned until 6:35pm.. So it started off badly. The food was plentiful, but very bland. If you weren't up at the crack of dawn putting a towel on a chaise lounge by the pool or the beach then you weren't getting a chair until the afternoon. We had to be up by 8 am to be in line by 8:10 at the concierge to make a reservation at the restuarants. There were only 3 times and only 10 people per time. If you didn't get 6:30 or 8 the last one was at 9:45.. Way too late so you would have to eat at the buffet.. which the service was terrible - we had to get our own drinks and wait for ever to take your dirty plate away.. The positive of the buffet is there were plenty of seats. The shows were good and the afternoon poolside entertainment was good except it was very loud. Napping was a challange until I got earplugs. The bars drinks were limited and even the frozen drinks were watery. My recommendation if you speak english, find a hotel that caters more toward the American or English cultures. This was resort definitely catered more toward the Germans and French.  
<Date>Feb 18, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Our week in Hell Where do I begin?...this place is like none other we've ever visited. The grounds are spectacular,like out of a tropical paradise movie.Before we arrived,I spent a tremendous amount of time reading these reviews.What a waste of time,I was scared to go  eat the food after what people wrote.BTW...We stayed 1/17/04-1/23/04.the food is a little different than is served in America,but very adequate if not very good.I didnt know you could prepare lobster so many ways  all were very tasty! These people love there seafood as they take great pride in its preparation.When we werent eating lobster,shrimp  steaks,the offerings were quite overwhelming--they had everything each night-so I dont understand the reviews on how poor the selection or preparation of the food comes from--maybe these people should've spent their money on psycho-therapy instead. The Beach: the sand is flour white just as soft.The water is salty,but hey,it is the ocean.As for the seaweed,yes,there was a little,but once again,this is the ocean  there wasnt enough to make a decent sized salad with...so once again,I think these people are born complainers.We usually ate breakfast about 8:00 then wondered down to the beach,back to the room  around 10:00 or so would get set for the sun  beautiful topless scenery on the beach--chairs we never a problem getting  3 of the days we chose to get a cabana hut to view the scenery from--no problems at all!!! I'm 45  most of our group was of similar ages,some younger,some older,but middle-aged at least  we all did the boogie board thing-they are a blast-highly recommended!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Meet expectations- Good international client mix Me, my wife and 5 year old son stayed at the Caribe Club in Punta Cana 22-29 Jan. and found that the hotel met our expectations for a 4 star. We had no significant problems that were not addressed reasonably promptly by the hotel. I think that many of the negative reviews of this place are not balanced and focus on minor quircks .. I could rave on about how the Muzak playing in the mangrove swamp tackily detracted from the natural enviroment but I won't ..... Food was decent and plentiful, rooms were clean, hotel security was adequate, activities for children were multillingual and generally entertaining, bartenders were busy but efficient. Maintain personal security precations around guests and at the beach though as thefts do occur ... Although some staff had difficulties with english their attempts to communicate was certainly better than my attempts in Spanish. A capability in French is helpful. Many of the staff can speak a smattering of german, french, italian, english in addition to Spanish. There was a good international mix of guests- South and North Americans, many germans, some brits, french, russians and italians- A little cross cultural pollination never hurt anyone as far as I'm concerned and may well open the eyes of those who are self centered in an english-only world... No one bugged for tips- but I know they were appreciated. The value of the peso is dropping and the hotel workers are paid a pittance and many work very long shifts......Kids clothes are appreciated too...The stores on the resort were double in price than at the little commercial district Place Bavaro -which is a 15 minute walk away. Don't forget to bargain hard as if they were all car salesman! You get your best results when you start to walk away! Don't buy anything at PC airport unless you need to - prices are close to triple than anywhere else.....I would recomend this hotel for a family oriented vacation or to a couple to relax or even get married. There were many weddings when we were there- The VIP upgrade from Signature is worth the expense if you have a child or two...larger room, better TV, minor amenities etc...  
<Date>Feb 3, 2004

I just found the vacation to be a complete waste of my money. I would not recomend the hotel to anyone looking to travel to the Dominican Republic.
