<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>nice resort,but... Well...after some research.. Punta Cana was the ticket for a nice honeymoon. I chose the Princess Caribe..their were many positive reviews on Tripadvisor about the resort..and I needed a Sunday departure for Jan 18th-25th. I opted for a VIP upgrade through Signature Vac. There were some perks we hoped we could enjoy as honeymooners, including a SUITE upgrade which I paid extra $ for. ( more about this in minute)On checkin.. we waited almost 2hrs to get our room, and we were so exhausted. Also..there was absolutely no honeymoon suite offered to us..or as the 'manager' said..they 'overbooked' the hotel.This was so very upsetting...we looked forward to getting a suite! Thats why I paid for the upgrade! In the end ..what we basically got was a slightly larger hotel room with a king bed..thats it.The view was Ok... but as we soon discovered the actual building is very noisy..there are doors constantly slamming..(at all hours) echoing throughtout...Well... the actual resort is beautiful, clean and well-maintained. The reception area is HUGE and really neat in design!The beach is gorgeous..the water turqoise and warm. The sand soft and silky-white. Loved that..if you want chairs you may have to get up get up 5am in the morning to get chairs before all the Germans or French raided them with towels.Be very careful where and what you eat..The buffet was very good..with decent choices.Beware of the other restaurants..especially the Italian..my wife got really sick everytime we ate there, I got sick at the Mexican restaurant.All in all..we had nice relaxing time..got a great tan...talked to friendly locals in broken spanish/English..that work there..they make low wages..tip whenever possible.Its a very beautiful,, very active resort that just needs to improve its services..and this 3.5/4 star resort could potentially be a five star.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Unforgettable A friend and I stayed at this hotel from the 11th to the 18th of January. We weren't to happy to go to this hotel, cause we were expecting to go to another hotel. Somehow there were changes in our reservations and the Caribe Club Princess would have to be our home for this week. As soon as we saw the entrance of the hotel when we were arriving by bus, we put a huge smile on our faces. It's uncredible what you see. It's huge and beautiful. The check in was made very quickly and we were told to go to our room with the 24 hour train service of the hotel and our luggage would follow us. We got into the train and we couldn't believe our eyes. The hotel is very big and we thought we would never find our room. Fortunately things are well indicated and we found our room very quickly. We were on the third floor, the view wasn't the nicest, but the room looked good and we immediately knew that we would survive our stay with a smile on our faces. Our luggage came 15 minutes later and that's when we decided to go and take a shower. We are from Portugal, so we had had a long trip and needed to fresh up. We left our room with the intention to go to the reception and clearify some doubts and ask for a safe. Service was good. Then we decided to go back and have some dinner. Our room was in front of the buffet restaurant and most of the specialty restaurants, in front of the main swimming pool and next to the snack bar. So we were very well located. After dinner we noticed that there was a beach party going on and I think we couldn't have wished for a better welcome party. We soon got to know the entertainers and other clients and we had lots of fun. The following days were filled with beach, kayaking, tenis, dancing, aerobics, meeting people, eating and drinking, etc. There is no stop. If we thought we would get bored at one point for always being in the same hotel and seing the same people every day... in the contrary... we wished we had booked for 2 weeks instead of just 1. Every night a different show, then the party went on in the lobby and then in de disco. IT WAS GREAT! I loved the hotel's dance and did it every single time the entertainers asked us to join them. I left the hotel with pain in my heart. We met lots of new people, from all around the world, and I'm sure I will miss them a lot. The dominicans are very nice people and I don't understand why people say they only speak spanish or german. I heard lots of english and french too and there was noone complaining for not being understood. The food was great too... some things better than others, but neither of us got sick. And that's was counts. The specialties restaurants were a bit hard to reserve but we tryed all of them and it was good. I have visited many hotels, I've worked in a few of them too, and this was really one of the best hotels I have been to. CARIBE CLUB PRINCESS... PORTUGAL WISHES YOU ALL THE BEST!! We loved our stay!  
<Date>Jan 21, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Acceptable for the price - but won't do it again! My wife and I booked the CC Princess online after researching other Punta Cana hotels, and reviewing some of the testimony on TripAdvisor. Just got back, and felt the need to share some of our experiences. Overall, I would have to say that the hotel was acceptable for the price we paid, but our next vacation we will spend the extra $$ and get what we like. First the good stuff: The beach has great sand, nice small surf, and is long enough for a 2+ hour walk in each direction. The resorts grounds were very nicely kept, and the rooms clean. The three pools were all very clean, and hardly used - except for the daily water aerobics, etc. The food at the buffett was abundant, but bland - coffee was excellent. Food at the Italian restaurant was good, Mexican fair, and Chinese - poor. Our biggest complaint was that the resort was very loud! Our room looked over the main pool, and all day, every day, there was music blaring, and some guy screaming on a microphone OK OK Amigos! Needless to say, having an afternoon siesta in our room was out of the question. If you like the same tacky music every day, and enjoy group activities like this, then this won't be a problem. In order to escape the noisy pool area meant claiming a beach chair as far away as possible, but in order to do this you had to reserve your lounge chair by 7:30am every day. Making reservations at the a la carte restaurants required standing in line every morning (8:30) for at least half and hour - this was a pain, but we always seemed able to get a reservation. These two morning rituals made the vacation seem very regimented. Also, aside from the overpriced organized tours, there is nothing to do outside of the resort. We knew this before booking, but didn't think it would be an issue, because we just wanted a quiet week in the sun. We were looking at renting a car after two days - but travel time to Santo Domingo was 3 hrs. each way. So all in, we probably got what we paid for, but do yourself a favour, pony up the extra $1000 each, and go to a Sandals.  
<Date>Jan 20, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Trip but will not return to the hotel Just returned, Jan. 18, 2004 from the Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana. I have to say the resort is beautiful, the pools are nice and clean, the beach was raked every morning of debris, the flowers where in full bloom. It was the first island we have been to with an open aire airport and hotel it was a bit different but very nice. The staff was very friendly. We had a beautiful room on the 3rd floor of building 1 that overlooked the pool. Our room was cleaned everyday by 12:00 and we had fresh towels delivered everyday by 4:00 along with two bottles of Presidente beer. If you are looking for somewhere to go and you do not like to partake in the watching of shows or just want to be by yourseves this is the perfect place to be. I would say 90% of the hotel is Canadians, Europeans or Germans and as we found out this hotel caters to them specifically. All the shows are in German or Spanish 80% of the staff does not speak or understand English. But we managed. The food was ok but not spectacular. The best meal we had was at the Mexican restaurant other than that it was comparable to many buffets in the states but lacking seasonings. The internet cafe was a huge help to relay messages back to the states. We met one couple from the states that used a calling card that they purchased for 3 cents a minutes back home but was charged 30 cents a minute at the hotel. Make sure when calling you call the front desk and ask for an ATT operator or calling is difficult. Would of like watch or partake in some of the shows but all where in a foreign language and ddi not make much sense. All in all we had a good time and will come back to Punta Cana but will be staying at a different resort. We where told by our Apple representative that the Sunscape and Secrets Excellence are both 95% American and cater to the Americans. Although we talked to several couples at other resorts on the plane ride home that said there resort had American Entertainment. Please email if you have any questions.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Beware - terrible Service If this review will prevent even one couple from going here, then we will have accomplished something.My husband and I stayed at the Caribe Club Princess the week of Jan 02 to Jan 09, 2004 for our honeymoon. Note to honeymooners this is NOT the resort for you. The first three days of our vacation were spent pleading and disputing with the hotel for services that a four plus star hotel should rectify immediately. We are not picky travelers and this was ridiculous. Read on for more details.TERRIBLE SERVICE This hotel is known for having the Manana Syndrome . There is actually a page in the Signature book which explains this. It means that if there is a problem, it will be fixed tomorrow or maybe never. Nobody at the hotel will do anything to help you. They know you are only there for a short period of time, so if they can brush you off, they will. The staff will tell you, that will be fixed or done in 5 minutes , really it means hours or days, or never!!! Here is an example We checked into the hotel on Jan 02, 2004 at 11:30pm. The door to our suite would not close as the lock was broken. We PLEADED with the hotel for over two hours to change our room. Finally, at 2:00am, the problem was fixed temporarily. The next morning we pleaded again with the hotel for another room. We eventually did receive another room, but not until 6pm the next day. Upon moving to the new room, we noticed that the bathtub did not drain while showering. Our tub almost overflowed several times. It took the hotel almost 48 hours to rectify the problem and this only occurred once the maid saw our tub and made an emergency call to the front desk. The requests from myself and the signature rep to get the problem fixed were ignored!FALSE ADVERTISEMENT We booked through Signature Vacations. The Signature Website advertised special offers for honeymooners. (flowers, free massages, free a la carte dinner, fruit basket and wine). We based our decision to honeymoon at the Caribe because of these offers. We arrived Jan 02, 2004 and we asked our Signature rep about the promotions on their website. We were advised that Signature WAS NOT AWARE of these promotions, but were advised that we would indeed receive all of the free gifts, which we did not. We only received the wine and fruit on our LAST night, but only because we had to constantly fight for them.NO CLEAN TOWELS It is impossible to get clean towels on the beach after 1pm as the hotel is always out. The irony is that the hotel and Signature are aware of the problem, but nothing is being done to rectify it. Also, we did get clean towels in our room every day, but only after 9pm.BEACH The water is nice and there are no rocks in the water, but the beach is dirty. There is seaweed everywhere and the hotel never rakes the beach. You will find plastic cups, cigarette buts, dirty napkins etc. on the beach every day. Kids dig holes in the beach and it takes the hotel days to fill them. Pay the extra money and go to La Romana where the beaches are spectacular.FOOD We did not get sick on the food, which was good, but there is absolutely NO variety at this hotel. If you have traveled to 5 star hotels before, you will be disappointed. The buffet had no variety. As for the a la carte restaurants We had to wait over 45 minutes after being seated to even being acknowledged by a waiter and get water and wine at the Italian restaurant. The food here is disgraceful. The other restaurants are OK, but the meat is all terribly overcooked, it is like leather.CONCLUSION If this is your first time traveling, then this hotel would be fine as you will have nothing to compare it to, however, if you are a seasoned traveler and like a nice hotel with good food and service, go elsewhere.  
<Date>Jan 15, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Enjoyed it but we probably won't go back. My wife, daughter and I spent December 21 to 28 at the Caribe Club Princess in Punta Cana. We were glad we went and enjoyed it for the most part. It is ranked a four star hotel and that is what it should be ranked. It is not a five or six star.Our room was nice (oversized, basically it was almost two rooms) with a king bed and two single beds. The bathroom was large with a great shower/bath. There was an outdoor patio.The beach was the cleanest, most beautiful we've ever encountered, although you need to get up at 7-8AM to get towels and place them on lounge chairs to insure you get them. There were times people didn't get towels later in the afternoon as they ran out. Many women of all shapes, ages, and sizes go topless. But we got used to it quickly.The workers were extremely friendly but many did not speak any english. It is wise to bring single dollars with you as a dollor or two tip is generous to them. You cannot get dollars in any ATM's ( the caribe does not have an ATM) and you do not want to be stuck with pesos when you leave. They will exchange only 30% to dollars upon exiting the island. Bring cash and travellers checks.The buffet and restaurants were very good. We loved the Mexican restaurant. The Chinese and Italian were also OK. The wait staff could give lessons to many american restaurants for their friendliness and promptness to your desires. You do need to make reservations in the lobby at 8:30AM each day if you want to eat in a themed restaurant. Incidentally, remember to ask for liquor if you want it in your drink. A pina colada doesn't have rum unless you ask con ron.We did take taxis into the town twice during the day (Higuey) to shop but the people there were incredibly aggressive. Plus men alone will be approached by women of the night even in the afternoon. Do not go there at night. The resorts have armed guards at the gates and beach to keep it safe.There is no real casino at the CC Princess but there is a shuttle that runs every 20 minutes to the next door resort which has a small casino after 8PM. Roulette, blackjack is a dollar minimum so if you are a Vegas afficiando then you'll think you were at the church charity casino night. They did have a great bar with free drinks and a sitting area for spouses who don't gamble.Christmas eve was fun and is the only time the help is allowed and encouraged to party with the guests. Champagne was flowing for everyone.You ask why wouldn't we return? We just like islands like Aruba, Nassau, etc. in which you are comfortable touring the landscape for various clubs, restaurants, casinos, shopping, etc. We enjoy renting a car and seeing the countryside. That is not the case in Punta Cana. There you spend the vast majority of time in your resort.Oh, by the way, we did do the Marinarium excursion. It cost $75 each person. They pick you up by bus and take you to to an area where you board a boat which trolls out into the ocean. It stops at a predetermined spot which has a fenced in area in the ocean. You get goggles and snorkles and get to swim to the fenced in area and join stingrays, fish, and sharks. That was great. The sharks are vegetarian sharks but it still is amazing to swim with them. The excursion advertised lunch and drinks. They do supply drinks (soda, rum, beer) but the lunch is a make it yourself sandwich of cheese and ham that they bring around on trays. The boat staff was very friendly and spoke english, spanish and french. The trip was an hour late getting back to the resort so we did miss our dinner reservations however.My recommendation is that if you get a good deal (and January and February are good times) then the Caribe Club Princess is great.One final note: we went with the excursion company that is three letters and starts and ends with T. We saw the rep for ten minutes and never again. Plus our shuttle to leave was an hour late and would not have come unless we made three calls. I'm sure that was unusual but it was not a pleasant way to end the trip.Hope this helps.  
<Date>Jan 10, 2004

<Author>travel2maui
<Content>Above average if not excellent We were in the D.R. Dec. 27, 2003 through Jan. 3, 2004 which was probably peak season. We did not feel that the place was overcrowded, however. The one negative impact that the time of year had was in the lack of availability of lounge chairs at the pool. To get a lounge chair you have to reserve early. Unfortunately many chairs are reserved by guests and never occupied even though there are signs that dis-allow this practice. This resort has a buffet restaurant, and 7 or 8 specialty restaurants. The specialty restaurants are Seafood, Italian, Brazilian, Mexican, Dominican, Chinese, and Steak. We had 3 children with us and they could not truly enjoy the a la carte experience. The steak restaurant was wonderful, Brazilian offered more food than a person could possibly consume, and the seafood was also very good. The feedback we heard about the Chinese restaurant was not positive. The buffet restaurant offers made to order eggs and omelets daily, as well as a pasta bar for both lunch  dinner. The dishes are labeled in 3 or 4 languages. There was a problem getting beverages at the meals. We frequently had to get our own coffee or drinks. Again this was probably due to the resort being at it's peak season. Our room was located on the first floor. Clean  comfortable. No facecloths - bring your own if this is important to you. We tipped the housekeeper and several other staff members for exceptional service. We had been told by our travel rep that their monthly income is approximately $200 (US) and we felt that tipping was appreciated by the staff. The beach is very nice. No seaweed or garbage. The ocean was rough with high winds, and it rained daily for a varying amount of time on each occassion. We walked 15-20 minutes down the beach daily to shop with the local vendors. Be prepared to pay 30-50% of the initial asking price. Some of the shop keepers can be aggressive and persistant. There are three pools. They are well maintained. There may be some effort on the part of the hotel to separate the German, French and other travelers - possibly due to language barriers. There is a separate show area for the Germans. The open-air lobby was beautiful and had been decorated for the season with a tree. It has a thatched roof, comfortable furniture, and a marble floor. There are several gift shops, and an internet cafe. The guest rooms are located 10-15 minutes from the lobby, and there is a golf cart type vehicle that makes routine trips around the facility to transport guests that do not want to walk to their rooms. The walk to the rooms is through beautiful gardens, and these gardens are one of the highlights of this resort. There are mini fridges in the rooms that are stocked daily with beer, sodas and bottled water. There is a spa that offers massages and other services. A 1 hour massage is $45. Horseback riding was included in our package and was a highlight for our kids. We did not see the shows or take excursions. The excursions that were offered included an Outback Safari trip, a helicopter ride, a marinarium, Santo Domingo, and golfing to name a few. There can be a language barrier with some of the staff. Overall we enjoyed this resort and feel it deserves it's 4 star rating. Would consider a return visit.  
<Date>Jan 5, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Vacation Place My wife and I arrived on the 25th of Dec.03 for a one week stay. We were not disappointed the food was good, fresh and plentiful. Our room was kept clean. The staff for the most part were friendly and helpful. They have the greatest hard working animation team. This was our first trip to the Dominican Rep. and we found the majority of Dominicans to be very friendly and warm. This resort is very family oriented with a good mix of Spanish, German, British tourist which gave our vacation a unique international flavor.We took a day excursion with Outback Jungle Safari that was a worthwhile experience to see life beyond the resorts. We would certainly highly recommend this resort to anyone seeking a fun holiday. Thank You Princess

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We had an EXCELLENT time!! My husband and I just got back from the Caribe Club Princess and we had a fantastic time! We are both in our 30's and even though there were many children at the resort, we still enjoyed every minute of our vacation. The hotel was beautiful and to our surprise they upgraded us to a honeymoon suite!! It was gordeous with a jacuzzi and a canopy bed and our maid was so wonderful and made sure we tipped her well!! The food was good, but we both like spicy food and we found the food to be a little bland, but it was still good with many choices. The drinks were strong, so I basically stuck to beer and water but lying in the sun all day, you really don't want to drink too much alcohol anyway. The staff were very friendly and always made an effort to say OLAH!! They were always happy and singing while they worked, which made our stay very enjoyable. The great thing about this resort was that you didn't care if you spent your entire time on the resort instead of taking day trips because there was so much to do and the beach was beautiful. We had sun every day and I TOTALLY recommend anyone to go to this resort. Thank you Caribe Club for a vacation of a life time!! GRATIUS!!!!(sorry if my spelling is wrong :) )

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A Great Week! Hi Everyone, My daughter and I travelled down together for the week prior to Christmas and it was wonderful. The weather was great, even on the day it rained. There's nothing like big warm drops of tropical water to remind you you're not shoveling snow. The food was good and it was always labeled. That's great as I don't eat fish. The coffee is excellent although I do wish they were faster with the refills. Our room was always clean although if you want washclothes, take your own. Kleenix is a novelty item there as well. Next time I'll take a shower buff puff and then throw it away. We tipped most days a dollar or two as their wages are low and it was the Christmas week. Christmas day buffet was incredible. Prawns, lobster, wine flowing. Absolutely beautiful displays. We had supper with most of the Canadians who are the friendliest. The French Canadians, Germans and French pretty much keep to themselves. We didn't really encounter rudeness but it would be nice if they smiled once in a while! Our signature rep was not the most helpful. She was polite enough but certainly didn't go out of her way for us. We found out more useful information from fellow travellors. Just a tip: if you miss out on making a dinner reservation try the lady who usually stands at the entrance to the buffet restaurant. This worked for me when my rep said it was too late. (She was wrong) The evening shows were not high on our list as they weren't that professional. It was nicer sitting by the ocean with a glass of red wine and watching the waves. The 24 hour bar by the beach is wonderful. The staff were great, our room was not really fancy but clean and comfortable, the food was better than the Copacobana on the Mayan, and the beach was nice. Further up you got garbage and lots of seaweed. Be aware that when you leave the Dominican, they weigh your luggage and charge you $5.00 American for every kilo you are over. This is a bit of a scam as our home airlines let you load too heavy suitcases. If you buy things you end up paying through the nose. Two young men on departure had to pay $140.00 American to go home. Quite the surprise. We'll go back again. A nice resort.   
<Date>Dec 28, 2003

<Content>best trip ever My wife and I went to Punta Cana from november 2 to 9, 2003 We use to go to Florida every year but anymore we loved our vacation to the Caribean We stayed at the Caribe Club Princess HotelMy '' habitacion'' ( room) were very clean and the daily maid service was excellent.Food : I personnaly work in a hotel business for many years and I can tell you that you cannot complaint.breakfast buffet : fully complete, with staff cooking in front of you : omelet or turned over eggs. etc..lunch buffet : excellent lots of choices, or you can always have hot dog, hamberger, chicken , sausages etc. near the beach. salad bar is always availabledinner : buffet excellent with an attraction every night. ( special dessert made in front of you, fresh caesar salad, always a pasta bar cooked last minute) the trick with buffets is you take one different choice every meal and not a bit of everything.a la carte restaurant : mexican beautiful atmosphere, food ok. bresilian: nice atmosphere, food excellent too much. we did not go to the italian restaurant ( pasta bar everynight at the buffet), we did not go to the chinese restaurant. Nightly shows : We went to all of them, it is fantastic they have 10 professionnal dancers + the animation team.daily activities : very well organized.overall rating : we are 50 years old and it was our best trip ever. we will surely go back to the same place next year.p.s. the beach was ok, the drinks too much ( have fun Yves Brien

<Author>mj1m
<Content>Absolutely Beautiful!!! Have stayed at this resort and I can say is absolutely beautiful. I have written before on this site about the Sunscape Punta Cana Grand, (nothing Grand about this place at all). You can compare the two hotels. My wife  I stayed in the Royal Suite overlookingthe pool and the ocean, and we we amazed. We have been to some of the nicest resorts in the Caribbean, but this resort is one of the best. The room was a nice two story, two bathroom, two balcony, jacuzzi suite with all the amenities of home. We were treated like a King and Queen, I would have to say wherever we went on the resort. They were in the midst of changing when we arrived and their sister hotel was being completed and have received rave reviews so far.It amazed me at the Sunscape as I mentioned in my comment on their page, how we noticed the staff making up rules to the guests as theywent along, quite disappointing. And the tour guides blatently lying to their guests telling them the Sunscape was the only hotel in the Punta Cana area, and that the beach was Bavaro Beach.. We laughed as I read these reviews all the time and people at these hotels try to convince people who have never been to Punta Cana just where Bavaro beach is. One American wrote on her comments that this beach area is indeed Bavaro Beach and if nobody agreed with her, then they really weren't seasoned travellers to the DR Well sorry to bust anyone's bubble but, the Caribe Club Princess is indeed in the middle of Bavaro Beach and it is a safe and beautiful resort which can offer a different world of Royal Suites if your willing to pay the extra money. Trust us you won't be dissappointed. If you want to know anything else about the resort, feel free to e-mail me, we have actually directed some other people to this resprt and they have thanked us ever since!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Experience My wife and I were at the Caribe Club Princess Nov 09 16, 2003 thanks to our travel counsellor who recommended this hotel. We were very satisfied with our vacation, and will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to our friends. This is an excellent facility, very clean rooms, immaculate grounds-keeping, good food, professional animators (activity coordinators), fantastic beach, friendly and polite staff. Although it rained a lot (being the rainy season), this did not dampen the spirit of the employees and guests. The rain only falls for a few minutes then clears up. The key is to loosen up, remember you are on vacation, relax and make the best of all circumstances. The staff will ensure that you enjoy yourself as long as you are willing to participate. Beware of the vendors at the Bavaro Plaza and surrounding area. Their first prices will clean out your wallet. Negotiate and be prepared to walk away if you do not get the price you are prepared to pay.  
<Date>Nov 26, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Absolutely Fabulous Resort!!! I just got back from an amazing week at the Caribe Club Princess. I knew the moment I entered the lobby that this would be a vacation of a lifetime. The resort was beautiful. The facilities were clean and very well maintained. The pools and beach were beautiful and very clean. The food and drinks were excellent. The variety of drinks available and include in the all-inclusive package was very impressive. If you asked for a drink, even something not so popular, they could make it for you. The staff was incredibly friendly and spoke many languages including english, french and spanish. The entertainment (shows) each night were very well done and lots of fun! There were tons of Canadians at this resort and it was very easy to meet lots of people, although if you are just looking for a great pool to lay beside and read a book, this resort has that too. My advice...don't hesitate...book the trip, it's well worth every penny. I can't wait to go again and maybe for two weeks next time!

<Author>TRAVELINGAGENT
<Content>Nice Family Hotel My Husband  I in our early 50's, hosted this trip with our children and grandchildren 11 in total, kids aged 9,7,2,18mths. We did plenty of research before hand and chose this for the 4 - 4+ rating it has , the kids facilities, the a la cartes (unlimited), the activities and such, and it was sufficient in that respect. We had no problem with rooms being cleaned, it was always done, use the please clean room sign on your door, ours was done early every morning except one day and restocked as required, although the towels or water may come a little later if they are awaiting supplies ( happens in any hotel). We found the food to be good in every restaurant, the a la cartes were not hard to book just go first thing in the morning, stand in line and wait your turn no problem getting in 11 people when we wanted to, tried Italien, Chinese, Mexican all good and services good. Beach towels not hard to get, we usually go right after breakfast around 9:00 a.m. and then choose chairs pool or beach, no problem. Kids club had mini disco for kids, great idea, just wrong language and so was beach sing a long for kids, but we went and hummed along anyway. Dr. services were needed by our littlest traveller, they are in a seperate little building right by the hotel rooms and are there 24hrs and speak english. An ambulance was needed and arrived in 5 min. and they were taken to Higuey hospital 30 min. away. Hospital was very nice and modern, enterpreters available and if you have travellers medical insurance they contact your physician and obtain medical information. Two nights stay was need for bronchitis, mom and dad both allowed to stay...very efficient. Some of us had minor stomach ailments, but would just chalk it up to too much drink, sun, or wrong choice of food, nobody laid up in room for any more than couple of hours. All in all good hotel and lovely beach, staff efficient and services were there as said.  
<Date>Nov 24, 2003

<Author>c_eos
<Content>WE wont be reurning I'm sorry to report I have to agree with others on here that the resort has a real health problem there. Very nice and clean resort and great beach area for entertaiment purposes. The european tourists could be very rude when they wanted to be but I was there for relaxation and wasnt about to let that bother me. My husband is still suffering from a bacteria bug he picked up there as well. We never could pinpoint the culprit he ate but even after eating nothing but bread and water for the last 3 days of our holiday he still suffers. This man has a cast iron stomach and the 2nd day just about wiped him out. IModium Imodium Imodium is a must! It saved our holiday from being ruined. The majority of tourist were constantly drinking bottle water which should have been a sure sign for us . Our maid was very good tho she understood no english at all. But the maids tend to come at all times of the day and nite for whatever reason and just walk in. With Signatures new VIP CLUB program express checkin was great but I wonder if they need to use this as a way of attracting tourist to this resort?We are seasoned travellers and have visited PPlata 3 times previously and cuba as well and will continue to travel there but this is one resort we wont return to. We are easy to please so long as we have a decent clean room , nice beach and safe food and drink. We had all( they serve bottled Dasani water) We had all but the food which could have be disasterous and I hate to think if it had been a child this happened to.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>wouldn't go back if you paid me We were at the Caribe Club for our honeymoon from Nov 1, 2003 to Nov 8, 2003. The room was clean, and refreshed daily. The beach was also clean, but that is where the positives end. We were not given any of the honeymoon bonuses we were promised, despite asking numerous times. Our room was on the top, (third), floor and it rained every night and kept us awake all night due to the metal roof on the hotel. I can't begin to describe the sound of rain on metal!!!! The entertainment was poor, the activities were predominantly in German, and very badly organised. We went on one day trip which promised a historical tour of Santo Domingo during which we were rushed through a museum and a Cathedral in about 45 minutes and then deposited at a souvenir shop for the rest of the day. We were told that the food was washed in purified water, which we witnessed not happening. I am still dealing with the resulting bacteria from that, and likely will be for another while. The staff was reasonably polite, although not very helpful. I also overheard them a number of times mocking various guests, that is until I let it be known that I speak Spanish. Also of note is that the Caribe Club is located on the property with another hotel. This means that there are actually twice as many people sharing ammenities as what we initally were told. There is only one public washroom in the beach/pool areas, which was never busy, so be prepared for an excessive amount of urine in the pools.Overall we were very dissapointed in this trip, and I would not recommend it to anyone thinking about taking a trip down.  
<Date>Nov 13, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Americans beware My husband and I went to Punta Cana in April of 2003. We thought this resort was great all the employees we came across were wonderful and really enjoyed the Americans. We took the safari tour which was a Blast. It was are first time visiting Punta Cana and it did take us awhile to catch on to some things. Reservations must be made very early in the morning to go to any of the restraunts and you must rise and shine to get a beach chair. We also did have some issues with the water sports. The boat never came to take my husband out water skiing and they seemed to be a little reluctant to give our US dollars back. The one thing to remember before you go is watch out for other travelers they are not fund of the Americans going to their vacation spots and they are not afraid to let you know it.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great for the price! My family just returned from Caribe Club, now called the Tropical Princess or Caribe Club Princess, both are on the same property but if you book at the Tropical Princess you will only get to visit 2 of the a la carte restaurants, otherwise you will have to pay a supplement at the remaining 5 restaurtants. We never did visit the al a cart restaurants as the buffet restaurant El Higuero was just fine. Only a few items were repeated each day but with such a selection it didn't matter. The rooms in the Tropical Princess side were plain but clean, the drawers kept getting stuck making loud noises. There was no iron in the room so make sure you bring one with you. Next door they were building a new complex and were awakened by the heavy machinery. No bugs were incountered, but the odd lizard on the walls in the hallway. One of the theatres only presented shows in German. The shows by the lobby were entertaining, but late 21:45 each night. Canadian money had to be exchanged to pesos, not American Dollars. Mini-bar was stocked daily with glass bottles of Pepsi and 7 up, warning about the ceramic floors and glass bottles! Bottled water was plentiful and the water that was poured at the buffet restaurant was fine. The service in the buffet was slow and the tables were never set with full cutlery, SPOONS are a rare find here! The beach was clean, no rocks anywhere, but the water was a bit rough and therefore not the blue caribean water you see in the brouchures. You get one towel card per person upon arrival and if you lose it there is a $20.00 U.S. charge. The resort mainly caters to Spanish and German guests, but overall the resort was fine, great swimming pools and bar service. Great rate for last minute deals! Enjoy!  
<Date>Sep 15, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Only American's There My family just returned from a trip to Punta Cana. I was really surprised to find we were the only American's there that week. We ran into very little english and I think the employees were annoyed with us. The resort was clean, the beach needed to be raked but it was picked up of garbage. One of the pools was closed down. One pool had some green on the sides. The entertainment was good. The kids club was a little scary, there is no really check in and they have no idea how to account for all the kids. You do not sign in or out each time. Also there was very little english spoken by the kids club leaders. They had a great agenda for each day but didn't follow it everyday. The food was ok. My husband and I got the revenge. His lasted about a week, I am still on antibiotics going on week two. I really liked the Itailian Restrarant but hated the Mexican one. The buffet had lots to offer but I was afraid to eat most of it. We took two trips outside of the resort. The country is very dirty, garbage everywhere. The driving is scary. The snorkeling was in very rough water with coral very close to your body also scary. The room was clean and bug free, but sometimes the room wasn't cleaned until 5 or 6 PM. Also expect very little help if you lose a child on the beach, that is after you find someone to translate for you. This was the most scary part. I'm glad we went I just don't think I would go back with so many other places to go.  
<Date>Aug 26, 2003

<Author>Trinigirl07
<Content>Needs Improvement for 4 star My husband, daughter  I spent the week of August 3rd - 10th inclusive.Good Points: 1)Property: beautiful and very well maintained. Lots to do, or nothing at all if you so wished. Beach: small waves  bits of seaweed, but not a problem. 3)Animacion Team: entertainers kept you busy if you chose to do so and quite aggresive with the young ladies. 4)Food:selection quite repetitive, but very edible. Bottled water readily available.Other Points: Spanish, German, French and then English is spoken by the entertainment crew, and in that order. Strong German presence. They have their own theatre, child care and dedicated entertainer staff. The staff do not speak english whatsoever, and therefore are afraid to even make eye contact with you. This comes across as being unfriendly, but once you make the effort to say Hola they will respond. However they do need more english speaking staff at the front desk. If help was needed you had to wait until they could find someone who could speak English. My high school Spanish came in handy. As in Cuba, take small gifts for the maid, and you will find that it goes a long way. They were very appreciative. The restaurant is open air, which is very uncomfortable for dining, especially at night. I believe that this is the main reason why we all got sick at different intervals. My daughter  I were sick for one day, but my husband still has lingering effects. TAKE IMODIUM !! Rooms are sparingly furnished, but there were holes in the walls where things had been moved around and not replaced/replastered/repainted. Patio lock was broken and safe not working. Didn't get it all fixed until the following morning. Free horse back ride takes 1 hour there  back and since we were not a paying customers we did not get drinks/snacks like they did. Also we had to wait an additional 2 hours till they completed their ride. TAKE REPELLANT !! My daughter loved the ride in spite of this. My husband could not ride as the truck had no shocks and he developed a bad headache from it. Shop at the beach stalls (as opposed to Plaza Bavaro or the hotel) which is to the left of the hotel (towards LTI Beach Resort) as the prices are at least half price or less. BARGAIN for everything. !! Please attend the orientation meeting from your travel operator as it will prove to be very informative.Overall it was relaxing, but I would not come back again to this resort only because we like to try different places. I do not consider myself picky as we have been to Mexico, Cuba, Cozumel, Venezuela, Acapulco, etc. I compared it to the 4 star in Cuba, and Cuba wins hands down over the Dominican. This resort deserves a 3-3.5 rating.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Mixed review The grounds are breath-taking. The hotel management horrible. The hotel staff is very polite and always nice, but fairly inefficient. The activities (archery, catamaran, soccer, beach volley ball, etc) are on time and entertaining. Now the details: We were there from June 21st to July 5th. Upon arrival at 3:15pm after the 3:00 pm check-in time and our room was not ready until 5:00pm.. We waited in the lobby which is not air conditioned. It was hot and humid. I would have liked to change into my swimming suit and go swimming to cool off. After a 2 hour wait, they gave us the wrong room. We had asked for 2 queen size beds and instead got one queen size bed an a crib. We had to call the reception. When I asked to speak to someone who spoke english, I was transferred very politely to someone who barely spoke english. Finally we got the room we asked for. House keeping cleaned our room any time between 10 am and 7 pm. One day (out of 15 days spent there) we had no dry/clean towels by 7:00 pm as we wanted to shower before dinner. The following day arround 5:00 pm, I saw house keeping and asked for clean towels. The food service is varied and does accomodate many tastes. I never got bored with the food and the restaurants a la carte have a nice atmosphere and did make us feel as if we were going out (of the resort). At the buffet, it was always difficult to find spoons, and drinks often came with a 15-30 minute delay. Once I recieved my beer after I was done eating. The last two days of our stay more than 75 guests came that day. The buffet ran out of coffee that night and although I had requested a spoon to eat my ice cream, I never got one. I shared my seven-year old son's spoon. While at the resort I got my advanced scuba diving certification. The dive-master as well as the rest of the teachers were charming, supportive, laid back and I enjoyed every minute with them. Kayaks and other free items such as bicycles, tennis rackets, canoes, etc were readily available. I don't know whether that would hold true during the high season (since they ran out of spoons and coffee the first time they received a batch of tourists). My 7-year-old son and 4-year-old daughter went to the mini club for children. The staff spoke decent english and were extremely friendly and always smiling. They always went out of their way to greet the children and compliment them even if they happened to bump into them. The people who taught Meringue lessons, aerobic, etc... are funny and entertaining. The pools are clean and the beach is beautiful.When it was time to leave, we learned that the President of the Dominican Republic had added an exit tax that was either $10 per person or $20 per person. No one could tell us for sure at the hotel. It turned out it was $10 per person (in addition to the $10 entrance Tax) if you flew by AA (Chartered planes are $20 per person).As for health, out of a party of 8, we all got sick for at least a couple of days at different times. We all drank the bottled water, but could not find a common cause. We speculated that it could have been the fish, and after I stopped eating fish, I got better. That was not the case for my wife. My kids got sick during the last three days. I guess it's like the added tax, every body has to pay.Overall we enjoyed ourselves and wished that management had their act together.  
<Date>Jul 6, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would not return We just spent 7 days at Hodelpa, now called Caribe Club Princess, from June 22 to June 29, and since most people who wrote were happy there, I wasn't.To begin with, some of the hotel staff, mostly the reception were rude and very impolite. I believe the first impression of any hotel is the reception. The people there barely knew a decent working knowledge of english. By mistake, I gave the wrong paper to the guy, and it was like I gave him a stick of dynamite! We asked for a safe, once again, we were told rudely to go to the other end of the counter. We paid $11.00 US for our safe, and to add to that, she didn't have any change, fortunately I had. We finally left the reception with no enjoy your stay or any kind of welcome.During our stay, the animation staff could use some improvement. Same activities, same music. Nothing really to get me going. They seem to have more interest for the German guests.The evening shows were done by people from the outside. I went only once and got bored. Most people I talked to, went once too, and never returned. The shows also very late, they start at 9:45 pm.The beach wasn't too bad. Lots of seaweeds. The water had lots of waves, which picked up the sand from the bottom, so the water near the beach wasn't too clear. I read some comments of people who wrote about the cleanliness of the beach. Since there is nothing much to do about the weeds, it's part of nature, plus the staff did their best in picking them up every morning, but it would have helped if the guests, especially the Europeans, like the Germans, and the Spanish would pick up the empty glasses, water bottles and put them in the trash cans instead of leaving them on the beach.Our suite, and the hotel gounds were very beautiful. We had a view of the swimming pool, and a decent view of the beach and ocean. We did encounter guest who had various problems with their rooms, such as roaches, bad views, once again the reception were less than interested in helping out their guests.The food wasn't too bad for me or my girlfriend. We generally ate everything, but you still have to be carefull. The staff at the buffet were very nice, especially the breakfast staff. We appreciated the friendly service of Anyi.If you must go into town, do it in the day. We went in the early evening, because we needed money, and there wasn't an ATM at the hotel. All the beggars, shopkeepers, and the prostitutes are out harassing you. We found most people prefer the US dollar or the Euro, and some get insulted when you pay them in pesos. We asked Milton at the reception to call us a cab, and he acted like we woke him out of a good dream. The cab driver was very happy when we paid in US, but the same guy was insulted when we paid in Pesos.When we were finally ready to leave, I called the reception twice for them to come and get our luggage, and we called 1 hour before check-out, and 2 hours before our bus was to pick us up. 55 minutes later, my girlfriend, the maid, and I brought our luggage down.Once again, when we checked out, the reception was less than friendly, no thank you's, no goodbyes.I would not recommend anybody to stay at that hotel. Too bad, because it is a very beautiful resort. Hopefully with the changes in Management from Hodelpa to Princess hotels, thing will change in the future. Should I go back to Punta Cana, I'll most probably stay at an Iberostar resort.  
<Date>Jul 1, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Just What I needed This resort was spectacular. Me and my girlfriend just got back last night (June7, 2003) from Punta Cana, and it still almost seems like a dream we had. We didn't expect the place to be so beautiful and elegant, but we weren't about to argue with it :) The beach was as marvellous as you could expect, and the pool was magnificent as well. I particularly enjoyed the sunken pool bar. Furthermore, we got the cheap room, or Superior as they call it, and it was plenty big, with great air conditioning, and very clean and pleasant service. The buffet was excellent, although I did get quite sick the first night (pack your immodiums people). My sickness could have been from other people on the plane, the many different types of drinks I had, or quite possibly the Mexican a la carte restaurant. We only got to try the Mexican and Italian, and the Italian was quite good. Other people also suggested the Chinese place, but we didn't want to risk more stomach problems. At lunch be sure to go the the Snack and Grill, which overlooks the ocean. They had barbeque ribs, sausage, hot dogs, burgers, fries, and other stuff that made us feel right at home. Finally, I was really worried about an overabundance of people that would make it difficult for us to find lounge chairs on the beach, as well as being outnumberred by Europeans. These fears were brought upon by reading other reviews. However, it was quite the contrary. We had plenty of usage of all the watersports, and the other facilities. Maybe we chose a less busy time of year??? The animation team was very energetic and funny as well. They were cool because they didn't really force anyone to do anything, they just tried to encourage it. Overall, spectacular trip, and I would recommend it to anyone.  
<Date>Jun 8, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>wonderful experience My husband and I, from the midwest, along with another couple, from the east coast, spent 2 weeks at the Hodelpa/Caribe Club Princess in May. It was wonderful. The beach/water was perfect. Our rooms, Jr. Suites were large and extremely clean. Pools, 3 of them were fabulous. Food, well, if you have to complain about food then an all-inclusive is not for you. The food was good. Large selection every day-whatever you desired, they have. A-la carte restaurants were ok. Good for a change in ambiance. Drinks were weak, unless you are travel savvy-tip the wait staff and you are treated accordingly. I never understood the whole all-inclusive concept, those workers do not get tips. On our last morning there, all 4 of us were given un-opened bottles of rum from the bartenders. We had taken good care of them during our stay. We travel extensively, our friends have been traveling for 26 years. Punta Cana is fabulous. As far as the roaches go, the mid section of our building was all tropical flora. We did see a large roach one night coming home from dinner. HELLO!!!!!!!! It's the tropics, there are bugs. Well one night, after bragging about the lack of scoundrels around us, as I was sitting on the john, looked in the corner and there was papa cuca-racha. A good smash with my beach flip flop and a little spritz of bug spray around the door area, well, that was the only one we saw. Staff was very friendly. Our first week there, I think we were the only Americans. The staff spoke enough english to get by. After traveling for a number of years, I took 10 months of Spanish. Our attitude re: foreigners, if they are in our country, well they should speak the language. If you are intimidated about language barriers, then stay home. We tried to make the best possible impression of Americans that we could and I think we succeeded. As far as gastrointestional distress: again, be prepared. It's not home, we all suffered a little. My husband finally began taking anti-biotics. He seemed to have the worst troubleefore leaving your home country, please consult your physician. We always are prepared, it makes the difference between a bad trip/good trip. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone. People who travel out of their own country need to be more open minded. Things are different and that's exactly why I travel.  
<Date>Jun 5, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>4 dissatified travelers We are 2 couples 40 something who travel quite a bit together for our vacations. upon arrival at the Caribe Club PRincess the grounds swept us away. really beautiful. Palm trees,lush green scenery and of the beach it was just breath taking. That said now for the good stuff. We had 2 rooms facing the ocean. junior suites which we suitable. At check-in the front desk did not even offer us safe locks which you MUST have. so after getting into the room we all went back to the front desk which is a 15 minute walk or u can take the go cart which goes back and froth maybe every 15 or 20 minutes to the lobby. Secured our keys to the safe then another 15 or 20 minute wait. we were hungry so over to the ala carte to grab something. The food look so good so we sat and ate and had a couple of drinks ,, coffee,soda,water, and beer. That evening was very slow,it being a Sunday we guessed. So we walk around the resort and sat by the beach till it was time to go for dinner. All the food really looks great but by MONDAY afternoon all 4 of us got sick. Getting in late 1 night to our rooms my husband opens the door and puts on the lights and there they were... cockarochers.... so off comes the shoes and we tried our most to slaM DUNK ALL OF THEM... we WERE READY TO GO HOME AND sUNDAY COULD NOT COME FAST ENOUGH..... The staff speaks only Spanish and GERman with just a few members knowing English... so you decide if this resort or any resort in this area is for you..... sign us as the 4 never to return...

<Author>bostonfoodie2
<Content>seashell We had the best trip to the Hodelpha Caribe Club (now the Caribe Club Princess) between April 20 and 27th. This all-inclusive resort was absolutely beautiful, safe, and fun. My 18 year-old had a ball between all the kids she met, the many activities, and the disco. The group of young adults that do the entertainment (organizing games, competitions, and putting on the shows) are unbelievable. All ages had a ball. There are tons of Europeans there, and they tended to not mix much, but even in spite of what is going on in the world, everyone was very cordial. Our room was gorgeous and spotless, with great maids with turn-down service and all. Our included massage was great, and we loved the little restaurants on the site, especially the Chinese, Mexican, and especially the Italian. There are also 2 gourmet restaurants that cost extra, plus the big buffet restaurant and the snack bars. The beach was beautiful with lots of water sports included. Part of the week it was a good idea to put your towels down on chaises (by 9 or so), but the rest of the week the hotel was not full, and it didn't matter. A/C was as cold as we wanted all week. We had plenty of towels, and the beach was well-stocked with them (they use a card system to keep track of how many you have, and you could get a dry one by exchanging. No one bothered anyone else's towel or belongings anywhere. The pool is unbelievable. Different price points/buildings had different colored wrist bands which determined what was included. Our wrist band was blue and we could do everythig, and I loved our buildings best (we were in building 2 right beside the pool). The part that was called Tropicale (less $$and I think a lot of Germans) had less fancy rooms and less privleges. It seems like millions of people work there in their crisp whites, and everyone was truly friendly, and seemed genuine. We especially loved Jorge in the buffet restaurant and Zacharias at the front desk, but really everyone was nice. Bring an insulated thermosr than drinking out of the little plastic cups. Tipping was included and no one hinted for tips at the resort, but we did tip when we felt people were especially nice, and it was appreciated. But don't fall for the line from the people that take you to the hotel that it is their or the driver's birthdays and tips are optional. The lobby is a social area with a bar and comfy seating and people really gathered there in the evenings before the shows (9:45). It's huge and really nice, and a good way to meet people. Employees walk the beach all day and evening, and they area felt completely safe. Photographers take pics with your permission all week with wildlife, etc, and then you can see them displayed and for sale in the lobby if you decide to buy. A 5x7is only $5, which isn't bad. We didn't drink the water except bottled (which is plentiful), but we ate whatever we wanted. We had a wonderful time, and would love to go back.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awsome Vacation I just got back from Punta Cana two days ago and I thought it was a great vacation. I'm 18 so going there over april vacation was great because there were plenty of kids my age. I went from Sunday to Sunday and by Friday most americans had left and 90% of the people remaining spoke French and the resort seemed alot less crowded. There was a ton to do there, water sports were really great. Don't be shy if you go there, water aerobics and volleyball were a blast. The food was pretty good and there was alot of variety. My room was beautiful, service was excellent, drinks were always flowing. The beach was always clean adn it was really beautiful. If i had to give some tips I would say that definately get to the beach early to put towels down, and you have to wake up early for restuarant reservations, but if you don't, the buffet Higuero was great. The pools were clean, the employees were friendly...VERY friendly (watch out ladies) The shows were really good too. I recomend watching them and then going to the lobby to drink and dance...and then head over to the disco which was alot of fun. Overall great worry-free vacation.  
<Date>Apr 29, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Awesome place First a bit about me, 27 yr old male, I have been to many all-inclusive destinations as well lots of travelling around the world and I strongly believe in the following:  you can't have a bad time when you have hot sand beneath your feet and a cold beer in your hands!I had the opportunity to go down south twice this winter 2003, Oasis Cancun in Jan. and The Princess Tropical in early April, and my trip to the Princess Tropical was 10 times better!don' hesitate to email me for some suggestions or more info! (already I feel really chatty)The Princess Tropical (formerly the Hodelpa Tropical) is a great place to go to, one of the best I've seen, it definitely earns it's 4 star rating!we went two guys looking to relax, meet some people and have a good time, and we got all that!Warning to english speaking people, I am French speaking but my friend isn't and the majority of the people we met and the people on the resort were either French or German speaking, but everybody was so nice and we made lots of friends with other Canadians especially. (what can I say, Canadians are nice folk!!!)This is for the most part a family or couples resort so it's certainly not a huge party place, there can be lots of kids running around the pool but there is three to choose from so it's certainly not a big issue. being 2 guy friends travelling, we were worried it would a bit to quiet, although we were looking to relax, but that wasn't the case at all. in all, we met about 16 other young and/or single people and we had an awesome time hanging out and drinking at the beach, having huge dinners and drinks together, watching the shows and enjoying a drink, drinking at the lobby bar and, dancing and drinking at the disco (do you guys see a theme here!!??) as I say, you'll never have a bad time when you're willing to make your own fun and open to meeting new people.THE HOTEL: the hotel is very nice, the lobby is huge and a good hang out place in the evening. The grounds are amazing, nice stroll on a nice little paer, rooms and restaurants) are kinda far apart but I didn't mind the brisk walk between the buildings (work the alcohol out of my system) and for those who would, a trolley goes by every 15 minutes (or any staff driving a cart will gladly give you a lift in my experience). there is often aline for the shuttle at the lobby and walking may be faster (are you that lazy!!)THE ROOM: the room was nice, no complaints. I had heard about lack of face cloths but really if you're going to let that ruin your time, stay home! (jeez use a towel!!!!) We were on the first floor of one of four units of about 20 rooms each. ours was located a HUGE 10 second walk from a pool and bar, couldn't ask for anything better!!! I did see a cockroach in our bathroom, which doesn't bother me all that much, you may want to request a room on the second floor to avoid this if your squeamish about bugs.THE BEACH: amazing! not the best but certainly up there!! nice white sand. if you get up past 7h00. don't think about getting a place under a parasol! (but who goes down south to hide in the shade anyways!!??) beach chair could become scarce at times but you could always scrounge for one! there was a lot of weed floating around in the water but it wasn't to bad. mostly smaller waves.THE FOOD: not amazing but you don't go to an all-inclusing expecting a gourmet menu! (HEY! if you don't like something, try something, that's why it's a buffet!) not a lot fo variety but Tropical guests have the opportunity to book two a la carte out of six (we have to pay for the other 4). they messed up our reservation but no biggy, (relax, you're on vacation!), the food at both the Dominican and the Brasilian was very good although I got mixed reviews about the Dominican! THE SERVICE: good! one thing to remember, never be in a hurry in the Dominican! check in will take some time so don't stress, it won't help! They take your luggage to your room which takes some more time, so if you want to get going fast when you first get there, walk your own luggage t where you are) as you can't take your luggage aboard the shuttle! The bartenders were super nice, we had fun with all of them all week, the animation guys were great, although some were a bit annoying and forward with the girls at time! I barely tip anything all week (which I feel bad about since the guys worked hard and were nice!) getting a drink at the beach bar during the day may take a while but they let you order many at a time!MISC.: The disco isn't that good, girls may get harrassed if not accompanied but the girls we met were ok as long as they were with us (I got ask a dozen time if they could dance with the girls that were with us!). We got offered drugs almost everynight by guys hanging outside the disco and were propositioned frequently by prostitutes. I knew what those girls were all about as soon as I saw them but some guys we met didn't and were quite disapointed to find out that the local girls were interested in their money and not their sly wit and down to earth good looks!!! the disco IS just outside the resort and open to the public. you have to buy you drinks there but we were already in the tank by the time we got there most nights!This is one of the only resort where they let you order mutliple drinks at a time, I would acutally go and order about 12 drinks at once for my group and they would have a waiter deliver it to our spot on the beach! room service IS free! Free pop and water in room fridge and re-stocked frequently! I havent seen and all inclusive this good in a long time, food and drinks available free almost around the clock at one of the beach bars!The shows are kind of crappy but the girls seemed to enjoy them so we endured it, plus the guys had a few chuckles cracking jokes at them!lots uf stuff to do, included (sail boat, kayak, boogie board for 1 hour a day) and not included you have to do a catamaran trip, parasailing (yawn!) and scuba diving (I've been scuba diving to better spots!))The locals at the market are really agressive (as usual!) and always negotiate (sometimes all in all, this place was one of the best I've been to! I have updated pictures of the place if anybody is interested!laterz  
<Date>Apr 28, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>All We Can Say is Wonderful My Boyfriend and I went for the second year in a row to The Hodelpa Caribe Club Now known as the Caribe Princess March 18 to 25th. The first year we stayed in the Caribe side and this year we stayed in the Tropical!! All we can say was that we just love this resort, the nice thing about it is that we were able to use the whole complex with the exceptions of a few Restaurants, and in our case we used them last year and we were not impressed with them. The Buffet Restaurant is Great and there are so many different foods to Choose from that you always have something yummy on your plate, and the desserts well well YUMMY, the Dominican Coffee as well was great we never craved Tim Horton's Once. Don't forget this is the Dominican it is not North America so the food is going to be different, but it is very good!!Our Room was fantastic Clean and Our View of the Pool was wonderful, We always had clean Towels and yes Face clothes some people said they had problems with that, but we never did. We always had hot Water, and plenty of Bottle water as well. If you were ever lacking anything all you have to do is ask your Cleaning Lady she is more than happy to help you, you name it and it is yours. We tipped her upon Arrival. The Beach well that is one experience and the word I use to describe that would be WONDERFUL. The sand is so white and soft, and the waves are out of this world. This part of Punta Cana Beach is great, we walk for miles and miles each way and I must say that our part of the beach was the cleanest and well maintained of all. The other thing is that the Beach Bars yes I said Beach BARS.. there are 2 of them that are also Snack Bars are with in steps of the Wonderful Waves of the Caribbean Sea. One thing was that we had to make sure we were up Early to get out Lounge Chairs, the first part of our holiday the Beach was very busy but by the 4th day it had calmed down Quite a bit. But Really your on Holidays and if you can't relax and take it easy you really should be back at home. It i a deep breath and ENJOY!!!Overall this is One Place we will keep going back to. And we Recommend it to everyone, just keep in mind you are In another Country so relax and sit back enjoy all it has to offer, do some of the excursions we did our first year and we had a Blast. God we love this place!!!!p.s. Tip your servers and Bartenders as well, they work long hours everyday of the week and they treat you very very well and always have smiles on there faces!!!Missing Dominican,Dawn and Nick

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>My one week Vacation Hola muchacho'sMy wife and I have just returned back from our one week trip to Punta Cana, we stayed at the Hodelpa Caribe Club. I guess I can go from good to bad in my review.The good stuff, the beach was great, the people are great, the service was a little slow but that is the Caribbean ( must be the ron ) anyway.. The Hodelpa Caribe was very nice with the choice of pools and bars to hang out at, the room was perfect we had an upgraded that was not worth the extra if you ask me, but being on the upper floors is best it kinda keeps you away from the roach's that are the size of my index finger. The bad stuff, We both seemed to have a problem with the food, after the second day we already had gotten sick of the menu. Chicken, rice and potatoes, rice, potatoes, chicken and beef...moooo..I know they told us to stay away from drinking the tap water, so we drank bottled only...Crystal mmm..mmm good. Never had a cold one always warm. We did both suffer from a little abnormal bowl movements, a little more than I have ever experienced in the Caribbean. The must have a toilet paper factory close by the hotels, my wife and I went through about 8 rolls in 7 days. Here in Canada that is enough for a month...Other than the accelerated bowl movements and gas pains, things were very good. We both got great tans, met some good people and enjoyed the whole week even if we had to pinch are butt cheeks a few times a day. I highly recommend everybody to experience Rebulica Dominicana...Just don't forget your Pepto Bismol you will need it...Con mucho gusto  
<Date>Mar 31, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Get up early We were at Hodelpa for one week in mid February. My girlfriend and I loved the place. That was our second trip in the south, the first being in fabulous Riviera Maya. Some things were great and some bad. Let's start with the good stuff. The beach was realy nice, perfect warm white sand and refreshing water. Although, a lot of waves making the water unclear but that's not the end of the world. Our room was on the Tropical complex wich has the same acces to everything as the Caribe. Two stories instead of three and quieter. Upper story rooms offers cathedral ceiling. Ask for #5321 on poolside.Hodelpa's guests are mainly german. In fact they have their own theatre for the night shows wich is unusual to me. If you like to do a lot of activities in the day such as volleyball, water-polo, dart etc, you must speak german. Everything is made for them. If you want to be in the shade at the beach don't wake up past 6:30 in the morning because you'll see every chair covered by a towel. Maximum 7:00 am for the chairs on one of the three pool. But let's stop being negative, this hotel is realy beautiful with it's colors, three nice pools, good buffet and restaurant. Bring enough sunscreen or pay 30$ cdn! By the way, we did not give any money to the maid until the last day and got an excellent service. Enjoy your vacation!  
<Date>Mar 17, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Good value for the money We were in Punta Cana for the week of january 26 2003. We stayed at the Hodelpa caribe Club. On arrival at the hotel we had great service from the reception in booking 6 rooms of three and my double room. The reception staff was polite and cheerfull and theyr English or French was acceptable. The lobby is beautifull and gives you a great impression of the rest of the resort. Always clean and presentable. You have great service upon arrival to kickly get your luggage and handbags to your room. Although the rooms are very far from the lobby-reception area, you'll have a good time peacefully riding the mini-train to your room or suite. Ladies, DO NOT ride in the front with the drivers at night! That's all I'll say.... Rooms are spacious, very clean and everything worked in there. The A/C was amazingly efficient. There are no facecloths in the room. Lots of towels but bring your facecloths from home. The maids are polite and respectfull of patrons. They do a great job in making sure that you have plenty towels and whatever you need. No elevators available in both suites buildings or standard room wich I find weird, especially for older folks... The food is good at the buffet Higuero. Just good. Not amazing. I've had better selection and variety in the Dominican Republic. If you are a desert lover, wrong place. Very limited desert selection. But food is fresh and tasty. All the a la carte restaurants are AMAZING! Make sure you try all of them. The disco is very cool. Make sure you get there before 12 AM to gather-up some drinks cause after that you have to pay for them. But the prices are fair. Good variety of music. I was surprised actually by the DJ. He spinned some real cool tracks, very recent dance hits and the amazing Latin tubes were awsome! Staff in general are friendly and helpfull. Big lack in animation quality. Practically nothing in the evening for kids. Bars are all over the resort and the quality of bartenders is variable. Jairo is the master of the pool-bar. Danny and his boys at the loba smile...always. The pools are clean, well located, very close to the beach and snack-bar. The beach is nice. Not amazing, but nice. One thing I didn't like was the fact that they never cleaned the beach compared to many other destinations we visited. There was lots of leaves and debris from the ocean from the previous nights and especially when it rained practically every night.....Anyway. Good activities on the beach. Lots of longchairs for everyone. Water sports were very available and easy to reserve. Beeing a frequent traveller, I recomend Hodelpa caribe Club and Punta Cana to anyone who wants a good resort and hotel for a good price. But for people used to luxury and gourmet food and executive treatment or visiting the local area for great tourism spots go elsewhere. There is nothing besides the resorts in Punta Cana. Still, I give it my 4 stars rating  
<Date>Mar 1, 2003

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice place, not so nice staff. Just got back from a week at the Hodelpa. The site and resort itself were beautiful, and even the food was excellent, but even so, I won't be going back. My misadventure started when I arrived at the airport in Halifax: I was informed that due to overbooking, I was being bumped to another resort for a night, but that I would receive wine, dinner at the resort's 'haute cuisine' restaurant, free massage, etc. I was a little annoyed; having reserved my trip 6 months in advance, I didn't think I would have to deal with this kind of thing. But I was happy I about the freebies, not realizing at that point that other resorts often give out entire free week stays for such inconveniences. Anyway, because of the bumping, I ended up spending two days of my vacation waiting in lobbies for my room to be prepared (check in isn't til 3pm). But the real kicker came when I went to arrange for my free meal and was told (in quite a rude manner) that I wasn't going to get one. Finally, I did get the meal, but having to fight for it kinda ruined my day. As for the wine, it showed up 3 days later with a rotton cork. A few times I approached guest services with questions and I found their manner to be so rude that I went out of my way thereafter to avoid having to deal with them at all. Despite all this, I did have a good time, and the place is breathtaking, but I would advise anyone going to the Hodelpa not to expect stellar service or even much politeness from guest services. The customer certainly isn't always right at the Hodelpa.  
<Date>Feb 24, 2003
